An idea suddenly occurred to you, maybe you could use this new information to tease or even blackmail him into doing you bidding. You took a moment to imagine the look on Ho-oh's face when he hears about it. But doing so, it'll probably get him raging mad both from revealing that you trespassed his brain and, worse, skimmed through his most intimate contents. You shuddered at the potential death wish and shelved the plan.

You quickly replaced all the membranes back into their respective boxes and returned them to the shelf. If you stay here any longer, you have a feeling that you might gross out. You left the chamber and went on to try out the other entrances.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Rest of the brain/respiratory system/circulator...

choices: Start of the Fourth (and last) day.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You choose the one that is directly to the left of the private library. You don't feel like ever checking back the room you just left, and you really hope that you erased any clues of your short stay in Ho-oh's private library. The punishment for such an offense surely would be much worse than anything you have experienced.

While you think about these matters, you arrive to a room that, at first sight, seems like the control room. It has screens and consoles spread around the room, but after a closer examination you don't see anything that could be the controls you're looking for. You observe the screens, and note that most of them are diagrams of every organ in Ho-oh's body. It seems like these screens show the state of every part of the body, and if something needs to be fixed or done in any part. You guess that this is how Ho-oh can find work for you. "This may be a way to anticipate myself to whatever I have to do tomorrow!" you think.

You examine everything around you. There are a few problems, and you're sure that sooner or later you'll need to help Ho-oh, most likely after he wakes up. A screen showing the bones is indicating that most of the joints needs to be lubricated for a better performance, while another screen says that Ho-oh has a few messages from other legendaries. Whatever organ needed to receive these messages is damaged, meaning that he can't see them nor can send. Directly under that, there is another screen that points that the vocal chords are starting to be wearing down. And the last warning message says that Ho-oh is needing relief and help on his more private matters. There doesn't seem to be more warnings. Before you leave, you note one last thing. Another screen points that the captive (you feel uneasy reading this) is, according to the locator, in his resting room. There is also a clock, and it says it is almost 4:00 AM.

You leave the room, ready to examine another part of the brain. Before you enter through another path, you see that there is a sign indicating Ho-oh's normal day. This makes you realize how long you have spent here. According to the chart, Ho-oh usually wakes up around 4:30 AM. You stop and look at the path you are about to take. You take the risk and go through it. At the end you manage to find what you're looking for. The control room!

You try to enter, but there seems to be some kind of electric force closing the path. You are guessing this is part of Ho-oh's protections, and that the electricity is coming from the organ you had visited earlier, the 'orientation-generator' organ. You make a quick plan:

Leaving the locator in the room, and while Ho-oh isn't expecting it, sabotage the 'orientation-generator' organ. You don't know how, but you guess you'll think of a way.

You run towards your room. You get there, place the locator in your pocket, and try to sleep. When you wake up, you realize that, much to your surprise, Ho-oh hasn't called you. He is awake, but it is 7:00 AM.

The surprise doesn't last long. "I was about to wake you up, human! Today you'll have a heavy day, and you better follow every single instruction I give you!" Ho-oh says. "As a way of apologizing for yesterday's punishment, I'll let you choose the order of your chores." What? You can't believe what you're hearing. "Don't be that surprised! I was frustrated for other matters and took it on you. But don't expect more from me! This is the only time I'll apologize to you, I assure you that everything that happens you from now is stuff you deserve!"

You sigh, and get out of your room, ready for the stuff you know you have to do today.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Next Chamber

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:

"Alright, human. You got a lot of things to do today:
-First, you are going to maintain all of the major joints in my body. It has been hurting for several months now and it has made flying harder for me.

-Thirdly, I seem to be losing my voice these few days. I want you to do a checkup of my vocal chords and apply the appropriate remedy if a problem is discovered.
-Your last assignment for the day will be elaborated upon once you completed the above works.
-As previously promised, you can perform the work in any order you like. There is no specific time limits for the above. All of them safe for the fourth one, must be completed by sundown.
-Now, off to work, human"

You left the chamber after you decided to check on the joints as your first assignment. The map you were provided indicates that the bone joints are located in a crawlspace that encompasses the "ceiling" of Ho-oh 's body and neck portion. That's a wide area to cover, you thought. The access hatch to the joints is located just below the head of the Pokemon and you wasted no time to enter it.

The crawlspace resembles the interior of lattice metalwork or the structure support of an iron statue, the only differences are that bones are used in place of metals and the pink fleshes. The space is narrow, making you fall on your stomach to crawl into the wide crevice. You moved to the nearest joint to start your work. The joint looks dry, slightly yellowed, and every time Ho-oh moves it, it creaks loudly. You covered your ears each time the sharp sound comes out. There is that feeling that if no maintenance is done soon, the whole place is gonna collapse on itself.

"I see that you have chosen to start with my joints, human. They're getting really painful the last few days. Describe their condition for me.", Ho-oh said.

"It looks dry, blackened, and is creaking loudly whenever you move, Ho-oh.", you said matter-of-factly.

"Alright, then. Listen up!!! I want you to lubricate all my joints with the lubrication fluid I provide."

A flexible tube appeared besides you.

"Use this tube to spray lubricant onto my bones. To use it, just simply squeeze it and spray the stuffs onto my bones. The tube can be extended for the entire length of my body. Now get started, human.", ordered Ho-oh.

You begin on the first bone joint by squeezing the tube as instructed. A beige-colored slime sprays out and coated the joint. After a few wiggling done by Ho-oh, the creaking sound mostly subsides and the joint seems to move with a lot more flexibility. Satisfied with the results, you proceed to the next joint and the next one and toward the spine. Each time, you made a meticulous effort to thoroughly coat each joint with slime. The more difficult part of the work is the wing joints; they are far larger than the rest of the joints. It took you three times more efforts to finally get them nice and working smoothly. At last, you coated the last of the joints near the tail and reported to Ho-oh on the completion of your assignment.

"Good for you. Now let me check all of the joints before I make my decision on your effort.", Ho-oh said.

You saw all the joints around you moving in synchronization. There is virtually no sounds now and the Ho-oh seems to take a lot less effort to move them. After a minute of checking, Ho-oh rendered the verdict.

"My.....For the first time in centuries, my body finally feels right!", Ho-oh said, "My wings and backside felt new again. You definitely learned from all those shocks and punishments I gave you, human. As you have exceeded my expectation. I'm giving you 5 tokens for your work here."

"Ummm. Thanks.", you said, taken aback by the rarely-surfacing good mood of Ho-oh.

"Well...what are you waiting for, human? If you want to keep me in this uplift mood, you better get on with your next work. You might earn yourself a day off tomorrow.", Ho-oh said, returning to his usual reserved demeanor.

The next stop: the Message Relay System, you thought. (though Ho-oh didn't know that you know this)

With that, you connection with Lugia broke off. You only had a minute to think about your plan before Ho-oh's voice rang out.

"Hey! What are you doing? Have you finished your meal now? Get back to work on my vocal cord.", Ho-oh ordered.

Using Ho-oh's claws, you manage to grab the chip and tear it off, not before accidentally scratching Lugia's back, causing deep wounds.

-"I'm sorry for that, Lugia. I'm not used to this"- you say through a message.

-"It is okay, I'll heal before you know it. Now that the chip is off I have my powers back. You should turn off Ho-oh's powers. He surely will try to reactivate them as soon as you leave the control room, you should try to find a way to keep them off for as long as possible."

You can see the levers that give Ho-oh energy for using his strength, and quickly decide to use the remains of your shirt. You turn off the levers, and use the shirt to tie them together to the corner of the controls. You try to pull the levers back, and are glad to see that you aren't capable. You feel everything around you moving. What is going on outside?

-"I'm done, it should be easy to get out of here."-you write back.

-"I'm holding Ho-oh down with my own body. Listen, as soon as you get out of the control room Ho-oh will obtain the control of his body. If you disabled his powers then we should have all the time of the world. Go find an exit of his body, I'll know when you're out."-Lugia tells you.

You take a deep breath, ready to finally be free. You cross the entrance of the control room, and see how the screens turn off again. -"Human, I'll make you pay for this!" Then a really pained scream echoed through the chamber. Your guess is that he tried to shock you, and received the payback for everything he has done for you.

You are in the throat, and going towards his beak. -"No, I won't allow it!" -you hear your captor say. The tongue in front of you blocks the beak. You try your best to contact Lugia mentally.

-"Could you pull the tongue back outside?"

-"I can't! My wings are too big for that. Listen, there are more ways out from Ho-oh's body, and I don't see how he could block them. And don't worry, I'm sure there are many ways that don't involve exiting through Ho-oh's back door."

You think for a moment to remember any other possibilities. You smile, knowing exactly what you'll do.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Controlling a Legendary

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You headed for the eye chamber, remembering that you previously tried to escape from Ho-oh- nostrils. You were running swiftly through the tunnels leading to the chamber. Along the way you heard Ho-oh yelping from the continuous shock on his cock and rear end. That really served him well, you thought. Once you arrived at the eye chamber, you immediately rushed from nostrils hole and squirm your way out. The moment you truly exited from Ho-oh is a moment of pure happiness. You saw Lugia towering over the Legendary, pinning him down to the ground of the cave. When she realized that you made it out, Lugia used her wings and gave Ho-oh a heavy blow to his head which knocked him out.

The Lugia rushed over to embrace you and almost squeezed the air out of you both from her size and power.

"Thank goodness, you've made it.It so good to see you alive and well. You must've been through a lot the last few days.", she said panicking, "Are you okay? Are you hurt in anyway? What else had that monster done to you?"

"I'm okay now, Lugia.", you said comfortingly.

Lugia caught sight of your lack of cloths and how dirty you are and the several cuts on your arms and legs.

"This is all my fault. If I hadn't flew through Ho-oh's domain, this wouldn't have happened. If I had travel underwater, he would've never knew about you.", Lugia said in a depressed tone, "And he......made you do all those repulsive tasks in his body. Most of all, he tortured you. I couldn't forgive myself for this."

"Calm down, Lugia. I am safe and sound now. I'm standing here. Ho-oh won't be laying his talons on me again. Despite my lack of cloths and a few bruises that Ho-oh did to me, I'll be fine.....Thank you for caring so much about me."

You saw Lugia blushed a bit.

"Okay, as long as you're fine, I'm glad about that.", Lugia said, hugging you tighter. For a few instance, you thought you saw tears in Lugia's eyes. She really cared about you. You embraced Lugia tighter in an emotional moment in the cave. Only when both of you hear a groan coming from the ruffled body of Ho-oh did you two finally let go.

".........Let's get out of here before Ho-oh wakes up again.", you said.

"Right. He's going to be out cold for an hour. Come on let's get out of here."

You entered Lugia through her mouth and returned to the personal bedroom you love so much.

"I'm not taking a further risks of encountering Ho-oh or any other Legendaries now. We'll be traveling underwater as soon as we reached the ocean.", Lugia announced.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: You finally escape from Ho-oh

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The next few days are like paradise. Lugia apologizes to you and tries to give you a week of pure enjoyment. She really wants you to forgive her, and you did in the moment she picked you up after coming out of Ho-oh.

After a week of being treated like a king, you decide to return the favor. Lugia is so nice to you, and you just spend time inside her! You decide to do some of the tasks you had done inside Ho-oh, and after some days you have done them. Lugia feels better than ever, and you're happy to see that it worked. Besides, your host had reached the ocean, and the environment is beautiful. You spend countless hours in the observation deck, just watching Lugia swim. It is a while world you never thought you would see.

A few weeks later, you mark the end of your second month as a tiny human inside legendaries. They have been the most fun you had, excluding the four hellish days you spent inside Ho-oh. You knew it couldn't last forever (well, technically it could, but you didn't think it was appropriate), but you still felt surprised when Lugia informed you that in a few days she would finally arrive to the shrine, so she could return you to normal.

You and her talk about the future. She says that she'll watch over you, and maybe visit you every month, to keep the friendship going. She doesn't want to be caught, but she still wants to see you. You agree with her, and tell her about your team. You had told her about your adventures, but hadn't said a thing about your own Pokémon.

"They're the best, Lugia. I'm so proud of them."

She can see that you love your Pokémon, and shares your happiness. But the longer you talk about them, the more nostalgic you get. You miss your team, and you're sure that they must be very worried. It has been two months since they saw you. You know that they wouldn't forget you easily, but felt that they at least deserved to know what is happening to you.

Lugia senses your actual state of mind, and tries to think a way to cheer you up. She isn't too keen with the only idea she has, but she would do anything to see you happy.

"Listen, would you like to bring one of your Pokémon here?"

"What?"

"Would you like me to bring you one of your Pokémon so whoever you choose stays with you for the rest of your time inside me?"

You are amazed with the idea. It would actually be great! You already chose which one, but what worries you is how it will react to meeting a Legendary...from the inside. That, and the possibility of staying a few days inside Lugia. Could your friend cause trouble, or get lost or anything? Would you take the risk?

"There is a tiny organ in my brain, which will infiltrate into the human PC systems and bring you only one, already shrunken Pokémon. If you don't want to do it, then fine, but if you would like to, then you have free access to it. Remember, only one".

You spend some minutes thinking, and finally...
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You decided to bring over one of your favorite Pokemon. It has been two months since you last saw your favorite Vaporeon and you missed her badly. With this in mind, you took the appropriate route over to Lugia's brain. Come to think of it, you haven't actually visited Lugia's brain before. This could be your chance to further understand this Legendary Pokemon. You eventually found her brain which is considerably larger than that of Ho-oh. You laughed as you privately wonder whether or not that has to do with physical traits or intellectual quality.

As the same with Ho-oh, the brain is divided into different chambers through a hub. You found one with a sign labeled the "Human PC Access". This must be the one that Lugia talked about. You entered it and found a Pokemon PC embedded into the fleshy wall and another one that acts as a desktop computer complete with a keyboard. You went over to the PC and typed in your name and access code for your Storage account. First, you check your remaining money in the account and the items you still have. Then you made the move to withdraw Vaporeon on the screen. The PC hummed and beeped for a few second, then a Pokeball came out from a hole to your right.

You took the Pokeball and opened it by throwing it against the floor. A Vaporeon pops out of the ball. Seeing the Vaporeon, you immediately went over to hug it. It has been too long since you last felt its soft, scaly coat and hear her call. Judging from Vaporeon's reaction, she also seems to miss you greatly. You thought you even saw some tears in Vaporeon's eyes. Now that you two are together, you finally have another Pokemon to interact with besides Lugia.

The two of you played for a while in the PC room. Rubbing her in her favorite spot, brushing her head, and playing games that she likes. Before you noticed, an hour has passed. You returned Vaporeon back to her Pokeball and stow it in your pocket. You'll find some times to play with her later. You now turned your attention to the desktop computer beside the Pokemon PC. You pressed a key on the keyboard to turn it on. The screen instantly refreshes and display a wide array of function for you to use. There is a Message Relay System that resembles the one in Ho-oh, some fun-looking mini-games that you can play with Lugia, a private chat, a web browser, and much more.

Out of curiosity, you clicked on the Message Relay System and found that numerous other Pokemons are on the system. There is a list with the name of the Pokemon and a status icon to indicate whether they're on the system or not. You moved through the list discovered at least 15 Pokemons are on the system, some of them written in a text that you can't understand. This looks much like that messaging system you used to talk with your friends back at home. You even saw, much to your dismay, Ho-oh's name on the relay system. Since you and Lugia are now deep within the ocean and Ho-oh catching you again is an impossible feat, it wouldn't hurt to "chat up" with your old captor. Before you click on his name to engage the conversation, you asked Lugia whether it would be safe to do so. She told you that you don't have to worry about it since Ho-oh cannot track her location and that she could drop in on the conversation by typing at anytime.

Consider it a second payback, you thought. You smirk to yourself as you and Lugia figure how to rile up the Pokemon and get the most fun out of it.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: ...decide to do it

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You click around until you decide to do it. Lugia already suggested some stuff to taunt Ho-oh, and you had proposed some ideas of your own.

"Hey Ho-oh, are you still in pain for my leaving gift?"

"WAIT UNTIL I GET A GRIP ON YOU HUMAN. YOUR DAYS INSIDE ME WILL LOOK LIKE VACATION COMPARED TO HOW YOU'LL DIE"

You laugh, enjoying Ho-oh's obvious anger. You still hadn't gotten over the torture, and it is nice to see Ho-oh hasn't forgotten you either.

"Aw, why the harsh tone, former captor? One would think you don't miss me."

"I did leave you like new, right? It is a shame that after the beat up you're now worse than before!

You continue taunting, and Ho-oh gets increasingly angrier with each line. This has been very fun, or at least it was until Ho-oh changed tactics, something you didn't expect.

"Say, are you vengeful by any chance? One would say you don't know to forget and forgive, you overgrown turkey."

"FINE LET'S PLAY YOUR LITTLE GAME. I know where you are going. It won't be hard to get there. I guarantee there won't be any laughs after I'm done with you."

"Are you serious? Looks like you haven't learnt a thing, Lugia and I won't mind to give you a second try of when I left you" you type, trying to look cocky but you feel a bit unsettled. What if he can get his revenge?

"STOP TAUNTING ME. THIS WILL MAKE YOUR DEMISE WORSE. And there is nothing any of you can do to prevent it"

"Are you completely sure, Ho-oh? I have been told some very interesting stuff." you see the words appear in the screen without you typing. You guess it must be Lugia.

"Is it true you have a large stash of hot fantasies Ho-oh? It is just my impression, but I'm sure that the other Legendaries won't be happy if any of them hear they're in that kinky stuff."

"YOU WOuldn't dare...right?" you read, amazed to see how timid Ho-oh is sounding now.

"Of course I would, sweetie. Want to see? If you don't think I'm capable of doing that, then come here. The descriptions the human has done are very detailed, I'm sure everybody will get a laugh from your hidden side." Lugia types, condescending.

Ho-oh seems to think for a while before replying. "Fine. I'll leave it here. Just...keep it silent, okay? And I don't want to hear again the word human. Nor from you nor anybody. I already got too much pain from it. Please, tell your...buddy to behave."

"Fine with me, but you did deserve it."

Ho-oh seems to have blocked incoming messages from you or Lugia. You are still rereading the stuff you had written before, and manage to laugh again. You're confident you won't see Ho-oh in person, but it would be fun to tell Lugia to send messages from you to your former captor.

After memorizing with Lugia the best moments of your taunting you exit the brain. Unlike Ho-oh, you want to give Lugia some privacy, so the thought of exploring the rest of the brain doesn't cross your mind.

You go to eat something good, and Lugia gives you the best. She also gives you some stuff for your Vaporeon, who happily eats the food. She enjoys the meal, and doesn't seem to mind the fact that she is eating from the inside of another Pokémon. She is happy just being with you.

While you watch your Vaporeon eat you get an idea.

-"Would you like to see my home, Vaporeon? It is the best place I have ever been. There are many places in here, and if you're going to stay with me for a while then it should be good to show you where to go and where not to go."-
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Legendary Trolling

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You went on and show your Vaporeon the various parts of Lugia. There is the Observation Chamber in Lugia's head, your personal room, food chamber and storage, and so on. Vaporeon seems to be very excited to see all these amenities within a Pokemon. You specifically instructed her not to take one of the holes that leads outside of Lugia; despite Lugia having an exterior gravity on her body, you don't want to take the risk for your Pokemon. Another region you wouldn't want Vaporeon to find out about is Lugia's reproductive organ. You fear that the place would be too much to her and who knows what will happen when she gets the 'idea' whens she's there.

 The tour within Lugia went on smoothly for both of you and you haven't been this happy in a long time. Perhaps it was the long isolation from your friends and Pokemons, you thought. Although you have become close to Lugia, she still isn't a close friend that you're so used to. Judging from her recent interaction with you, there is some hint that the Legendary may be having some form of affection for you. You laughed slightly at the notion, an inter species romance is certainly unheard of, but still, it cannot be ruled out.

 Before you know it, it was late noon already. Vaporeon seems especially tired from walking around with you. You let her return to her Pokeball while make your way back to your personal bedroom for a quick rest. When you got to the bedroom you placed your belongings on the desk and made your way toward the bed. On the bed, you found a piece of folded paper. It used the same material as those you found in Ho-oh. You unfurled the piece and read it:

Dear trainer,

Meet me at the observation chamber tonight at 9. I have a surprise for you

,Lugia

You are surprised by the letter. Is Lugia asking you out for real? 

You decide you should take a rest and wait until the night to find out.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The rest of afternoon passes quickly. You spend the rest of the afternoon walking idly through Lugia's body, sometimes alone, sometimes with Vaporeon. You can't wait for the night.

Soon it is only one hour more before it is time to go to the observation chamber. You leave Vaporeon in your room on a bed you made earlier, and start walking towards the meeting point. It is still early, but you're so excited you don't mind waiting outside the observation chamber. When it is finally time to enter you walk inside.

You are nicely surprised with the first thing you see, outside. Lugia seems to be in some kind of shrine, much different than any other place you have visited.

-"Hi, trainer!"-you hear behind you. You aren't surprised when you see Lugia behind you, you got used to see your hosts inside their own bodies. Lugia approaches you and gives you a hug, you do the same.

-"Thank you for coming. I wanted to spend time with you."

-"What is this place?"-you ask, pointing outside.

-"It is the place where you can return to normal. But....I thought that you may not want to do it yet. I think that we should spend a few days more in this situation. When it is time you can go outside. This place is another home, and nobody else has been here besides us two. I have never brought anybody else here."

You nod, and Lugia takes you to the center of the room. She uses her powers to contort the flesh of the floor, and soon it turns into a table. Your favorite stuff appears on the table, and you start eating. A bit later Lugia joins you until both of you are finished with this.Then Lugia starts talking

-"I wanted you here because I felt the need to...tell you that you're the best thing that has happened in my life. And you know that I have lived for pretty long." You nod again, unsure of what this means, but you can't avoid thinking the same. She continues.

-"I know that we can't be together forever, and I doubt a serious relationship between us will work. But I want to give you the best days of your life. Even after you return to normal I want to show you places and things nobody else has seen."

-"I like that idea"-you reply, still unsure of what is going on, but you like that she thinks so high of you.

-"Would you...like to give me a chance?"

-"Of course!"

-"Then let's continue. Another reason for this...date."-she said, making the table disappear.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: A Night with Lugia

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Lugia slowly turned around and made her way closer to you with a seductive expression on her face. The nearer she came to you, the more nervous you become. Looks like the Pokemon wants to take things a little further now, you thought. Being together for such a long time has definitely brought you two closer together. Without you noticing, Lugia has now gotten so close to you that you can feel the heat emanating from her body. She wrapped her large wings around you and brought you closer to her chest. You felt yourself enveloped between her incredibly soft feathers, enjoying the warmth her body gave off.

Seconds later, you felt Lugia planting her soft beak on you cheek and started nuzzling you. The sensation is something that you've never experienced before. The feeling of fur brushing against your cheek sends shivers down your body. 

You saw a large bed materializing out of the floor along with ambient lightings within the Observation Chamber. The elliptical  bed contained several large plush cushions and seats on it.

 Lugia has positioned her actual body to face the entrance to her palatial shrine; the view you have now is that of a seashore lit by dim moonlight. You remembered that you have seen this scene all the way back when you first entered Lugia's subconscious.

The Pokemon slowly pressed you down toward the bed which you obliged. Once you lie on the bed, which feels soft and warm, Lugia wrapped her wings around you and brought her head right beside yours. She looked at you with her deep, azure eye, drawing you closer to it. You are mesmerized by its size and the details within it. You wonder what thoughts lie in them that Lugia wants to share with you. Then, as if the Pokemon could read your thoughts, words and images project themselves onto the eye. Sounds began to play within your head. Just, when you are about to ask Lugia, she spoke.

"This is a something intimate I created for our personal viewing.", said Lugia with a very prominent blush her face, "I hope you'll enjoy it."

The Pokemon fell quiet again as you watch the movie playing before you, still held snugly in her wing.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

choices: You search in places far from you
You search in places near to you
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You watch the eye, mesmerized. You would never get tired of those lovely pair of ocean blue pools if you had to stare at them for eternity. Your awestruck reflection slowly faded as images comes into focus. The words "The Journey" formed within her pupil and gentle music started playing. Lugia's blushing was a big warning sign of what you would be about to see, so you got ready for the movie. You decided to wait first what was it before making any comment.

The movie seems to be about Lugia's deepest imagination, and you. The content isn't as hardcore as you thought it would be, but it does have some hints of intimacy you never expected to reach when you first reentered Lugia's body.

Much to your own amazement, you watch Lugia imagining you exploring her body, but in a more intimate tone, specially focusing on her reproductive system. You see yourself reaching the uterus, and Lugia appearing there. Then you and your host engage on activities that hadn't ever crossed your mind, despite your mild attraction towards Lugia.

It is a big surprise to you to see your friend's imagination, and wonder if what you're seeing is how she feels. In the movie you see yourself and her almost mating. If anybody on the movie gets more cheeky, then you could as well end watching yourself entering in the realm of hard pornography. Much to your relief, the movie doesn't seem to go that far. Lugia seems to understand that you aren't sure about that, so the movie keeps being about touching and caressing each other's bodies. Lugia seems like a creative lover.

It is a short movie, like half an hour, but its was so impressive and realistic it seemed longer. When it ends, it looks like Lugia wants an opinion. You try to gather words to express yourself.

"Wow...that was...impressive..."you say. Lugia smiles, and replies "I'm sorry of this seems creepy. Maybe I'm confused with everything that has happened."

You nod, and Lugia lets you go. "It is getting late. Why don't you go to sleep? And...maybe tomorrow you could come here at the same hour. You could...try to imitate things you saw in the movie." she says, blushing again. You are dry for words again, and nod, unsure if you're wanting to do it. The mere thought of touching Lugia's body as freely as the body, including her private parts, is amazing, but you don't know if you do want to do it. You decide to stop thinking about it.

You return to your room, hoping to sleep. You notice that Vaporeon isn't there nor in her Pokéball, but you decide she is wandering around. You fall asleep.

The next morning, you wake up and still notice that Vaporeon isn't on her bed. Still leaving that aside, you have breakfast, but you are reminded of this when Lugia sends food for your Pokemon. Then you tell her about Vaporeon's dissapearance.

Lugia reacts quickly. "I'm going to stop all body process now, except the heart and breathing. There are others I can't stop, but I won't finish them until you find your Vaporeon"

"Do you think she is in trouble or in some part she shouldn't be?" you ask, afraid.

"I can't feel her, but I'm sure she is inside me. She isn't on my brain nor in my reproductive system, I know that. You'll have to find her by yourself".

You start thinking where Vaporeon could be. She has always been the curious type, and could be anywhere inside Lugia, maybe even in parts you don't want to see. You swallow your pride and start searching. Vaporeon isn't in the Observatio Chamber, nor in the storage nor in other similar places.

You wonder if Vaporeon would disobey you. She is quite fast, and could be in the least expected place, on the other side of Lugia's body.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Lugia's "Special" Movie

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You started frantically searching for Vaporeon, becoming more worried and nervous ad the minutes ticked by. You started your search by looking in the Food Container, going through the freezer, the wine chamber, and the dining area without much luck. Looks like Vaporeon wasn't hungry in the last few hours. She didn't even came here for the fish meats, which are her favorite foods. Where could she be?, you thought as you returned to your personal bedroom to perform one last check before making any further decisions. Still.......there was no sign of her. You remembered that Lugia told you that your Pokemon isn't in any of the chambers you previously visited, you guessed that Vaporeon probably wandered off into some unexplored areas. 

"If I can't detect her location within me, Vaporeon most likely went into the part of my body that is off my locating range. The original intention of such systems is to insure the total privacy of a person like you within me; those are places you go to when you just need to be alone for a while. If you were to be in one of those organs, I wouldn't be able to tell if you are there unless you tell me. Oh, why does my own body has to work against me in such time?"

"Okay. Don't panic yet, Lugia. Do you know where can she possibly be?", you asked.

"There are several like the personal bedroom, and the private chamber in my uterus, but I think the one Vaporeon most likely will be in is the Store Complex."

"What is that?", you asked.

"Remember the little chamber where stuffs appear when you step onto a platform? The Store Complex is where all of that stuffs come from. Think of it as a hybrid of a factory and a shopping center put together."

"That sounds kinda dangerous for Vaporeon", you said.

"Not to worry, I already shut down the production line, so risks are small.", Lugia assured, "Let's go on your search now. We don't wanna take too long. You can ask me anytime you need to."

You are going to find Vaporeon no matter what happens. You started by walking through tunnels that you haven't previously taken, intent on finding your beloved Pokemon.

A hour worth of walk later, you reached a large chamber with an imposing, tall structure that look like a 10 story version of a mall and made from translucent membranes. If memory serves you right, this complex could possibly be a contender with the world's most immense mall. You saw a sign that tells you this is the Store Complex and the various amenities offered within. You entered through a sphincter near the first floor and began your search through what could be the largest shopping complex you've ever been to.

"This is going to be a long day.", you thought as you wondered if Lugia had the much-feared cologne department in here.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: You search in places far from you

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You thought you wouldn't be surprised by anything inside Lugia, but the mall is by far the most amazing part of her body you have visited. Something this huge inside Lugia, with all these divisions.

You explore the first floor, seeing many compartments resembling stores. When you look inside each one, you can see an specific class of products. You see stuff you had never dreamt about, and stuff you never would wish to have, but after seeing many of the things Lugia can give you, you can't avoid adding a lot of new stuff to your wishlist, and can't wait to pick them up before the day ends. But you still pick up a few stuff you think could be useful to catch Vaporeon again. A few toys, a small bag of nuts, and others. You look around searching for more useful stuff, but you often notice you space out looking at the incredible variety of products.

After seeing into each compartment, you notice that you have been checking around for one hour. You walk until you find two passageways, one going towards the second floor, and one that goes to what could be a basement. You go upstairs.

There are many more compartments, and while searching for Vaporeon is your highest priority, you still spend time looking around. The second floor seems to be mostly for technological stuff, while the first one was for more common stuff. In the compartments of the second floor you encounter portable TV, laptops, and a lot other stuff you can't take with you, but when you enter into another one, you find something you never thought would ever see.

You take the object from the floor of the store and read the description attached to it. It is a translator, made like a collar. You are ecstatic. This can strengthen your friendship with your Pokémon, if you find enough translators. Luckily you do, but you have to leave some of the toys you had picked up before.

You leave the second floor, after checking every compartment. Vaporeon isn't in any of them, so there is only one part left. Lugia had said that this place had a factory somewhere, and you suppose it is down there. You find the path towards the basement, and enter. It is darker than the rest of the mall, so you use a flashlight you picked up before. The light is good enough, but it doesn't illuminate everything.

You enter the main area of the factory, and find a sign. To your left there is the factory itself, while the right path leads to where the defective and discarded products are. You instinctively start through the right side, as you think it could be dangerous, depending of how the bad products are disposed.

"Lugia, if Vaporeon where over there, what dangers could she encounter?" you ask.

"None. It is mainly an storage, but it doesn't mean that there aren't paths she couldn't take, as all of them are completely open."

"What do you mean?"

"There are a few paths coming from there. One leads towards a part where I repair the products, where she could be hurt by what I use. I also dispose of the products by crushing them and dumping the rest into my bowels. The other option is where the products are made, and she can get lost easily. Nothing is active, but she could still enter them. "

You try not to imagine what could happen if Vaporeon stumbled upon any of those options while it was active. You enter the storage, and look around. On a corner you find a lot of cotton and other stuff used on plushes, and on top of them, sleeping, there is Vaporeon. You are happy, and run towards her, with Pokéball on hand.

You don't notice how loud your steps sound. The noise wakes up Vaporeon, and she gets startled by the light of the flashlight. She runs scared, and you throw the Pokéball. You miss, and it hits the ball while Vaporeon runs towards one of the entrances. After you pick the Pokéball, you run towards the path and illuminate the sign. You read what it says and enter.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Great Mall of Lugia

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You head for the Disposal/Repair center to search for Vaporeon. Despite Lugia telling you that all mom-essential body functions are stopped, you are still worried for her. The dark tunnel eventually gave way to a brightly lit chamber with large transparent bins on either side. A closer look at these bins revealed that the items are sorted according to the materials they are made from: glass, fiber, metal, etc. The discarded items include laptop with cracked screens, some shirts with off marks print patterns, Lugia plushies in the wrong colors, and even a broken crystal model of the Legendary Pokemon. In the rear of each bin is a large vent that leads downward. A warning sign posted beside reminds you that the vent will lead to the bowel where the junks will be compressed and recycled when possible. The implication slightly unsettled you. You hope that Vaporeon hadn't went down on of these vents.

Swiftly, out of the corner of your eye, you spotted Vaporeon dashing from her hiding spot deeper into the chamber. You followed her until she went under a long table filled with various items. This is definitely the repair area as there are countless electronics parts strewn across the table surface. You can see screws and bolts scattered across the table with what looks like the chassis of a T console. Lugia explained that she fixes thing whenever it is possible. If an item is unrepairable, it will be disposed into the ocean. But as the Guardian of the Sea, she rarely did this, believing that the ocean should remain clean for both Pokemons and humans to share.

After looking around the stuffs on the table some more, you focused your attention back onto your Vaporeon beneath. Kneeling down, you can see her huddled in one of the corner trembling in fear. Based on your experience, the only time that Vaporeon will act like this is when she encounters an unfamiliar surrounding. Lugia's body definitely fit that description.

You tried your best effort to coax the Pokemon out of her hiding place. You bend yourself lower and gently signal with your hand for her to come out. On the first three tries, Vaporeon didn't even more an inch, remaining in the corner of the table. You used one of the food you got at the mall to slowly lure her out. The food worked, the Pokemon slowly crawled out and made her way toward the dried food in your hand. After finishing the food, Vaporeon curled around your leg and fell asleep. You retrieved your Pokeball and returned her inside. Vaporeon deserved some rest after her misadventure in Lugia.

You stood up and made the announcement to Lugia that Vaporeon has been found and that she is now with you. Upon hearing the good news, Lugia applauded greatly you and went on to restart her body function including the factory you're in. You returned to the ground floor to continue your shopping, you still got several floors to go and explore.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Disposal/Repairing

choices: You proceed to start the mission
You try to convince Lugia to think other plans.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You returned to the ground floor, and went upstairs to the second floor. This time you looked around to find some stairs you may not have seen before. You did, almost in the corner of the place. You eagerly run upstairs until you reach your destination. This floor seems to contain food products related to food. Seeing how it was almost time, you tried many things, and there was many you liked. The fourth floor seems to be related to technology too, but the stuff was bigger and more complicated. There are many things you can't imagine the possible functions, but Lugia gladly explains to you everything about every piece.

There are another two floor left. The one directly above you can only be reached with an elevator. You walk until you find one, and press the button that leads towards the fifth floor. When the door opens you are inside a dark room, with only one chair in middle, and an screen in front. It seems like a personal theater.

"As a Legendary Pokémon, I have heard many stories. Here you can see a selection of recent anecdotes I have heard from other Pokémon, and myself, when available. Unluckily it has been rather scarce for some time! Mainly because I have been away from the other legendaries since I found you. Sorry"

You reply saying it is okay, but you can't avoid feeling a bit disappointed. Seeing how there is only one floor left, you decide to see what is the last part of Lugia's mall. You enter the elevator again and press the top button. It doesn't take long before you reach the place.

The doors open, and much to your surprise, you see a large room, with many different things on pedestals. You look around, trying to define the exact function of the place.

"Here is where I keep a showcase of what is and has been the most important things of my life. As you can see, many things I have talked you about before are here. Including a small representation of you" she says happily. And effectively, you see a portrait of you along with a short description of your situation. You are flattered, to say the least.

"Besides me, what is the most important thing to you?" you ask

"Look at the center of the room"

On the center of the room you see a beautiful pearl, just bigger than you, but it is still the most beautiful thing you have seen. Mesmerized, you try to touch it, but your hand goes through it. Lugia chuckles.

"That is just a hologram. I have the real pearl here, on the shrine. It is tiny, but I'll use it to return you to normal, as it can strengthen my psychic powers. Want to see it? Come to the Observation Chamber."

You don't take long before reaching the place. Once Lugia feels you there, starts walking deeper into the shrine, talking to you how she obtained it. But her happy conversation stops when she gets to the farthest part of the shrine.

"Where is it?! Where is the pearl?!"

You try to calm Lugia down, but she remarks that without it you won't be able to return to normal. She frantically looks around, until she finds prints on the floor.

"Of course. Surely he must have entered here and taken it".

"Could it be Ho-oh?" you ask, fearing a retaliation from your former captor.

"Impossible, these are too small to be him, these aren't even from a bird. Wait, I'll try to channel my pearl."

A minute passes, while you wait for Lugia's results. Then she talks again.

"I see it, and I don't like it. It is...inside another Pokémon. And there is only one who could have it." she says, before exiting the shrine and starting to fly. After some time, you see she is heading towards a small cave near a beach. She lands on the entrance, and you feel the ground under you dissappearing. Soon you are in Lugia's mouth.

"Listen, there is a Floatzel here. And we aren't in...very good terms. It must be some sort of revenge. I need your help."

"What do I need to do?"

"Infiltrate his body. Once you're in, search the pearl. I can't define in which part of his body it is. But remember, it is very important that he doesn't notice your presence. If he knows you're inside his body, this could very well be a repeat of what happened with Ho-oh. I'll take care of your Pokémon while you go."

Those words makes you be afraid of your mission, but you nod and tell Lugia you'll do it.

"Good. Go" she says, opening her mouth and extending her tongue on the rocky floor. On the distance you can see the Floatzel, asleep. It is much smaller than Lugia, but is huge compared to you.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You quietly pondered for a few minutes. The pearl that can very well return you to normal now sits within another Pokemon. The thought of entering yet another Pokemon really does not go well with you, especially those that are on the enemy's side. With your experience in Ho-oh still fresh in mind, you don't want to know what it's like to end up in Floatzel's large intestine or anus.

"Do I really have to do this again?", you asked Lugia.

"I'm sorry, but we have little choice but for you to head into Floatzel to retrieve the pearl. We just don't get along well. The last time we met each other, we destroyed several forests on this island by our blasts alone. If I were to confront him directly now about my stolen treasure, he might even destroy the pearl and flee. Could you think of consequences like that?", Lugia said in a concerned voice.

You dreaded the potential result. Remaining shrunk forever. Definitely not something you would like to live through. After giving the mission a deep thought, you agreed with Lugia to take it.

Before going on the mission, Lugia gave you a portable earpiece radio that you can use to communicate with her when you encounter a problem. She also told you the possibility that your search for the pearl may last for a few days to a week. You placed the device into your left ear and tested it with Lugia; it works perfectly. You and Lugia are confident that there is no chance for your communication to be intercepted since Floatzel isn't a psychic-type Pokemon. Now with everything ready, slowly and steadily, you made your way toward the cave.

The Pokemon's lair is just a few feet away from the sandy beach. The cave also contains a small fresh water hole from which Floatzel can drink. Man, Pokemons sure know how to choose the best spots to live at, you mused briefly. The moment you entered the shallow cave, you felt extremely chilly, as the warm sun gets blocked by the solid rocks towering over you like a canopy. Floatzel is sleeping peacefully upon a rock just steps away from you. With your small size, the Pokemon is easily at least 500 feet long. He is also lying in such a position that you can easily enter into his gaping, cavernous mouth. You went up to the rock that the huge Pokemon is on and tried climbing into his mouth which higher up that you thought it would be. From this location, the Pokemon's snoring has grown to unbearable decibels that you have to constantly shield your ears from the sound.

When you are planning your next move, Floatzel suddenly stirred in his sleep, bringing one of his paws next to his gaping maw, just inches away from you. The abrupt movement startled you and you almost screamed in fright. But you quickly reminded yourself of the situation and only a muffled gasp escaped your mouth. Using the opportunity, you climbed onto the paw and prepared to make your way into the mouth. Getting to the top of the paw, you got a good view of Floatzel's mouth. The tongue is surrounded by a set of sharp fangs and teeth. With a long jump, you landed on Floatzel's tongue which caused you to bounce up and down several times. When everything finally settles down, you righted yourself up and crawled toward the Pokemon's throat and down into what could be another vast labyrinth of organs and chambers.

After traveling through an impossibly long esophagus, you landed in Floatzel's stomach with a plop. When your eyes adjusted to the dimness, you started to make out the general features in the stomach. You are now lying in a round pool of water and light acid in the center of the chamber. Fragments of seashells and clams from the last meal that the Pokemon had float on the surface of the liquid. Slightly disgusted by the concoction, you pulled yourself out of it and focus on the task at hand. Floatzel's stomach is remarkably different from both Lugia and Ho-oh's; first, there are several floors in it, at least nine. Each floor contains at least 10 openings that leads to other parts of Floatzel. You almost fainted at the vastness and complexity; if Ho-oh's body was difficult, this was beyond that. This could a grand palace if it weren't for the organic interior. Another difference is the fact that you felt little heat from the flesh surrounding you. This adds to the mysterious feel to this place.

There is little choice but to start at the first floor with one of the openings.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: You proceed to start the mission

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You examine the environment, and try to look through the mix you had landed on. Maybe if Floatzel just ate the pearl it is at the bottom of it, and it is somewhat shallow, so you maybe you could retrieve it. "Lugia, I know I just entered, but I may as well ask: if the pearl fell in a liquid, would it sink?"

"I think it would sink. It depends of the liquid" she replied.

You say thank you, and focus again. The pearl isn't on the pool, and if Floatzel ate it, then it may as well be deeper in the digestive tract, through one of the sphincters of the first floor. You push the thought aside, and wish it wasn't the case, so you start by examining the entrances on the first floor.

You look for any indications of what lies behind every possibility, trying to find out a way so you don't run in nasty surprises. Unfortunately there doesn't seem to be any, obviously Floatzel doesn't had plans to have a guest in his body, so it is mostly up to luck. You pick one randomly and hope you made the right decision, but doubted you would find the pearl behind the first choice.

While you go through the sphincter and walk through the narrow tunnel, you try to imagine where Floatzel would hide the pearl. He wouldn't put protections, right? He didn't expect a human to enter and search it, so it is matter of finding it. When you try to focus on possible places, you get to the end of the road.

You're in a chamber as high as the stomach. It is also divided by floors, you count three. But the most important fact about the chamber is that there is a huge column of water. It falls into a deep pool on the bottom, and from there it gets channeled through glass-like pipes to parts you don't know. The curious part is that the water is even going upwards in a vertical manner, so there is pressure. You comment the situation to Lugia.

"He is a water type Pokémon. His body is likely to work with water in most places. You know to swim, don't you?"

You aren't a very good swimmer, but you think you can hold your breath for a long time, and know to float, but the amount of water inside the body may be an obstacle. You examine the deep pool. The water is clear, so you see the bottom, but there isn't a sign of the pearl.

"Okay, I need to move. Maybe it'll be faster if I let the water carry me somewhere" you think before plunging to the pool. You position yourself so you float, and approach one of the pipes. There is something that catches you off-guard. The whole organ moves, and you suppose this means Floatzel is awake and moving. You remind yourself to be careful.

You hold your breath, and let the water carry you. You can see through the glass, but you can't define what is outside. Luckily the water is fast, and you are thrown into an organ.

You're in a big dome.There is a wide lagoon, and many whirlpools. It seems to be some sort of one-way station, but the best thing is that there is a dry place on a corner. You claim that corner as your resting room.

Once you leave some stuff there, you focus on where to go next. You need some sort of way to access the higher floors of the stomach, relying on the content of it, but you are worried about acids, so you need something to help you. But where to find one?

Maybe Floatzel keeps discarded shells or something somewhere in his body. You doubt they get digested, so you set to search for one, and plunge into one of the whirlpools.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: The Beginning

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The whirlpool sucked you downward into the lagoon and took you through another glass tube.You are spinning and traveling with the water with such an astonishing rate that you can't tell which direction is up. Strangely enough, you are not choking in the water. In fact, you are able to freely breath the water into your nose without any discomfort. Your best guess is that Floatzel probably use water in his body to store oxygen for the many deep dives that it takes daily. After spiraling for a minute or so, you reached the bottom of the lagoon.

For unknown reasons, you are able to stand in the water without needing to swim. You see various impeller-like protrusions that constantly churn the water while releasing air bubbles. As the bubbles got smaller and smaller from the force of the impellers, they eventually became indistinguishable from the water surrounding you. That must be how the Pokemon blend air with the water, you thought, and what enables me to breath here. Walking on the soft bottom of the lagoon, you see the remains of several clams and mollusks from Floatzel's previous meal, lying discarded in various locations. The remnants are so numerous that in some parts of the lagoon, the floor is completely covered. When you look even more carefully among the things, you even spotted some bone fragments from fishes. You know that some Pokemons are carnivorous but never thought that Floatzel is one of them. The last time you looked at your Pokedex, you remembered that Floatzels only eat seaweeds and plankton. Well.....the Pokedex registry will need some updating now.

After half an hour of strolling on the bottom, you saw nothing of interest other than random seashells and other debris on the bottom so you swam back up to the surface of the lagoon. When you surfaced from the water, you took a quick break at the dry corner you found a while ago. Then, by taking another glass tube on the other side of the lagoon, you found yourself back at the chamber with the massive waterfall. This time, you tried to find a way to get to the second floor of the chamber. You carefully eyed each of the glass tubes in the deep pool, locating on that seems to lead to the second floor.

You jumped into the pool and head for the tube. After another dizzying trip, you reached the second floor, emerging on the water surface from a circular opening in the floor. Climbing out of the water and standing up to take in the view around you. There is only one tunnel on this floor for you to take. You entered the passage and let it take you to whatever place it will lead you now. Soon, the tunnel ends at another sphincter. The strange thing is, there is an eye-like symbol formed by pulsing veins on it. Bright lights are emanating from the other side through a pin-prick hole in the center. As this isn't Lugia or Ho-oh, there are no signs indicating your location. You only shrugged as you touched the sphincter and opened it to the next chamber.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You enter the chamber, and are received by an underwater world. This seems too much like your past trek with Lugia. You spend a while just looking at the images in front of you, before snapping out of your memories.

Examining the chamber, you seem to be in the equivalent of Lugia's Observation Chamber and Ho-oh's Eye Chamber, as you can see the outside world. Floatzel seems to be swimming somewhere, but you're too scared to process information. If you're here, does that mean that Floatzel can see you? While you're paralyzed by fear you can see Floatzel hunting fishes. It isn't a nice scene, and soon pieces of fishes are everywhere you can see. The Pokémon also seems to be reuniting small spheres, biting into shells of clams and extracting pearls from them. You see the pearl disappearing, and you suppose it got eaten. Looks like Floatzel collects pearls! Maybe Lugia's pearl is along with the rest.

You carefully get out of the chamber, crawling slowly until you reach the sphincter that marked the entrance to the room. Once you're outside, you contact Lugia.

"I accidentally stumbled upon Floatzel's eyes and stayed there for fifteen minutes. Could he have seen me?" you ask, hoping everything will be alright.

"If he doesn't know you're inside him, it is likely he isn't paying attention to his eyes. You must be safe, but be more careful next time" she replies.

"Listen, Floatzel ate a pearl, so he collects them! Yours can be where the rest are."

"Indeed, he does collect pearls, but is quite selective. It is likely that he is testing the pearl by eating it. He once told me that if a pearl can withstand his stomach for a time, he sends it to where he stores his pearls. If the pearl has signs of being affected by the acids then it gets through the intestines and discarded."

"Could yours be with the rest?"

"It is possible, but it is a special pearl, and he knows it. He could have it in a completely different place, far from the other pearls. But maybe I'm wrong. You should go check"

"How?"

"Go to the stomach and observe the pearl. You'll have to wait some time, but after that, follow the pearl until it gets to the rest of the collection. But if you notice that the pearl and you are going down the intestine, turn back immediately and get back to the stomach so you search the correct path by yourself"

"I think that is a good plan. I'll do it" you say, while taking a last glance through the tiny hole in the sphincter. Floatzel is getting out of the water and returning to his home. Without a second thought, you start walking towards the stomach. It takes you some time, but you finally open a sphincter and can see the stomach. You're on the floor just under the highest one, so there is no danger of being reached by the stomach contents. You can't see the pearl, but from time to time something shines at the bottom of the stomach, the pearl.

Looks like you'll have to wait for a while.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: The Enemy's POV

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You stood at the edge of the floor, monitoring the activity of the stomach below. You saw several pearls rolling around on the bottom of the stomach. Sloshing around in the clear water seems to make them shine even brighter than before. Then, with a light gurgling sound, you saw violet liquids began to drip down from the ceiling of the stomach. Initially mere trickles, the liquids eventually widened into torrential pillars that turned the pool of water into the same color. The pearls are beginning to be affected by the liquid; giving off a distinctive fizzling sound. It struck you that Floatzel was directing acids to the chamber to check on the quality of the pearls. Some of them rapidly dissolved into a powdery white clouds under the effect of stomach acids while a few remained undamaged. The undamaged pearls are collected by another glass tube under the acid and transported to some unknown chambers with the Pokemon. You believe that Lugia's Pearl probably went through the same process and survived the 'test'. All you got to do now is find the organ in question, which proved to be a more difficult job than you thought.

Since it is unsafe to directly dive down to the acids to access the glass tube for now, you have to take an alternative route in Floatzel's body. You checked the floor you're on to see whether there are any other openings. There are two more tunnels on your floor. You chose between one of them and take the passage to wherever to leads. The way was just as slippery and twisting as the first one. Occasionally, the safest way for you is to slide on the slime-covered floor. Eventually, you reached another sphincter for you to open. A different symbol is marked on the entrance. This one seems to depict a sun and a moon arranged on top of one another. You opened the sphincter without hesitation and entered the chamber.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Waiting time

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You enter the chamber and look around quickly. It is a small chamber, almost like a cube, with only one path, not counting the way you came in. The main object in the room are two round objects, on the walls, one on each side.

You approach and examine one. It is a flat round structure, with many pushable pieces. After observing, you find out that this seems almost like a clock, there are no numbers, but you guess this is based on that. The clock is composed by many symbols and abstract graphics, one on each piece. It seems that each piece represents a different function, signaled to be done at one time of the day. You look around to identify the meaning of the symbols. There are the most basic processes, eating, sleeping and similar, but others are very abstract and you have no idea what they mean.

But this clock only marks half of the day, so the one at the other side of the room must mark the other! It seems that the one on the left is related to the night and the one on the right is related to the day. Just to test the resistance of the pieces, you try to push around one of them, which seems to indicate hunger. It doesn't move more than a few inches, you seem to need strength to modify Floatzel's internal clock. You decide to take the time to memorize everything you can, so you aren't in the wrong place at the wrong time.

Looks like Floatzel spends a lot of time awake. Just a few hours in the night, and a nap of one hour in the day, around the time you entered his body. Looks like you only have an hour where you can walk freely without worrying about he noticing you, supposing you don't stay awake during the whole night.

When you're done memorizing, you notice that some of the pieces have a strange bundle of flexible nerves connected to them. All those bundles go behind the clock and along the wall until they get inserted in a tiny hole on the wall, near the only other sphincter in the room. Both clocks have them. Looking more closely, you notice that all the nerves are connected to functions that are related to water and other liquids, all kinds of them.

You walk towards the sphincter, and get ready to enter. It is very likely that behind it there is a room that controls the liquids everywhere in Floatzel's body.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: The Body Clock

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
After entering the sphincter, you are in a chamber with a wide array of tubes. Many of them are transporting liquids of different colors and unknown uses. They are so numerous that they create a dazzling spectrum of glowing color that you thought only exists in paintings. The room is circular and about the same size as the body clock chamber behind you. The nerve from the previous room ran through the ceiling and are connected to various points on the tubes. A closer look reveals a near-transparent valve switch that regulates the flow of each liquids. There are no obvious ways for you to take control of the tubes in the chamber so you surveyed the area before making any further moves. Based on you observation, this chamber is probably near the center Floatzel's body, where regulating the flow of various liquids would be easier and more efficient. You surmised that some of the tubes might be for stomach acids, some for water, and others for unknown purposes yet to be discovered. It is also highly probable that the body clock in the previous chamber controlled the valves in this room too.

Checking on the tubes again, you first tried twisting the valves on the glass tubes but found them to be stuck tight. You tried other ways of altering the flows of the liquids but no obvious effects are seen. After an hour of fruitless effort, you gave up. You told Lugia your current dilemma and she was quick to tell you that Floatzel's has a very predictable body schedule based on her experience. She told you that the Pokemon will probably drain his stomach within two hours after a meal or a pearl collecting session. As Floatzel probably does not have a manual way for a human to override his body function, Lugia suggested that you continue to look around his body further for more clues.

You gave a sigh and slowly made you way back to the multi-floor stomach. The water at the bottom is gradually diluting back into its original state as evidenced by the light purple color. You found another glass tube that you hopped into, transporting you to the fourth floor in the stomach. Once again you are face with several openings to enter. You randomly picked one as always and entered it. This time, the passageway seems to be leading downward into the Pokemon's body.


Meanwhile, outside. Floatzel is having a funny tickling feeling in his body. It started in his stomach and gradually made its way downward into his lower body. Although he was initially suspicious about it. Was that nefarious Lugia up to something again? But he later dismissed it as probably as some stomach upset caused by a bad pearl or clam he ate. He reassured himself that nothing could invade his body.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: Liquids Control

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You walk through the passageway. It keeps going downwards, in some parts you slip and roll before you're able to regain your balance. The trek is tiring, and you consider many times giving up and returning to search for another possibility, but you keep telling yourself that if it is so hard to get to your destination, then it must be something good. Maybe it is the organ you're looking for!

You finally reach flat ground. You seem to be laying on bone, and judging for the steepness and the direction of the path, you must be standing on the pelvis right now. You are on a wide space, and you can see some organs around you. On each one of them there is a single entrance. You look carefully each one before deciding which one to take. You don't want to take any wrong turn.

You choose a round small organ on the other side, apparently on the other side of the body. You hastily open the entrance, to find that the organ is as small as you expected. There isn't much to look at. Just a single screen, and a tiny panel. You step in front of the screen. If you messed around this, would this mean that Floatzel could note it? The location of the organ seems to point that it isn't likely. Something like this was expected to be in the brain, so whatever you can do here may not be important for Floatzel, or maybe the water Pokémon was careless, thinking he was safe.

You press one of the two buttons. The screen turns on, and there is a dial on the side. It seems to be a present recording of the outside, directly from the eyes, but it has a lot of static. You can't see what is happening outside. Floatzel is out of his cave, looking at the sky, and then something crosses the screen, something white and huge. You almost jump when you realize it may as well be Lugia.

You press the only other button there is. It seems that this is outdated technology or whatever this can be labeled as. A very simple interface appears, with only four options, without names. The outside seems to be the first one, and it doesn't even work right. The other two allows you to see inside the main room of the brain (this reminds you that you need to be careful to go unnoticed), and another one is locked. you have no idea what is there. The fourth one ended being different, though.

Half of the image doesn't work, but you can clearly see a lot of pearls. Whatever is recording seems to be on a far side of the room, so you see most of the pearls. You look around, trying to see the one you're looking for. And there it is, in middle of the room. And for your amazement, it has no protection. You guess that the hard part is getting there.

You turn off the screen again, and leave. This surveillance room seems to be here because it simply doesn't work anymore, but maybe Floatzel has replaced it with something better.

You are again in the space on the pelvis. You're starting to get hungry, and you realize you didn't make a lot of plans about that. You have a few packages of dried food for you, but you didn't bring more. You need to find a way to obtain food, and fast.

Outside, Floatzel sees Lugia crossing the sky. For a moment he had thought Lugia could enter his body using psychic powers, so now he was relieved. He decided to take be careful. He closed his mouth hermetically and reminded himself to be more careful with what he eats.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: Surveillance/Reconnais...

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You quickly look around in the pelvic chamber, trying to find a promising organ where you can get some form of food. Some of the organs are familiar like the stomach (which you visited) and the liver but others have unusual shapes and brightly colored that caught your attention. A good look at the organs around you doesn't reveal much about what they do other than the muscle strands that connects to their entrance.  Another quick jog through your memory of surfing through your Pokedex, a food storage area within Floatzel doesn't seem likely. The echoing sound of the large beating heart way above had the effect of making you even more desperate unlike the soothing effects of Lugia's. You are very hungry at this point and willing to do anything to find food, even if it means making you presence known to Floatzel.
Forced to make a choice, you walk up toward one that is blue in color and has a elliptical saucer shape.

When you passed through the entrance, you encountered a circular chamber with an intricate series of web-like structure that forms a conical structure overhead. The web is an intricate design that consists of small white disks interconnected by blue wire like objects. The ground feels solid and smooth.You placed your hand on the floor which felt like concrete. The chamber's only other prominent feature is a tall pillar like structure that supports the entire web structure toward the ceiling. The spire is topped with an dome that has a transparent shell. A blue glow seems to emanate from within. You noticed that a small elevator like ride is located in the center pillar. Once you walked into the device, the thing closes itself in a membrane and made its way up to the dome. 

As the membrane opened in the lift, you couldn't believe what you're seeing. You are in a chamber that looks like a bar. But there is only a counter that can fit a single person. The walls are decorated with seashells and nets. Sounds of ocean crushing and soft winds are played from undetermined location. Several large light globes cast an azure glow into the chamber. Strangely, the lights also creates a water ripple effect. You immediately felt an ambient effect by being in this chamber. The rest of the space is occupied by screens, more panels, and other gadgets.

You went over to the bar table and made yourself comfortable. A menu is placed on the counter, you started reading it to see what is offered.

Outside, Floatzel stared blankly at the sky, wondering about how to face Lugia should she come looking for trouble. Just to make sure, he even rewinded parts of his memory to the part whete he is hunting for food and to Lugia's brief appearance in his sight to check for signs of anomaly. Floatzel failed to notice a small dark speck that appeared at the lower corner of his eyes during his hunting, thinking that it's sea debris.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: Looking for Food

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The bar doesn't seem like a good place to have a varied income of food, but it should be good enough for the few days you'll be inside Floatzel. You aren't surprised to see that there are many drinks that seem to have alcohol as an ingredient, but there are a few dishes that seem okay. But how to order it? You can't say it aloud, right?

You look around, trying to see other clues. There is a strange device on the far side of the counter. It has a single slot, maybe to insert the menu. You place the menu on the slot, and wait. Nothing seems to happen, until a hole opens in the ceiling and food falls directly on the counter.

It seems a rather colorful mix of fishes, not what you wanted to pick from the menu, but you aren't going to complain. You taste it, and while it could be better, it is edible, so you carefully eat it. You encounter bones and other parts of the fish, obviously the food didn't go through the complete cooking process, so it has a few bad surprises. You won't be getting any better for now. Investigating a bit more, you find small containers you can carry, enough for many portions. Knowing that maybe it couldn't be possible to return here later, you take the chance to reintroduce the menu on the slot, many other types of food falling on the counter. You gather what you can on the containers and place ice on them, just in case. You hope that the containers have something that doesn't let food rot. You also gather a few drinks, and plan to be careful with them. They certainly will last much longer than the food.

Once you're set to resist at least three days without having to come back here, you return to the ground. Things seems to look better than before! You have food, and you have a place to sleep!

You look around for some way out. You want to return to the upper body, at least to be closer to the spot you had chosen to sleep. It is almost night. You find a small sphincter hidden by some of the tissue of the walls. You crawl through the sphincter, wondering why it is so small. But it seems to be going to where you want, as it goes upwards.

You keep crawling until you fall down on some liquid. Much to your surprise, it isn't water. It is much thicker than any liquid, but doesn't seem nasty either. Looking around, you're on a thin tunnel, extending to both sides. You start tumbling through the syrup-like mix, wondering where you are, but wherever you're going, it is starting to get colder. The liquid around you is starting to freeze too. It is true that a Water type is likely to be able to produce ice somewhere, but Floatzel doesn't seem like one of them. Could this icy liquid have any other use? Still, you need to get out of it soon or you may risk hypothermia.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Bar Special

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The thick gel around you started to freeze, ice crystal began forming on your cloths. The frigid air caused your breath to condense into visible white smokes.
