You started wondering if Floatzel knows how to use 'Ice-type' moves (which you know isn't really possible), then what else could he do that you didn't know. Not wanting to stay in tunnel any longer you began the arduous journey of trying to make it out of this freezing labyrinth alive. You began at one end of the tunnel that seems to lead upward but you have no idea whether or not it'll take you to the intended destination. As a precaution against slipping on the increasingly ice-filled tunnel, you planted your hands and legs into the "snow" for firmer grips. During your ascent, you discovered that the freezing wind came from small holes located along the diameter of the tunnel. Floatzel must've used some form of reverse dynamic to produce temperature this low, you thought. After minutes of climbing, your hands are trembling uncontrollably from the cold and you couldn't feel your feet anymore. The slush has become nearly unbearable for you as it 'burns' your hand. Despite the challenge, you still got to move forward; the scary thought of losing your life in Floatzel's body provided you with the incentive.

When you saw the end of the tunnel ahead, you couldn't be more overjoyed. You scrambled toward the exit and made it into the open space. The warmer air was a very welcomed amenity for your nearly frostbitten body. You lay on the ground for an uncertain amount of time, allowing the blood in your body to warm up again. After about an hour or so, you felt well enough to stand up again, you realized that you are in another chamber entirely now. You are in some kind of large atrium-like interior. Bone like materials covered the walls and floor around you. Much to your surprise and fear, you saw a large than life models of Floatzel and Lugia that is situated at the dead center of the room. The statue is situated on a pedestal several feet high. The two are posed in a dramatic battle in which Floatzel seems to have the upper hand. Upon closer look at the thing, there are several things that you can think about. The materials of the Pokemons felt very life-like, especially those deep penetrating brown/blue eyes that seem to be watching you. You touched the furs and tail which are soft and comfy. You notice that a sign fixed to the pedestal near you: The Dramatic Victory Envisioned: An artwork that depicts the eventual triumph of Floatzel over Lugia. Materials and subjects are made as realistic as possible by using actual samples as basis..

After reading the short description, you look at the statue for a few more minutes before you notice that there is another hole right behind the statue. You went toward the hole and continue onward to the next location.

Somewhere in Floatzel's complex body system, a screen panel flashes "Guest Detected.....Determine if subject is hostile.....Utilize silent observation with no interference with subject."
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel's Interior: Frozen Ducts

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
It doesn't take you long to enter the next location. And much to your relief, it is a room. How lucky! It is a good thing you stumbled upon a new place to sleep in.

It is a simple room, but seeing how you have to go undetected, it is good enough. There is a bed. Not as comfy as the ones you're used too, but it is okay. There aren't other things in the room. It is possible that this is a provisional guest room, and if Floatzel for some reason had to have somebody inside him, the room would have other things. You wonder if you'll be able to obtain stuff without him noticing.

You place the very few personal belongings on a corner. You had left some in who knows what part of the body, you don't remember, but it isn't necessary to get them back.

You lay on the bed, trying to think. It is obvious there is more than a rivalry between Floatzel and Lugia. You wonder if your friend would tell you what is going on.

"Lugia? Are you still awake?" you ask using the device Lugia had given you for your ear. Yes, Lugia is awake. You ask her about Floatzel.

"I was...his mentor. Many years ago. I taught him everything he knows, and helped him to have more powers than any other of his species. He is close to being as strong as most legendaries, I taught him well. It is a shame that he started to hate me for some reason. We have fought many times, and in the last one I barely triumphed. I don't want to have another encounter with him, as I think I'll be finally outclassed. This is all I think you should know."

"What could happen if he found out I'm inside him?"

"Floatzel only hates me and everything related to me. I'm sure he'll wonder what you're doing inside him and when did you enter, but I don't think he would try to harm you unless he noted we're good friends. Be ready to lie if you are caught."

You think for a while. Floatzel seems to have a rancorous personality, so maybe...as long as you don't do anything wrong...it'll be okay. It is still better to prevent, so you decide to keep being as stealthy as possible. Soon you fall asleep.

Floatzel notes the alarm inside him. Nothing like this had happened before! How can it be possible? He does a quick scan of the body before finding the guest in the room. "A human?" Maybe it would be good to let the human do whatever it wants for now. Doesn't seem like a threat, but Floatzel closed any path towards his most prized possessions, at least for now. He also opened any path that could be used as an exit. Some hours later, Floatzel had already forgotten about the human. As long as he didn't do anything suspicious...
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Hotel Floatzel

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You woke up to the sound of your watch beeping, indicating that it's 7:30AM in the morning. Usually, you would just press the reset button on the watch and go back to your sleep. But being inside an enemy Pokemon made you more vigilant about your surroundings. You picked up one of the containers carrying food and opened it. In the next 15  minutes, you treated yourself to some of the foods you ate yesterday;  you're enjoying one of the grilled fishes and some delicious  egg roes  and some kind of sweet infusion tea. With your breakfast finished, you gather what little personal belongings you have brought and head for the exit, beginning another day of searching for the pearl.

Leaving the hotel room behind you, you returned to the statue room and found another hole for you to walk in. The path took you further upward to the mid-section of Floatzel. Based on your experience the last day and from what Lugia had said, you realized that both Pokemons have many organs in common; which you think is the fact that Lugia is Floatzel's mentor. You thought about what could have caused the relation between them to become frozen. Was it the zealous quest for more power? A traumatizing incident? Or is there a deeper story to this?, you thought. Although you are only in here to retrieve the pearl, you couldn't resist the desire to learn more about the background between Lugia and Floatzel.

Eventually, you reached another sphincter in the tunnel. You entered it and discovered a room with a bunch of wires interconnecting in a grid pattern to various computer terminals on the edge of the chamber, a lot of the computers are flashing random letters and symbols with a low hum. Attempts to decipher the symbols on the displays are useless, as you cannot read untranslated "Pokemonese". And asking for help would almost certainly broke your cover and defeat the whole point of being here. You walked around a bit more a found a computer with a larger screen to use. Something about it tells you that this one is responsible for everything that goes on in this chamber. You found a button layout beneath you and began pressing keys to see what they do.

Floatzel woke up to the sound of the notification system in his brain. Although initially confused by the sound, the Pokemon eventually remembered that he detected a human within his body. Focussing himself, Floatzel performed another scan and found the human playing with his self-termed PokeConnect computers near the middle part of his body. The Pokemon activate an active surveillance signal to keep track of everything. When the human is proven to be harmless, I'll send him a little surprise, Floatzel thought.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Second Day

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You keep pressing random keys, and see the characters on all the screens changing, but nothing else seems to happen. Maybe if you knew what they said...

...and what is more important. What are these things controlling? Could these have an effect somewhere in Floatzel's body? It is possible, but you have no way to know, at least for now. You decide to pay attention carefully to the signs and letters on all the screens, to try to find out the reason for these.

Floatzel is getting tired of watching the human. The guest doesn't seem to be doing anything besides trying to figure out the function of the computers. It is basically a way to be linked to other Pokémon, in any part of the world. But it looks like the human can't understand the language, how disappointing. Floatzel had left a couple messages to try to define the human's reasons to be inside him, but it is going to be worthless if one can't communicate properly. If the human proves to not to be a menace then maybe it would be okay to traduce the language to something the guest can understand. Meanwhile Floatzel decides to change tactics.

He quickly forms a new path to the Pearl Storage. If the human is going for them, then it is expected that the human will go straight to that point. Then he lays a trap in middle of the path, to get rid of the unexpected habitant of his body. Floatzel connects the path to the PokéConnect computers room, but doesn't open it yet. First he creates a new road, that leads to the organs that direct air to the lungs, the large floater and other parts that needs air. Then connects it to the room the human is in. If the human is a mere explorer then this should attract it. Floatzel watches carefully, and when the human presses a button, Floatzel opens them as if it were activated by the computer.

When you press one of the keys, two large sphincters open on the side of the room. You don't remember seeing them when you entered, but it is possible you didn't pay attention. You walk to them, and see signs. The one to your left says 'Pearl Storage', while the one on the right says 'Air Pumps'. You are full of joy. Finally, the part you're looking for!

But before you step towards the left entrance, a sudden thought comes to your mind. Can it be this easy? Maybe...maybe it would be good to wait and enter there later. You doubt that Floatzel would make this easy. But if this is a test, then you are caught!

You decide to play safe, now you remember the place and can return later if at the end this isn't a test. You enter the path leading to the...Air Pumps. Whatever that is.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The tunnel toward the Air Pumps proves to be the right choice as everything seems fine along the way. But again, the notion that the Pokemon realizes that you're in his body isn't going well with you. If Floatzel knows that I'm looking for the pearl, wouldn't he already had me expelled from the body....or worse imprisoning me and making me do things that makes Ho-oh looks benevolent in comparison. You shrugged off those thoughts and decide to focus at the task at hand: going down the tunnel to the Air Pumps. You can feel the waves of wind blowing in your direction as you scaled the passage. You eventually reached a split path that diverge in a V shape. A small sign contains the simple outline of a pair of lungs. The sign contains an interesting addition, a floatation-like organ in a U-shape that is connected to the lungs. Seeing no point in choosing, you took the one to your left. When you reached the lung, you are greeted by the rush of even more warm air. The tunnel you entered from is situated at the base of the organ which you estimated is 50 feet high. You observed how air entered through another hole all the way on the top. As the air passes into the lung you're in, they go through some kind of bristles that resemble large trees that is suspended from the ceiling. Although you know anatomy and the respiratory process quite well, it is another thing to actually see it in process. After the lung is entirely filled with air, the bristles began there work by sucking the oxygen into interconnecting tubes which then transport them into yellow veins in the middle for delivery to other parts of the body.

After seeing enough of the huge lung you decide to see what the U-shaped organ you saw on the sign was all about.

Unknown to the trainer, Floatzel has been monitoring his action the entire time. The Pokemon preferred the trainer to remain ignorant about his surveillance. The human seems uninterested in the pearls, the Pokemon thought, maybe he is just curious about the functioning about my body. If that's the case, maybe I'll just play him around my body for some much needed entertainment. Floatzel grinned as he thinks of all the things he can do with the human as he sensed him approaching the floater organ. I'll leave a surprise for him later.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You turn back and return to the bifurcation from earlier. This time you took the other path, thinking about your next move. There isn't a single clue about Floatzel's purposes. You wonder...if there could be a way to find out.

It doesn't take long before you reach your destination. You know that the organ you're in is the species' most outstanding physical trait. And well, while you hadn't expected it to be the most amazing thing ever, you can't avoid feeling strangely relaxed.

You're enveloped by the yellow hue casted by the walls. Your surroundings move constantly, ad you have trouble, you fall down frequently. The floor and the walls are rubbery, as you had expected, and the air around you is moving constantly. Everything ends being relaxing to you.

You walk, breathing deeply. Although the floater is somewhat deflated, it still has a lot of air and space, and it seems pure. While you walk, you think about the recent event. There isn't still contact from your host. You're starting to wonder if he even cares about your presence. It is better than being abused and treated like a speck of dust, but you can't avoid feeling a bit...disappointed. At least this could mean you have enough freedom to walk around his body, free to retrieve the pearl, but if he found out your presence, how would he react to you entering his Pearl Storage?

The thought of somehow obtaining a false pearl to fool Floatzel crosses your mind. It is an awesome idea! You try to contact Lugia to tell her about it, but then you slip. You was so focused on your thoughts that you didn't notice you had approached to the end of the road. In front on you there was a big hole, you remember that the floater goes along the body until it end around the chest. And you slipped, you're now falling down the floater. It is very high, and if it weren't for the soft tissue, this could very well be your death.

You fall for many seconds, sometimes hitting the side. When the floater gets thinner, you hit both sides until you finally fall to the bottom, to a point that isn't much bigger than you. You take a moment to recover from the fall, and look around. The thought of climbing back isn't possible. You can't get a grip on the tissue. Luckily for you, there is a single sphincter, although it is small, you think you can fit through it. But the worse thing about the place you're in, is that the air around you isn't pure. Later you would deduce that the used air and dioxide would gather where you was. Instinct kicks in, you know you shouldn't stay long in here.

You stretch the opening and crawl through it, instantly falling. The tube you entered is wider in the inside, but you don't have time to look at your surroundings. The air currents takes your light body, and you don't know what will happen now.

Floatzel was thinking about what he could do with the human when he feels something funny and slightly painful. It doesn't take long for him to realize that the human entered another part of his respiratory system. If one didn't do anything soon, the human could be expelled from his body with the rest of the stale air. As a precaution Floatzel covered his nose so nothing would come out of it. He didn't want the human to be out yet, not now that he just found out the unexpected guest can be harmless. Floatzel hopes that things will be okay.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Floater

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You continue tumbling about in the tunnel, bouncing against the soft walls on your descent. For some reason, you find the air very stale and difficult to breath, but that not your concern for now as you are more interested in finding a way to stop your fall. The winds in the tunnels grew stronger and stronger the deeper you went in. Soon, you bumped up against a wall of flesh that stopped your fall. You felt as if your head was about to split apart from the force of the fall. Cringing and holding your head in pain, you remained dizzy and disoriented for a good minute or two before you regained enough consciousness to survey your new surrounding. It looks like the end of the air tunnel but something seems odd about the floor you're on. There is a thick layer of orange fur on the ground; without doubt, those fur certainly helped reduced the impact. The air has fallen completely still....not a wisp of wind can be felt. Confused about this, you bent down to touch the fur. It resembles a thick carpet and it extends all the way to the circular edge of the tunnel. It feels as if the 'carpet' was blocking the path. You attempt to pry open the edge as if it were a sphincter. The floor refused to budge an inch. It left you scratching your head as to what could this mean? Did Floatzel discovered that I'm in him? Am I now imprisoned or something?

Outside, Floatzel sensed that the human has come to a stop at the entrance to his nose. He makes a quick scan of the human's body to make sure he isn't hurt. The Pokemon only detected a few minor bruising but the human will be fine. He guessed that the human is probably very confused now about what just happened. Although Floatzel is unable to read minds, he is really amused by the human's curiosity of his body. Floatzel didn't know how the small human came to be in his body, but he'll take the opportunity to play him to his liking without the human realizing that he is aware of him. Floatzel took a deep sniff in his nose to take the human back in to depths of his body thinking of where he should be dropped next.....

Just as you are dreading the prospect that Floatzel has discovered and trapped you, there was suddenly a strong suction force coming from above the tunnel, lifting you off your feet. A loud scream escaped from your mouth as you are being carried in the tunnel. The furry floor where you previously stood open up below, allowing you to briefly see bright lights before being sent deeper into Floatzel's body. The air in the tunnel feels much fresher now. What was that?, you thought. Did I just see outside a while ago? If you did, you wouldn't really be surprised about it since you are, after all, in the Pokemon's respiratory system. But that still doesn't explain the floor. You are left to conclude that is most likely a Pokemon's equivalent of nose hair. The strong winds send you tumbling in a head turning spin. What you didn't is a new path opening up ahead, transporting you to the next destination. All you can feel is that you are traveling higher than before.

Floatzel silently laughed as he hear the human scream as he was sucked back in. He sure can be interesting, he thought. The good thing is that the human seems uninterested in his treasure. He calculated that the human just been through roughly less than a quarter of his body part if he exclude the Pearl Chamber. While still entertaining himself to the idea of the human, Floatzel felt his stomach rumbling from hunger and realized that he hasn't eaten yet. He walked toward the sea and took a plunge into the deep water to hunt for some food. As he swam in the cold seawater, Floatzel opened his mouth to swallow whatever prey he saw in front of him. Within a quarter of an hour, Floatzel managed to gather fishes, shellfishes, and various other edible things; enough for him to fill him and plenty more to send to the storage stomach. As he finished the last of the seaweed in his mouth, an idea suddenly crossed Floatzel's mind. As a good host, maybe it's time that I treat him to some fine foods and a nice, luxury room with good views from my eyes, Floatzel thought as he began to rearrange and modify his body interior. He recalled the things that he saw humans used and created an inner environment that the human will love. When the he sees what I've prepared for him, he'll want to stay in me forever and I'll get to have a new 'pet' to play with.......
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You fly before the air finally stops and you drop on the hard floor. You once again stop for a minute to orientate yourself. You have spent roughly the last half hour laying on the floor, and you don't like it. You gather enough energy to stand up and look around you.

You groan when you realize you're once again in front of the eyes. You had already visited this place, coming back seems useless, but you notice that there is something different. There is furniture, made of the materials you had expected. You approach slowly to it, now knowing for sure that you have been found. But it isn't as bad as you expected, as you sit on the chair and see the food on the table. It has better quality than the one you had collected before, and you're thankful for that.

While you eat, you're wondering if this also means that he'll be able to listen to you. Talking to Lugia can be risky now, unless you find a way to use your thoughts. You try to configure the device on your ear, without Floatzel noticing. You find what you're looking for, and test it. It works, so you aren't worried anymore, you enjoy the rest of the lunch. You have to admit that maybe getting caught wasn't a bad idea.

When you're done, you walk around the chamber, watching the scenes outside. It is the normal life of your actual host, nothing special. When you are considering leaving the place and continue your mission, a hole opens on the floor. You approach and try to find out where it leads. Despite the seemingly good intentions, you have doubts. "Go." you hear, a voice you hadn't heard before. It doesn't take you long to find out who it is, and seeing that maybe it would be good not to upset him, you obey. You jump into the hole.

You fall on your bed, on the same bedroom you had slept in last night, but this place has changed too. Now it has more stuff in it, and on a corner you see the stuff you had left somewhere in his body. You look around, trying to see if there is anything special. Everything seems normal. You consider that maybe it is time to try to...finally ask what is going on.

"Uh...hello?" you say loudly.

"Human. I hadn't expected one of you to somehow shrink and enter my body. You and I need to talk now." Floatzel says.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Great Lunch at {i}Floatzel's{/i}

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Floatzel formed a muscular tube from the ceiling that engulfed you and sucked into it. You are pushed through the tight tubing and brought to another chamber. There is a table and a chair for you to sit on. You promptly took a seat. A screen turns on in front of you and a set of keyboard materialized on the table. The screen now shows the cavern which the Pokemon lives in. You can see something moving off-screen from the right side. Suddenly, Floatzel walks into the camera and faces you on the display. You are shocked by how casually the Pokemon seems about humans, especially one that is in his body right now.

"Hi again, human.", the Floatzel said politely, "I'm Floatzel, as you probably know, it is so good to see you here in my one-on-one meeting room. Within this room, you will be able to do private conversations with me. You can speak directly to me as I can hear you in there. If you don't feel like talking, you are welcomed to use the keyboard in front of you to type your response."

You nodded in agreement with the Pokemon. Floatzel doesn't seem so bad after all, you thought. But still, I better try to keep on his good side if I were to live. Absolutely no mention of Lugia, you reminded yourself. The Pokemon seem to notice your silence and replied.

"You may wonder, why are you seeing me if you are in me. Short explanation, I can temporarily create a second invisible conscious that can be used as a scouting device or a camera as I am doing now. Well, back to the point of me getting you here. I'm curious, as a human, how did you end up being so small?"

You remained silent. Floatzel gave you a smile.

"There is no need to be afraid, human. The room you're in is impervious to any sorts of psychic interception, even from that cursed Lugia. You can safely talk to me here.", Floatzel said with an emphatic scorn on Lugia's name.

You became a little worried about the situation; You will not be able to communicate with Lugia during this meeting. Looks like I'm by myself now, you thought. After much thinking, you began to explain how you got to be shrunken mysteriously without any apparent form of psychic power. You specifically left out Lugia and told Floatzel that you encountered a lot of Pokemons along the way that are keen on eating you up and how you had to travel long, challenging ways to finally get to this island to find the solution to your predicament. You made up stories of how you are trapped in countless stomachs and endure constant torment at the claws of your captor (which is a half-truth) in unmentionable ways. At last you finished your story by saying a Peliper dropped you here and you entered him unknowingly while seeking shelter during dark.

"That's quite a lot to endure in such short time.", Floatzel said, "You don't have to worry much, I'm not one of those mean Pokemons. And by the way, since you're new in here, why don't I show you around a little?"

"Hmmm....I would love to", you said, doing your best to look polite and happy.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Chatting with Floatzel

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Floatzel went off-screen. An entrance opens on the side of the room, and you step out of it. You can hear Floatzel, but he comments that it feels odd talking alone, so he resorts to giving you a small device so you read his words. You're being guided around, and much to your dismay, you are shown many places you had visited in your short stay inside Floatzel. You suppose that he wanted to show you the most important places for you, and you hope that the next ones are new.

You don't pay attention to what Floatzel says, it is stuff you had already supposed or knew for sure. Maybe Floatzel has noted your disinterest, as he seems to be more frustrated at the lack of enthusiasm. He finally decides to ask you what is going on. While you're returning once again to the stomach to explore the higher levels of the organ, you receive a message from your host.

Okay, I expected a better reaction. What is wrong with you?

"It is that I have already seen these places, it was yesterday. I thought there would be something better at first" you say as polite as you can.

Listen, I'm letting you be inside me, the least I ask is for a bit of gratitude.

You apologize and say that you are thankful of his protection, along with other compliments. You don't want to upset him, as you don't know what he could do if he gets mad at you. Floatzel tells you to wait for a moment, so you sit on the edge of the level you're in and observe the bottom of the empty stomach

If this isn't catching your interest then I need to fix that. I have created something that I'm sure will spark your enthusiasm while showing you around my body.

"Okay, what is it?"

Enter through the hole near to you. It is empty, just enter.

You obey. You enter the sphincter, and are greeted by a tiny and empty room. Once Floatzel feels you're in, five spheres appears in front of you, each one of them differently colored. They are made of a material you have never seen, but they still remind you of the pearl you're supposed to be looking for.

Let's play a game. I'll place each one of these balls around my body, in different places. You won't have a time limit to find then, but when you do I'll show you my personal treasure. I collect pearls, you know.

This does catch your interest. Now this could be a good way to complete your mission! "I accept. What are the rules?"

I'll hide each one in a different type of organ. Once you step out of this room, you'll receive five clues describing the type of organ it is in. That is it. After you read this, you see the balls sinking into the floor and to who knows what parts. You see them go, and wait a minute before coming out.

"I'll start" you say before going out of the room.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

choices: You figured out the first clue
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Once you exited the chamber, the device you are holding refreshes its screen, displaying five clues for you:

1. Head out through the passage of air. Face not the sunlight but behind you. Enter the right window and let the soul be your guide.

2. You're me but I'm still myself. Honored as the worthy captain.

3. Walk down the main road, toward the palace of culture. Midst seas you will find me.

4. The ocean flushes loud, against the gentle beating of drums.

5. Deepest desires in store I possess. Gifts transferred by tubes to foreign rooms.


You read them again but couldn't quite grasp their meanings. Surely, some of the clues are metaphorical and others are literal. The challenging part is solving them. 'Passage of air'? Behind me? Windows? Where does that refer to? , you thought. While thinking about the riddle, you heard Floatzel laugh.

"Looks like I got you interested", chimed Floatzel, "I thought I should make it more challenging but seeing that it is your first time here, I made it easy for you. If you still find it difficult, I'll give you a little hint: Some  of the places can only be seen from the outside of my body.... In addition to that, I rearranged everything so the entranced won't be the same."

"Ah, no...", you groaned.

"Oh, yes, this'll be the most fun I had in months, said Floatzel, "Once all the balls are found, a great reward awaits you. Gooood luck!"

Upon hearing the tidbit from Floatzel, you believe that the passage of air refers to either the nose or the mouth. But the next part of the clue remains beyond you....
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Start the game

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You are almost sure about the location, but you have no idea what the organ itself is your goal. Still, there is nothing to lose by going to where you think it is. You check the entrances around you, looking for one that goes upwards. You finally find one, and start the trek to the head.

While you're walking, you decide to spend time thinking about the answers to the other clues. You meditate about your past experiences inside the bodies of other Pokémon, well, the only two you have been in. You can think of a few places that can fit the clues, and at the end you are sure of the answers for clues number #2, #3 and #5, but you can't figure out the 4th one. When that is out of the way, you focus on the clue you're trying to solve.

You still think that the location is up there, either close to the nose or the mouth. And judging by the clue, you shouldn't look towards the exits, but the opposite direction. You have also heard that the eyes are windows to the soul. Can it be? Could the first ball be in the eyes? You are doubting that the ball is in one of the first places you have visited in your temporal stay inside Floatzel, but everything points towards that.

You finally reach the mouth. When you see the long tongue and the teeth, you decide that maybe you should check for entrances, in case you aren't right. You know that there must be a way to the eyes somewhere, but how to reach? If that isn't the answer, then you should look around for other possibilities.

You take your time to walk around the mouth. Much to your surprise, nothing is moving. It feels that Floatzel is asleep, which is a point in your favor, so you can explore without him doing something. You look carefully to the roof of the mouth, for any possible paths. You also sneak under the tongue, but only manage to soak yourself in saliva. You think that it was stupid.

After your examination, you deduce that definitely the mouth hasn't the new entrance to the eyes. You return to the back of the mouth, and look at the other side of the throat. There are small paths where you can stand, but there isn't a way there. The only way is to ascend more. You look around until you find ridges on a side, you use it to climb until you reach another floor.

Looking around, you guess that you're now in the nose airway. Now that you think it, didn't you somehow reach a way higher by getting sucked with air? You doubt that it'll be possible to reach it again. You guess that the only option would be to trek along the nose until you find a way. Would you need to get outside to find it? You doubt it, but one never knows with this hose.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: You figured out the first clue

choices: The Eye World and the First Ball
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Shaking any remaining thoughts off, you walked down what you believe is the way out to the nose. The wind in here is particularly strong, and you got to have a rough idea of the timing of Floatzel's inhaling and exhaling. Otherwise, you might lose your balance and get blown out of the nose like a cannonball. When the wind gets too strong for you to go on, you resort to grasping on the thick nose hairs that lines the entire length of the tunnel. Some of the hairs felt moist and firm, many of them have dusts, mucus, and other foreign particles trapped in their intricate web. After another steep climb, you reached the opening at the nostrils. You can see the outside again, but that's not your top priority.

You found a narrow ledge to stand on the dark surface of the nose. You carefully sidled your way up the groove that eventually lead to the top of the nose. Once on top, you see that both eyes are shut and some distance away from you. Making sure that Floatzel is still, you slowly moved across the snout and closer to one of the eyes. You chose the one to your right, figuring that the wording of the clue probably has multiple meanings.

The moment you arrived at the front of the eye, it suddenly shot open, creating a large gust that almost blew you away. The intricate patterns in Floatzel's brown eye are like the random strokes of a pencil underneath a microscope. You noticed the reflection within the eye which provides you with a good panorama. Due to the concave shape, the image is enlarged and distorted. You can see the cave entrance and the sun shining through a set of trees. The reflection is so crystal clear that you could make out the shape of the clouds in the sky and Floatzel's paws in the foreground.

You reached out toward the eye and touched your own reflection. The instance your hand is on the surface of the pupil, you felt yourself being sucked inward. The force is tremendous and you put up no resistance as you are dragged through the window.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You float around, disorientated. It feels as if you were encased in jelly, which is curious. You thought that at the other side there would be the eye chamber, but looks like it isn't a thin membrane, it is a whole space, filled with who knows what. You aren't surprised you can breath, but the feeling of the sticky substance is annoying.

The environment is pitch black, but after a while of moving randomly everything around you changes. Images of landscapes, stuff under the sea, other Pokémon and even Floatzel himself are around you. The images are distorted and oddly skewed, so it is obvious it isn't real. Maybe they are reflections of the outside, maybe from the past or something, remains of stuff that has been seen.

You keep moving, almost swimming, almost walking, observing around you. The images may be a distraction for you not to find the ball you're looking for, but everything is surrealistic and does distract you. You don't even know the color of the ball. You wonder if you could accidentally leave the eye before finding what you're looking for.

You are moving upwards, until you crash against the top of the eye. Once you notice that there is no more space up there, you glance under you. There is something that doesn't belong to the images, something solid and round. You are happy when you recognize it is one of the balls you're looking for. You try to swim as fast as you can, but the sticky environment hinders your progress. The ball is moving too, so you waste a lot of time chasing the ball through the slime.

You finally grasp the ball. Once you have it stored, you start to look around for a way out. The images must be coming from somewhere, so you go towards the opposite direction. If they are stuff Floatzel is seeing right now, then maybe going towards the opposite side will make you be inside.

You stumble upon a firm membrane at the back. Despite how solid it is, you can pass through it without leaving any marks. You hurry to leave the eye, and fall towards the floor of the chamber you're in. Looking around, you see that you're once again inside the eye chamber you had visited before.

"I found one!" you yell. Floatzel doesn't reply, but you know that he is awake. Outside you can see what he is doing, he seems to be in his cave, continuing with his everyday life. You turn your back towards the outside world and leave the eye. It is already dark, you spent a lot of time inside the eye, but you think you can find the second one before you decide to sleep.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Eye World and the First Ball

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
While you're strolling in the tunnel, you try to solve the second clue from Floatzel. You're me but I'm still myself. Honored as the worthy captain. You assumed that by captain, the Pokemon meant something to do with being a leader, being in control of the situation. Does it have something to do with the control room?, you thought. The last time you were in Ho-oh's control room, you could control his body but not his conscious. It makes complete sense if you take into consideration that the control room is the only part of the body that can allow you to be a 'captain'. On the other hand, the Pokemon's mind still exists instead of being overridden by your control.

With this conclusion in mind, you try to find your way to Floatzel's brain by taking a passage that leads upward. Once you entered the tunnel, the surrounding began to change. The floor and walls became more rubbery and overhead clearance became higher. The size of the tunnel now rivals that of a cavern. You are left to wonder if Floatzel would let you in his brain so easily since this is literally his center. Shouldn't he be safeguarding all the information stored in there? But if he placed one of the balls in there, it means that I'm gaining his trust, you thought.

It took a 5 minute walk to finally see the end of the tunnel. Here you are greeted with a large pink mass of brain flesh. The fold and wrinkles on the brain are large enough to be valleys and mountains from your perspective. Flashing strobes of lights are scattered here and there, dotting the nerves surrounding the mass. If memory serves you right (pun unintended), Floatzel's brain is larger than Ho-oh's. There is a single spiral stairway near the brain stem that goes into the bottom of a lobe. You climbed the stairs into the brain and find a lobby-like chamber with two sets of chairs and tables placed on either side. The brain interior looks more like an actual building complete with an ornate floor, stairs, and framed pictures of Floatzel himself in heroic pose. There is a large sign that overhangs the ceiling displaying directions:

Data Center*
Control Room
Instinct Management*
Special Bedroom
Memory Bank*
Lugia Archives*

* Access to these areas will require permission from Floatzel. Please ask your host for more information.

You reviewed the signboard again; look like Floatzel has restrictions after all. Only the Control Room and Bedroom can be visited. But one of the restricted places caught your eyes. What does the "Lugia Archives" contain? Will you get to see the contents? Hopefully if the Pokemon grants you access later on, you can better understand the relationship between those two.

You followed the direction toward the control room, intent on finding the ball and ending the day.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Searching the second ball

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You enter the control room, ready to take the ball and leave. However, it is different than the one you had found inside Ho-oh. It is much more limited, maybe because Floatzel doesn't want you to have complete control of his body, but it still has the most basic stuff for you to control it. You look around, looking for the ball itself. After inspecting every place in the control room, you haven't found the object.

A message displays on the screen, and you hear a sound coming from it. Once Floatzel got your attention and you're in front of the controls, the image changes to the outside. "Looking for this?" he says while holding a ball. It is obvious that it was outside. "Go for it" he says while throwing the ball into the sea. Then the controls in front of you light up, you take that as a sign that you have to pilot Floatzel.

Walking is easy, and you have no problem with that, but after you get in the water you start to have trouble. Floatzel's body floats around when you don't want too, other times it sinks, and you can hear Floatzel taunting you for your bad maneuvers. You know that he is doing this on purpose to make it frustratingly hard for you.

"Shut up!...please" you yell. It doesn't stop the Pokémon.

After a while you think you know how to swim on one direction. It is night, but you can see clearly. You patrol the area, trying to find any round object on the bottom of the sea. You often grab something because you think it is what you're looking, but normally it is just debris and stones, and one pearl which you proceeded to eat. Floatzel comments that it is the worst pearl he had encountered, didn't even need to test it to know it is of bad quality.

You dig around the sand, until you finally find something that sticks out. You manage to grab it and are relieved to see that it is one of the balls. You eat it too, and then start to pilot Floatzel's body to return to the cave. You manage to crash him a few times against the floor of the beach when you try to stand up, until he decides that it is over and that he should take control before you hurt him.

"You're a much worse Floatzel than me. This room is officially out of your limits without my supervision" you hear him say, laughing about your efforts. You spent too much time with this, just as he says at least twice before you exit his brain. "I wasn't wrong, seeing you bumbling around is the most fun I had in months!"

You're somewhat annoyed at his behavior, but you guess that he is somewhat right. When you enter your bedroom, you remember what you wanted to ask him earlier.

"I had seen something called "Lugia Archives". I was wondering, what is that? I noticed there is a statue down there that shows you two fighting and you winning"

"Just some records about she. Lugia is a good for nothing legendary, after you read my archives you'll see why. Maybe tomorrow or the day after tomorrow" Floatzel replies, and doesn't say anything else for the rest of the night.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

choices: The Search in the Lugia Archives
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You woke up the next day in the bedroom. Your body felt so tired from yesterday's activity that you were tempted to sleep on. Checking your watch, it reads 8:13am. As a person who is used to get up early, you are surprised that you have overslept by an hour. Okay now, time to get something to eat for breakfast, a shower, and back to the searching for the remaining balls, you thought. Before you can make another move to leave the brain, the ground beneath you opened up and caused you to rumble downward. When the fall finally stopped, you find yourself back in the eye chamber you visited so many times already.

Something was different about this place this morning. There is a large meshed drain hole in the center of the hole. Platforms are arranged in a cut circular ring around the drain. You tried asking Floatzel about the function of the setup but he didn't reply. The Pokemon continue walking along the beach as if trying to survey the sea for any sorts of food.

Without warning, hot water started raining down from the ceiling of the eye chamber. It started out as a light drizzle but became a full power waterfall in mere seconds. You tried avoiding the water but you eventually became wet. The jet stream of water covered the chamber in a warm curtain of mist and steam, obscuring your view of the eyes.

"Gooood morning, human!", Floatzel chimed, "How are you liking the complimentary shower I'm providing right now?"

"Huh, what? This is a shower? At least you could have told me about this.", you said.

"Heh heh. Sorry. I thought you would like it better if it were a surprise. Plus, you get to have a scenic view here.", Floatzel said apologetically while stopping the flow of water.

"Oh great!", you muttered, "Now that my cloths are completely drenched, how am I supposed to walk around your body today."

"You know....you are always welcomed walk in my body naked. There's no need for cloths anyway; it's not anyone's gonna see you like this in here and I'm perfectly fine with you without apparels.", Floatzel chuckled.

"Thank you very much", you said sarcastically, "But I would very much prefer something to wear. My cloths aren't going to be dried for hours, what am I supposed to wear now?"

"Hmm....I'll make something for you to wear now. Let's see if I can get that done.", Floatzel replied.

Within minutes, a soft fabric like substance engulfed your body. The silkiness of the veil-like membrane gave you a strange feeling as it drives itself into the crannies on your body. The fabric slowly shaped themselves into a shirt, an underwear, and a pant for you. When the process is completed, you take a look at the result.

Floatzel has made you an orange T-shirt emblazoned with a large head of the Pokemon himself giving the viewer a smirk. The words "Enter Me for Fun" is printed below the image. For your pant, Floatzel made a nice-fitting jean with stylized markings based on those he has. You inspected it again and find the result satisfactory but a little bit funny.

Floatzel seems to sense your satisfaction and smiled too.

"As a little apology for what I've done, I'm disclosing the location of the third ball. The third ball is also in the brain, it is somewhere within the archives. I've opened up the Lugia Archives for your private viewing. Search there."

You felt another tube carried you back to the brain. The third ball is just ahead.....
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Third Day

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You're excited to finally see why these two have such a tense animosity. It almost makes you forget that the main target would be finding the ball, but you plan to take enough time to learn more.

The tube carries you to the storage. It has a lot of flat tablets, organized in a single shelf. It isn't a big room, so you guess it won't take long to find the ball. You start by removing the tablets from the shelf. After a while you have removed all of them and found the ball in a corner of the shelf, you take it, completing the third clue. You however don't want to leave yet.

"That was fast" you think. Why would it be this easy? You guess that it means that Floatzel may want you to check the information he has about Lugia. Not that you'll object. You carefully start placing the tablets back into the shelf, which seems to form a timeline going to the present. You read each tablet, looking for anything that may be interesting. You aren't surprised to see a lot of "I'm superior to Lugia in every sense" and other similar egoistical stuff, but you thought there would be more. You however do find some information.

In the first tablet it tells how Floatzel, many years ago, asked Lugia to teach him. It seems that he wanted to go further and be stronger than anybody else in his species, and use it to demonstrate his superiority over his peers. The longer you read other tablets, you see it turn into the desire of being stronger than his master, turning him into a force to be feared not only in his home but in the rest of the world.

Many of the tablets describe how Lugia trained him, and the stories makes Lugia look like a ruthless tyrant who had no consideration towards him or anybody else. You think that it may be possible that Floatzel has modified these memories to match his actual image of Lugia, and some contradictions between tablets seems to prove it. You can't imagine Lugia being as bad as described. But what made Floatzel loathe the legendary Pokémon this much?

Somewhere after the middle of the timeline you find a possible answer. "I asked her to help me to be even better. She said that there was nothing else she could teach me to enhance my abilities. She is lying! I know that! I can be much better, but she refuses to do it. It is obvious Lugia thinks I'm a threat for her. I'll show her that I can outmatch her, sooner or later. I don't care how long it'll take"

You guess that Floatzel has always been somewhat narcissistic, but that his increasing strength made it worse. He seems to be okay with everybody else as long as it doesn't bother him, so maybe as long as you don't upset him a lot you should be okay. Lugia refused to help him so he vowed to defeat her.

Once you have organized all the tablets back onto the shelf, you leave the room. "Did you read anything interesting, human?"

You think carefully before replying. "Yes, that was a big surprise. I...didn't know you were so powerful, it is impressive!" Floatzel seems to be happy with your words, so you aren't in danger right now.

"I knew you would see that. You aren't that bad, for a human. Okay, you have three of five. Will you be able to find the fourth?"

You think for a while, trying to solve the fourth clue. After discarding many possibilities, you set onto one, and start walking.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Search in the Lugia Archives

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You began the search for the fourth ball after the relatively easy search for the previous three. The ocean flushes loud, against the gentle beating of drums. The clue was the first challenging one that you have encountered so far. What does it mean for the ocean to flush out loud? The beating of drums? Where would I find that in Floatzel?, you thought. After half an hour of pondering, you're still without an answer. You tried to ask the Pokemon for an answer, but he just merely gave you a mischievous grin, saying that it will be more fun if you found the answer to this one yourself. Look like Floatzel will be tight-lipped about this one, you thought.

Left with no other choice, you decide you should go back to randomly wandering around in the body. Perhaps with some luck, you'll stumble upon the right location. You left the brain and took a passage that leads downward. Along the way, you spotted numerous other entrances that branches off from the main route. As was the case in Lugia, they are all marked with pictograms representing the part they lead to.

About halfway down the route, you spotted a tunnel with a sign reading Mystery Organ on it. You have never seen places like this previously, not even in Lugia. You decided to go down the path to see what it's all about. Deep down, you hoped you found the right organ.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The fourth ball

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
When you enter you have the nagging feeling that you picked the wrong path. Although the organ you're in seems to contain an ocean, there are no indications of drums. You're standing at the edge of a large amount of iridescent water, and can't see any other entrances or paths you could take.

You crouch and touch the water, not being able to find a difference besides color. You hesitantly walk forward, but much to your surprise you find out that you can walk on the surface of the water. You keep walking, soon reaching the center of the huge lake. You're almost blinded by the brightness and the colors of the water, and you stop. The moment you stop, you start sinking. You start to panic, and sink faster, until you're covered by the water. You can't see anything.

You can breath, but you're getting dizzy. Despite being able to breath, the water has enough oxygen to let you live, but you can feel effects of lack of an adequate amount of oxygen. You try to relax, and once you do you note that there are currents under the water. You let yourself be carried by the currents, disorientated. Before you know it, you're back where you started, the entrance. The currents leaves you on the edge, and you gasp for air.

"What is this?!" you yell

"A labyrinth. There is only one way out, and you have to let yourself sink from some point to find it. If you find the exit you'll be able to reach my very core, which is said to contain the essence of a Pokémon. This labyrinth is its protection"

You mull over the words. What is at the end of the labyrinth is a very abstract concept, and you can't imagine it."I don't even know what my essence is and what it is for. It could be dangerous, maybe you shouldn't go there" Floatzel says, with a strange note of concern you hadn't heard before.

You take that as an indication that you should leave. You backtrack, and return to wandering aimlessly around the body. You can't guess that is the fourth location, but...

...it is odd you hadn't thought of it before, but the heart does seem like a drum. Maybe because you hadn't thought of it like gentle. Could it be that the blood represents the ocean? It is worth trying.

You look around for a path directly to the inside of the heart, hoping that this time you're in the right track.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Mystery Organ

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You started the search for the way to the Heart of Floatzel. Traveling back to the long hallway, you began looking for any signs that indicates that it will take you to the Pokemon's center. One of the tunnels has a heart-shaped pictogram engraved on the wall. You took the path with any hesitation. The farther into the tunnel, the warmer your surrounding felt. It gradually feels as if a blazing sun was shining down upon you. You can hear the unmistakable beating of Floatzel's heart getting louder with each step you take.

Later on, after finally reaching the end of the tunnel, you entered a large room filled with veins and tubings. Looking downward onto the floor, you notices that the floor you're standing on is no more than a narrow bridge of muscle. On the other end, there is a large cylinder suspended midair by wires of muscles. You immediately felt fear creeping up your legs as you realize how high up you are. If estimates are correct, the bridge is about 70 feet high in the heart chamber. There are large vats of what you assumed to be blood beneath you. A large pump-like valve draws the blood from the large vats through several thick pipe and pumps them into the veins around you. The heartbeats generated a rhythmic rumble on the floor.

Looking at the details of this place, you conclude that this must be the location of the next ball. All you have to do now is find it. You crossed the entire length of the bridge and entered the cylindrical thing . When you entered it, you immediately felt weak electrical power coursing through you. You panicked at first, thinking that you might have headed for the wrong place and upset Floatzel. You closed your eyes and crouch down, expecting the worst of pain to descend upon you. But a few seconds later, you managed to open your eyes and take a good look of the chamber. The place has a lot of electrical charges running through the walls and floor. A closer look at the floor reveals a thick gel that resemble jello in consistency. The blue glow that the electricity gave off created an intricate web that reminds you of some fancy scientific equipments. When you tried to touch the gel, you felt a little jolt going through you finger, briefly paralyzing your arm.

You felt the device in your pocket rumble. You took it out to see that Floatzel has left you a message.

You are now in the Electrical Capacitor of my heart. This organ is where all the electrical charges generated by the beating heart are stored in thick gels. They act as batteries for my body, powering many of the organs and rooms you used in my body.

p.s. The ball is in the second floor of this chamber.


Your face brightened at the hint that the Pokemon left at the end. You excitedly walked around the room, finding a stairway that leads up. The prize is definitely yours to take now.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Heart

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You climb the stairway as fast as you can, ready to take whatever is up there.

You're now in a cramped chamber. There is a constant electrical charge on the walls, and you're afraid of touching it. And in front of you there is the ball. You try to retrieve, but there is a glass-like panel between the ball and you. You feel around the edges, it is like a dome over the ball. You can't lift it. You can find some strange threads near, with more small sparks at the end.

You grab them carefully, trying to figure out their purpose. After a short thought, you apply one to the glass dome. Some of it disappears, not the point you was touching. You're happy, and drop them, but the moment you do the dome reappears. You experiment around, trying to find out how this works. It seems that you need to place the threads at two points to make the whole dome disappear.

You take your time to find out the exact positions of the threads, but after half an hour of unsuccessful efforts you haven't been able to turn the dome into nothing. You're growing more frustrated every time, until you decide that you aren't going to stay here the whole day.

You place one of the threads on top of the dome, and see a small space on the bottom. you try to sneak your hand, while you drop the thread carefully so it stays on the dome. You take the other thread and place them in a point where it would make the hole bigger, just enough for you to be able to take the ball. You grasp the ball, but while you're taking it out the hand you're holding the thread slips, the top of the dome is gone and the first thread falls on your hand, shocking you. You yelp in pain, dropping the ball, which bounces all the way downstairs.

You don't waste time to follow the ball, and once you're on the first floor you barely see it rolling to the outside. You run, and once you're out you grab the ball, but the gel on your shoes makes you slip, throwing you over the edge. You manage to grab the muscle, stopping your fall, but you're in troubles. You don't know if you can climb with the ball on your hand.

"Floatzel, help!" you yell, hoping the host will be nice enough to save you.

"Looks like you managed to do something wrong" he says, taunting you. You're about to shout back, frustrated, when he adds "Just let yourself go. It is high, but you won't die...I think. Then you can get out of my bloodstream in another organ"

You look down to the blood, and decide that you should take a chance. You grasp the ball and let the muscle go, hoping that the impact with the blood doesn't knock you off.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Heart Puzzle

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The fall into the large tank of blood below took less than 5 seconds. You silently hoped that Floatzel was right and that you are going to survive the fall. Striking the surface of the liquid, you're immediately plunged into the warmness of the blood. The translucent nature of the blood makes seeing next to impossible. You try to find your way upward midst the redness around you. It was a while before you managed to surface from the liquid, gasping for much needed air. There is a faint taste of iron on your tongue. You look at the large tank as you float idly. There seems to be a current carrying you in a slow swirl in the large pool. You saw one of the thick tube you saw earlier and tried swimming toward it. You were instantly sucked up by it and taken toward the pump. You felt yourself being squeezed through tiny passages and launch into a blood vessel at startling speed.

Now that you are in a blood vessel, you ate essentially taking an expressway through the entirety of Floatzel's body. You discovered that you can move around by simply stroking your arms and change direction by tilting your body. Despite being completely engulfed by blood, you felt air circulating in you body though you are holding your breath. You can see numerous other veins that split off from the main one like river tributaries. At current estimate, you are being carried around Floatzel once every 15 minutes.

The fast speed coupled with the turbulence around makes you uncertain of which tunnel to swim into. After much deliberation and several laps in the vessel, you randomly swam into a tunnel. You reached the surface of the blood at the end of the passage and find yourself in another room. This one contains a large structure that looks like a large cube. There are no signs about its function anywhere. The only clue you can tell is the bright glow that comes from the entry way into the structure. Left with few choices, you ventured on into the thing.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You enter the place, and much to your disappointment it is empty. There is nothing. Then you notice what is on the side. It seems like a control board.

You examine it closely and notice that there are many options, most of them being about common mechanicals attractions found in amusement parks. You select "roller coaster" and wait to see what happens. The cube around you shakes and, in few seconds, you see the roller coaster appearing in front of your eyes. Soon it is finished, and you approach the cart. As you expected, it has the colors and the shape of your host. You doubt before riding the car. This could be dangerous.

The ride starts, and as much as you hate to admit it, it ends being fun. At the end you're dizzy but full of adrenaline. You eagerly get back to the controls to select other possibilities. "If you stay inside me, you'll enjoy this and many other places inside my body, human. Please consider it" you hear Floatzel say, but you don't think about it. You want to have you life again, outside. And you entered Floatzel's body to retrieve what is needed to achieve that. But you don't know how to tell Floatzel that you won't stay. This ruins your fun a bit, but after a while you forget about it and continue enjoying the theme park.

You don't note how long you have been there until you note that it is almost night. This startles you. You thought you would be done with your mission today! But looks like you'll be inside Floatzel for one day more. You hurry outside the themepark, and rethink the fifth clue. How did it go?

Deepest desires in store I possess. Gifts transferred by tubes to foreign rooms.

"Of course" you think. "There is only one place". You wonder if Floatzel's store is like Lugia's. You doubt that his will be as impressive and big as Lugia's.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Floatzel Theme Park

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Now that you know where the last ball is, you try to find a way to get to the store. However, you don't know where the store is. When asked, Floatzel only told you to continue down the bloodstream to find out.
Hearing that, you entered the blood stream again to be carried around the body in search of the store. The search proved to be a challenge; you constantly used the wrong vessels and end up in empty rooms and other places you've been to before. After an hour of exhaustive search, you narrowed down to one tunnel. This has to be it, you thought. Let's hope that Floatzel would make finding the last ball easy.

You swam into the passage and reached a vast cavern with a wide single-story building in it. In contrast with the organic surrounding, it appears that the building is made of steel and concrete. There are even glass on the building, something that Lugia has not yet acquired. You thought that maybe Floatzel's claim of being more powerful than Lugia wasn't all bluffing. A "Floatzel Department Store" sign hangs above the top of the entrance. When you entered the door, you are greeted with a vast shopping arcade lined with different stores. There are shops for clothing, toys, computers, and entertainments. You counted at least 60 stores here. They offered everything except pointing you to the direction for the ball. Another, noted difference from Lugia's store is that Floatzel's is staffed with copies of himself. You saw several Floatzels tending to their area, each with a badge that denotes his duties. One of the things that you find funny about them is that they all have name tags identifying themselves as 'Floatzel'. Wow, how am I ever going to tell them apart when I need something. Just as you are taking in the sight of the stores, a Floatzel approached you and greeted you with a smile.

"Hi and welcome to Floatzel's Department Store and how can I help you?", the Floatzel said.

"Umm... Nothing really. Just having a look around here.", you replied,

"Okay then, let me know if you need any help, human.", the Floatzel said with a wink.

By the way he winked and his subtle emphasis on the word 'help', you took that to mean that the actual Floatzel is watching you with these 'clones' and that they're not going to be of much help to finding the last ball; the Floatzels are going to be playing as your-typical-store-staffs.

You searched around in the countless stores around you, visiting a clothing store, a toy shop, electronic shop just to name a few. While searching for the ball, you also picked up several bags of items you like. You got some cute Floatzel plushies, a new set of clothing for yourself, and trading in the Floatzel managing device for an even better one. At one particular store, a Floatzel staff tried to persuade you into getting a subscription for Floatzel TV. That Pokemon said that the service allows you unlimited access to Floatzel's memory, access the Pokenet, live view from the outside, and even first-person intimate shows. You kindly declined the offer and went to a bench to get a rest. With your hands full of bags, you arms are getting weak from the weight of all the merchandise. You still wonder where would the ball be.

Just then, one of the store signs caught your eyes: The World of Psychic Telling. You are surprised that such things are available inside the Pokemon. Normally, such stored are located in obscure corners but the one before you is prominent and it even looks like the main store here. You walked closer to the store and read the sign at the entrance:


Are you having any conundrums? Are you wondering about the mysterious power of Floatzel? Come in and let me solve your problem?


You enter the place without much thinking, hoping you'll get some answers inside.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Looking for the Last Ball

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The store isn't as illuminated as the rest. You glance through the dim illumination and you see a table and a single chair. You see a Floatzel behind the table. You approach and sit on the chair, and the Pokémon said mystically "Do you need help?"

You look at him funny before asking "what is this place for?"

"Here I answer your questions, as long as I know the answer"

You meditate for a moment, before deciding that now that you're here you may as well take the chance. "Anything?" Floatzel nods. You take a deep breath and start.

"Will...uh...the big Floatzel know about what I ask and you answer?"

The Floatzel doubts before answering. "Well, I'm him...but he wouldn't know. I'm a projection with his knowledge and nothing more"

"Then where is the last ball?" you ask, expecting a straight answer, but it wasn't what you expected "You have it with you!" You rummage through your pockets but you don't find anything. Floatzel smiles, mocking you. Annoyed at his behavior, you take every bag you have and search inside every product. It is a long task, as you have many things with you. You finally find the ball inside one of the plush toys. "Got it!"

"Now you'll see my treasures!" the Floatzel says "But tomorrow. I'm so sleepy right now..."

You take this as an indication that you should leave, but first you have one thing more to ask "Tell me, what is Floatzel's biggest treasure?"

"The pearl he stole from Lugia! It is among the rest of pearls in the storage, but it is easily recognizable"

"Does it have any protection?"

Floatzel seems embarrassed. "Well, the only protection is that one can't enter the storage unless Floatzel shows you the path. Besides that, there isn't any"

Your face brightens with this new information. "Good! And how can get it out of Floatzel's body?"

"You can only do it while he is asleep. Otherwise he'll feel the pearl while you roll it through his body. Other than that I don't know. Floatzel hasn't thought about that".

You knew that you wouldn't obtain more valuable information. Before you leave, Floatzel talks to you again. "Floatzel wants you to stay because he wants a pet. Maybe after some years he'll think of you as a friend". It seems like a random thing to say, but it opens your eyes. You don't like how that sounded.

You return to your room, keeping the balls with you. Before you fall asleep, you notify Lugia that you're about to finish the mission. "Excellent! I'll start thinking ways to get the pearl and you out" that is the last thing you hear before you fall asleep. The first thing you plan to do is tell Floatzel that you caught all the balls.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The World of Psychic Telling

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You woke up far earlier than usual the next day. It's about 4:50AM in the morning and relatively dark. You can still hear the sound of Floatzel snoring somewhere in the distance. Seeing no use in further sleeping, you got out of your bed and made sure to carry all five balls in your pocket. If all goes according to plan, you'll be out by late night today. You went over to the bar to grab a quick meal and a drink. The fish you ate are still slightly raw but this will probably be the last time you ate this kind of stuff. Then, you slowly made your way to the eye chamber to meet with Floatzel. The chamber was still dark because of the closed eyes. You can tell that something looks different.

You noticed a faint grayish glow on the two windows despite no light sources. Confused, you approached the glass for a closer look. Suddenly the windows flashed white, momentarily blinding you. You initially thought that Floatzel has woken up but you still hear snoring. You opened your eyes and find that the windows became displays. There is a keyboard lying around on the floor. You picked it up and began using it.

When you read the content, you can see that it is some of web blog with several topics. The title page lists it as "Floatzel's Private Blog". You grinned widely realizing that Floatzel must have forgotten to log out of the Pokenet system and there are stuffs to discover.

Skimming through the lists, you came across topics like daily activity logs, secret moves, and hunting records. A section of the blog is devoted entirely to hating on Lugia. The specific page has been visited by many Pokemons who also posted sympathetic messages and some even include pictures of Lugia in extremely explicit details. You quickly returned to the main page wanting to avoid a repeat of the scenario in Ho-oh's brain.

Several more scrolls downward you reached a topic that almost caused your heart to stop. It reads "I Found A Tiny Human. Anyone can help?" Judging from the date of the post, you instantly realized that Floatzel has been trying to find more about you since he realized you're in his body. You clicked on the topic and find that the post has already garner several dozens of response. The replies are mostly deriding of the fact that human can be in fact shrunk. Most of them are just emoticons and random jumble of letters that basically add up to telling Floatzel to get his priorities right. An Alakazam even suggests Floatzel to visit him for a brain reboot to set him straight. Wow, you thought, Pokemons on the net are just as chaotic as humans, if not worse. You smiled as you know that no one is really taking the Pokemon seriously.

Just as you are reveling, a window popped up with a message.


Hi, Floats. Are you having problems with a microscopic human inside you? I can help you with that.


You decide to impersonate Floatzel and talk with this Pokémon, maybe you'll learn from this.

'Well hi and yes. I do have a problem with that. Who is this by the way?'


Name's Ho-oh and I got LOADS to share with you about a small human.


Oh, shi......., you thought, not him again.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: An Early Morning Surprise

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
"Okay, tell me about it" you type.

Ho-oh starts telling a very distorted tale of you and him. He is portraying himself as the victim, who only wanted to be the human's friend, and it is making you look like a jerk who made disasters around his body. You feel rage escalating with every word you read, but manage to control yourself. Soon Ho-oh finishes and says now what will you do with the human?

You think carefully before typing. "I'm not sure. Should I do something about it? What do you recommend?"

You should get rid of the human, but before that, make sure you humiliate it. You have a tiny scum inside you. Nobody will miss it

You had enough. You have to say something so Ho-oh thinks Floatzel is done with you, so Ho-oh never contacts Floatzel again. You also need to erase all traces of Ho-oh's conversation. Even if it is false, how will you demonstrate it to Floatzel? After all you sneaked inside his body and tried to stay hidden. That could make him turn hostile to you. After a careful thought you type "Okay I think I know how to deal with this. Thank you for your advice. I'll be grateful if you don't mention this again. I want to leave this as the past. The human didn't seem that bad but I won't go through your same experience"

Wise decision. If you need ideas to how to make it pay, contact me

"Again, I know how to do this. Please, let's not talk more about this. But thank you for saving me"

At this point you close the window, and search around for a way to block Ho-oh. You find a tiny link that seems to do it, and you click it. You hope that if Ho-oh ever talks with Floatzel again it'll be when you're gone and very, very far from these Pokémon. You go around for a while until you have erased every line of the conversation you had with Ho-oh, and considered erasing the post about the tiny human, but you decided to leave it. Maybe Floatzel would notice it and would know you're doing this.

You leave the keyboard on the floor and leave the web blog as if you had never entered, then slowly walk out of the chamber. When you think you're far, you run back to your room, deciding to wait for half an hour or so before trying to enter to the eye chamber again. Maybe Floatzel is awake now.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Talk to Ho-oh as "Floatzel"

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
When you reentered the eye chamber, the room is now brightly lit with a table set up for you. As was usual, Floatzel was looking out of his cavern, eyeing the distance for anything of interest. He seems to pay special attention on anything in the sky, likely looking out for Lugia. On the table, Floatzel has prepared a generous breakfast consisting of fruits and poorly-sliced fishes. You dig in on the food as the Pokemon greeted you.

"Morning, there. How are we doing today?", Floatzel asked.

"I'm good. What are you doing now?", you asked.

"Naw, it's nothing. Just watching out for that loathsome Lugia. We don't want her to barge in on our time together, do we?", Floatzel said.

You somehow wish that could happen and make things easier. Lugia gliding in to save the day is preferable but not likely. It a wonder that Floatzel hasn't realized your true intention here. You're doing all this for the pearl that could finally get you back to normal, something you missed for months since you met Lugia. You'll just slip out during night and problem solved. But still, there is still the danger that Floatzel may want to fight Lugia again very soon. You suspect if the two ever fight, you'll surely have a front row seat to witness it. The battle will be one of a kind, a duel that will see was right about their power. Seeing no use in hoping for Lugia's arrival, you decided it's time to tell Floatzel about the balls.

"And Floatzel.....I got some great news for you. I managed to collect all five balls around your body."

"That's superb! I thought it would take you longer and the last one was the most difficult, yet you still made it. You really exceeded my expectation, human. As a reward, I will show you my treasure chamber, where I kept all my precious artifacts."

You swiftly finished your breakfast and is taken by a tube to another part of the body. During the trip, you frequently encounter free falls and bumps, making it less smooth than your typical passageway. It continued for ten minutes before you end up in the treasure chamber.
