After sitting together for some times on the island, the two Lugias took off toward the evening sky and flew against the backdrop of a colorful twilight. You see them glide gracefully in a crisscross fashion not unlike synchronized dancing. The intimacy of the flight indicates that this is some form of Pokemon rituals, perhaps for mating. You blushed slightly at the unlikely possibility of Lugia actually doing it with you.

You continued to watch the two Lugias fly until the sky fades to dark and stars begin to appear. By this time, the female Lugia leads the male one back toward her cavern on the island. Once both of them are in the cavern, the female casts a forcefield on the entrance and focused her attention on the male Lugia. She moves toward him in a rather suggestive manner and held him tightly in her wings. Blushes began to form on both of their cheeks as they caress within an embrace. The female Lugia whispered to her mate: 'I wanted you the entire time but I was never sure about it. Meeting you back in that forest surely provided me with the opportunity to better know you, to realize what is important for a Legendary. Now, it is time for me to confide with you how much I needed you, wanted you.'

Although the line is directed at the Lugia, you feel that the Pokemon is actually talking you.

The next scene involves passionate exchanges, preening, and gentle pecking between the Lugias. The exchange has caused you so much blushing that you are wet from the sweat. After much action, the film ends with the Lugias staying on the island, guarding over the seas with their newly forged bond.

You got off your seat and look at the time. It is now late afternoon. Wow, you never realized that the movie would be this long. You tried to talk to Lugia but she didn't reply to you. Initially, you thought that she must have fell asleep somehow but a message left the the screen tells you to go and take a rest in your room. Secondly, she wants you to go to the Store and get yourself something nice to wear and meet her at the food storage chamber where she will assume appropriate form. Lugia also adds that she has a surprise for you when you meet her.

You shrugged and started walking back to your room. Could this be? She's asking me out?
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Climax of the Movie

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
"What is going to happen at the...uh...date?" "It is a surprise" she says, trying to add mystery "After the date, you can...return to normal".

The prospect of returning to normal in matter of a number of hours you can count with one hand is strange. But you are sure that there will be a grand ending to your adventure. Meanwhile you decide to do what Lugia says.

You return to your room, and start gathering your stuff. You take the stuff you obtained from the store, and put them in a large backpack you had obtained in your first days. You take your time, until you make sure that everything is well crammed in it. Once you're done packing, you lie in your bed idly. You want to give Lugia some time before the date.

Once you consider you have spent enough time doing nothing, you decide to go to the second point in your list: getting a suit. You go back to the old platform that you found during the firsts days you spent inside Lugia, and stand on it. Soon you receive what you wanted, a dark blue suit, which fits you perfectly. Good!

Once you are dressed accordingly, you go towards your destination. Your own clock says it is around 10:00 PM. There re two hours before night ends. What will happen?

You enter the food storage chamber, which is much dimmer than you remember. There is some sort of tissue on the floor, almost like a blanket. On the blanket there is a bottle and a basket. Upon closer examination, the bottle has some of Lugia's wine. You remember the incident when you got drunk and went swimming in your host's bladder. It was very embarrassing when it happened, but now you laugh when you remember. Looks like today everything is making you remember details of your adventure.

When you're about to examine the contents of the basket, you hear a faint sound, the sphincter of the chamber opening. Lugia must have entered. You turn around.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Lugia's Grand Date

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
When you turned around to see who entered the chamber, you found yourself looking at Lugia.

"Hi there, trainer.", Lugia said cheerfully.

You brain is completely in shock at what it saw at the entrance. The way Lugia looks completely has your attention now. Stunned, it took you a few second or so to realize that she has assumed the form of a human. She dressed herself in a long white gown with blue sequin details. On her hands, there are white gloves that have designs made to resemble her wings. As you eyes fall upon her face, you met with a pair of ocean blue eyes with a soft face framed by long, light brown hair. Lugia's human form looks about the same age as you and with a similar height. Around her neck, there is a sapphire necklace with the outline of her Pokemon form. As you studied her new form, you could say that she is the personification of beauty itself.

"I bet you never expected me to assume human form, right? I figured that since this is an actual date, I need to do something a little more special for you. Plus, it helps remove the awkwardness about dating with a Pokemon. So, how's my dress?", Lugia beamed.

"You...look...absolutely fabulous.", you replied, trying hard to hide your blush.

Lugia walked slowly toward you and stretched out her hand. You took the cue and bent down to give it a light kiss. You heard Lugia stifled a laugh.

"After all these times I looked over humans, I still couldn't figure out the courtship rituals you have.", Lugia said, a light blush also evident on her face, "I guess I still have a lot to learn about humans."

"Don't worry, Lugia.", you told her with a comforting smile, "You'll have them figured out pretty quickly soon."

"Thanks.", Lugia smiled, "I'll see where this goes."

You carefully assisted her in settling down on the blanket and grabbed two wine glasses that are set up at the side. You uncorked one of the bottles containing Lugia's wine and carefully pour it into the glasses. You passed one to her and raised yours. At that moment, the ceiling transformed and show stars, galaxies, and the moon from the outside while soft music composed by Lugia started playing.

"To Legendary Love", you said as you gave a toast to Lugia.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Continue

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
The date went smoothly.

The food is simply the best you have ever tasted. The wine is still the same you had drunk near the beginning of your adventure, but this time you knew you had to be moderate. And the ambient made everything feel like a dream. There are very few moments in somebody's life where one feels in peace with everything and everybody, and this is one of yours. And Lugia, with her human form, is simply mesmerizing. You would be content with looking at her the whole night, but you have the fortune to talk and be close to her.

Before you know it, you two are talking about any theme. Traveling, friends, questions you have about the world. Lugia seems to know all the answers, surely because of her legendary life. You then try to impress it by telling interesting or funny anecdotes from your trainer life. You seem to be successful in that regard. She laughs, and is genuinely happy. You are proud of your clever anecdotes.

Soon you two run out of food, but there is still plenty wine. You two lay down in the floor, and contemplate the stars and constellations over your heads. You know it is an illusion, but it is still beautiful to just see that. You hold Lugia's hand, and feel that there is no place where you would rather be right now.

"I'm sorry to bring this again, but I suppose you know you're leaving" says Lugia, with a sad tone. You just nod, looking at the stars. "I know we'll see each other again. But I want to give you something so you will remember me while we're apart" Then she takes her necklace. "Take this. For our love...if you feel the same for me"

"I do" you say, taking the necklace. You don't imagine yourself wearing it, but you know you'll take it everywhere you go. It'll be like a lucky charm. You approach closer to Lugia, and you two cuddle while the music keeps sounding. You're in bliss.

After a while, Lugia stands up. The music stops, and you feel that it is time. "It is midnight. It is...time for your departure" You nod, and stand too. The constellations over your head disappear. "I'll be waiting for you to come out"

"See you soon"

"Also, you can take any route you want, out of my body. Just thought it would be good to remind you"

"I'll consider it" you say. Then Lugia's human form leaves the room. You're left alone, and drink the remains of the wine. You feel that you aren't ready to leave Lugia's body, but it is now or never. Your life is waiting for you outside.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: The Date begins....

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
You slowly stood up and walked toward the sphincter of the chamber. As you proceed through tunnels, you slowly reminisced about your encounter with Lugia. Although she promised that you would be seeing her regularly from time to time, you still feel saddened that you have to leave Lugia. From the time you first met her, the countless days you shared your stories with her, the ordeal with Ho-oh and Floatzel up until now. A lot has happened in such short time. In some ways, it kind of happened too fast for you; as much as you find it weird, you realized that you really love Lugia. You look at her as something far more than a Pokemon. You seriously thought of her as someone who you could develop a relationship with if you look past the differences.

You remembered to head to your bedroom to get your things along with Vaporeon which you returned to a Pokeball. After packing up everything you have, you continue on your way to the exit.

A few more minutes later, you eventually see Lugia's mouth and slowly stepped out. The cold air immediately caused you to shiver. You are back in the cave of Lugia. Turning over to Lugia, you saw her preparing the pearl on the ground. Floatzel sat at one side of the cave curiously looking at what Lugia is doing. He has a gentle smile on his face when his eyes fall upon you.

"So, how did the date between you and Lugia turned out?", he asked with a grin on his face.

"Wha...who told you about that?", you stuttered.

"Oh, it's nothing. It's just that I'm curious about the courting behaviors of humans. So I kinda asked Lugia to show me the whole thing using the eye trick. And it sure looks like a good movie.", Floatzel said with a laugh.

You blushed deeply and shot a glare at Lugia who is also trying to hide her blushing face.

"Don't worry.", Floatzel said, "She showed me under the condition I tell no one else. You can count on me. By the way, could you tell me what next after the dating?"

"Alright, that's enough Floatzel.", Lugia exclaimed, "First, I showed you that because you promised me that you wouldn't tell anyone. Secondly, you also promised to clean up the cave after I showed you that. Better start before I decide to blast you to the other side of the island."

"Ugh, alright. Hey, human. Be sure to explore more of Lugia the next time you're in her.", Floatzel said with a inplying tone as he begin cleaning the cave starting at the entrance.

You saw a tiny ball of energy from Lugia struck him on the head.

You looked at the sight in slight amusement. Looks like the two is really getting along well now, you thought.

"This is it..... The moment you regain your normal size.", Lugia said, a hint of sadness in her voice, "Please stand in front of the pearl."

You did as you're told.

"Here we go.", Lugia said as she began using her power to activate the pearl. Her eyes glowed bright white and the symbols began appearing on the pearl. Suddenly, it glows blindingly and you're enveloped in a bright blue ray.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Leaving Lugia's Body

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Your eyes sting a lot, but you feel energy coursing through you. It is an odd feeling, and you feel you'll pass out. It is almost the same thing you had felt when you shrunk, so you knew that this definitely was related to it.

Soon you can feel the light slowly fading. You rub your eyes, and try to focus around. You're still in the same place. At first you feel that there was no change. The cave is exactly the same than before. Then you look around, and know it worked. You're back to normal size.

Lugia is near to you, smiling. She is still much bigger than you, but it is a natural difference of size. You approach and gently touch the base of her neck, which is the highest spot you can reach without standing on a rock or something. She knows you're grateful for everything.

You also feel a tug on your clothes. You look at the source, and see Floatzel. It is surreal, now that you think about it. Less than three days ago, you were so small you had a series of adventures inside him. But now you're back to normal, and despite his size being much bigger than most of his species, you're taller than him. Barely, but you're taller. In a way, you're grateful to him too. After all, he may have been the cause of your shrunken state. You want to give him a reward, but seeing how you got nothing in that moment, you limit it to helping him clean the cave.

It is a huge cave, and it took one hour to leave it clean enough, mainly because Floatzel couldn't resist playing a prank or two on you. Lugia watched the whole time, amused. "We're finally done" you say, approaching Lugia. You already said farewell to Floatzel.

"It is time for you to continue your life. I can use my psychic powers to move you wherever you want. Where do you want to go?"

You think for a moment before replying. "It would be appropriate to continue where I stopped. Can you take me to the forest you had found me?"

Lugia smiles and nods. "See you soon...never forget this adventure"

"It won't even be possible to forget" you reply, while the environment around you warps and turns blurry. Seconds later, you're back to the forest you had been shrunk in. It is still night, but you know how to get out of there.

You plan to somehow contact Lugia (you have the feeling that the bond between you two will make it easy) again in some months, and spend some days shrunk. Who knows, maybe you can be inside Floatzel again, or maybe experiment and see if there are any other Pokémon that could serve as a host for you.

You doubt you'll ever tell anybody what you went through (and who would believe you?), but you know it will be something that will be present for the rest of your life.
1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.title: Back to Normal

1411211111111111111112111111111111111111.content:
Several months later.....

Since parting with Lugia, you returned to your usual schedule of training with your Pokemons and defeating the gym leaders in your region. You take the necklace she gave you wherever you go as a good luck charm and a souvenir from your beloved Lugia. Each time you stepped into a gym, you easily take down all the trainers inside along with their leader. Each time you're battling a Pokemon, you couldn't help but wonder if they also have interiors like Lugia or have fascinations about devouring their trainers. With your flawless victory, almost all of the gym leaders are surprised as to how you knew about the innermost weakness of each type of Pokemon. You always tell them that it's years of training. In actuality, Lugia shared those information with you. Before you know it, you've won all the gym badges for your region and you planned on continuing on to Kanto for the next eight badges.

It was night when you returned to your apartment after another day of training. Traveling through all those towns have really taken a toll on you. Every day in the past months, you couldn't get your mind off Lugia. You could imagine her feeling similar emotions while she glides the skies, back to her duty as guardian of the ocean. You took a quick shower and checked your computer for any news today. But most of the articles today don't interest you. The few that do talked about the mythology of Legendary Pokemons. When you read their conjectures, you couldn't but smile at how wrong their guesses are, as the only human who had firsthand experience.

As you are about to lie down in your bed, you see a soft glow emanating from Lugia's necklace on your desk. Puzzled by the sudden phenomenon, you picked up and examined it. You can see the sapphire symbol flashing in a slow rhythmic pattern. Before you could examine it any further, the pendant levitates on its own and started tugging at your hand. It seems as if it wants to lead you somewhere. Curious, you let the necklace lead the way out your apartment and on the way out of town.

Soon enough, you find yourself at the forest again. Tonight, it seems particularly quiet; nothing but the rustling of the leaves and occasional chirping sound of bug Pokemons. The necklace continues to lead you deeper into the woods until you came upon a rarely visited clearing. When you looked up from the necklace, you find yourself looking at none other than Lugia. Her soft fur glows as if they were struck by moonlight.

At that very moment, you are overwhelmed with emotions as you raced over to embraced her with tearful eyes. Lugia craned her neck around you in a similar display.

"Lugia, I missed you so much.", you said as you felt her neck.

"Same here.", Lugia said, "After you left, I thought about you all the time. So much that it had somehow affected my power. It sure feels good to be reunited."

Lugia lowered her beak to your mouth a gave you a passionate kiss. Without prompting yourself, you kissed back in a comparable way. The two of you kissing for several minutes before Lugia's voice speaks in a somewhat different tone.

"Alright. Can you two cut the kissing already? It feels like I'm watching a boring dating lesson here. I'm giving a 4 out of 10. And Lugia, you really need to switch off the waterworks here; all those tears could fill your ocean several times over."

".....huh.", you exclaimed.

"Sorry about that.", Lugia apologized, "It's just Floatzel messing with my controls again. That Pokemon never learn about respecting my privacy or keeping his thoughts to himself."

"Hey! You're the one who let me in here.", Float said in Lugia's voice, "Plus, controlling you is next to impos......"

Lugia cut off Floatzel's mic.

"So, are we ready for another exploring?", Lugia said as she opened her mouth and set up the pearl.

"We sure are, my Lugia.", you said, "We sure are."

You try to measure it. -"It must be at least 180 ft tall, not including tail!"-you think.

You also feel happy to see Mew. After all, he is a legendary psychic Pokemon. Maybe he could help you to be normal-sized again. Although the Mew already had seen you, you was afraid he, she or whatever it was, would think you was just a bug and wouldn't pay attention to you, so you try to get his attention. You yell a few times and jump as high as you could, which was less than a centimeter. Luckily, it seemed to have noticed you, since it hovered lower and finally landed softly near you. The Mew tried to look at you, its big face to a few centimeters of you. You jump a bit more, until you're sure Mew won't stop looking at you. After some seconds of silence, you hear a voice saying, most likely Mew's:

-"Amazing, a tiny human"

Happy to be recognized as a human and not as a common insect, you wonder how Mew could talk, then forgetting about it, supposing it was some sort of phychic power, telepathy or something like that. You yell as loud as you could:

-"Help! I shrunk!"
-"I noticed that, but how did it happen?"-Mew replied.
-"I don't know. I was just walking around, almost passed out and then I found I was tiny"-You answered-"Couldn't you help me to get back to normal size?

You eagerly wait for Mew's answer.

-"Sorry, I can't. My powers aren't that good right now"

You just look at your feet, sad. Then you hear Mew saying

-"I can't leave you here. There are too many dangers and predators in the forest. Would you like to live with me until we find how this happened?"

You think about it. After all, what Mew said was true, you alone wouldn't survive for too long. Besides, the idea of living with Mew for a time didn't sound bad.

-"Okay, I won't mind it. But where would I live?"
-"I only can think of one option, due to your size. You could live inside me. You would be safe, warm, and well-fed. And there would be nothing to worry about, too."
-"I...what?"-you reply, surprised of Mew's option-"but...what about acids, and the air, and"
-"Don't worry. You won't be digested and you will be safe of anything. You will even be able to see inside me. I promise you'll be okay"

You think about it. After some seconds, you realize that living inside Mew is your only option right now, since you see nothing better. You could get lost, or fall and break your bones or drown in a puddle or many other possibilities easily. Living inside Mew would be a good enough shelter, warm and comfy. And if Mew says you will be okay, you see no reason to not to believe that...

-"Okay, I accept."
-"Excellent. Would you like to get in now?"-Mew said, pointing at his mouth.

There is no acid, which meant the Mewtwo was telling the truth.
He sits down against a tree "My body is your new home, you may go anywhere inside me." You look around, the stomach lit up with a faint light so you can see. You see two chambers, the right one seems to lead to his intestines, and the one on the left leads to other chamber that could be anything.
143.title: Help from a Giant Mewtwo

choices: Get in the artery and go up.
Get in the vein and let it carry you somewhere.
Forget about it and keep walking through the intestine
1431.content:
After trying to choose which road to pick, you decide to start your exploration. You walk towards the right one, looking around to see everything in Mewtwo's stomach. Besides the second hole and the one that is connected to the esophagus and was your entrance to the stomach, there are no more possibilities, so you plan to not to return to the stomach for a while. Then you start opening the entrance to Mewtwo's intestines.

It was tight, but after a while you was able to enter, and got ready to get deeper in Mewtwo's body. All you see at first is a tunnel that, at your actual location, is still pretty big -maybe the roof is a bit lower that in the stomach- and you could see it was going to the left. You start walking, remembering that the small intestine may be pretty long, especially at your current size. The walls moved quite often, and you almost fall once or twice during the first minutes. Then you get used to it and you use the natural movements of the intestines to move faster. You also notice that the while you walk away of the stomach, the roof seems to be lowering and the walls seems to move towards you, but it stops, and you deduce you must have left the duodenum and got into the small intestine, and started walking. There still was enough space to walk, and the roof the of the intestine was still high.

The walls are covered by a strange texture, which reminds you of your location. At first you didn't want to touch it, but after walking several feet in the long tube, you gather enough courage to touch it. The walls feel soft, and you could see every detail of the villi surrounding you, meaning you're quite smaller than you expected. You walk for a long time with your hand on the wall, enjoying how the villi tickled your hand.

After fifteen minutes or maybe more, you calculate that you must have seen more than half of the small intestine. While thinking about it, you trip and your hand goes through the wall and you feel some sort of strong current, like a river. You stop and suspect that your hand seems to be in an artery or something similar, and when you remove your hand and see it has a strong red color you confirm your suspicions. Although you knew that there would be veins and arteries at the other side of the walls of the intestines, you didn't think it would be possible to find a way of getting in Mewtwo's circulatory system. The more you think about it, you realize you could use it as a way to move faster through Mewtwo's body, without having to walk long distances to other places. The only thought of having to walk all the way back to the stomach -something you would have to do sooner or later- makes you feel tired.

You put your hand on the wall to find the artery- or whatever it was- carefully, trying to find in which direction the blood was going. The flow of the blood in the artery seemed to follow the walls of the small intestine back to the stomach, and logically then it would go to other places far from where you are now, always going up until it got to its highest point. In the way you could surely find many places to visit, or even rooms you didn't know could exist inside a Pokemon. Then you go to the opposite wall and try to find a vein or something. You find one and try to feel it. In this one the blood seems to follow the intestine for a bit and then you deduce that it would be the opposite of the flow of the artery, meaning this one would lead even deeper in Mewtwo's body, but far from the intestines, which would help you to find new places too.

You decide to try to get your hand in the vein, and it slips through the wall easily. Then you remove it and note it didn't leave any mark or hurt the small intestine in any way. You think that just walking into the walls would get you in the artery or the vein and you would be ready to let it carry you to other parts of Mewtwo's body. Then you remember where you are and you look as far as you can in the rest of Mewtwo's small intestine. It seems to continue straight for a few feet and then it goes down. You calculate the end of the small intestine is near and that in a few minutes you will be able to finish walking it, and although you know where it is going, you don't seem to care very much about it. After all, there are surprises and new roads everywhere, and you think that the large intestine wouldn't be an exception

So, where would you go?
1431.title: Enter the intestines

choices: You decide to try whatever comes first.
You let the blood to carry you further.
14311.content:
-"I guess I have seen enough of the intestines for now"-you think-"Now, where should I go...?"

It is hard to pick which of the two remaining options to use, due to you not knowing which places the artery or the vein would visit. After thinking it carefully for some minutes, you decide to let luck to guide you. So you spin around with your eyes closed until you fall to the floor. In front of you there is one of the walls of the intestine, and after checking again where the small intestine continued, you deduce that you're in front of the wall with the artery. You walk towards it and touch it, feeling its texture again. After some hesittation, you slip your hand through it, and you feel the blood. Moving your hand around you can't feel anything, just the blood splashing agaisnt your hand.

You was about to enter the artery, when you remembered that surely it would full of blood, and there wouldn't be any air to breathe. Worried, you decide to ask Mewtwo if there is any way of not to drown in his circulatory system.

-"Mewtwo, can you hear me?"
-"I'll be able to hear you from any part of my body. You are pretty deep inside me, and you will be able to get even deeper if you find the way"-he says. You stop for a moment to notice he is using telepathy, and then you ask:

-"Okay, I'm planning to get into an artery to be able to travel faster through your body, but I'm worried I might drown in there. Is there some way to..."
-"You don't have anything to worry about. You're very small. There is more then enough oxygen in my blood for you to survive. And it is pretty thick too, so you don't have to even think about my blood getting in your lungs or something similar"

You just stood there, surprised. You didn't even think the possibility of getting some of Mewtwo's blood into your body, but you're relieved that you'll be able to use the circulatory system safely. -"Eh...thanks"- you manage to say before taking some steps back. You plan to run and jump through the wall of the small intestine and into the artery. You suppose it is big enough for you to not to miss and fall to who knows where. Although you knew there will be enough oxygen, you take a deep breath and start running. You jump, close your eyes and get ready to crash agaisnt the wall. Instead you feel your body going through the wall easily, and then you feel you're moving, although you're perfectly still. You open your eyes slowly.

You exhale, and then you find you're unable to breath, but you don't feel like you're drowning. You suppose you're getting the oxygen through the skin or something, and then you look around. Everything is red, and there was very small spots around you, which you suppose are the cells in Mewtwo's blood. You try to move and find that you can swim, but it is hard to do, the blood is very viscous. It takes you a while to get near the wall of the artery. It is semi-transparent, so you can see what is directly outside. The blood isn't going very fast, so you will also be able to exit the artery whenever you want.

You got to the wall of the artery just in time to see the stomach, and then you feel everything going up. Most of times the only thing you see is flesh and muscles, but sometimes there are rooms and chambers, unknown to you. Then you hear Mewtwo using telepathy to contact you, even if you can't talk.

-"There are many places you'll be able to enter through this artery. The closest ones to you right now are your food area (a place just a bit higher than the stomach where you could find food and eat), and my lungs (which is self-explanatory). You can also continue further, where you will be able to access different places and organs. I'll be able to feel you going through my artery, so I'll know your decision"-

You aren't hungry right now, but knowing where you would find food may be a good idea, since you wouldn't find it in any other part of Mewtwo's body, unless you like semi-digested mush from Mewtwo's stomach. On the other side, the lungs could be interesting, and you may find something to do in there.
14311.title: Get in the artery and go up.

choices: Sit down and watch things from Mewtwo's POV
1432.content:
Being presented with the choices, you decided to take the hole on the left to start your exploration/adventure of Mewtwo's interior. What lies ahead of the chamber is a complete mystery to you but being in the warmth of another living things interior is something you always fantasize about. The hole is fleshy and soft to the touch which makes it slightly difficult to navigate your way through the hole. After an undetermined time, you realized that the tunnel's pathway began to ascend upward in Mewtwo's body; this facts confirms that the hole definitely leads not to the Psychic Pokemon's intestines but....somewhere else. Where could it lead to?

The farther you go in the passage, the more uptight it seems to get until it got to the point that it is completely vertical. You could no longer walk up the tunnel, but to your amazement, there are some sort of hidden recesses in the fleshy walls that allows you to climb up much like you would do with a ladder. You started to make your way up to the tunnel to your yet unknown destination. Occasionally, the sliminess of the tunnel caused you to slip a few steps down.

After traveling what seems like hours, you finally reached the mystery chamber in Mewtwo, but it's obviously at a far higher place within his body. The chamber looks similar to the stomach except it is dome-shaped and something large is surrounded by a purplish aura in the center. You take a closer look at the object, it seems to be somewhat brain-like and you assume that the aura is Mewtwo Psychic force-field to protect it against unwanted 'physical' and 'mental' intrusion.

You also realize that the room is brightly-lit unlike the stomach. On the other end of the chamber, there are two large, oval screens that are showing the forest you just got shrunk in. You also saw hands coming into view on the "screen", but those hands are Mewtwo's and he seem to be walking somewhere deeper into the forest.

"I see that you have taken the tunnel that leads into my head, human.", said Mewtwo, "You will find this place rather amazing because you can see stuffs through my eyes and most interesting, I can allow you to enter my brain for some "psychic" surprises. Currently, I've placed a protective layer around it and I can remove it at your request for you to take a look inside."

"So, what do you want to do?"
1432.title: Going up in Mewtwo

choices: Ask some more question before going in.
144.content:
The white silky furs, the dark blue face, and the crescent blade on the right of its face......It's an Absol, the Disaster Pokemon!

You saw the 250 feet tall Pokemon approaching you and you feel a large thud as Absol placed his paw a few meters away from you. The Pokemon slowly focus his attention on the 'creature' he had discovered with his stern-looking eyes, lowering his head toward you. The Absol's sharp, red eyes focus on you with a piercing precision.

".Hmm...strange sight these days. The first time I saw a creature looking sort of like a human but yet so tiny. Interesting.", Absol commented.

"Umm, Absol! I am a human and you're probably here to cause......wait, you could talk....goodness, first I got shrunk and now, talking Pokemons!! What the hell is happening now?!", you exclaimed.

The Absol looked equally surprised, seemingly not expecting the bug-like thing before him to talk and identify itself as a human. From the look of his face, you can see that the Absol is in disbelief, perhaps shocked.

"Well.....that's new.", the Absol stuttered, "I never knew...that people could be this small in this forest."

"For your information, Absol, I was shrunk by unknown forces.", you said, "I have absolutely no idea what happened or how to get back to normal..........Hey, since you're a Pokemon from around here, do you know what happened to me?"

"....No....I haven't. This is the first time that I see this happens.", the Absol said frankly, "It may be some strange combination of psychic and bizarre forces that caused you to shrink so dramatically. Well, I think that there is a way for us to find a way to solve your current problem."

"Wait....You're.... helping me?", you asked, "I thought that encountering an Absol will bring bad luck upon you and more so when I'm in such small shape. At least that's what I heard the other trainers said in the cities."

The Absol slightly frowned and explained: "I'm no such thing.....It's one of those awful superstitions that you humans love to talk about. Those gossips about me are not true at all. It just that whenever I showed up at a place, there's always something bad going on.....Don't you think spreading rumors about someone else is kind of....strange and hurtful?"

From the way the Absol talked, you realized that you've hurt its feeling. Although the Pokemon's expression still look intimidating, you could tell from his eyes that you've said something very wrong.

You quickly apologize: "I'm sorry, Absol.... I didn't mean to hurt your feelings. It just that things happened so abruptly and my thoughts and composure just got a little rash from the shock. You know, being in a completely new environment makes you all panicky and ,in extreme cases, can make you lose your mind."

"That's alright. I understand your problem.", the Absol replied, "But for you to remain out here in this forest is quite dangerous. The terrains here aren't very welcoming and easy for creatures your size. Besides, you would make a good prey for the wild Pokemons around here."

"You're right.", you tell Absol, "But how are you going to help me and why should I trust you, because you're technically also a wild Pokemon?"

"I cannot bear to see a human in such trouble. I always feel like helping a human to shake off that stereotype about me being a harbinger of disasters.", the Absol said.

"Okay. If I were to believe you, how do you plan on helping me?

"Here's the deal, since it is too risky for you to be out here, I'll let you enter my body and make it your temporary home. You don't have to worry the food and water, those will be provided to you. And you don't have to worry about digestion in the stomach, my body cannot process humans.", the Absol tells you.

You're still a bit skeptical about Absol's claim. But the way the Pokemon talked to you and the signs of genuine intention on his face partially erased your doubt. It also occurred to you that if Absol was bent on eating you, he would have already done so without hesitation. So you gathered your courage and replied....

".mmmm........That sounds good enough.", you said, remembering about a fantasy you've held a long time ago about being eaten by Pokemons and living inside them; that dream is about to become your new reality.

"Everything's ready right now and you're good to go at any time.", the Absol said enthusiastically, "Come on... go in, there's no need to be afraid."
144.title: 'Absol'utely Strange

1441.content:
"....Alright, I'm going in!", you tell the Absol.
Upon hearing your affirmation, the Absol gave you a gleeful smirk, as if it has many more secrets to reveal to you.....

"It's a good thing that you're following my advice.", Absol said, "you'll find that I'm no ordinary protector, you'll see once you get in me."

The Pokemon's remark has left you even more curious about his secret and your willingness to be "within" it. As if in a trance, you slowly walked toward Absol, closer to its dark face. After arriving at the front of its face, the Absol gave you a affectionate glance with its beautiful red eyes before opening its wide mouth. From your vantage point., you can see the rows of sharp teeth still dripping with drool. You slowly crawl you way onto Absol's tongue, being careful not to touch any of the razor-sharp fangs.

"It feels good to have you on my tongue and you sorta taste good. I might as well have you for food", the Absol said.

Your face instantly paled from the Pokemon's remark.

"Ha.ha..ha... Got you! How would I ever want to hurt a newly-made friend and even more so, in this lonely forest.", the Absol laughed, "I feel that you needed a little joke to defuse some of the nervousness I sense in you."

You gave a faint smile at Absol's little prank as you make your way toward the gullet. You looked down into the fleshy, pulsating cavern, imagining what kind of secrets you may encounter down there. Will there be endless passages? Will Absol give you a "tour" of his body? What kind of living space awaits you? These are the questions that are flying around in your head at the moment. Finally, you jumped into the gullet and let Absol's body move you toward your new destination: the stomach. The esophagus moves you downward in a slow and rhythmic fashion as if your lying down on an escalator within an organic tunnel.

Within 5 minute's time, you landed in Absol's stomach. The stomach appeared larger in here than on the outside, especially when considering the fact that you're now insect-sized. You sit yourself against the stomach wall to relax for a while. As Absol has promised you, no acids have emerged...just the sounds of his body working around you. Absol's heartbeat have a strangely comforting effect on you, eliminating the anxiety that has occupied you during the last few minutes.

After an hour in the empty stomach, you gradually got bored and you want to explore the secrets that the Absol has told you about hidden within his vast body. Apparently, the Absol seemed content and happy to have you as a 'guest'.

"Maybe I should ask Absol before I proceed anywhere else in his body.", you thought, "It's always better to ask the "host" to familiarize yourself with a new environment."

What will you do?
1441.title: Into the Absol

choices: Enter the mysterious hole before you
14411.content:
Sitting quietly within Absol's gargantuan stomach, you made the decision to ask the Pokemon what kind of stuffs you do with him.

"So, you wanted to explore my interior, huh?", Absol asked with a slight chuckle, "Well then, if that's the case, I think I need to 'introduce' myself a little better. I'm one of the rarer forms of Pokemon currently in existence. What makes me different from your typical Pokemon is the fact I have 20 times as many organs in my body. That has allowed my body to contain far more things and function than is possible for normal Absols."

"Uhmm....does that mean that you have some abilities that are only exclusive to you?", you asked Absol.

"Why yes. One of those ability is my capability of sustaining a living thing within me, like I'm doing for you. Once you entered my body, there is no way out of my body unless you wanted to end up at my "backdoor" with all the disgusting gunks. Besides, once you get to know my body better, you would never want to leave it. Instead, you would always want to be with me."

"What does that mean?", you askes as you tilted your head.

"The secrets in my body are up to you to explore. There are parts in my body that satisfy all your personal needs like living space, food, water, and many more.", the Absol replied enigmatically, "Once you see the secrets of my body, you will understand why you will never, ever want to leave it."

You're totally speechless at Absol's statement. To explore his body and be with it possibly as long as you're so small. That definitely would be a fantasy come true since you always love those 'inside story' tales and movies. You gotten excited just by thinking of the adventure ahead of you.

"Absol, as a start, can you tell me what I can try out first in you body?", you inquired.

"Very well, it seems that I have gotten you pretty interested. My advise to you would be to enter the hole right next to you. And don't worry, it won't lead you to the intestines; it will take you somewhere else in my body. I'm keeping the destination a secret until you avtually get there. It is my belief that things will be more "awe-strucking" if you were to discover it without any explanation."

"So....go ahead. Enter the hole and find out where it'll take you?", the Absol said in a mysterious tone.
14411.title: Absol's Strange Body

144111.content:
You walked over to the hole and started to go through it. As you went farther and farther into the tunnel, the tunnel started to get larger and larger. Finally after a few minutes of walking, you come into a huge open chamber. It was easily as large as a stadium! The "Stadium" had many openings in the walls leading to various parts of the body. All the openings had signs that told were there destinations were.

"So how do you like it?" Absol asked. "It's much larger then I imagined." You replied in awe. "This serves as "The Hub" Of my body. It connects to everywhere in my body including my stomach as you saw." Absol added. You took another look around and you saw the Absol was right, there were hundred of openings around the chamber. There were so many that you didn't even know were to start exploring.

You took a look and decided that the choices you had were to either, ask Absol for help, or explore the chamber and see what destinations are available.
144111.title: A Whole New World

choices: Check out the other "amenities" in the room
1441111.content:
The "Hub" in Absol is incredibly vast. The countless openings you see has left you completely disorientated.

After more than 30 minutes of aimless stroll and pondering, you nake your way toward one of the many openings in this "Hub." You take a brief walkthrough of several openings nearest to where you are. Among the choices you see, there are "ESP Center", "Brain", "Absol-chat", and waaay more. Then, when you arrived at the fourth opening nearest to you, the location on the sign made you curious

The small sign made of bone above this particular entrance you're in front of is labelled "Human-Trainer Living Area." You think that the name somehow suggest comfortable accommodations at the other end of the tunnel. Not wanting to hold off your adventure any longer, you enter the opening, yearning to know what lies beyond this passageway. Somewhat confusing to you, the tunnel itself look like it is luminated by itself; apparently, Absol flesh are capable of glowing. Though strange, come to think of it, Absol had told you about how he is a special type of "rare" Pokemon. So, seeing stuffs out of the ordinary will probably be common during your stay in his body. The way to the 'living area' is long and winding, resembling stone caves you've been to in Sinnoh. But the most obvoius difference now is that instead of catching Pokemons and training them on your journey, you have ended being within one and rendered powerless by your mysterious shrinking.

Your mind is totally filled with thoughts and unexplained feelings about what Absol could do for you and how will your relation with him progress in the future. Your thinking is suddenly interrupted by the fact you bumped into a doorway of some sort. The doorway is clearly made of both bones and flesh. You move yourself through the membrane-like doorway and into the living area.

The sight before you is as equally amazing as the "Hub." The room before you is as large as Absol's stomach. There seems to be a circular bed of some sorts made of soft, white fur in the center of the room. To your surprise, there is a cute-looking Absol Pokedoll on the bed. It's probably a gift from Absol. The chamber also seem to have other "amenities." The room seems to be seperated into sections, each with its own unique use.

Do you want to check out some of the other features in this "room" or do you want to return to the "Hub?
1441111.title: Explore the Chamber for Destinations

14411111.content:
As you looked around the living area, you saw the many features of the Human-trainer living area. It seemed to have all the comforts of home.

You looked around the living area and saw it had a bed, a bathroom and even a study containing a computer of some sort. You kept looking around your "Bedroom" and saw that the bed was made out of a fleshy and bony material. You didn't think it was going to be comfortable but to your surprise, it was more comfortable then any bed you ever slept in. The area also included a interface on the wall behind your bed that was set in a environment that looked like a forest setting. "That, is one of many screens in my body that lets you see what I'm seeing." Apsol said. You looked at the screen and really there wasn't anything interesting just yet. You kept exploring the "Human trainer living area" and noticed the computer. It was very strange to find a working computer, let alone one made out of a bony fleshy membrane. "That allows you to browse the real-world website as well as my "Personal website" My website not only teaches you about my body but can also give you a map.

So...what do you do.....?
14411111.title: amenities of the "Human-trainer living area"

choices: The first half (includes head, neck, chest and front legs)
The second half (includes belly, back, back legs and tail)
144111111.content:
You're pretty impressed to see a working computer in such an unlikely place. You try to find how to turn it on, and accidentaly touch the screen. It turns on and you take a look to the desktop. It is almost empty, the only software seems to be an internet browser. You click on it, and remember about what Absol said about a personal website. You're about to ask how to get in it when the home page finally loads

Just as you needed, the home page seemed to be Absol's Personal Website. It had a background that looked like flesh, and everything looked like it had been carved in the flesh. It was almost like seeing it directly on the walls of your bedroom. You look around for a keyboard, a mouse or something simiolar and, being unable to find one, you just touch the screen again with a finger, while moving it down. The page scrolls, and you find a guestbook. You was the first visitor of the website, according to it.

You get back to the top of the page, and notice some options at the left side of the page, leading to other parts of the website. There are nine options, and only a few interested you for now. You clicked on the "Organ List" button.

A long list appears. You scroll down to see how many organs was in your new home. At the bottom some sort of disclaimer answered your question. "All the 340 organs are fully functional and can be visited at any time" You just stood there, not being able to understand how so many organs could fit in Absol's body. The list seems to be ordered alphabetically, and every organ had its own page, so you scroll up until you find "Human-trainer Living Area". You clicked on the link.

"The Human-Trainer Living Area is an organ where a guest will find features resembling a bedroom, a study and a bathroom. It was made for a human guest specifically, but any kind of guest can live in there" - you read. After it there was a silhouette of Absol, with the outline of the organ, the nearest organs and where it was localized. It seemed to be in the chest, just behind the esophagus. It was almost at the center of it, so it was protected by layers of flesh and other organs.

There was more information about it, but you're too excited to read more about it, wanting to explore more of the website. You try to get back to the list and accidentally you get back to the main page. Just before you click again in "Organ List" you notice a button directly below it that said "Maps". Knowing how useful a map would be when you decide to explore around, you click there. A 3-D Absol silhouette appears, this time it was bigger and was divided in many areas. There was also a link to a map of everything in Absol's body. You clicked in the belly area, and the silhouette of the section you pressed appeared. The belly was divided in even smaller sections, too. You quickly press in a random section, and a map appears. You count 15 organs in this section. You have no clue of what will you find in most of the organs you're seeing now, just recognizing something that you suppose is a kidney, part of the small intestine and lots of veins and arteries. Then you realize an option: "Turn names on". You click on it and now you can see the names of every organ. You was right about the kidney and the intestine, and you read the other names, which included a part of the Hub and two or three of the names you had read in the Hub.

You go back and this time you press in the link to that was below the 3-D silhouette. A big map appeared, and the only thing you could see was lots of rounded things, everything was so crowded you couldn't see most of the organs. Looking around, you find that there are rooms even in the feet, the blades and in Absol's tail.

After closing the big map, you decide to focus on one section of Absol's body, so you can start exploring. You mentally divide Absol in two parts, each one including recognizable parts of Absol's body. After a while, you decide to take a map of...
144111111.title: Browse on the computer.

1441111111.content:
You decided to take a map of Absol's first half. You clicked on Absol's front section on the "display" and a map with better view of the parts in his front sections. On the display you can make out at least 60 places you can visit within the front-half of the Pokemon's body. Overwhelmed by the sheer number of places in Absol and wanting to kick-start your little journey sooner, you tried to choose some of the most prominent choices you can see on the 'flesh computer; but to no avail, there is far too many good places to start at.

Just when you're about to open your mouth to ask Absol, a message suddenly appears on the "display." It is displayed on some sort of chat system on the screen with the User ID Absol. Strangely, even though the display is made of flesh, it can display colors.

"Having trouble finding a place to start in my body, human?" , the message says, "You seem to have taken a strong liking to the "Human-Trainer Area."

You remained quiet for a moment, unsure about what you're going to do.

"Hi? I know you're still there, human. There is really no need to be surprised by the private chat system on the 'computer.' It's sorta a communication tool you can use in your "living area." Also, we are the only ones who will know the conversation we are currently having."

A simple on-screen keyboard is provided for you to type in your response. "Yeah, I like it in here, Absol. This computer is just cool. Also I've decided to explore the front-half of your body. One Problem.....there's too many place to choose from. Any recommendations?", you typed.

"The front-half....hmm...Alright, I've got 6 places on my mind that you may want to visit. Want me to explain them??", Absol messaged.

"Okay", you typed.

"Nice to hear that. Here are some place I would recommend you to visit."

Paw-pad
Believe it or not, you can visit the location of my paw from the inside. The location provides you with a very comfy flooring. You can also take a look at my huge claws when they are retracted. And if you like to do something a little more dirty, there is a "sweat gland" in there to make stuffs more fun.

Head
The place is located at the jewel-like marking on my forehead. That is the place where most of my psychic powers are concentrated. I can show you how I perform many of my moves here.

Eyes
This place provides an unhindered view of the things I'm seeing at the moment. It's also the place you would want to be if you would like to experience my little game called "Absol-for-a-Day." In the game, you get to temporarily be me and I can telepathically teach you all about being Pokemon when you're engaged in the experience.

Brain
You can visit some of the information in my brain is you like. It will act as a "library" for you, if you want to know about anything in the Pokemon

Blade
Have a close-up look of my beautiful weapon. Although it is usually soft, I can make it razor-sharp should the need arise. You will see the mechanism of my blade. In addition, it also acts as a transmitter; that's why you can access websites in your 'living area.'

Chest
This is the location where my hearts and lungs are located. I'll be keeping the surprises a secret for the time being, you'll just have to see it yourself.

Try visiting them, it'll be fun

It took you some time to read through Absol's long message.

"Whoa...sounds like fun.", you typed in response.

"Thanks!!!! Let's get started.", Absol replied.

You hear a gentle whirring sound near the 'computer' as a paper-like sheet begin to appear at the bottom of the 'display.' When the sheet falls out, you picked it up and saw a printed map of how to get to the locations Absol just recommended to you. The content of the paper is printed on a flexible transparent membrane.

You studied the detailed map for a moment.

"Hmm...so where should I start?", you thought.
1441111111.title: The first half (includes head, neck, chest and ...

choices: Use the Absol Transit to go to the "Paw pad"
Walk to the "Paw pad"  to do some exploring on the side.
14411111111.content: You decided to explore the "Paw-pad" First since it was first on the list. But based on the size of Absol's world, it was going to take a while to get to you'r destination. You decided to ask if there was another way to get to the "Paw-pad." "Based on the size of you'r inner world, I will take me forever to reach the "Paw-pad" Isn't there a faster way?" you typed. You only had to wait a few moments for a response. "Well, there is one way you could get around my body more quickly." Absol typed. "Not only can you use the "Hub" to get to various places in my body, but you can also use the Absol transit." Absol explained. "There is a station located in all the destinations in my body, including the "Human trainer living area" You can travel anywhere in my body in half the time!" Absol typed. You looked at the map and saw that there was in fact an "Absol Transit" Station in the living area and in the "Paw-pad" "So what are you waiting for? Give it a try!" Absol added. You walked over to the station and saw that there was a seemingly endless amount of choices. "You can also walk if you want to explore on the way" Absol typed. So you had a choice, take the "Absol Transit" In order to get to the "Paw-pad" faster, or walk to the "Paw-pad" and do some side exploring on the way.
14411111111.title: The "Paw-pad"

144111111111.content:
Exploring sounds interesting and it is pretty likely you're going to find new rooms and unexpected stuff on the way but...then you take another look to the map. You place your finger on your actual location near the neck and then follow the shortest road to the paw. You calculate it would take you from twenty to forty-five minutes to get to the paw, and although it gets to explore new places, you was already starting to feel a bit tired and didn't feel like walking all the way to the paw. Luckily, the Absol Transit seemed like a faster way to get to the paw, and you would still have energy to do whatever you wanted to do in the paw.

You walk around the Human Trainer Living Area, trying to find the station. You find a tunnel near the study, and you go through it. You quickly get to a place with low roof, that reminded you of a subway. You walk forward and then you feel the floor under you to contract when you step on it. Almost instantly, some sort of fleshy train appears. You notice what seemed like a door, so you approach to the train. You walk through it and enter the train. It is small and there are a few seats made of some sort of spongy tissue. There is also a few thin membranes covering some big holes in the walls of the train, almost like windows.

You walk to the back of the train, and find a screen. You're still impressed to find something resembling to technology inside a living being. There is only one line, waiting for you to write something. You touch the screen and a keyboard appears, along with a message welcoming you to the Absol Transit.

"Welcome, passenger! Using Absol Transit is easy and fast. Just type the name of the location, and let the body to carry you to your destination. If you have no idea of where to go, let the Absol Transit to pick a random destination by writing -random-"

You type "Paw-pad" on the screen, and another message appears "Thanks for using Absol Transit. It will take ten minutes to reach the destination. Sit down and enjoy"

The train starts to move, and you sit near of one of the windows. You see the train leaving the station and after a while it goes through a wall. Outside, it looks like the train's rails or whatever it is using to move are outside the organs, and you see many huge rounded objects, which you suppose are other organs you'll soon visit. The train goes to the right and you see a bone, and after looking to the map again you see is one of the ribs. You get past it and see lots of flesh and nothing interesting outside, besides other organs. You look back to the map and try to deduce the route of the train. Besides the rib, you don't see anything else that could indicate you your location.

You sit down and relax, occasionally looking outside of the window. Soon you see the train os moving on a long bone, and you watch outside for a while, yet the bone seems to be pretty long. You think it is the bone of the leg, and get ready to get down soon. The train soon stops and you stand up, going outside of the train. It stays there, so you walk outside the station and find yourself on a relatively soft place. You're not inside the Paw-pad yet, but you're close. You walk and you find the entrance. There is also one more road, which seems to go up on the leg. Ignoring it, you enter to the Paw-pad
144111111111.title: Use the Absol Transit to go to the "Paw pad...

1441111111111.content:
You entered the entrance to the "Paw-pad" Chamber, looking forward to the surprise Absol has up in store for you. The entrance opens before you into a huge, irregularly-shaped room. In this room, the ceiling is slightly lower than in the hub; about 25ft based on your estimate.

The room is completely surrounded by muscles and parts of the flooring is dark blue. When you stepped onto it, it extremely soft and it feels leathery. Above you, you saw four, jointed bones spread out from where you're standing, ending in four separate 'wings' in the chamber. Each 'wing' has a smaller dark-blue surface like the one you're standing on. You conclude that you've finally made it to your first destination after much confusion.

Seemingly feeling your presence his paw, the Absol talks to you again: "It looks like you reached my paw-pad. Here you can get to play on my extremely spongy pads and do whatever you want in this room. Despite the fact I'm currently walking about, you will not get disorientated because you are constantly keep in a straight-up position by my body's psychic power. Additionally, the four 'wings' you're seeing in there are my 'fore-toes" each of which contains a long claw. Another thing is the 'sweat gland' which I mentioned previously. That's all, just relax and enjoy your time in there as I continue my walk to my home."

After Absol finishes his statement, you decided to explore the "claws" first. You walk toward one of the 'wings' in the chamber. The claws are currently retracted and secured in their place. The blue claws are huge and they look sharp enough to slice through anything. You stare in awe at the gleaming claws, turning your head to look at all four in amazement. Then out of the corner of your eye, you notice that there some sort of bumps on the floor. You take a closer to look and find out that there are two bumps that resembles buttons, one dark green and the other red. There are labels on them: Retract (Green) and Arm (Red). The green one is currently depressed, leaving you to wonder what is the function of the red "Arm" bump.

You made your decision to step one the red one. As you did so, muscles around you sprang to life and you saw the claws fully extend out of Absol paw through openings in the chamber.

From the outside, Absol notice the claws on his left paw are extending and retracting without him doing so. Then he knows that the human in the Paw-pad must be playing around with the buttons in his paws. Absol sees it as a good sign that the human is really into him. He gave a wide smile as he continued walking deeper into the forest.

Back within the "Paw-pad" chamber, after much playing with Absol's claw control-buttons, you want to try something else. Remembered that Absol said something about the 'sweat gland' inside this chamber. You decided to look for it.

You spotted a screen on the wall near you. You went over and take a look at it. The screen is displaying a rough layout of the chamber you're in. You touched the screen. The display instantly refreshes and it asks you whether or not you want to activate Absol's sweat gland in the left paw. The 'screen' further explains that the sweat are harmless and will further enhance your experience in the chamber.

"Once the 'sweat gland' option is activated, this chamber will start precipitating sweat from the ceiling. Do you want to try it?", the screen asks.

What do you choose?
1441111111111.title: Playing on the Paw-pad

1441111111212.content:
"Here we are, the eyes, you'll see that currently I am walking through the forest and for the purpose of getting home I would like to stay in control if that is fine with you, but if you would like to take control simply access the cord on the ground."

You entered the room and were astonished as you saw a wonderful white room of marble perhaps, the eyes were beautifully crafted windows and the cord he mentioned was barely noticeable as it went from his eyes to the back of the room, probably the brain. So this cord would give me control? Too bad he was walking, though having fun with a pokemon would be amazing, maybe Absol would like to have fun in this forest.
1441111111212.title: Experience

1441111112.content:
You walk through one of the corridors. You the come across a fork. A sign points both ways. Each direction led somewhere different.

Left: Stomach for Pokeball storage
Right: Personal Stomach

Each place sounded interesting so you decided to go
1441111112.title: The second half (includes belly, back, back leg...

choices: Find me another human to live in here
Direct me to your Oder Producer
144111112.content: You decided look around some more. As you left, you decided to ask Absol something. " Hey Absol," you asked. "Yes?" he replied. "Would you be able to
144111112.title: Something else?

145.content: Then which legendary Pokemon would you choose?
145.title: Other

choices: You ask Dialga for other ways of entering
1451.content:
You look around when the dizziness diminishes. It is obvious that you aren't in the forest anymore.

The sky above you is covered on what looks like purple clouds. And, looking around you, you seem to be standing on some sort of stone platform. There seems to be no living being besides you, and there are several odd stuff scattered around. From your position, you can't look beyond a few meters, then you notice you're standing. You look around, and focus on the objects.

You can't believe what you're seeing. You see fruits, what looks like a huge piece of meat, and various trinkets around, all of them much bigger than you. For you, this either means that, or those things are naturally huge, or you have shrunk. You lean towards the first one, at least until you hear a growl or something similar, behind you. You turn around, and much to your grief, you notice that it was the second option.

You see a dark blue dragon, with several protruding gray spines over its body. There is also some kind of metallic element on its chest, and in the center, a blue gem. The creature is inspecting and eating the food stuff that fell over there. You have the feeling you have seen it before, and you finally remember. You had seen a drawing in a book, a long time ago. If you're not mistaken, you're near the Temporal Pokémon, Dialga!

And you're also shrunk. This doesn't seem like a good combination. Dialga is naturally an huge Pokémon, but now "humongous" would be a better word.

You start looking around for a place to be safe. You're not sure if you want to be seen, but before you can move, Dialga turns its head towards you. "...This is new."

You almost faint again. "Eh...eh...hey"

Dialga seems to be frustrated. "This is unacceptable. Humans aren't supposed to enter my realm"

"I didn't do it on purpose! I fainted and then I woke up here"

Dialga growls again "I know that! It isn't your fault. Palkia is supposed to bring stuff to me with space powers. That dork must have done a mistake. I'll send you back"

"Wa...wait a moment! You can't send me in this state! I'm shrunk"

"Aren't all humans this small? Um..."

"At least give me my normal size first, please!"

"I can't do that" Dialga says " If Palkia was the one to do this to you, then Palkia is the only one who can revert it. Space bending powers and what not. Meanwhile..." Dialga seems to be thinking.

"Can you contact Palkia?" you ask, hoping the answer is positive

"No. Who knows what dimension Palkia is visiting right now. I have no way to know. You'll have to be here for who knows how long. If you stay around, you may be in danger of me crushing you by accident" At this point you look at Dialga's huge cylindrical feet. There is no doubt that if it stepped on you, it would be hard to scrape your remains off the floor. You want to avoid death as much as possible-

"I only see one solution. I'll have to eat you"

This doesn't go into your survival plans. "No! Please don't! I don't want to die!"

"Who said anything about dying?"

"Don't you even know what happens to what one eats?" you yell, furious

Dialga looks at you closer, obviously annoyed by your words. "I know perfectly well what is the digestive process. It won't happen to you. I'm offering you to stay inside my body. This way I'll be able to know where you are"

"A...ah..." Your fear is suddenly gone "Does that mean...no death?"

"No death. But just a word of warning: My body isn't an amusement park. You better not cause a mess". At this point, Dialga lowers its head to the ground. Its fang-like horns make it hard for Dialga to rest it on the floor, but it somehow manages to do it. It opens its huge mouth, signaling you to enter. You're not sure you feel comfortable to go through the same place you had seen go some food less than ten minutes ago, but what other option do you have?
1451.title: Dialga/Palkia

14511.content:
Accepting that there is no choice but to listen to Dialga, you made your first steps toward the giant Pokemon's mouth. Although he had reassured you that there won't be any problem, you still feel hesitant about entering Dialga. The Pokemon looked at you with an amused expression, seemingly taking pleasure in your indecision.

A few steps later, you managed to arrive at the edge of Dialga's mouth. From here, the Pokemon looks even more of a behemoth. Sandwiched between the two metallic fang structures, you could only marvel at the very existence of such a Pokemon. Although you didn't see it, you can feel Dialga's crimson eyes following your every move. Eventually, you picked up your courage and stepped onto the tongue. Strangely, it feels solid to your touch despite Dialga being able to move it with ease. You can't help but admired the tall cavernous structure of the mouth. Pearly white molars the size of houses flanked you on both sides as you ventured deeper.

A minute or so later, you reached the throat of the Pokemon. When you looked down, you saw a long tunnel containing glowing rune-like symbols extending all the way down.

"There is no need to worry, human.", Dialga spoke, "Just jump down. You'll land safely in my stomach."

Due to you being in close proximity of the throat, Dialga's voice was deafening and low. You felt your ears ringing from the loudness as your brain readjust itself after you were knocked off balance.

Doing as he said, you leaped and began your plunge downward. The feeling of free-falling isn't a good one. It feels as if your entire body is being twisted inside our multiple times and spun randomly. A little over 10 seconds into the jump, you feel yourself slowly decelerate in defiance of gravity. You opened you eyes and find the tunnel opening into a larger space below. When you tried to move your hands up, they didn't immediately move to the front of your face. Instead, it looks as if someone had played a video in slow motion. You don't know why this happens but you are thankful that you aren't falling at breakneck speed.

Another minute or so and you find yourself safely landing on the floor of the stomach with a metallic clink. You could once again move your hands at normal speed. The stomach of Dialga is gargantuan. Judging by length alone, there's little doubt that a Pokemon stadium could comfortably fit in this place with many more spaces to spare. The stomach walls are covered in rune symbols and circular drawings that glows neon blue. The sight made you momentarily forget about your immediate problems; all you want to do is admire the sheer beauty of the place.

"I see that you have safely arrived at my stomach, human.", Dialga's voice echoed from above, "I believe you're wondering about the phenomenon you encountered on your way down and an explanation is necessary. My special ability is time manipulation; I can move forward and backward in time and speed it up or slow it down at my order."

You are completely surprised by the revelation.

"....wow, a Pokemon that could control time itself.", you said in admiration.

"If everything is fine, then I would like to explain some simple rules.", Dialga said, "Since you are in my body, I would request that you treat it with utmost respect. Like I said before, my body is not an amusement park. You are not allowed to explore places without my permission. Do you understand this?"

"Yes, absolutely.", you answered.

"Good. Now please enter the glowing hole beside you. We have some things to work out first."
14511.title: You enter Dialga's mouth

145111.content:
To your right a spot on the floor starts glowing. You look closer, and notice it is a hole, slightly wider than you. Without a second thought, you grab onto the edges of the hole, and let yourself be suspended on it. Then you let go the edge.

You fall for a second before you hit some kind of slide. The passage impulses you at a nice speed, until you see more light at the end. The slide stops gradually until you're able to stand up and enter the room.

You're in a completely empty room, but the walls are almost pitch black, while the floor is more of a metallic gray color, despite it being as squishy as always. The room is small and featureless, and you wonder why you were sent here.

Dialga starts talking to you.

"This is the situation: you're going to be a guest inside me for some time. I don't know for how long. It could take a few days, or a few weeks, or a few months. That depends on how fast I localize Palkia. In this moment I'm starting to rearrange some of my organs to provide you some places so you feel like you were at home"

"How can you do that?"

"I have very limited space-like powers, those are the type of powers that allow one to manipulate matter or create stuff. I can only do it with my body, no more. Palkia has very limited time powers. It is the burden of being...almost related in blood" Dialga stops, maybe thinking about what he just said. "Leaving that aside, I'll give you safety and comfort, with the only rule that you abide to my simple requests: Don't go to places without my authorization"

"Then where can I be?" you ask

"In your room, and some places I'm creating for you"

That is way too limited. This seemed like a lifetime chance! Being inside a Pokémon, and one that is very powerful! But you find out that you will be confined to only a handful of places. Picking your words carefully, you talk: "Maybe...I could be an asset for you. As a way of saying "thank you" for your hospitality. But I wouldn't be able to help if I'm restricted to my home. Don't you think it is something that should be corrected?"

Dialga doesn't reply to your words. Instead, a wide circle lights up in a side of the room. "I have to gather some information about you, if I'm going to let wander around my body freely. Step inside that circle"

You obey. As soon as you stand on the center of it, you feel some kind of energy coursing through you. It feels as if you touched something electric. You stand in the circle for a few minutes, until it turns off. Seeing nothing else around, you walk away from where the circle was. You suppose that it was Dialga's way to know more about you, much quicker than you telling what he wanted to know. You just hope he gave you some privacy and didn't look at your secrets.

You wait for Dialga's verdict. "You seem like a responsible person. I have watched your past, I see how you behave. However, I see some flaws. I'll give you more liberty, but there will still be a few restricted places for you. Meanwhile, go to your room" A door appears on one of the black walls. You enter, excited to see how your room is.

"By the way, you would still have needed to have your past checked, even if you didn't say that" Dialga comments while you observe around what is your bedroom. It is like you were standing in a cubist painting. The walls are with a cobalt blue and gray, and it looks like somebody sticked a lot of those plates Dialga has on his body. Definitely the Pokémon isn't the best at decorating.

At least there are some stuff that are good. There is a bed, and it is soft. It is a relief. You also seem to have something that looks like a huge clock on the wall. There are a lot of blank spaces. Dialga explains that you have to fill the spaces with preferences of what you would like to do at some times. You only write sleeping times and food times, leaving the rest blank for later days.

Last is what looks like a railway in middle of your room. Attached to it is a capsule. Dialga explains that this will be your way out of the room, that it'll take you to whatever place you want, but that it only works from your room.

It seems that Dialga is what one could call "logical". Doing only the most necessary things. You wonder if, after some time inside him, a softer side will be revealed.

"Now that you're settled in your room and know its main elements, there is only one thing left before you're free to go. As I told you, there will be a few forbidden places for you". On the wall a map of Dialga appears. It looks like it'll be always there, as a reminder of where you can't go.

"I'll highlight the places out of your reach. If I ever grant you permission, those highlights will be gone. If I ever find you inside one of these places, you'll receive a severe punishment. Understood?" You nod. "Now look carefully"
145111.title: Data Registration and Checking

1451111.content:
Several regions on Dialga's map began flashing with red strobe lights.

"Okay, these are the following areas that are off limit to you.", Dialga said, "First, you are not allowed to access my brain and I would like you to respect my privacy in that regard. And the information and world there is beyond your comprehension anyway. Second, the Temporal Region is a no go zone for you. Entering that area unguided could result in severe injuries, both physical and metaphysical. Third, when you travel around in my body, you will encounter various apparatuses or devices. Let me be clear, you are not to operate them without my expressed approval. If you are found attempting to violate any of the above, you will be confined to your room and subject to severe punishment at my discretion. Is that understood, human?"

You took time to study the map, carefully going over all the prohibited area. Once you have memorized the areas, you answered with a firm yes.

"Good. It seems that we are off to a good start.", Dialga said, "As long as you obey the rules, you'll find my body to be a welcoming place.

You thanked Dialga again for willing to provide you with accommodation. It was really nice of him to help you and all. In fact, you are surprised that he even adjust his own body for you. It challenged the idea that Legendary Pokemons aren't exactly known for their closeness to humans.

"If everything is fine with you, I'll have to start looking for Palkia. I wonder where that doofus has gone to this time.", Dialga muttered, "Maybe I can start with your world first. In the mean time, you can use the capsule to visit other areas of my body."

With that said, you headed for the capsule and entered it. The capsule has a black cylindrical shape with glowing lines running along its entire length.
