The thing seemingly sensed your presence and started up itself. A map of Dialga appeared on the interior wall. You checked the map, seeing several dozens of available places for you to go to excluding the brain and Temporal Region. A particular area is flashing green on the image. You pointed to the area and the words "Asset Training Center" appeared on top of it. Dialga explained that the Center will be your first stop before you move on to other places in his body.

Once a destination is set, the capsule whirred up and started traveling through holes and glowing walls.
1451111.title: Continue

14511111.content:
The capsule is comfortable, and you find entertaining to imagine all the places Dialga has in his body. This seems like it'll be something enjoyable.

About ten minutes pass before you arrive your destination. Looking at the map, the Asset Training Center is not far from your room, this says a lot of the sheer size of your host. You have the feeling that if you tried to walk from the head to the tip of the tail, a whole day wouldn't be enough.

The capsule opens, and you step out of it. You're now in what looks like a shiny white room. There is an huge platform at the center. You get closer to it, and finally step on top. Nothing happens.

"What is this place for, Dialga?"

Dialga takes a while to reply. "Eh? Oh, yes, I almost forgot. You said you wanted to help around?"

"As a way to say thank you"

"I suppose helping me around can keep you entertained. I don't want you to get bored..."

"What would I have to do?" you ask

"I'm going to propose something: would you like to work in the mornings, and spend the afternoons and nights doing what you want?"

You think for a moment. It doesn't sound bad, and could be a chance to know your host better, both in the ways of how his body works, and in a more personal way. Besides, it would be nice to have something to fill your time while you're inside him. "Yes, that sounds perfect Dialga"

"Good. I may not have something for you everyday, though, but if you really need something to do, then tell me. Is it fine if you start tomorrow?" Dialga asks. You reply that it is okay. "Then let's use this morning to give you a fast rundown of the very basic functions of my body. First things first"

Clothes appear in front of you. You pick them up. The clothes seem to be made of some kind of rough material. "This is in case you don't want to ruin your actual clothes. Use this if you want to". You try it on. It is almost perfect, maybe a bit long, but it won't bother you.

"Now where to start...uh. I know" Something starts forcing you down the platform. Once you're out of it, something starts forming on it. You watch amazed how Dialga appears on top of the platform on its natural size. He is still huge, compared to you. Not even another you, standing on your shoulders, would be able to be higher than Dialga's head.

"Did it work?" Dialga says, looking around. Then he sees you. "Yes, it did work. Now human, come here" You step on the platform again. "Let's start with something simple, so you start knowing me better. You'll examine my outside carefully. My external body is a sure way for you to have a hint of what is under the skin. Every part will be important, so be sure not to skip anything. If you need help, tell me and I'll re-position myself for your convenience. Any questions?"

You reply that it is clear, but Dialga's intimidating size makes you hesitate. "Come on, don't be shy. I'm not going to hurt you" he says, and it is the first time you see Dialga in a more or less friendly tone. A bit reassured, you step forward to start.
14511111.title: An Introductory Course to Dialga

145111111.content:
With permission from Dialga, you moved closer and examined his body in detail. This could possibly be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to understand more about such a mysterious Legendary. You noticed that his metallic exterior gives off a lustrous sheen and has light blue details that runs along his legs. Although he made his size into what you would see at your normal height, Dialga still looks imposing; standing at least 30 feet tall. Out of curiosity, you placed your hand onto his body. It's soft like flesh but it felt as if you're touching cold metal. The Pokemon seemed intrigued at how you're exploring his body. Having a human physically lay his hand on a Legendary Pokemon, and a temporal one at that, was unthinkable. Such transgression once warrants Dialga to cast the human to torturous dimensions to suffer for eternity; that is, if a human ever finds his inter-dimensional abode. But Dialga currently seem not to care much. Instead, he observes how the human looks at and touch every part of his body at his reach. Humans are such interesting creatures, he thought. Sure worthy of conducting observation myself.

You continue to walk around the Pokemon, examining every part of the body. The claws on his legs are made of metallic materials like his fangs. A light tap on them gave off a loud clink that reverberate through the chamber. Spikes similar to fins sprout out from the back. At first you believe that they are used as some form of weapon, but it seems to also has other functions as evidenced by pulsating glows that it gave off.

You are almost under his body when Dialga interrupted you by speaking.

"Alright let me give you a quick rundown of my body here.", the Pokemon asked, "Since you're are new here, I probably wouldn't be going into too much details about my body or abilities. If you're going to help me in here, these are some of the basics."

You nodded and listened.

"As a Temporal Pokemon, I have to ability to control the flow of time, whether it's backward or forward, fast or slow. To accomplish that, I use the spikes and horns you on my head and body to distort time-space and manipulate it at my will. If you want to know about the details of how that's done, it's far beyond your understandings. All I can tell you is that it has much to do with cosmic, dimensions, and energy forces. And that's something for you humans to figure out.", Dialga explained, "Another part is my body itself. What it basically does is protecting me from the effects of inter-dimensional distortion. As you travel through the fabric of space-time, you will encounter something called a rift, which can have serious consequences if you're unprepared. With the properties my body has, there is no concerns about that. The distortion resistant trait also protects you as long as your on the inside."

"That's some deep things you're saying there.", you said.

"This is just the surface. The longer you're with me, the more you will discover about existence itself.", Dialga answered cryptically, "Back to topic, what I want to do is to do a routine check of my body and report any anomalies to me."

"That sounds that a difficult task."

"That you don't have to worry.", Dialga said reassuringly, "You'll be attending more lessons in this room here in the future regarding those issues. Now that I have nothing more to say, run along and explore."

The Dialga in the chamber disappeared into thin air. you made your way back to the capsule, replaying what the Pokemon had just said. Mysterious as he is, he has gotten you interested.
145111111.title: Physical Examination

1451111111.content:
The capsule takes you to a point inside Dialga's chest. You notice you're near that strange jewel embedded on the plates on the chest, but you have a feeling that there won't be a way for you to take a peek in there. Not that you planned to do that.

The capsule starts stopping slowly, until you're able to step down. You look at your new surroundings. You're in another small chamber, and the capsule itself appeared in the middle of the room, as if it ascended from a space underneath your actual location. You see a handful of screens, almost covering the space between the ceiling and the ground, but there is only one panel with buttons. You approach it. You notify Dialga you arrived, as you feel that this place will be very important for you.

"This chamber will be one of the tools you'll use during your work. Every screen has a different function. If you look in front of you, you'll see the controls" Effectively, there are many buttons and a single stick, which looks like you'll be able to move. "Press the big button to turn on the computers. You'll only be able to see the one that is in front of you"

You press the button, and instantly see how the screen acquires an image in the screen, a tridimensional image of Dialga. "If it is too confusing for you, you can change it into a map"

The buttons that are the closest to you allow to see specific portions of my body, whether it is based on systems, areas or the importance of the organs". Change screens with the only dial around" You move the dial, and the screen in front of you moves to a side, another one taking its place. It turns on, and you see a bunch of numbers, along with some words explaining what they are.

"This screen shows data like temperature, strength and other similar tidbits. I'm not sure if you'll know the average amount that this should have, so you may not use this screen" You move the dial again, and another screen takes the center. It is different stuff. You see the most basic functions of Dialga, summarized in bars. "This screen shows if I need to sleep, eat or similar. I can do it by myself, but it is included if you want to know. The main screen you'll use if the first one" You put it back. Dialga explains how you use the controls, and you follow each step. When it is all done, he decides to do a practice to end the day. It is starting to get late, at least in your world.

"Before you retire to your room, let's pretend you just arrived here. Now examine my body for any anomalies. If there is a problem, you should see the organ or area with a color. Minor problems will be green, and the worse the problem, the redder the color will be. I doubt you'll see life-threatening issues while you're inside me, though"

You start switching maps, looking for any color. It isn't a bad job. There are about ten maps, and you take a look at all of them before deciding that there aren't any problems. "Everything is fine, Dialga"

"That is because I already corrected those issues by myself, before you arrived"

"If I find a problem, what do I do?"

"You notify me, first. Then you go to the area, and examine carefully to find the root of the problem. Then we'll apply the best course of action to fix the problem" You nod, understanding this "For practice purposes, I'll strain one of my muscles. After you're done fixing that, you may retire to your room to sleep"

As soon as he said that, you start coursing through the maps again. This time, there is an alert in one of them. In the one with Dialga's muscles, you see a small area in the back, filled with a green color. "I found it" you say, before going to your capsule. You highlight the area, and wait to be taken there.

This concrete human seems to have the ability to understand instructions easily. Somebody like this human can be a good help around
1451111111.title: Dialga's Central Chamber

14511111111.content:
The capsule whirred to life, transporting you to the location of Dialga's muscle strain. The map display indicates that the strain is located in the upper part of the Pokemon's right hind leg. The problem looks minor and is a perfect opportunity to prove your usefulness to Dialga. A good few minutes later, the capsule came to a gradual stop at your destination.

Exiting the capsule, you found yourself looking at a massive structure constructed from indescribable materials. The thing has a dark grey hue that reminds you of carbon metal. It looks like an extremely thick pillar about 9 feet that goes from the floor to the ceiling where it is joined with an even thicker horizontal beam. You can see the pillar occasionally twisting and turning on it axis. Running along the gargantuan structures are glowing stripes the run in a helix shape along its entire length. Based on the sight, you conclude that the thing before you is a part of Dialga's bone structure. If so, where are the muscles? There are no strands or fleshed in sight. You are about to asked Dialga about it when the Pokemon starts speaking.

"Now that you've arrived at the location of my strain, there are probably a lot of questions lingering on your mind.", Dialga said, "As you probably already noticed, my definition of muscle is a bit different than those of humans. If you can take a closer look at my bone, you will see that it consists of tiny metallic strands bounded together by my body's natural energy force: the glowing lines. The strands are made from the same thing as my fangs and body spikes; they are far more stronger than steel but also flexible."

When you take a close up look at the bone, indeed, thin spaghetti-like strands made up its structure.

"When I lift my leg, My brain automatically reduce or increase the strength of the energy lines accordingly and allow the strands to bend or twist into the desired shape. It's similar to how a bundle of what you humans call drinking straws would work."

"Interesting.", you said, "But how could you even strain such body structure if you made it so flexible and sturdy?"

"There are times that I will over apply the force needed to move and accidentally burn out or break the energy lines. When that happens, it would weaken my 'muscles' significantly in the affected parts. If severe enough, I will be immobilized and forced to rest for several days before I could move my body again. Basically, your job here is to look out for those problems and repair them. If you intervened, my muscles will heal far faster than on its own."

"How do I do that? Sounds like it takes more than just first aid to fix.", you asked Dialga.

"It's nothing hard.", the Pokemon chuckled, "The injured part of the line will be dimmer than the rest. You just have to give the strained part a nice massage and stretching to get it back to working order...Well,
enough chat for now, better start working on those strains. "

With that said, Dialga fall silent again. You started circling the bone to find where you need to work on. Soon enough, you came across a region where the energy lines are dim and struggling. You gave the lines a thorough rub. Every time you touched the lines you felt some arcane energy channel itself through your body. It similar to an electric shock but without the pains.

Half an hour later, you managed to fix all of the lines on the bone.

"Excellent work!", Dialga exclaimed, "Not bad on a first try."

"That's nothing.", you said, "Just doing my best to be of help to you, Dialga."

"Okay, as I promised you, you are now free to return to your room for some well-deserved sleep. I wish you good night."

You wished the same for Dialga and entered the capsule to return to your room. A short trip later, you entered your bedroom and plopped down on the bed, drifting to sleep almost immediately.

This human is far more capable than I expected. He's respectable and quick but some flaws still linger. I should definitely observe him more closely now.
14511111111.title: Finishing the Practice

145111111111.content:
Now that the human is asleep, Dialga decided to take this as a moment to take a deeper look at the information he had obtained a few hours ago. Watching humans sleep wasn't his way to spend the night. Dialga had retrieved practically a copy of everything in the human's mind.

After making sure that the Pokémon would know if the human woke up, Dialga started examining the information. He noticed that indeed, humans aren't as small as his guest is. He also noticed that the human was one of those trainers he had heard about. Dialga frowned, but calmed down when he saw that the Pokémon in his team were all healthy and happy.

The life of the human was boring and generall generic, but to Dialga it was like a new whole world. Humans seems to be in a close partnership with Pokémon. Dialga noted Could we be in the same partnership? Dialga doubted that the human would be more than a guest, but eh...he wasn't opposing the idea of actually turning into friends. Not that it would be instantly.

Then Dialga started looking for flaws, or something that indicated the human could be a bad person. Everything seemed to be rather inoffensive. Nothing seemed to hint the human could harbor bad intentions towards Dialga. But he also noticed that the human showed recklessness at some situation. Impulsive actions led to trouble. Maybe I'll have to keep an eye on him, just in case

Dialga doubted if he should check anything about the human's deepest secrets. He finally decided not to do it...at least for now.

The last thing Dialga checked was if the human had any knowledge that could be useful during his stay inside the body. Looks like the guest has a respectable amount of knowledge about Pokémon biology and anatomy, so at least the basics were covered. The only thing left was to see how the human would help him.

Leaving the rest of the data for later, Dialga once again looked at the sleeping human. It should be worth it to watch over this human. Could be a potential aid in the future...but what would the other Legendaries think? He doubted that other Legendaries ever had humans inside them. Dialga sent a message to Palkia, asking his whereabouts.

But...wouldn't it be worth it to, well...keep the human inside him for a while? Just to study it?

Finally Dialga went to sleep. The morning surely would bring the human something to do.
145111111111.title: Covert Mind Surveillance

1451111111111.content:
The morning came with the beeping of your watch. Groggily, you stirred awake and looked at the time: 7:30. Being a trainer meant that you are well-adjusted to rising up early for more practices. You slowly got out of the bed. When you reached for the nightstand to retrieve your Pokeballs, you felt thin air. You frantically looked around the room: a bed, a time clock scheduler, and a simple desk. All of them set in a room with metallic walls...Gradually, you remembered what happened yesterday and the fact that you currently live in Dialga. You called out for Dialga but there wasn't a reply. You tried several times to get the Pokemon's attention but you efforts were fruitless. He's probably still sleeping at this time. Guess Pokemons don't have a rigid living schedule like humans do, you thought.

You used the next few minutes to perform a few simple stretches to get your body into active mode and explored your room a little more thoroughly. There are a little more items in the room than yesterday. First, there is a newly formed couch and coffee table opposite your bed. Supposedly fitting with the 'theme' you've seen so far, the new furnitures look like something out of a cubist or abstract painting; all boxy and futuristic.

And part of the previously featureless, cold steel walls opposite the couch now contains a glass screen blinking with random symbols. Moving in front of the screen caused it to refresh. An interface now appears detailing functions like 'live views', games, word editors, personal finance, problem reports and several more. With some fidgeting around, you learned that the screen tracks your movement and that you can used your hand to control the options. Some of the features made you curious. What does personal finance have to do with Dialga? Is there some form of banking system in here? Just when you are about to explore that option, you felt your stomach growl loudly. You realized that you haven't eaten since yesterday.

You boarded the capsule and looked at the map, searching for any place that may provide food. Out of all the choice, only the "Replenishment Galley" looks remotely related to food. You pressed the location on the map and allowed the capsule to take you to whatever is ahead of you.
1451111111111.title: Next Morning

14511111111111.content:
The capsule stops. It is your cue to step out of it and look at your surroundings.

This new place isn't much bigger than the rest of places you have seen, with the obvious exception of the stomach. You're now in a room that is full of strange pipes, odd machine-like things strewn all over the walls, and a few chutes on the ceiling. Everything seems to be made of chrome and other similar materials, remarking even further the fact that your host is a Steel-type. It is almost as if you stumbled upon some kind of engine room inside Dialga. What is this chamber?

You request Dialga for more information about this room, but you don't receive a reply. Maybe he is still asleep. How long did he stay awake last night?

You walk around, trying to figure out what these things are. During your investigation of your surroundings, you encounter some kind of safe, with a handle on the door. You open the safe, and are instantly received by cool air. You see many food items, which you almost recognize as some of the stuff that were strewn around that platform yesterday, when you arrived to whatever dimension Dialga lives in.

You take a fruit you recognize. It is so big that you have to use both hands to take it from the fridge. You place it on one of the metallic flat surfaces. Focusing on one of the odd contraptions on the wall, you twist a small button. A small fire appears, as if it were a stove. Somewhere in the room you find a pan. You use your hands to rip off a piece of the fruit,and place it on the pan, which you place on the stove. Soon it starts sizzling.

After a while, and a few other experiments with some of the stuff in the room, you sit on the floor to eat your piece of fruit. The result...wasn't good. "Bleh"

You finish your meal, and soon the rest of the fruit goes back into the fridge. "Are you done?" you hear. It must be Dialga. "This Replenishment Galley...is just a kitchen, right?"

"More or less. I have to remember to teach you how to make your own food in here, but it seems that you managed to do something"

"It could have been better" you frown.

"If you're done with breakfast, then you can start your duties" You nod, entering the capsule. You'll have to admit that you're very excited. Does this mean that there is work for you? What could it be?

Soon the capsule reaches the central room, and you turn on the screens
14511111111111.title: Replenishment Galley

145111111111111.content:
You eyed the dozens of screen before you with vigilance. Today is your first day on the job and you do not want to disappoint Dialga with any mishaps. Any mistakes on your part could damage your relation with the Pokemon and at worst, jeopardize your chance of returning to normal. I gotta keep it together, you thought, Dialga is the key to finding Palkia. Once we find him, I'm going to give him a piece of my mind about shrinking random humans. After making yourself comfortable in a steel seat that Dialga had created, you turned the dials on the control to check on the status of all body parts.

A half an hour into your work, you found nothing problematic. All the bloodstreams are at acceptable flow rate, the body heat is normal, and the protective magnetic field surrounding the Pokemon while dimension traveling works just fine.
One thing perplexed you while inspecting the screens: why is Dialga so trusting of you? From the time you first met him, the Pokemon seemed very believing about your statements. Is there anything that he knows that you don't? Considering the fact that Dialga controls time, there is little doubt that he could see the future of anyone. If he could that, does this mean Dialga knew about what lies ahead for you? Judging by how he treated you so far, he probably saw something important regarding you otherwise, Dialga wouldn't have given you such freedom in his body let alone allowed you to enter it. You kept the intriguing thoughts to yourself and continued your duty.

An hour later, there isn't much to look around about. The same stats, the same normalcy. Eventually you got bored of the silence, so you decided to start a conversation with Dialga.

"Hey Dialga. Your body is working as smooth as a machine right now. There isn't much that I could do now. Do you mind if I ask you something?", you asked the Pokemon.

"Go ahead, human", Dialga answered calmly.

"I was wondering about how you and Palkia get along since you two seemed to be from the same dimension?"

".....I'm not quite sure how to answer that question, human.", Dialga replied, "Our relations are, in the simplest term, complicated. A lot of events has happened, both good and bad, that brought us together or caused us to fight. There are incidents that brought harmony and those that sowed disunity. The last time we fought each other, we caused several dimensions to collapse. It's a gaping quandary that you should stay away from."

"Sounds awful if you ask me.", you said.

"And that is merely the surface of our problems.", Dialga sighed, "If you ever attempt to find out more, you will find yourself in a cosmic conflict that has been going on since the beginning of time. But for now, we maintained a state of peace with each other. It is uneasy but much-needed."

You took some time to allow the information to sink in. So Dialga and Palkia aren't really at terms with each other but still maintained some level of understandings, you thought. Hope that won't affect our search for him. You returned to the monitoring the screens and wondered which dimension Palkia would be in.

The human seemed interested about my history with Palkia. It seems that it's their characteristics to find out about the past. Looks like this human is more than he appears to be, even if unknowingly
145111111111111.title: First Day of Work

choices: I'll take one of these tours
1451111111111111.content:
You get ready for your first exploration day inside Dialga. Who knows what you'll see inside the behemoth!

You enter the capsule, and look at the screen to decide about a good starting point for the tour, but there are too many places. You spend some minutes analyzing every option, trying to find the best one, but you give up. There is no way you'll be able to choose a starting point. You figure that once you manage to have a place where to start, everything will be easier.

"So you can't decide where to start your exploration, right human?" you hear Dialga say.

"It is that everything sounds worth visiting..."-you reply, being completely honest. Everything has something that attracts you. Even places that one would suppose would cause you to be grossed out, sound interesting, for the sheer curiosity you have about how it would be to be in them.

Want me to help you?"

"How can you help?"

"I created a few routes for you. You could choose one, and visit every place there is in that route"- Dialga explains. The screen in front of you changes into a menu, with around five options. -"Select a route and the capsule will take you to the first stop. You'll have to walk from there to the next point, and so until you finish the route. Every route is supposed to take the rest of the day. How does that sound?"

It doesn't sound bad, but maybe you would rather to explore by yourself. You take the time to read the options in the screen of the capsule.

The Very Basics: The places that you'll visit everyday

Myths and Lore: Knowing more about the past

Odd Places: Things you never thought you would see inside Dialga

Amazing: Visually engaging places

Body Processes: How Dialga's insides work This one seems to have a submenu, but only one is unblocked. Digestive Process: It is more than you think

After reading every possibility, you make your decision and notify Dialga
1451111111111111.title: End of work, more exploration

14511111111111111.content:
"We'll, I'm new here so I guess I'll start with the basics of your body.", you told Dialga.

"Very well, then. Go ahead and press the option in front of you.", Dialga said.

You went ahead and press the option for "The Very Basics" and watched as the capsule starts moving once again. There is an exciting sense of adventure; you have no idea what lies ahead. What kind of location could you visit everyday in this Pokemon? All you could think of as the capsule move along the path is that huge map back at your room. You didn't read the detail on all of them so Dialga could be taking you to anywhere in his body. You imagined everything from the mundane like the stomach to places that goes beyond metaphysical experience.

The capsule reached it's stop with a screech. You stepped out into a large metallic chamber with tall ceilings. As your feet touch the ground, a glowing blue line starts following wherever you walked. They seem to be coming through the solid floor and will constantly reform itself if you walked in circles for too long. You guess that is one way for Dialga to track your movement, both to keep you safe and to prevent you from entering restricted areas. Taking a closer look at the new room, there is what looks like a running track that goes around the entire perimeter of the room complete with obstacles and barriers. In the center, there are steel bars that are shaped to resemble various exercise equipments like dumbbells, stretchers and bike simulators. On the side of each of the equipment, there is a little display that record the activities you perform.

"I see that you have arrived at your first stop, human.", Dialga's voice echoed in the room, "This place is the Exercise Room. I know that humans constantly engage in activities to keep their body in good health, so I figured that I could provide you with something you could do in your free time."

"Thanks. I could really use these things here since I'm not really moving much in here.", you told Dialga.

"You're welcome. Besides maintaing your body, your movement with this chamber can be used to generate energy for my body; by stepping on the floor or using the exercise equipments, you are actually creating an electro-magnetic force that could be absorbed into the walls and floor to be used by my body. So simply put, both of us will benefit from your exercise."

"That sounds nice. Glad I could be useful while I stay in you.", you said.

"It's alright. You're already helping a lot by monitoring my body activities. So, if we're all done here, we can head to our next location by taking the hallway on your left. There's something that I always wanted to use."

You turned your head at Dialga's cryptic comment but took the passage anyway to your next stop.
14511111111111111.title: I'll take one of these tours

145111111111111111.content:
You walk until you notice your steps are starting to sound as if you were walking on some sort of platform. The tissues around you are also getting more rigid, and you notice they're covered by some kind of substance. In the distance, a hole can be seen. You speed up, wanting to see what is beyond it.

You enter the biggest room you have seen yet, once again leaving the stomach aside, but the one you're in now looks much more interesting, as it is something you thought you would never see inside a Pokémon.

You're now in a room that anybody would have thought to be a foundry. There are several chains, suspended platforms, and huge drums that, while you can't see inside them, you suppose they're full of molten metal. The heat around you increases as you walk on the platforms, but for some odd reason, everything looks like it hasn't been used for a long time, maybe never.

"What is this place for?"

"These are my metalworks. Here I would use my metal resources to repair any damage my steel-like body parts may receive. But since I'm not somebody who battles often, this hasn't been used yet. Now this is yours"

So you now have a foundry. Nice! "How do I operate this place?"

"You'll see many controls on the rails. Each one of them should have instructions. You can use this room to create stuff for yourself. You'll have to create your own molds, though"

You nod, and once again look at the huge containers. You would hate to fall inside one of those. A random thought crosses your mind in that moment, you remember you wanted to ask Dialga a question.

"Dialga, I had seen something about financial management or something like that, on that screen taht is now in my room. What is that for?" you ask.

"That is the next planned stop, human. Now continue, there should be an entrance at the other side of the Metalworks. Enter"

You cross the platforms until you reach the wall, and locate the entrance.
145111111111111111.title: Dialga's Metalworks

1451111111111111111.content:
You quickly filed through the passageway toward what could be the weirdest location yet in Dialga. The revelation of a body part capable of being used for finance and banking came as a surprise to you. You wonder what kind of function will it do as there is no apparent purpose to have such location in a body. Ever since you entered Dialga, all the body parts you've encountered so far are made for your convenience; much of them seemed to be Dialga's attempt at making things as normal as possible for your stay. The banking system is likely an extension of that.

Soon, the hallway opens up into another room. From the looking of things, this location is as large as the stomach. Like previous places you've visited, the chamber is fashioned out of featureless and sterile steel; functional but minimalist. There are circles of kiosks throughout the floor each with a distinctive color. Multiple glass screens hang down from the ceiling, displaying information in runes. Entering one of the kiosks, you found a set of slots and buttons. You let Dialga know that you arrived and asked him for information.

"This place allows me to conduct all forms of transactions across the dimensions. That means, I can adapt to the financial systems of the known worlds.", Dialga explained, "If you're wondering, Pokemons also have a financial system much like you humans do. We trade everything from basic foodstuffs to precious energy stones and all categories in between. Every type of Pokemon has their unique way of doing business. In your case, I have created a unique monetary system that could be used in my body. You can obtain those money by exchanging your world's currency or performing various tasks throughout my body."

"Well, what exactly are these kiosks for?", you asked.

"Each one of them correspond to a specific dimension used by Pokemons. By using each station, you can purchase or sell things to those on the other end. Personally, I think that the Steel-types have the best things while Psychics are gonna rip you off with their pricing."

You are astonished to learn that Pokemons have such complex systems in place, unbeknownst to humans. In some ways, they overlap with your world's society. That leaves you to speculate what else could Pokemons be capable of. Do they include the ability to hide a human in their bodies? Or are there abilities far above human grasp?

"So this place doubles as a bank and as a trading center.", you said.

"Precisely.", Dialga answered, "If there are no further questions, let's move on to the next stop: The Communication Venue.
1451111111111111111.title: The Banking System

14511111111111111111.content:
The last stop was literally five steps away from the room you just visited. Obviously they were adjacent organs.

Now it was more of a wide tube, instead of a chamber. It wasn't excessively long, but there was still quite a walk. It extended towards the distance, nothing being near you. You could see several things you recognized. If the place weren't made by flesh, you would have thought you were in some kind of museum.

You approach one of the closest machines. You're underwhelmed to see that it was...a typewriter. You can't say you have ever used one, they stopped being made a lot of time ago. There is a piece of paper. You started typing.

"This is a text that is supposed to work as a test but I have no idea if the test will work or if my text will show"

You tear the paper off. "Now what, Dialga? I just arrived here, and found several things"

"This is the Communication Venue. This is basically your center for any communication you may want to have with the outside world. As you can see, there are many possibilities. There is that typewriter for letters, a computer for Internet, a phone for calling, and...well, many other things that vary from dimension to dimension, but I don't think you'll use them often. You don't know anybody that isn't in your home dimension"

It seems to make sense. "So you mean that I can communicate with anyone back at home?" you ask. Dialga replies affirmatively, and adds that it all works thanks to the several steel-like shapes his body has. The scientific explanation is long and you aren't sure you understood everything, but it seems to be related to waves and signals being picked up.

There was one last question you had: "How did you get these stuff inside you? Did you create them?"

Dialga seems to hesitate. "Yes...I created them a while ago. That is it" he replies. You are almost sure that your host isn't telling the truth, but you dismiss those thoughts for the moment. Your legs are starting to ache from the walk, so you ask how many places are there left before the route ends.

"Just one more place, and it'll be perfect for you to relax. Go to the end of the tube" You walk to the end, contemplating all the machines and features of the tube. It seems something very practical. You enter the entrance, ready to see the last part of the route.
14511111111111111111.title: Communication Venue

145111111111111111111.content:
You take the passageway toward the last part of this tour, the metallic-flesh surroundings having become the familiar sight in here. A peculiar thing this time around is that the hallway leads upward in a series of stairs. The change took you by surprise. Until now, you haven't encountered a path that leads upward, leaving you more curious as to where Dialga will ultimately lead you.

At last, you reached the last flight of stair and entered another chamber. You are currently at the top floor of an atrium that consists of several decks. On each of the decks there are what looks like pools of water, each with a different color. The pools are perfect squares arrange in such fashion that would make a neat freak proud. From afar, the pools resembles a colorful mosaic. The largest of all the pool is in the center of the bottom floor. It features a glowing pattern underwater that seems like a recurring theme throughout Dialga.

"And for the last part of this tour, we have arrived at the Pool Room.", Dialga announced, "I consider this to be one of the more interesting parts if my body. Many of the waters you see here are from different dimensions with a wide variety of effects."

"Waters from different dimensions, right?", you said, "Do you know any effects that these pools might have on my body?"

"I'm not really sure about that, human. I haven't tried some of these myself yet, so you might want to avoid pools marked by a red border.", Dialga said, "From the pools that I did test, some of them increases your stamina, while others can temporarily give you psychic powers or enhance your memory."

"What about the large one down there?", you asked.

"About that one........I think you're not ready for that pool yet. The power....it's too hard to explain everything in detail to you. You will..... understand it the longer you stay with me", Dialga stuttered, "Anyway, do you want to check out the newly created Mall Corner? I got a lot of things you might like there. Let's head back down and take the capsule to get there."

You did as the Pokemon told and head for your new location but something kinda feels off about Dialga. Since you visited the Communication Venue, you have a feeling that there are a lot of things that Dialga isn't exactly forthcoming about. It leaves you to wonder what the Pokemon is up to. Sometimes, it even feels like he is monitoring your every move in his body. You can understand that he's probably doing at least some form of monitoring on you as a safeguard but hopefully Dialga isn't doing anything too intrusive.

That was close. The human almost used my Power Sharing pool which would no doubt expose my observation/surveillance of him. Definitely need to be more cautious the next time around. I can't let him become suspicious of me and leave me. This human contains so much valuable information that I could learn from.

In addition to finding that idiot Palkia for what he had done, I have found the perfect human to observe and keep me company.
145111111111111111111.title: Pools and More Pools

1451111111111111111111.content:
You enter the capsule, and look at your clock. It is almost time to go back to your room, but the thought of a mall appeals you. There must be something good in there!

The capsule takes you directly to your newlyfound destination. You look around when you arrive. The room you're in is as big as the trading room. You see the same odd structures that were used to trade, and if it weren't for the color scheme, you would have thought you were back there. You approach one of those, and examine it. You find some kind of catalog. You browse it. You don't recognize most of the things that are in the catalog. The language is unknown to you, so the only reference you have are the images themselves. You leave the catalog and go to another structure, just to find another. It is the same thing over again, an unknown catalog to you.

"Dialga, what is up with this? I don't understand a thing here!" you ask.

"This is the mall, but not only for the inside of my body. This mall will work in more than a dimension too!"

"You mean like that financial system?"

"Yes, but instead of being focused on money, this is for you to buy stuff"

"Excellent!" you say, excited, and grab a catalog again. You look at the prices. "This looks very expensive..." You don't need to look at your actual amount of money to know that you don't have enough to buy most of these things. You remember that you need to cash the money you got saved in the bank. Maybe then you'll be able to buy anything. That reminds you...

"Say, Dialga, when would you get paid?"

"Every night you'll receive a certain amount of money, and when you complete a task successfully, you'll receive more" Dialga replies. You nod. You select some of the stuff in the catalogs, planning to buy them when you got money. In a few days you should be able to buy them. You spend some time more inside the Mall, and when you have enough stuff in your wishlist, you choose to leave.

When you're about to enter the capsule, you catch a glimpse of something in a lateral entrance to the Mall. It shines, and your curiosity gets the better of you. When you approach to the entrance, you see an odd contraption. You remember what Dialga had said earlier. "When you travel around in my body, you will encounter various apparatuses or devices". Maybe this is one of those...

You promise yourself that you won't enter it, but you're too curious. "Dialga, I think I found one of those devices you had talked about. I won't try to operate it, but I can't avoid to ask...what is this for?" you ask, while approaching the apparatus
1451111111111111111111.title: The Mall Corner

14511111111111111111111.content:
You closely scrutinized every inch of the device. Like many of the contraceptions in Dialga, it is humongous. It's a massive monolith that glows a florescent silver which is something you haven't seen until now. An alcove containing a bed surrounded by glass walls. To the left of the bed, a large disc-shaped dial is embedded on the control panel with multiple settings written in an unknown language on the dial. Numerous wires and tubes goes from the side of the device to the ceiling where it leads to somewhere yet explored.

"The thing before you is a Healing Chamber.", Dialga explained, "It can be used to perform body check ups and give out medications should you ever get hurt in my body. Everything from minor cuts to life threatening injuries can be managed here."

".....are you sure you know about human stuffs?", you asked worriedly.

"If you're worried, there's really no need to. I know all there is to know about medical stuffs. You see, you'll learn tons of stuffs if you ever travel dimensions and space. And since you just got here, why don't I run a quick scan to see if you're fine?"

"That sounds nice...... I haven't actually visited a doctor in months since training Pokemons take away a lot of my time. But you better don't do anything weird with my body. If you ever did, let's just say that I can a major debacle in your body", you said.

Dialga mentally gulped and promised you that he won't do anything out of line.

Dialga instructed you to enter the glass chamber and lie down on the bed. He told you to relax and look up at the ceiling. A beam of blue light appeared from a hole on the ceiling and focusing itself on you body. You watch the ray scan your legs, arms, chest, and even your privates. Wherever the beam fell, you felt a tickling sensation of electricity. The beam slowly made its way up to your head where it shone into your eyes, and temporarily blind you. The whole process took about ten minutes to complete. Fortunately, Dialga told you that everything is normal.

Initially, you really appreciate Dialga for preparing what is basically a hospital for your use. But a question almost immediately arise in your mind.

"Ummm...I have a question: why would you make such a device when you previously told me that you wouldn't allow me to travel to parts that are too dangerous for me? If I wouldn't be injured, what's the need for it?", you asked.

Dialga seemed to pause for a few seconds as if to collect his thoughts.

"....I just made it just to be on the safe side. You never know what gonna happen. Even as a Pokemon who could see ahead of time, there are still certain things that I couldn't predict.", Dialga said.

Sounds reasonable, you thought, An unexpected fall could strain my leg and an accidental cut will need bandaging. But Dialga seems really nervous since this morning. Is there anything he haven't told me yet? Better return to the bedroom for some rest.

whew! Almost got caught again. Looks like I'm really poor at making things up. But it seems that the human is starting to have doubts about my intentions. But never mind that: I've finally installed a Mind Reader software into the humans brain. Their brains don't come with a firewall and coding are relatively simple to crack. Although the human trainer doesn't realize it, I can perfectly pick up every stray thoughts he's having. I can also see through his eyes, hear, and taste like he does. That means more research data for me and more things to probe. More "customized" things to come for the human.
14511111111111111111111.title: One of Those Devices

145111111111111111111111.content:
Dialga watches the human enter the room, and do stuff around the room until it decides to go to sleep. Dialga notices he can't see into the dreams of the human, but decides to leave him one last piece of privacy. Dialga has enough ways to recollect information. Sure, most of these would need to be tested tomorrow, but it was still a step towards a better understanding of this odd species.

Dialga could definitely see through the human's eyes, the Pokémon noticed it while the human got itself ready to sleep. Now that the guest is asleep, Dialga had time to browse all the information recollected so far.

The human seemed to be somewhat cunning, at least cunning enough to notice odd stuff inside Dialga. It was obvious the human felt Dialga had been hiding something, and it is true! I definitely have to be more careful in the future

While the human followed the tour, Dialga had asked his fellow Legendary partners for some information about humans. Most only had tidbits of information, but other Legendaries, who interacted more often with humans, sent him a lot of stuff to process. The information showed the whole species in a new light, but Dialga was more interested on the shrunken human. After all, Mew had sent Dialga one odd thing...something about a human that would earn powers beyond the species. A very interesting legend. But the human of the legend had some physical traits that the shrunken human lacked, so they couldn't be the same.

However...Dialga wondered if he could turn this human in something else, somebody that deserved the recognition of the legendaries. But of course, Dialga first wanted to determine if it was worth it. Maybe I should make this human go through some tests...or something. But how would I make it go through them?

Dialga started making plans while he observed the human. Tomorrow the guest would have an active day after work.
145111111111111111111111.title: Under Dialga's Watchful Observation

1451111111111111111111111.content:
The next day started out pretty much the same for you. You woke up early in the morning to have breakfast then head for the Central Chamber for your work routine. You expected Dialga to assign you a lot of maintenance work today but it quickly turns into a very boring day; there isn't even minor anomaly for you to fix. Much to your surprise, Dialga was also unusually silent today, only greeting you when you had breakfast. Hours was spent blankly staring at screens and graphs. No warnings, no alerts, no flashing lights....... On one hand, you are relieved that you won't be making long trips through Dialga's body, but on the other, you have absolutely nothing to do for work. It left you feel disengaged as you fixed your eyes once again on the status screen......

"Come on...come on....can time go any faster? I really hate it when things are slow. It's a good thing that everything is normal in here, but this is no fun for me! Hey....maybe I can ask Dialga to fast-forward my time. Nah, he said that it won't work in his body; something about his inside being 'time'-proof. Oh we'll, guess I have to sit this though then..."

-------
Dialga couldn't help but smile when he felt the boredom that the human was feeling. He had deliberately silenced the alarms in the Central Chamber as a little experiment to see how the trainer would respond. Dialga could see the trainer eyeing the screens through half shut eyes and see his hands randomly fidgeting about in the front. The Pokemon was more than amused at what the human was thinking. Dialga can, in fact, quicken the state of time within the confines of his body, meaning the time in his body could be distinct from that on the outside. This human is indeed very interesting and smart.

Hours later when your work is finally over, you let out an excited squeal in celebration of the end of boredom. You ran out of the Central Chamber toward the capsule with a sudden burst of energy. You seated yourself and was about to set your destination when Dialga finally broke his morning long silence.

"A pretty slow day, huh?", said Dialga, "Sorry about boring you, I'm having very few problems today. Must be quite a morning for you."

"It's okay. I still got to explore your body anyway. So what tour are we going to have today?", you asked.

"Let's say I'll keep it a secret until you get there. I have a lot of surprises to show you.", Dialga answered enigmatically.

"Okay.....playing up the mysteries today, huh?", you asked playfully.

"You can say that.", Dialga said, "I'll handle driving the capsule this time. You just sit back and relax for now."

The capsule started moving upward on its rail taking you to your new destination for the day.

You are in for some awesome stuffs, human, thought Dialga.
1451111111111111111111111.title: Third Day

14511111111111111111111111.content:
You relax, eager to start whatever Dialga got for you. Anything would be better than the boring morning you had at work. While you imagine what Dialga could have for you, the capsule suddenly stops, making you hit yourself against the wall. "What is going on?!" you yell, startled.

"Nothing, human. We have stopped. Come out"

You exit the capsule to find yourself in a very small room, with nothing inside. It seems like it exists only to receive the capsule. "So, why am I here?" you ask

Dialga seems to hesitate a little before replying. "I have decided to watch over your well-being while you're inside me, and I want to make you even better" That should be good enough

You ask how Dialga plans to do that. "It is easy. If you look around, you'll see four paths. At the end of each one, there will be a test to see how you dominate them, and what flaws you may have. Each part will be done in a different part of my body, so you'll be visiting new places too.

The one in front of you will take you to an strength test, which is lifting a series of increasingly heavier objects I'll provide. To your left there is an obstacle course, to measure your agility. The one that goes into the floor will be an endurance test, to see how you fare in bad conditions or an unlikable environment. And the tunnel to your right is a speed test, which is a race.

You're free to choose the order you'll do it. Please tell me it so we can start"

You take the information and think carefully about it. You're confident of your abilities, and have no doubts you'll pass every test Dialga has, doing better than he expected. You start walking towards the first test you'll take.

"What will be the order, human?"

You reply while you walk to the...
14511111111111111111111111.title: Dialga's Test

145111111111111111111111111.content:
"Alright, Dialga. I guess I'll take the left passage to the obstacle course. Haven't tried one of those in a very long time", you said.

"Excellent.", Dialga exclaimed, "I'll have the place ready by the time you get there. But I have to warn you, it isn't as easy as it seems. The things I've set up is designed to push you to your limits, to strengthen your stamina, and to improve your intuition. So you better be prepared for what's coming up, human. If you think you are up to the challenge, you can proceed to your first test."

"I'm on it. A trainer does not refuse a challenge when offered one.", you said confidently. You take the tunnel to your left and head for the obstacle course.

"Good to see that determination you got there, human....."

The passage is a featureless steel corridor with glowing stripes running horizontally on the wall. Along the way, a question suddenly struck you. It's has been lingering for some times already, but it's just slowly coming into realization now: Dialga seems to be preparing you for something. You decided to investigate this a little further, careful not to directly state your concern.

"So, why are you suddenly so concerned about improving my wellbeing, Dialga?", you asked curiously, "Are you sensing that I'm going out of shape or something?"

"Umm....I figured that it must be really boring for you to be stuck in the metallic confine of my body with nothing stimulating to do. So I decided that such activities might be the thing that'll keep you upbeat while the search for Palkia continues.", Dialga said in a hesitant and awkward manner.

"But didn't you just showed me an exercise room yesterday?", you pointed out, "That looks good enough to keep me busy. Are there any other purposes for these tests that you aren't telling me?"

At this point, Dialga's heart skipped several beats. Sweats formed on his steel body as he felt himself heat up. The Pokemon sensed every warning siren in the Central Chamber started blaring and every screen started displaying jumbled error messages. He started feeling light headed. This human is a scrutinizer, Dialga thought, far sharper than I imagine he would be. I have to make up a convincing explanation.... and quick!

"Of course not!", Dialga quickly denied, "It's just some random thoughts I had. I thought that you might be interested in some form of tests. By the way, you're almost at your destination."

"Ok...", you said.

Something tells me that Dialga is only telling me half truths. The Pokemon is definitely up to something. But what is it? There isn't anything that the Pokemon could gain from me. Unless the Pokemon wants to keep me as some sort of pet, nothing seems out of the ordinary so far. Dialga didn't seem to have any malicious intent, so you decide to just leave it aside for the time being. Until then, I guess I should be a little more careful next time.

By the time Dialga had finished his sentence, you've entered a large room that is several hundred feet long that is filled with all sort of imaginable obstacles. It looks like a track field, only 20 times bigger. The chrome steel chamber contains rocky terrains, steep slopes, deep waterway, fire-infested rooms, sharp meshes, narrow crawl ways, spinning platforms and many more.

"Welcome to the Obstacle Course.", Dialga said, "Ready to hear my instructions?"


This human has a very keen sense. A cery curious one. He's already on the brink of picking up on my intentions now. Although the human seems satisfied with my answer at the moment, I can still feel his suspicion beneath that veil of calmness and smile. I have to find some distractions, something to mislead and quell his suspicions. And I know exactly what to do. Initiating Human POV.....
145111111111111111111111111.title: Left or Right

1451111111111111111111111111.content:
You look to all the obstacles you can see from your actual point. How will you be able to pass all this stuff? Even some parts look dangerous. You feel lightheaded, but you suppose it is due to the nervousness. On a side you can see a high platform, which must be the starting point. You start to ascend to it, getting ready to take the challenge.

"Done, Human POV is working". Dialga now can see what the human sees, hear what the human hears, etc, along with a few functions that may be useful. "This won't be playing clean, but it should distract him" Dialga has very limited controlling of the human now, along with an outline of the human's actual thoughts. As he feared, a lot of them were suspicion of the Pokémon not telling the truth.

You stood on the platform, and waited. After a few minutes of nothing happening, you inquire what is going on "I thought you were going to tell me when to start!" Dialga apologizes, then gives you the signal to start. You quickly jump to the catwalk in front of you, and try to maintain your balance while you walk through it. At the end there is some sort of rocky slope, you feel like it'll be hard to climb.

When you get to the slope, suddenly you feel assaulted by a random thought of food. You push that aside, but more random thoughts come in quick succession during the obstacle course. Your life, your bed, the pain you're feeling from the fall you just had on that spinning platform.

Dialga keeps inserting thoughts, in a hope of making the human forget its suspicions. It seems to be working, as he seems them disappear. When they're completely gone, Dialga turns off the POV, satisfied with his actions

While you're swimming through a deep pool, you feel your mind getting lighter. You're finally able to focus on the obstacle course itself. You're in about half of it, and you spent it wondering why you were thinking about the color of the sky. After you focus on the challenge, you feel everything is easier. You crawl under thick wooden planks, run through a shaking platform, and jump over countless pits, until you reach the goal. You're exhausted. "How...How did I do, Dialga?"

"Eeeh...fifteen minutes. Average. Not a good start, in my opinion" He would have done better if I hadn't meddled with his mind, so I'll concede some points. "Now rest, human. You have fifteen minutes to rest before the next one. Now you'll see several bottles of the best water there is. Enjoy.

You pick one of the bottles and drink its content, while you look at the pathways to the other three tests. You're tired, so you consider taking one that doesn't require getting too tired. After some consideration, you think the endurance test will be good enough. You don't know if it was the right choice. You notify Dialga about your decision. "You should take some water bottles with you. You'll need them" your host tells you.

You take some, and after you feel with enough energy, you walk through the entrance. The path keeps going down, like stairs, until you reach a thick muscle blocking your way. You touch it, and enter a wide tunnel. The environment is hot and humid, and in just minutes, you feel you're starting to sweat. The air feels somewhat stale too, but you don't mind. "There is certainly a lot of space in here. Now, what do I have to do in the endurance test, Dialga?"

"As I said, it is time to see how much stamina you have against harsh conditions. You're now in the start of my large intestine. Behind you you should see the entrance to my small intestine, just so you know it is the truth". And yes, behind you, you can see a huge closed sphincter.

"Now you'll trek through the large intestine. Obviously the further you walk, the harder it'll be for you to continue, due to many factors you'll discover in the test. As this is to measure endurance, you're free to stop anytime, just notify me and I'll get you out of there. The endurance test only ends when you decide to stop, or if you reach the end of the path. Do you understand all?"

You reply that everything is clear "After you're done with this test, you can rest for an hour. Now, go!" you hear him. After your average performance in the obstacle test, you really want to impress Dialga now. You just hope you're able to at least be better at this than the obstacle course.
1451111111111111111111111111.title: Dialga's Obstacle Training

14511111111111111111111111111.content:
If you though that the Obstacle Course was hard, the Endurance Test took it to the next level. After a mere hundred feet, your shirt is completely drenched in sweat. The walls are dripping with condensations of water; their occasional echoes breaking the silence in this lonely part of Dialga. Unknown remains of food sticks to the walls, slowly being absorbed into them without leaving anything behind. Puddles are strewn throughout the bumpy iron floor, either making you slip or getting your pants wet knee deep. Dialga isn't bluffing about how difficult the ordeal will be. And since you accepted his test, there is no giving up now. I have to impress him this time, you thought, I'm not going to let some of my weaknesses jeopardize Dialga's opinion of me, especially an experienced Pokemon trainer.

As you walk deeper into the intestine, the humid environment coupled with the familiar yet foreign odor of antiseptic creates a nauseating sensation that threatens to get you off course. And the stale air isn't helping at all. Despite these problems, you continued through the large intestine.

So far, the human seems to be holding up quite well. I kinda admire him for that. I have to create more challenges up ahead. At this rate, it is increasingly likely for the human to be the one from our legends. If he's really holds up to this one, I'll have to reward him somehow. But for now, things are gonna get a little extreme down there....


Up to this point, the conditions in the intestines is still bearable for you; although twisting and twirling a lot, you managed to walk half it without much incident. Suddenly, a rumbling sound emanates throughout the entire structure of the intestines. That's strange, you thought, this doesn't You turned your head back just in time to see a large torrent of liquid heading your way. Before you even sprinted, you are swept off your feet by the sheer strength of the current. Your body spins and churned in the liquid which tastes of metal from the accidental gulps you took. In an attempt to surface, you frantically swam in whatever direction you think is the way up. On the first try, you hit the floor with a large bump and slammed into a wall on the second one.

On the third try, you finally surfaced almost out of breath. You panted loudly for several minutes while allowing the flow to carry you. That was a close one, you thought.....

After drifting for some times, you called out to Dialga about how you performed on this test.

"I must say that it's impressive on the first attempt, human. Your endurance are up to my expectation. But there is still room for improvements. That last part overwhelmed you rather quickly and in regard to that, I will test you harder on that aspect."

You have mixed feeling about Dialga's assessment. Dialga is impressed with your ability but he still sees some flaws that require more training. Though you're happy with the results, it isn't enough yet. You make mental notes that you will focus on the next challenge.

"You will arrive at the end of my intestine in a minute or two. And you may take a one hour break and get yourself freshen up.", Dialga said, "From there, you can choose the third test you want to take."


The human has completely devoted his thoughts toward the tests. It's good in two ways: first, the human had forgotten about his suspicion about my intentions. Second, I'm one step closer to making him into the Wielder of the Legendaries from the myth. And of course, he'll always be my human....
14511111111111111111111111111.title: The Endurance Test

145111111111111111111111111111.content:
You sigh mentally, to avoid accidentally drinking more of that liquid. Instead, you choose to relax, waiting for the liquid to carry you. You don't notice that the amount of liquid has decreased by the second, surely due to the natural function of the place you're in. By the time you notice it, you're starting to touch the ground with you feet. You just hope that the end is close, as you seriously don't feel like walking more.

And, much to your relief, the wave had carried you far enough to arrive by foot in less than a minute. After one turn, you feel the environment feels fresher and cooler. In the distance, you see what only can be the large anus of your host. You chalk the change of temperature to how close the rectum is to the outside world or some other similar explanation, and quickly forget about it. You approach the most you can, and sit against one of the walls. Taking one of the water bottles you took with you, you decide to take a short nap.

When you wake up you feel energetic again. You stretch, look at your clock, and notice you have around twenty minutes left before you continue. Without not much to do, you decide to try to start a conversation with Dialga.

"Soooooo...how is the search for Palkia going, Dialga?"

"Not so well. But I'm kinda sure that I'm in the same dimension he is. Only time will tell"

You almost laugh at those words. You're sure Dialga said the last four as a joke. "And when you find him, what will you tell him?"

"Besides one very needed speech about being careful with his powers? Not much. I expect him to apologize for all the trouble he caused to you, though. Not that there is a big chance of it, but it would be good to ask him"

"What about this other dragon...what was its name..."

"Giratina? We don't talk to Giratina often...normally we only do it when there is a serious emergency. Last time I talked with that Legendary was around thirty years ago. If Palkia refuses to do something to help you then I'll contact Giratina to force Palkia to do it"

You realize you're curious about Dialga's past. You wonder what this Legendary did before encountering you. You place a reminder to yourself to ask him in other moment. Meanwhile you talk about various other stuff, until you realize that the twenty minutes are gone. You stand up, and you tell Dialga that you're ready for the third test.

"For the third one...uh..." Strength isn't your best quality, so you want to delay that test. "The Speed test will be good. It was a race, wasn't it?"

"More like a time trial. Who would you race against? I'll set an amount of time for you to complete the track, the amount of time I think it would take me to complete it if I were in your situation"

You nod. Sounds like another chance to impress Dialga. "Let's do it"

"Now you need to get to the start point. This'll be a surprise for you: You'll be racing on my back!"

This certainly takes you by surprise. "What do you mean?"

"I mean that you'll come outside, and take your position on my lower back. Then you'll start running until you arrive to my neck. I had made it long as I thought it would be a good ending for the day, but looks like you decided to do it as your third test"

These words don't help to make you feel like you picked the best option, but it is too late to change your choice.

"When you're ready, come out. You're right near the closest exit available" You don't like very much the idea of coming out of your host through the least dignified path possible, but you feel that asking for an easier option would not make you look strong. You sigh and walk towards the anus.
145111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Test

1451111111111111111111111111111.content:
You step in front of the anus which is one of the few parts that resembles flesh in Dialga. It is currently tightly sealed without any distinctive mechanism to open it. The idea of going through this part of the body is repulsive and completely beyond what is acceptable. Although the metallic liquid was disgusting, you're quietly thankful that you didn't encounter any solid wastes. Maybe Dialga did this as the last part of my endurance test. If that's the case, he really knows how to test my limits.

You unwillingly touched the wall next to the hole and saw the anus loosens. The opening is large enough for you to crawl through and you quickly did so without hesitation. Once you made it outside, you are greeted by Dialga's tail. At the side of the exit, you located a series of recesses with which you can climb onto Dialga's back. Once you got on the back, you encountered the wall of spikes that sits on the Pokemon's back. You also noticed that you are no longer in the same place where Dialga found you. The world around you is distorted and colorful with seemingly contradictory landforms; a mountain that's made from water, a sky that is a bright pink, rivers that seems to flow skyward, and a night sky filled with stars that acts as the ground. The wind constantly blows against you, causing a sparkling blue aura to trail behind you. When you attempt to grab at the aura, it immediately dissipate. Not even 'surreal' is enough to convey the full meaning of this place.

"We are now somewhere between the 11th and 12th dimension of existence.", Dialga explained, "This place may seem foreign to you but it's kind of like home to me. While you most likely only been to the 3rd and to a very limited extent, the 4th, I have travel through hundreds of such universe. Each of them is unique with self-contained laws of physics. If we ever had the chance, you really need to see the 22th dimension; that place is beyond beautiful. Delving into further details would likely overwhelm your mind, so I'll just leave it there."

You are already confused even by Dialga's "simplistic" explanation. It might be a little less confusing if you had some knowledge of time-space stuffs; you have the feeling that if Dialga were to fully explain that dynamic, he would be speaking another language beyond human scope. But you couldn't help but wonder what kind of places you'll visit with Dialga that no one else would ever had the chance to experience.

"Anyway, the place you're standing on would be the starting point of the race. First, you'll have to scale the spikes on my back, then you'll run all the way to the finish line which is halfway up my neck. The time limit would be 15 minutes; once you step out of the start line, the counter will start. Are you ready?", Dialga said.

"Yes. Bring on the challenge, Dialga.", you answered confidently.

"Then get set.......Start!"

You quickly run toward the spikes, scaling them with your hands. The surface is hard and sharp which causes a few minor scratches here and there. In the distance, you can see Dialga's head looking in your direction, enjoying the race from high above. A total of 8 minutes is spent on ascending and descending the mountains the spikes along. You pretty much used up half of your energy doing that. But, nevertheless, you keep on running toward the neck. The run along Dialga's back isn't any easier; it's a path filled with bumps and pockmarks which caused you to trip once or twice.

By the time you arrived at the finish line on the neck. You almost collapse from the rapid beating of your heart. If you were to go any further, you are sure that your body will disintegrate. You spent several minutes on you back panting and staring blankly at the pink sky above you. You haven't done something the intense before.

"Excellent! You made to the finish line with 5 seconds to spare.", Dialga said enthusiastically.

"Great......how....did I.....perform?...", you said, still trying to catch your breath.

"Better than I expected. You deserve a well-earned rest. Come now, I'll take you to a new place within my body. Head for the opening in my ear.....there is something I want you to see."

I can't believe it. He really ran all the way. I can feel that determination, that desire, that striving to be stronger within his mind. Now I'm sure that the human possesses traits that matches those of the legend. For now, I'll keep a closer eye on him.....
1451111111111111111111111111111.title: The Speed Test

14511111111111111111111111111111.content:
You start to climb all the way on Dialga's neck, until you reach the head. You avoid looking down, as you feel you would get vertigo. Pushing those thoughts aside, you look for Dialga's ear canal. You have a difficult time finding it, as they're small and almost hidden, but soon you manage to find a crevice that can only be it. You manage to get inside the narrow tunnel, and start going. You wonder what exactly is here that Dialga wants to show you. Can you interpret it as a reward for your performance in the Speed test? Maybe.

Your thoughts are interrupted when you unwittingly bump into a silky object. After stepping back, you realize that it isn't anything other than Diagla's eardrum. After examining the membrane for some minutes, you wonder if this is what Dialga wanted to show you. Doesn't look like something worth the whole trip up here.

"So, now what?"

"You should see an opening on a side of the tunnel. Take it"

Looking around, you do see one pathway. Leaving the auditory canal, you start going upwards. It keeps going up, and soon you start to think that Dialga is guiding you up to his brain. He had said you weren't allowed to go, but he was the one to tell you to come. You reach the end of the passageway.

You're now in a dome-like room, with one wide screen at the front. In the screen you can see more of that dimension Dialga is visiting. You approach it, and soon notice one tiny control board, along with a chair. This reminds you a lot of your control room, the one that every morning you have to watch.

"This is what I call "The Cockpit". Basically a feature that would allow somebody inside me to have temporary control of my body. Why don't you try?"

You grab the main control. "I didn't know this could even be possible!"

"Almost all Pokémon have some sort of control terminal inside them. But it is very uncommon to be used. After all, it isn't like all Pokémon will find a shrunken creature. Now, have fun. You have half an hour to lead me around. Who knows, maybe you'll find Palkia"

You start moving the control, and find out you're making Dialga turn in different directions. Soon you manage to move the body forwards, towards one of the rivers. You don't think Dialga knows to swim, so you change directions. Soon you find ways to make Dialga run and explore faster.

The dimension is certainly something you never thought you would see. Something tells you that you may be the only human ever to see it. You even forget about Palkia, and instead focus on exploring around. You don't want to waste the chance.

When Dialga tells you that time is up, you feel that you spent hours exploring around. If this is one dimension, you really hope to see others!

"Thank you Dialga, this was amazing" you say. You feel your host would appreciate your opinion.

"To make your mornings more pleasant, I have installed a screen so you can see the dimensions I explore. Maybe it can help you to be less bored"

That certainly sounds like a great decision. You once again thank Dialga, and remind him there is one test left. Dialga directs you out of the cockpit, but tells you to stop to one nearby room.

"The Strength test is fairly simple. I'll provide you with different objects, substances and other stuff, and you'll be lifting them. We'll start with the lightest I have and/or produce, and if you manage to lift it, we'll continue with the next. This'll only stop when you can't lift what I provide you. Got it?"

You nod. "After this, you can go rest to your room. Tomorrow I'll tell you my opinion about your overall performance"

After those words, Dialga stops talking, and several things materialize in front of you.
14511111111111111111111111111111.title: The Cockpit

145111111111111111111111111111111.content:
In front of you, there are several dumbbells and iron balls that ranges from the size of a handheld flashlight to that of a large box. The only indications that they were made by Dialga are the cubist design and the navy blue coloration of the weight. In addition to those, there are also several large blocks of steel neatly stacked on one corner of the chamber. The objective was simply to lift and carry those blocks across the room.

Here goes nothing, you thought. You immediately start your final test, eager to finish the test and take a much needed sleep. The day had been very active and you're completely exhausted by all the tasks. Dialga can be very demanding at times. By the way he pushes you, the Pokemon better give you a good assessment report tomorrow. But still, what are all these tests about? Dialga seems to be dodging that question since this morning. All this time you're in his body Dialga is preparing you for something, but what is it? You can't quite place it; every time you try to think carefully about that question, your mind just simply goes blank. It is as if something is blocking your mind and redirecting it somewhere else. You suddenly spaced out again and forget about everything you thought. When your conscious returned, you only remember that you have to complete the task Dialga gave you. You shrugged and started the Strength Test, which hopefully will be simple.

The first several dumbbells are the easiest; you lifted them without straining any of your muscles. The dumbbells got progressively heavier until you reached 120kg which you are barely able to get off the ground.

You went on to the metal blocks and began moving them across the room at a fast speed. Each of them weigh at least 60kg. Halfway through, you felt the pain in your arms began to intensify. At that moment, you are about to give up and call it a day. But then, you don't want to let Dialga down or create a poor impression of human strengths which can affect future relationship with Legendary Pokemons. Ignoring the pain throughout your body, you put up your best effort and moved the blocks at a faster rate and finished the assignment in 2 minutes. You lie down and groaned so loud that the voice echoed throughout Dialga's head.
