"Good job, human. You finished all the test I've set for you. I think that it's courageous of you to accept each of the test without question. And for that, I will give you a fair assessment first thing tomorrow morning.", Dialga said, "Now, return to your room and enjoy your sleep. By the way, you might wanna lower the volume next time you're near my brain; migraines in Pokemon aren't exactly light."

Seeing that you completed the Strength Test, you returned to the capsule and rode back to your room without much thoughts. You entered your room and fell on your bed fall asleep within minutes. Dialga better give you a day off for this, you thought.


His suspicion kept coming back. No matter what I do, he'll eventually start thinking about my motive again. It's getting really difficult to defend this. I was left with little choice but to alter that part of his memory. It's for his own good; he can't know too much about my abilities. He won't be able to handle that information. Now, I have to ask Mew and the others again on how I can further observe this human. Despite his shortcomings, he is one with great potentials. Perhaps, when he's stronger, he'll be able to handle the facts about my full power a little better.

By the way, he looks adorable when he's asleep.....
145111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Strength Test

choices: Dialga decides to tell the truth
Dialga decides to keep the secret
1451111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The next morning seemed like the rest. The third or fourth day of your temporal residence inside Dialga.

You got ready, did your newlyfound morning routine, and got to work. You saw a new screen, which later you found out would let you see what Dialga sees. Surely an attempt to keep you more entertained, if there is nothing else for you to do.

"So, will you stay in this dimension?"

"Yes. I think Palkia is around, but I don't think I'll find him...this dimension is huge"

"Oh, what about the results from yesterday's tests? You said you would tell me today"

Dialga felt proud of giving you the scores. "You did excellently, human. There is room for improvement, but you could be destined for great things, even greater than you think. But you had a performance that went beyond my expectations"

You were relieved to hear that. At first you had thought that you could have disappointed Dialga, but you were sure his words were sincere. But despite that, you still were a shrunken human inside a Legendary Pokémon, and it didn't look like it would change soon.

You didn't mind very much, as long as you could at least watch something that no other human would ever see. The wonders of the other dimensions were one of the best things you had seen. You doubted there would be something more amazing than that.

At least until what you wanted the most happened, and what Dialga wanted the least happened.

"Look who is here! What a coincidence to see you around, Dialga!"

Dialga turned around, and felt shocked to see Palkia. He really hadn't expected to actually find Palkia so fast. "Aren't you going to at least greet me?" Palkia said. Dialga was at loss of words, but you were ecstatic.

"You found him! Thank you Dialga!"

This made Dialga grow uneasy. "Why aren't you saying anything. Is there something wrong?" Palkia asked with clear concern. Meanwhile, you waited for Dialga to give you a passage out or something, or at least to tell Palkia about you. Minutes passed, and Dialga started to sweat a lot, the alarms in your control room started to sound, it seemed that Dialga was overheating. You ignored those alarms.

Soon you started growing...frustrated. Why wasn't Dialga saying a thing?

"Dialga, please, it is the chance for me to grow back to normal!" you yell.

"Okay, now what is wrong with you? I'm not leaving nor letting you leave until you tell me what is going on" Palkia said, making sure to hint it was very serious.

"I...I..."Dialga stammered. He really didn't expect to be in such situation.

Should...should I tell the truth to both? Should I really say what is all of this? I really want to turn this human into something bigger, but how...how can I lie to both and get away with it?
1451111111111111111111111111111111.title: Morning

14511111111111111111111111111111112.content:
Things have never been so difficult for Dialga. If he were to tell the truth to the human, it could very well end their friendship and the possibility of improving him would he gone. But if he didn't say something, how can Palkia know what he had done? Dialga made a hard decision that would be unpopular on the human's end. Before the Pokemon spoke again, he caused time within his body to stop, freezing the human trainer in his track; making anything happening outside unknown to him.

"*sigh* Palkia.....there is something that I need to talk to you about.", Dialga finally said, "....Remember few days ago when you are randomly showing off your power to me, telling me how you finally master the technique of transporting foods and stuffs to me in larger quantities?"

Palkia silently nodded in recognition.

"You just transported a human to our dimension.", Dialga straightforwardly said.

"Uh, what? A human? Wait, have I made a mistake again?", Palikia asked.

"Yes, you teleported a human here, a Pokemon trainer to be exact.", Dialga bluntly replied, "Humans reside in the 3rd dimension and are an advanced civilization with some knowledge about time and space. That is if you ever paid attention to all those trips we've had. We've been there numerous times in the past, remember? Anyway, I found the human shrunken at the stone pedestal and he has no idea as to how he got here. He only described a bright flash in the forest he's exploring before finding himself here. And I have reasons to believe that you may have inadvertently caused this......"

Dialga looked at Palkia sternly, causing the Pokemon to flinch slightly at the glare.

"I've constantly warned you against using you own powers excessively for your own purpose; treating it as some kind of plaything, but you just wouldn't listen. Last time, I have to help you fix up the debacle you caused when you moved the entirety of Dandelion Island to your personal dimension because you wanted to explore it all on your own. It took me nearly all of my power to set things straight again. Reversing time, making sure that all of the rifts are fixed, and creating more myths to explain the phenomenon."

"There is no need to talk about that again. I thought we resolved that already. If I accidentally got the human here, I'll just enlarge him and send him back.", Palkia defended.

"It's no longer that simple now, Palkia. He is something far greater than a mere human and I could see it in him.", Dialga said deliberately being ambiguous.

".......so how's the human right now?", Palkia asked awkwardly, "Did you do anything with it yet?"

"The human is currently living in me. I stopped the floow of time in there so he can't hear our conversations.",

"You allowed the human to live in you?", Palkia exclaimed.

"Yes, what else could I do? I can't leave him to drift in the dimensions.", Dialga answered.

"So what should we do now?"

"Once I restart time for the trainer, I'll let him outside for you to see. You just have to talk as if you saw him for the first time. Then we'll decide our next steps. Hopefully, we won't get Giratina involved in this."

"True. Now I really want to see the human I teleported.", Palkia said, his voice filled with curiosity.
14511111111111111111111111111111112.title: Dialga decides to keep the secret

145111111111111111111111111111111121.content:
Dialga made time flow again inside his body. You didn't notice that your host had even stopped it. At first you could notice that Palkia had shifted his position, but you didn't pay attention to it. "Human, could you please come to my mouth? You'll have to talk with Palkia directly"

You replied saying you would, and got off your chair. Dialga opened a direct passageway, and you entered it, excited. This happened much quicker than you had thought it would be! This must be your lucky day.

Soon you arrived to Dialga's throat, and while you walked over the Pokémon's tongue, you saw it was opening, letting you see what was outside. Effectively, outside another colossal dragon stood.

Palkia, despite being smaller than Dialga, was still an imposing creature. You couldn't avoid feeling intimidated by him. If you didn't know that this dragon could return you to normal, and didn't have Dialga protecting you, you would be very afraid.

"A human? What is a human doing inside you?" Palkia asked. Dialga, unable to talk with you on his tongue, stood in silence. You took this as your cue to start explaining your situation.

Palkia listened carefully, while you expressed what you wanted, and how Dialga had given you a safe place inside his body. You purposefully didn't mention the stuff about the tests, as you didn't think it was needed. At the end of your tale, Palkia nodded.

"So that is how it all happened. Yeah, it is my fault. Sorry about that, human" Palkia says, looking at you as close as possible. "No big deal, but could you please return me to normal?" you ask

You didn't notice Dialga's begging expression, but Palkia did see it. After thinking for a few seconds, Palkia said as inexpressively as possible. "I'm afraid I'm not sure how to do it, human"

You're aghast at those words. "What?! But...the same way you shrunk me!"

"I didn't do it on purpose. It was a collateral effect of the misuse of my powers"

Your disappointment must have been obvious, because Palkia stammered and added "But I'll find a way to do it! I'll hone my abilities and come back when I'm sure to do it right. Meanwhile, you should live inside Dialga, if he doesn't mind" Dialga made some odd sounds that you interpreted as agreeing with Palkia's words.

"Okay, thank you Palkia" you said. Dialga closed his mouth, and you stayed on his tongue, disappointed. Looks like you'll be in there for longer.

In that moment, Dialga stopped time once again inside him. "Thank you Palkia...I really am thankful" he said

Palkia was unsure of what to say, but finally gathered some words. "I'm not sure what you see in the human, but I trust your judgment. What have you done to test him?" Dialga tells Palkia all about the tests. "I think the next step is to check other qualities" Palkia said "Physically, he seems okay. But does he have the qualities of what you're looking for? Courage is the first one that comes to my mind"

"What do you suggest?" Dialga asked

"I think that today you should create some sort of...danger. Make the human think it is in danger. Or even better! Make him think that you are in danger. Then see if he reacts. If he is brave and actually cares for other beings, then he should help you, even if it means doing something that it won't like, or something that can be bad for it"

Dialga nodded, already thinking what he could do.

"Good luck, Dialga. If you need help with the human, or just want me to return him to normal, just notify me. I'll find a way to keep us in contact"

Then Palkia left. Dialga thought for a while, trying to think of a danger situation the human could "avoid" to save him. I could make a red alert inside me. Something that looks life-threatening, either for him or for me. But what?

While the Pokémon thought about it, he once again made time be normal inside him.

You sighed, and looked at the back of the mouth. It was time once again to return to the depths inside Dialga. "Dialga, can I stop working early today? I would like to...be by myself, for a while" you said. Dialga replied that it was okay. You started walking back to the throat
145111111111111111111111111111111121.title: Palkia and the Human

1451111111111111111111111111111111211.content:
You didn't hesitate to jump down Dialga's throat, knowing that the Pokemon would catch you like the first time. After landing in the stomach, you traveled to the Central Chamber to start your work. The job just become a lot duller; not only is there a serious lack of problems, the enthusiasm you had for the work was gone. The screens now felt more like a featureless wall, the metallic controls felt a lot colder. A numbness spreads in your body as long-restrained emotions started surfacing from the confines of your mind.

You feel your optimism fell down several notches; Palkia is unable to fix your problem right away. Though he promised to have it fixed as soon as possible, the news was a hit to your personal morale. I'll be shrunken longer than I wanted to, you thought sadly.

You finished work 3 hours earlier than usual with permission from Dialga. The first place you went to is your room. The television screen still shows the colorful dimension outside. Dialga has resumed his traveling. The scene just reminded you further about how your life used to be. You quickly locked the door,shut down all forms of communications in the room, and fell down on your bed. Tears formed on your eyes as you cried for the first time in a while. As interesting as Dialga's body may be, you really missed life outside the Pokemon. You missed the training with your Pokemons, the endless traveling around the world, the challenges, and most of all....interaction. Dialga can speak and talk with you like any human.....but something is still amiss.The longer you think about it, you realized: the Pokemon's labyrinthine insides just turned into the loneliest place you've ever been to.

Meanwhile, your plight hasn't gone unnoticed to Dialga; he has been watching and feeling your emotions the whole time. Dialga looked on as he feel his brain being assaulted by mountains of thoughts and memories from the human. The Pokemon viewed everything from the people that the human had met, the various ups and downs of his life so far, the hardships that he had endured to reach the Pokemon League, and his unwavering love for Pokemons. The more he viewed them, the sadder Dialga become. He didn't realize how much of an impact the shrinking had done.

Within an hour, the human had cries himself to sleep and Dialga deeply pondering about his actions and plan.

I never expected things to end up like this. It wasn't supposed to head in this direction. I wanted to return you to your normal life as soon as possible, but there are forces out there that are preventing it. I know that the arrangement isn't the best of things right now, but there is nothing else I could do.

You wanted things to be normal...but it is actually I who wanted to understand what "normalcy" encompass.

How I wish I could forget about my abilities and live a life like a human; free from burdensome responsibilities like balancing the forces of time and the likes. I wanted to know what being a Pokemon trainer is, the nature of relationships, experience the unpredictability of events, the list is endless. How I wish to be you, human! But that I could only dream of. I'm a Temporal Pokemon who only exists for the existence itself.

Things under my watch isn't simply guarding time and space; there is also a hidden side to it:



I can see the future......your future....
1451111111111111111111111111111111211.title: Continue

14511111111111111111111111111111112111.content:
After two hours, the human looked like it was sleeping peacefully, but Dialga had the feeling that it was very likely that his guest was having troubled dreams. Out of curiosity, and kinda hoping to see something that could indicate more about the human's emotional state, Dialga opened his Human POV again.

At first it was black, since the human was asleep, but after a few changes in the configuration of the mind reader hack Dialga had installed, the Pokémon managed to see the images of the dream.

The human was walking along with its team. The place was the dimension he had seen today, but nor the human nor the Pokémon seemed to pay attention to the surroundings. It was like they all were familiar with it. The human seemed optimist, and the team had a healthy aura of happiness and trust.

It was almost heartwarming to see the dream look so peaceful, but Dialga knew that, sooner or later, the subconscious would start distorting the dream to show the human's inner struggles. After a while, one of the Pokémon in the team disappeared. Nobody looked where the Pokémon had been, all of them continued forward, but the human seemed to be less cheerful, and the team less united.

Every once in a while, more Pokémon would be gone, and the human would look gloomier every time. The surroundings of the dream had started changing too. The surreal dimension started turning more stone-like, and the sky darker, until it all started resembling Dialga's own dimension.

The human soon was walking alone, through Dialga's dimension. Sometimes, the silhouette of one of the Pokémon would appear momentarily, but the human didn't seem to notice. Soon, it stopped. In front of the human, there was a huge shadow. Dialga was looking at a strange image of himself, the Dialga in the dream seemd corrupted and almost gray.

The human and the dream legendary Pokémon seemed to talk, but no sound was made. After that, the Dialga in the dream welcomed the human into his body. The last image the real Dialga saw in the dream was the human, looking resigned, as if he had been sentenced to life in some sort of jail.

Not wanting to watch more, Dialga stopped. This was enough for him. It was obvious that the recent happenings really had dampened his guest's attitude. If he wanted to turn the human into something greater, then he needed to help the human first. It was very likely that a depressed human wouldn't even want to cooperate, whether he knew or not.

I'll postpone the courage test. First...first I need to cheer him up. Tomorrow I'll show him that, despite being shrunk, he can have a good time.
14511111111111111111111111111111112111.title: Within the Human's Dream

145111111111111111111111111111111121111.content:
By the time you woke up, it's already 10 in the morning, a lot later than you normally wake up. It took a full minute for you to realize that you're back in your room. You haven't slept well. That dream is just too vivid; the disappearing Pokemon, that dark Dialga, you thought that you were gone for good. The feeling of loneliness, gloominess, and despair revealed itself in full force in your nightmare. Though you are back in the real world, you remained shaken by the dream......

The Dialga from the dream appeared as a gray and sinister version of the one you're familiar with. He told you that he intended to capture you from the very beginning. Everything from the shrinking to the whole search for Palkia was just a ruse to lower your guard. The gray Dialga went on to tell you how he would like you to be in him forever as his personal servant. The most horrifying detail that he said to you was that he will keep you alive for eternity and make you watch the world change before your eyes. Nothing will ever spare you from this prison. If he thinks that you're dissenting, you will be subject to punishments that goes beyond the cosmic and dimensions.Then the evil Dialga gave a very chilling speech that still haunts your thought: 'Now, we can be together, foreeeeverrr. Aren't you happy about it, my human? You are the first to ever have the honor of serving me. You will get to maintain me, work for me, and pleasure me for as long as time exists. I'll make sure you get the most out of it and if you dislike it, too bad because I'm. your. Eternal. Master...... and an insignificant human like you will OBEY!!!!'

You felt tears rolling down your face again. It's just too real.... Did.... did Dialga really want to keep me in here forever? Will I be forced to serve him like in the dream? Will I ever return to normal?

You shook off the last of your sleepiness and got off your bed. You are much calmer than you are yesterday but you still have no intention of talking with either Dialga or Palkia, at least for now.

You exited from your room, ate your breakfast and just wandered randomly around Dialga's body in an attempt to just get away from all your problems for a moment.

Your thoughts haven't gone undetected. Dialga was also on the verge of tears when he saw how the human recalled his dream. He is in no way like that nor has he ever thought about enslaving the trainer. It hurts Dialga to see himself twisted into something that bears more resemblance to chaotic entity than a righteous keeper of time. But getting the human happy will take some times.


This is my chance to make the human happy again. I'll just have to do it in a more discreet manner. No announcement or explanation. Just surprises. But how can I possibly do it? Creating things that reminds him of his life isn't the brightest choice now. There must be something original that I could do. I cannot allow the human to feel sad again....not after that horrible nightmare.

But for now, there is a friend I need to cheer up.


Dialga started rearranging the routes within his body to lead the human to his destination. 'I have an idea: if the human can't talk with his old friends, why don't I introduce him to some of mine?'
145111111111111111111111111111111121111.title: The Next Morning

choices: You reply you do want more
You decide it is enough for now
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You walk, not paying attention where you're going. Anywhere sounds good enough for you, you just want some time to think. However, looks like your luck has dictated that you won't be able to be alone. You stumble upon a small room, with only one computer terminal. "Another one? How many does Dialga have?" you think, approaching it. You aren't in the mood to use it, but you're too curious to resist.

When you're in front of it, the screen turns on. You only see a list of Legendary Pokémon. Other than that, there doesn't seem to be a reason for this to exist. Sighing, you absent-mindedly click on a random one. A window opens.

You have started a conversation with Mew

You stare blank at the screen. Maybe you shouldn't have done that. However, looks like your attempt at clicking around didn't go unnoticed.

Hello?

Mew has messaged you. After some doubts, you reply back.

???: Hi

Hi. Who are you? I can't see your species

???: I'm just somebody passing around. Sorry for bothering you.

You're about to close the conversation, when you get more messages.

I tweaked the settings. It says you're Dee-al-ga. What is a Dee-al-ga?

???: It's Dialga

Yeah, that. You sound different than the Dialga I know. I had no idea there were two!

At this point, you seem to realize that Mew may be easily deceived. You take this as a chance to mess around, harmlessly, of course.

???: Yes, there are two, maybe three! Or four!

Oh, wait until I tell my Dialga friend about this! He'll be excited!

Your fun seems to have taken a detour. Before you're able to type anything, a notification appears, telling you that Mew is busy. After a few minutes, you receive another message from her.

I think I now see what's going on. You're a human inside Dialga' aren't you? That explains why you have the same species name than him

There is no way she could have known that if it weren't because Dialga told her. You make a mental note to talk with Dialga about this.

???: Yeah, that is true. I think I'll leave now. Bye

No, wait! I would like to talk with you. This seems interesting. I have always wished to have something inside me, and well, now I hear a friend has a human inside him. I'm jealous. Why don't you tell me about how it is, how it feels?

You decide to humor Mew, at least to keep yourself busy. Much to your surprise, after a few minutes of conversation, you find that you're enjoying it. Mew seems to have genuine curiosity about you, and what you have done inside Dialga. From time to tie she remarks how she wishes she could experiment having somebody inside her, and how Dialga is a good friend, among other stuff.

I have to go now. If you want to talk again, just message me, Dee-al-ga. I'll keep that name for you!

You're somewhat happier now. Still, you remember...

"Dialga, why did you tell Mew about me?"

Dialga hesitates before answering. "Mew might not be...the brightest Legendary, but she is by far the most trustable. She won't tell anybody. Besides, she'll be willing to be your friend, no matter what is happening to you nor who you are.

Want to talk to any other Legendary?"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Pokenet: Friending Legendaries'

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The chat with Mew was a real eyeopener for you. You never knew that Pokemons are capable of communicating in this way; it really reminds you of all the time you spent on your computer at home. Looks like the Legendaries are a lot more advanced than previously known. When you're chatting with Mew, something about her just felt so familiar, so relatable. The way she talks and interacts with you feels...., human, allowing you to temporarily forget about your shrunken problem. That's probably one of the reasons why you're feeling happier. Mew seems like a really friendly girl to talk to, you thought, I wonder how the rest of Dialga's friends would react if the learn that a human lives inside a Pokemon.

"Well, I guess I could speak to a few more of your friends. It's not like you can communicate with Legendary Pokemons everyday. Plus, if Mew seems interesting enough, why don't I give the rest a try.", you said.

"...That's great!", Dialga chimed, "My friends will be more than happy to talk to you. They definitely would wanna learn more about humans."

"So who else can I message with right now?", you inquired.

"Let's see.......I currently have Moltres, Articuno, Suicune, and Kyogre on the system......Wow, I can't believe that she's online now."

"Ummm..did you say something?", you asked with a concern tone.

"Nothing. Okay, you can choose whoever you like to speak with and I'll let you know when the others get online."

You checked the Pokenet and saw that Dialga had quite a long list of friends. Only a few of them are currently active. You chose Suicune and a new window popped up telling you that a connection has been established."

Oh man....Why did he have to choose her....

Hello. Who is this chatting with me?"

'Hi there, Suicune. I'm a human trainer and I want to have a few chats with you."

Huh? Humans aren't supposed to be able to use the Pokenet. Could you please identify yourself?

'Okay, this may sound like crazy but I'm a human currently talking to you through Dialga.

ummmm. I don't follow.

'I'm a human using the Pokenet to talk with you. I just want to talk with you. I was shrunken by Palkia when he used his powers. Dialga was kind enough to let me live in his body while we search for a solution.'

Dialga?!!!! Alright, that's enough. Quit it with your silly jokes. You aren't even trying to make it convincing. A human? Shrunken? I've never heard of something that absurd before. Is this some kind of new thing you thought up to make me come to you? If you think that I'm going to be gullible enough to believe you after you tricked me into that weird dimension trip of yours with the false alert about my forest being attacked, you are seriously mistaken.

'What are you talking about? Please! I'm telling the truth. This is all Palkia's fault. He got me into this situation. You have to believe me, Suicune.'

One more time and I'm blocking you permanently. Palkia wouldn't do that. He can be a little silly and clumsy at times but he'd never do things that's harmful. Spill it, Dialga! Why are messaging me all of a sudden? Don't tell me you're gonna beg me to forgive you for what you've done.

You are stunned by Suicune sudden brash response. The ways she talks strongly contrast with her rumored elegant appearance. And Dialga....what kind of relationship did he have with Suicune; she seemed abruptly hostile when she heard his name.

Hey, I'm talking to you, you know!!! Answer me!

"Dialga?", you said, "What's this all about?"

".....Suicune and I are really good friends with each other. We've known each other for decades.", Dialga said, "But I've done too much pranks on her in the past. She's somewhat distrusting of me now. But don't worry, she actually pretty nice......if you stay on her good side. You wouldn't want to get her mad. "

"Sounds to me that you had this coming. Also, what happens if she's mad?", you asked.

"Let's just say that she is capable of harnessing the worst force of nature; terror far worse than a thunderstorm.......Please, just let me handle this in a calm and civil manner.", Dialga said, his voice slightly trembling.

'Hold on there, Suicune. I'm getting Dialga on the line.'

>: -(!!!!!!!! Arghh! You're in for a world of pain, Dialga!

You sit back and watch Dialga startup his own chat window with Suicune. I sure can learn a lot about Dialga from his friends, you thought, Things are gonna get interesting fast. Or worse....
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You reply you do want more

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune? Don't be hasty on your own conclusions. Listen to me, please.

You are really annoying sometimes, Dialga. Okay, you have one minute to give me a good story. Go.

You know how Palkia can be really careless with his power, right? Listen to his latest blunder...

Dialga proceeds to tell your story. From time to time, you add some words, but most of it Dialga is the one talking. Suicune doesn't say a word. You have no idea what she may be thinking, but you wish she believes Dialga.

Finally, after Dialga is done, she says something.

You know I won't believe you until I see proof, don't you? She seems calmer now, you interpret it as a good sign.

"What proof could I give that it is true?"

What about...oh, I don't know! That is up to you or Dialga.

Isn't it enough proof that he is talking to you?

You're one crafty prankster, Dialga. I wouldn't be surprised if you found a way.But okay, I'm believing it for now. Is that what you wanted to hear?

"Thank you Dialga, now could you please leave Suicune and I alone for a moment? There is something private I would like to ask." There is one line that caught your attention, and you really want to find out more. Dialga seems to comply, and although you're not sure if he really stopped looking at your chat, you ask:

"Did something happen between Dialga and you? You said something about he begging you for forgiveness"

Agh, you had to ask that. Okay, no harm on telling you. One of his pranks went really far. It got me in trouble with the rest of the Legendaries. It took me weeks to clear my name. I don't want to go into details, but it coincidentally had to do something with a supposed creature that supposedly was my fault. His story was more or less what he said about you.

You're appalled at that. Did Dialga really do that? As if Suicide knew what you were thinking, she hastily added:

But Dialga is a good guy, just that he really can't see the consequences of his acts. Let's leave it at that.

"Do you plan to get a revenge or something? A prank like that can't go unpunished!"

Hah, clever human! Of course I have a plan. I'll make sure he doesn't do something like that again. It should happen sooner or later. I have planned it carefully, and it shouldn't do harm to anybody else than Dialga

"What is it?"

No telling. You're a shrunken human who knows Dialga, after all. Surely you're in cahoots with him, if you really exist. I should stop talking, before I slip and say too much. Nice to know you, human!

Then, as a farewell message: Dialga, we'll meet someday. And you better show me proof that this whole thing is true, or else I'll kick your scaly metallic ass. Message me if you want to apologize for you-know-what. I feel like accepting it apologies.

Suicide logged off after that.

"She is really something special" you comment.

"I'll admit I do like her...a bit...don't tell her" you hear Dialga say. You can't avoid snickering, as you really can't imagine Dialga and Suicune together, in any way. "What did she say to you?"

You hesitate. Judging by Suicune's words, he does deserve some payback from her. You hope that you see it when it happens. "Nothing, we just talked about her life"

There are more legendaries. You stop for a moment, to think if you feel like talking to others. You're more cheered up now.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Tomboyish Suicune

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune and Dialga sure have some deep love-hate relationship going on, you thought. She isn't exactly forthcoming about her problems but you can tell that they're legit. From the way the Aurora Pokemon spoke of her plan, you really look forward to the day that Suicune gets her revenge on Dialga. It would be a day that you wouldn't want to miss.

Putting that aside, you continue to browse the list of Legendaries that you could chat with. You're unable to decide who to chat with; too many good candidates to choose from.

Since your chat with Suicune, several more Legendaries have signed on. There is Latias, Rayquaza, Raikou, Mewtwo, and Groudon. These Pokemons are some of the most powerful ever known, you thought. Trainers hardly have a chance to encounter them in the wild. This will be the perfect opportunity to know them up close.

Just when you're about to click on the icon for Latias, a notification appeared, telling you that Raikou wants to chat with you.

Isn't that the one of the Legendary Beasts, together with Suicune and Entei?, you thought. What's the chance of chatting with all three of them in the same day?

"My, Raikou's online.", Dialga chuckled, "He's a really hotheaded fellow who's fiercely loyal; willing to rush to the protection of his friends even in life-threatening conditions."

"Hmm, that's similar to the description on my Pokedex. He sounds like a dependable friend.", you said.

"He sure is.", Dialga replied, "Raikou still hasn't learned about your existence yet. want me to introduce you to him?"

"That's a pretty good idea.", you answered.

Just wait till he meets you. There is a side to Raikou that few knows; he's got a strong curiosity and is a bookworm (if that's the correct human term for someone who like information and research}. Once he meets you, be prepared to answer a load of questions. Just click 'accept' and we're on."

You touched the 'Accept' button and a window suddenly popped up on your screen.

Howdy, Dialga. Interested in chattin' with me?

Hey, Raikou. How's thing going for you?

Mighty good 'round here in Johto. Just a little bored and lookin' for someone to talk to.

I'm good too, Rai. Hey, interested in meeting someone I got here?

And who might that fellow be?

Hold to your paws, Raikou. You'll never believe me. I currently got a.....shrunken human with me!

...........A HUMAN!!!! Oh come on now, stop jokin' with me. We all know that it's not possible. A human is not capable of miniaturization or alteration to their physical property. Those abilities are reserved for Pokemons like you and me, Dialga. As a Temporal Pokemon, I thought you knew that.

He didn't did this to himself. Palkia started this with another of his silly power demonstration."

oh, that steelhead's at it again. *facepaw* I though he'd learn after that incident with teleporting those islands.

Sadly, he didn't and I got to clean up after him.....So you want proof about the shrunken human? I'll get him on now.

....If that true, I'll have a chance to update my information on humans. Meaning, research time!!!.....This'll be the biggest discovery ever. An entire encyclopedia on human.... : D

You might wanna slow down a bit on the questions. Don't ask anything too sensitive, okay?

Alright, I promise you....now where is this human? I wanna record everything about this.:)

A Pokemon who's nerdy? Now that a first!, you thought.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Talk with somebody else

choices: You decide to talk with one last Legendary
You decide to go to your room now
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You're not sure you're ready for this, as Raikou seems to be somebody very different to the Pokémon you have talked with so far. You're not sure how to start the conversation, so you decide to be safe with a generic salutation.

"Hey, how are things going?"

Let's not talk about me, human. You're the one who should be on the spotlight right now!

-"Simply wonderful"- you think sarcastically. Raikou went directly to the point.

How does it feel to be so tiny? Something way smaller than normal?

You meditate about the replies you can give. "Uuuhh...it is odd, that is it. And makes me nervous sometimes"

Well, it is natural! Now, ever imagined you would meet a Legendary? Tell me about what you had dreamt of these moments!

The change of topic was unexpected. "No, I never thought, it was more of a surprise"

Note for myself: the human seems to be rather easy to surprise.

We're seeing what you wrote, Raikou. Keep your own thoughts for your diaries.

It is good if the human learns about himself, Dialga, I know what I'm doing!

Sure you do

Now, human, how is it to live inside Dialga? Is it too bad to be inside another living being?

"Well...it isn't bad. I have seen awesome stuff, but I have also gone through one or two experiences I would rather to forget. This place is far from what I thought the inside of a Pokémon would be"

If you could to, would you live forever inside him?

Tough question. "Probably...depending of the circumstances"

Note to self: the human is also very adaptable, even living into the unlikelist of enviroments.

How many questions do you plan to do, Raikou?

I'm sorry, Dialga, it is that I'm simply excited for this! It isn't like everyday you discover there is a tiny human living inside a friend's body :O

You can't avoid feeling amused by Raikou's veiled enthusiasm. You certainly must have improved his week, maybe month, or even year.

For the next twenty minutes, Raikou asks you questions about your past life, your actual situation, and your possible future. From time to time he says his own impressions, through those personal notes. You enjoy answering his questions, and you feel a lot better overall about the present.

Dialga, this is a lot of information. Thank you for letting me talk to the human, this was very good

No problem

Human, thanks for the answers. If you ever want to talk to me again, just call me. I'll reply, no matter what I'm doing. I promise

You reply that you will. You don't know if you ever will, but eh, politeness is important.

Heh, somebody like that human would be so useful if I ever decide to study my own insides. I should ask him when I start it ;)

And with that parting line, he disconnected.

-"Is he serious, Dialga?"- you ask, hoping for a negative answer.

-"One never knows...I wouldn't be surprised if he ever asked you that"-

You stretch on your seat. You have been sitting for a long time.

"If you want to, you could talk to one more. I'll have to prepare something for you, and I would like you to stay inide your room until it is done" Well, it is the truth. I need to start planning that courage test.

You look at the screen.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou the Bookworm

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Chatting up with Dialga's friends has been one of the best things to happen so far. Mew, Suicune, and Raikou have interesting characters; they're someone you would love to meet in person. Hey, maybe this is my chance to expand my friend circle beyond humans only, you thought. Pokemons are a lot more likable and courteous than some of the people I've encountered. Speaking of that, my 'pre-shrinking' friends haven't really been talking a lot with me lately, even before this whole thing kicked in. Perhaps they're busy with their training....or are we growing a bit distant in such a short time? If it's the latter, it's good to know that Pokemons care more about me. We'll find out soon....

The conversations with the Pokemons have tired you significantly. You were way too absorbed to realize how much time you've spent. A quick check of your watch indicates that a little less than four hours have gone by since you started chatting. Your hands ache from all the typing and your eyes feel bleary from fixing them on the monitor for so long. But your curiosity continuously made you stay longer; every stray thoughts of stopping were instantly repelled by your desire to know more about your Pokemon friends. Just one more.... and I'm off for a quick rest, you promised yourself.

You searched the list for some other Pokemons to talk to. Most of them have gone offline except for a few. One of the names stood out: Keldeo. It's a name you've never heard before. A quick search on your Pokedex yields nothing in return. Well that's strange, you thought. My Pokedex is constantly updated with the newest species of each region I've been to. Is it a previously undiscovered species? It's not entirely impossible to come across one as only 64% of Pokemons were documented as of now. You asked Dialga who this mysterious Pokemon is?

"Keldeo is a friend I made a few months ago. He's a tiny fellow compared with the rest of us on the chat list. He's also a Legendary.", Dialga said, "You may be wondering about the unfamiliarity of his name. That because he lives and travels in places uninhabited by humans so your records probably won't include him. To make himself even more obscure, he isn't much of a talker and always tried to stay out of sight, even from other Pokemons. I only happened to come across him by chance and it took me several days to finally get him to trust me. I even managed to photograph him after chasing him around for an hour."

"You sure have gone great lengths just to be friends with this Keldeo guy.", you said.

"Sure did.", Dialga sighed, "It was exhausting but totally worth it! Here, let me show you his first picture. He's really cute but don't tell him that or he'll start denying and cry about joining something called the Swords of Justice. It's some kind of organization or something."

A picture popped up on your monitor. The photo showed the Pokemon from Dialga's perspective. You studied every feature of the mysterious Pokemon. Keldeo resembles a Rapidash but far smaller with a elongated snout. He also has a long red mane with blue details on his chest, hooves, and tail. There is a curved horn-like structure on Keldeo's forehead you assume is his main weapon. In the picture, Keldeo is looking up to what is presumbly Dialga. He has a shy and introvert type of expression on his face. The large innocent eyes only intensified the effects. He looks like he didn't really enjoy having that picture taken. If you look carefully, you can even see faint tear marks running down its cheek. Keldeo looks sort of adorable like this. The Pokemon isn't taller than your hip based on your estimation.

You are amazed about the revelation of a new Pokemon and potentially a new friend. This is an incredible discovery! You're the first human to ever meet a new Pokemon and talk with it. You were about to click on his name before being stopped by Dialga.

"Hold on there, human.", Dialga cautioned, "As much as I know you want to talk with Keldeo, he is very sensitive and shy when it comes to meeting with new people. If you were to talk to him like this, he wouldn't reply and will promptly sign off for days at a time. The guy is still getting used to the chat system. I think it would be better if you talk with him using my name; he'll be a lot more comfortable with it. I'll help you out should you hit a snag."

"Sounds fine to me.", you said.

You waited for Dialga to make some adjustments to the chat system before you started typing.

Dialga: Hi there, Keldeo.


.…........

Dialga: Are you there?


.........uh..........h...hi.....Dialga...

Dialga quietly chuckled..
Still being that cute little introvert...
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You decide to talk with one last Legendary

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
How has things been?

Oh, you know...the usual...

You wait for a few minutes until it is obvious to you that Keldeo isn't going to say anything else. Dialga laughs. "I knew this would happen! He won't say anything else until you mention something interesting"

Something interesting. You're not sure what you could propose. You suppose that maybe asking him about his travels can get you a nice reply.

What have you seen recently? Anything worth commenting?

N-N-Not much...I found a...a huge valley...doesn't look like anybody else has been around...

Why are you there?

Keldeo doesn't say anything for a while. You think you're stuck again, until a line appears.

...I'm here to...to...train.

Train for what?

You...you...you forgot, didn't you? I had told you...and you forgot...

No, I didn't! It is for the Swords of Justice, right?

You didn't type that line. It must have been Dialga's doing.

Yes...that. I think that...if I get stronger, then I'll be able to get in it. That's my goal. And...maybe I-I should be less...shy, as well.

It is nice to see that Legendaries Pokémon have their own dreams and goals. It helps to feel that humans and Pokémon are closer than most think.

How could I help you?

I don't need any help... and some seconds later: ...thanks

For a moment you consider mentioning something about you, but, just in case, you tell Dialga about that. "I suppose it'll be okay. It is worth trying"

I have a new friend, would you like to meet him? You can talk to him.

No...no...I don't think it would be good...right now. Maybe someday...

Oh well. Looks like you won't talk to Keldeo directly, at least for now. You say farewell to Keldeo, and step away from the terminal. It was fun to meet some of the Legendaries. They're quite an eccentric group.

"Did you like meeting my friends?"

"Sure I did! Thanks, Dialga" you say, grateful. Earlier that day you would have never thought that you would be cheered up. It had seemed like something impossible.

"Now go to your room, please. There is something I need to do, and it is a private thing".

You nod, and start walking to your room.

Good, he seems to be in a much lighter mood than before. I hope it lasts. Now that it is done...

I'm still stuck on the whole bravery test. I should start making the arrangements. I need to make it seem urgent...I'll wake him up early tomorrow morning
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Keldeo

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Okay. I have everything prepared now. The entire plan from the problem itself, the details of the mission, to the reward has all been set. I‘ve made sure that it‘s convincing enough. This courage test will be the final one for the human to see whether he is indeed the Wielder of the Legendaries. If he holds up, this will be the most important news ever for all of us. Not only is a myth proven to be true, it‘ll also mean that humans and Pokemons are a lot closer than we imagined. It‘s the lost bond between the two species. The implication will be massive and the dynamics of our relationships will be alrered. The human will also find himself with a new set of duties and destiny to uphold. As for myself, my efforts will be remembered for eons and it‘s all because of a accident and a shrunken Pokemon trainer. Now, it is time for me to put my plans into motion.....and a little drama.

Moments later.......

You are suddenly awakened by the loud voice of Dialga.

“Human!”, Dialga shouted in a panicked tone, “Are you awake? I need your immediate attention. Something has happened.”

You quickly checked the time on your watch: 5:40am, far earlier than usual. This is the first time that you have heard Dialga spoke in such urgent and alarming manner. What problem could possibly caused Dialga to wake you at such an early time?, you thought, Has he found a way to get me normal? Has something happened to his friend? Or is he playing some cruel jokes on me?

“Huh? What‘s the matter?”, you said groggily and slightly annoyed, “It’s 5:40 in the morning. Let me sleep for a little longer.

“No. This can‘t wait!!!”, Dialga hollered.

You sat up on your bed, very irritated. “It better be important.”, you groaned.

“This is an emergency. I’m still having a hard time believing this: there is something very wrong with my body. This is an unprecedented breach of my system which is normally secure. I cannot confirm what caused this other than it‘s from an external source and is deliberate.”, Dialga said at a rapid fire speed, “The anomaly cannot be resolved no matter what method I tried. Thr
E repercussions are serious and could jeopardize both of our lives.”

All of your weariness was instantly gone, replaced with full on panic. There‘s something that Dialga cannot resolve on his own? That‘s a pretty big problem if a Legendary Pokemon is unable to solve it? What could cause such distress from Dialga? This. Is. Bad!!! You are increasingly getting concerned for the Pokemon when you remembered when you’re monitoring his body he told you that you won‘t have to face any major problems during your stay. But now that something out of your expectation has happened, you don‘t know what to do next. You tried your best to remain calm and rational.

“Dialga, please calm down. What exactly happened?”, you asked.

The Pokemon took several deep breathes and spoke in a calmer and slower voice: “I was performing a routine check of my body as I normally do everyday. When I started the scanning program, several alert messages popped up indicating that my body security has been compromised. This has never happened. How could I be so careless?”

Dialga did his best at being melodramatic.

“Is the problem severe and where can I find it?”, you asked nervously.

“The problem has been located in my Temporal Region. I detected a deliberate alteration of key data and I suspect that Palkia is probably involved. If this is his idea of a prank, I’ll.....grrrr.”

“What exactly does the Temporal Region do.”, you asked.

“It‘s an organ that deals with controlling the flow of time. If left unfixed, it could change the definition of time; a second could become a century and years could become a mere nanosecond. It‘ll be complete disorder....”, Dialga replied.

“Oh great! Thanks to Palkia again. All of our lives would be ruined by such chaotic time. I, for one, don‘t want a lifespan of 15 minutes.”, you exclaimed.

“And there still more to that.......we have about an hour to fix things; missing the opportunity would mean a 140 year wait before conditions are right again.”, Dialga warned.

“My goodness...could things get any worse?”, you stuttered, “This timey wimey thing sure isn‘t your typical rocket science. A simple error and it‘ll snowball into something so unpredictable. I remembered the scientists called it ‘chaos theory’ or something. *sigh* Okay, Is there anything I could do?”

“There is a solution", Dialga said in a serious tone, “Because I‘m unable to fix this issue by my efforts only, I‘m giving you the mission of heading to the Temporal Region to check things out. You might have heard about that area on your first day in me; it‘s one of the places where you were restricted from entering. Now, I would like to make an exception to that.You are hereby granted permission to enter the Temporal Region to resolve the issue. Take extra precaution once you‘re there.”

“Wow wow wow...Hold on for a second.... Doesn‘t that sounds sorta dangerous to go there unprepared?.....”, you said.

“Unfortunately, it is. There is no time to train you. We have to go there at once. And I must warn you that going in there entails a great risk. That region is the source of my time bending and dimension-crossing powers. A lot of things that goes on in there will affect spacetime and existence. A mistake could result in the rewriting of history or changing laws of physics at best.. at worst, you could annilhilate numerous galaxies and civilization, possibly even yours.“

You froze completely at Dialga‘s implication.

“Bu....but it kinda.....abrupt to ask me to perform such....delicate assignment. I‘m just merely a Pokemon trainer, not some temporal superhero. I don‘t want to be the one who single-handedly destroy ruin the universe for everyone. I‘m so afraid that I might fail., you said, “I don‘t know if I can do it.“

You heard Dialga gave a slow sigh...

“You might think that this is a very heavy responsibility that was abruptly given to you, but you must remember that I have carried it since the beginning of time. And controlling my powers isn‘t an easy feat as it seems.”, the Pokemon said.

“Well, it‘s easy for you to put it that way because you have billions of years of experience. I‘m completely new to this. A few days ago, I don’t even know what ‘time space’ is.”, you retorted.

“Let me ask you something.”, Dialga calmly replied, “Your world and the universe still exists; everything goes on as usual, right? And you know why? Because I took the risk and challenge during all those millenias. I made countless decisions, some of them right while others don‘t work out so well. If I were to be afraid of failure and stalled my resolve, your world might be a very different place and you might not even exists. Are you willing to let everything you’ve ever known disappear just because you think you can‘t do it? From what I‘ve heard, humans love to stand up to the most difficult of challenges and always find a way to a quandary. Do you think you‘re up to the mission?..... Take some time to think about it. I know it‘s a difficult dillema.”

You considered the Temporal Pokemon’s words for some time. Dialga words have a little hint of chastisement in them and it made you feel bad about backing away.You attempt to balance the risks and the potential reward from the mission. If I somehow failed, I guess it means that I possibly will kiss my world goodbye and welcome my life as the only human still ‘alive’ in a metaphysical sense. If things go that way, you wonder what will happen if you spend eternity in Dialga in a featureless void. You stopped yourself from thinking further in that unfathomable direction. Conversely, you have the perfect opportunity to demonstrate your skills and worth to Dialga. I can beat his expectation and make him eat his words. If I can impress him, maybe he‘ll open up more to me. He can tell me more about himself while I can share some from myself. If we get to understand more about one another, it will put us closer to our goals, closer to normalcy. After half an hour of deliberation, you made you‘re decision.

“Show me the way to the Temporal Region.”, you said decisively.

Dialga smile at the human‘s thought which is strangely similar to what he had in mind despite not interferring with the human‘s thinking.My words are having effect on the human. I kind of overdid it but we‘re achieving the desired results anyway. He sure likes to think a lot when he‘s making decisions, especially that stuck in a void part. Even I wouldn‘t to be stuck there, Dialga thought. He‘s kinda cute when he does that. Especially when he goes in the absurd or silly direction of thinking. Strangely, I‘ve recently grown to like this human trainer more and more. I can‘t really pinpoint it. Is it his character? His occasional silliness? Or is it because he‘s what I could have been like if I didn‘t have to manage this whole time space thing? How I wish that we could do a body swap, human. I seriously need a break from everything. No one else knows how serious or frankly, boring and crappy, my job can be sometimes......

Now, be ready for some mind-blowing stuffs, human.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Next Morning

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Dialga makes the capsule enter your room. You enter, ready to be taken to the place where you'll help Dialga prevent a potential time catastrophe. The capsule takes you through Dialga's body, until you're able to be on a platform you never thought you would step on. In front of you there is also a huge metallic contraption, resembling a vault. This reinforces your supposition of the organ itself being very important.

"I'm ready, Dialga, but what will I do?"

"Look around and try to find something that looks like it shouldn't happen. Then notify me. I'll tell you how to fix it. However, remember that there is a time limit before..." Dialga stops talking, his silence says all you needed to hear. The vault in front of you opens, and you're soon entering the tunnel behind it. Everything is made of the same steel, and you feel cold. This place looks almost invulnerable, how could Palkia affect it? Maybe it is different in the outside, but you doubt it. You keep walking, until you reach a wide space. You notice you're standing on a stone platform very similar to the one that you had stood on when you had arrived to Dialga's dimension. Around you there is a purple fog, which blocks your sight. You can only see a few steps around you.

"Dialga, this fog really will make all harder" you say, hoping that the Pokémon can do something about it.

"It is another of the protections I had in place. I'll remove it" In matter of seconds, the fog is gone, although there is still a lot on the edges of the platform itself. You suppose there is a reason for that. Above you, there is a timer. "When the timer above you reaches zero, then nothing you do will help. The changes has to be reversed before time is over" The timer indicates there are around 45 minutes left.

On the platform, you see a blue spot on the distance. You start walking towards it, but Dialga stops you. "Wait, human. I need you to do something. Please walk as fast as you can near the edges of the platform, and examine the fog. If you see something you suspect shouldn't be there, tell me" You don't discuss Dialga's instructions, he knows of this much more than you do. Keeping in mind the timer, you run to the edge, and start going through the path indicated.

The thick fog looks almost like a wall, purple forms moving over and over. It is almost hypnotizing, and you sometimes have a hard time focusing. When you have been walking for a while, you see something you suspect shouldn't be happening. There is a whirlpool or something on the fog, much bigger than you. Near it, there are also several, of different sizes. "I think I found it, Dialga. There are some odd whirlpools here" you say, while you keep walking. There are around thirty, in different points.

"Hmmmm...what I thought. Palkia really must have destabilized the structure of time. Listen human, go to the center. You'll see a blue sphere. You'll have further instructions once you get there"

You start walking to the center of the platform, without wasting any time. You reach a sphere, almost as big as you. It is blue, and keeps rippling, forming waves on it. It is like water condensed, but you have the feeling it is something much more surreal. Then you see whirlpools. There are thirty or so as well. It doesn't take you long to know that it is related to the ones you had seen on the fog.

"The fog is literally the fabric of time. This sphere is what controls it. What I need you to do is...to fix it. I would do it by myself, but I'm fixing a lot of time stuff out here. Once you fix it, the problems outside should stop as well"

You try to glance to the timer above the entrance. There are like fifteen minutes left. "How do I do it?!"

"Stick your arms, and try to grab some of the substance inside it, in the bottom. Then try to fill the whirlpools with it"

"That sounds easy enough" you said, honestly expecting something harder. Dialga hadn't finished talking, though.

"The thing, human, is that...you'll feel a lot of pain. And if you have are touching the sphere when the timer gets to zero...you have a very high risk of dying" This lowers your confidence. Your own life...being risked in exchange of trying to prevent something huge. You think it for a minute or so, before replying you would do it.

Dialga seems to be rather touched by your courage. "Okay. Start now" he says, and you, after taking a deep breath, start touching the sphere.

As I expected. He is really doing it. Now to see if he is capable of doing it successfully. Of course, I'll be able to revert the changes after he is done and out. Now, if he can do it...then it'll be time to start his own training by giving him some of my own powers...a small part of them, of course. The pool I had stopped him from entering a few days ago should do the trick.

Come on, human. Do it!
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Temporal Region

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
I can feel it. That courage emanating from the human. It feels like a bright beacon within the gales of 'despair'. It‘s one of the defining characteristics of humans and many Pokemons. I find that to be one of the interesting similariies between us. We are willing to put aside fear and push our abilities to the maximum. It's a driving force behind every action, decision, and desire. How that courage is used depends greatly on who is using it. Some used it to achieve noble acts of justice, others used it to force their darkest thoughts upon the unsuspecting. In the case of this trainer, I feel a powerful sense of duty within him: to "restore" the stability of time and the universe. Even though this whole thing is fabricated, I could very well see the human do the same if it were to actually happen. The ‘risks’ of death is great but he still remains unfaltered. Speaking of that, I wish that Palkia could learn a thing or two from him. Let‘s see how well the trainer handle this.

Pain......That was the first thing you could think of the moment your finger came in contact with the sphere. You screamed loudly at the sudden jolt running down your nerves, spreading gradually like an expanding inferno crawling over every inch of your body. The blue sphere, apparently sensing your hand, started glowing brighter and swirled with a multitude of colors. It's a beautiful sight if not for the importance of your mission and the numbing pain. The sensation can be described as a cross between pins and needles and electric shock, only much more intense. The pain pushed you toward the brink of unconsciousness and overwhelmed your mind with random images and thoughts that you've never seen before. You didnt‘t pay enough attention to see what they are. You had expected something far less excruciating than Dialga had implied but the Pokemon didn't exactly elaborate on that. You quietly cussed at both the pain and Dialga and hoped that this will be over soon.

Doing the best to move your hand in the sphere, you grasped something solid within it. You quickly withdrew your hand from the sphere and the pain disappeared almost immediately. In your hand, you see something that resembles smoke but acts like a solid. It has a bluish aura with the consistency like that of a water balloon. Every time you squeezed the stuff, it dissipated into the surrounding but reforms itself in your hand once you loosened your grasp. Suddenly, you feel the surrounding distort a little. The Temporal Region fades around you replaced with the enviros of outer space.There was another series of images flashing before you. This time you see scenes of destruction of stars, planets and galaxies. You see them literally evaporating into nothingness. In it‘s place is a black void that expands and swallow everything in its path. There was a bright flash and you found yourself back in the chamber. The sight troubles you greatly. Is that what could happen in the imminent future?, you thought. How you handle the substance could very well affect what happens in those visions. Every minute passed will accelerate the effects of the distortion. There is no time to waste.

You swiftly took the substance to the edge and threw it into one of the whirlpools. The thing splashed down into the fog and did nothing at first. Just when you‘re doubting the efficacy of the substance, a dim glow starts to form at the center of the whirlpool. Suddenly like an intense chemical reaction, you see sparks and fires flying in the whirlpool. Sounds of explosions and electricity filled the room. Some of the sparks managed to land on you and caused an ice cold sensation wherever it hits. You look on as the substance took effect and gradually shrinks the whirlpool until it is no longer there. The area of the fog has smoothen and settled. You see another vision of stars and planets returning to a small portion of the expanse. This is a sign that the particular region has stablized. You smiled at the effort but there is still work to do.

You spent an hour or two alternating between pain from grasping the sphere and the cold sparks of the whirlpools. The elimination of each additional whirpool lifts up your optimism and the prospect of earning praise from Dialga. It isn‘t exactly comfortable but you aren‘t gonna quit saving time just because you dislike the experience. But performing such daunting task has taken a toll on your energy. Halfway through, you felt sleepy and on the verge of collapsing. Each time, you recalled what Dialga has told you and mustered enough energy to carry on.

After throwing more of the substance over the last whirlpool and watched it disappear, you fell down upon your back and stared at the metallic lattice on the ceiling. The task has finally been complete and the impossible has become possible. You saved the universe, your world, and multiple dimensions. Every part of your body aches from the mission. I did it, Dialga......I did it......Before you can finish the sentence, you fell asleep from exhaustion.

Dialga looked on at the sleeping human in his Temporal Region. The Pokemon used his power to transport the human back to his bedrrom and made sure he‘s comfortable. You have proven yourself, human. You are the person I‘ve been looking for a long time: The Wielder of the Legendaries. A new destiny lies ahead of you.

Somewhere, a Pokemon watches Dialga from afar....

Found you, Dialga. After tracking you for days, I have a fix on your location. You got me through that weird dimension of yours and got me in countless misunderstandings. I don‘t know where I should start on you but I promise you, it‘ll be painful. And also, I gotta see whether you are telling the truth abouth the human living in your body. That guy seems interesting. It‘s time for payback. Heh heh heh
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Continue

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You slowly open your eyes, and groggily stand up and look around. You notice that you aren't in the Temporal Region anymore. You're back in your room. Suddenly the memories of what you went through comes back to you.

"Dialga?! Did I do it right? Is there a catastrophe?!" you shout to the top of your lungs, before noticing that everything was okay.

"You did it bravely, human. You fixed it correctly. You definitely have the traits everybody should have"

First you're relieved, then flattered to hear such words about you. You smile sheepishly before replying that it was nothing, just something you had to do.

"You don't understand, human, what you did goes beyond than what almost anybody would have done. It was on par to what the Legendaries would have done. Well, maybe not Palkia. He's a different case"

"Of course he is" you say. You try to stand, and find that you're pretty much okay. No pain at all. "So, now what?"

Dialga stays in silence while he seems to meditate the next thing he'll say. "Listen, there is something special about you. Something that no other human has. Maybe it wasn't just Palkia what brought you to me, maybe fate helped as well. You're destined for great things, but you have the last word. You can't reach your destiny unless you fully embrace it" your host says, talking very clearly.

"What destiny is it?" you ask, curious.

"Enter, and I'll tell you what I mean" the capsule once again stops in your room. You enter, and it once again starts moving without you doing a thing. While you're being carried to an unknown destination, Dialga starts talking.

"Between us Legendaries, there is lore as well, not only about us, but about the other beings in the universe. One of these stories talked about a human, one human who stood over the rest, and it pretty much worked as some sort of...pseudo-legendary, in close cooperation with Pokémon like me and Palkia. The other Legendaries would consider him as part of the group, despite not being of the same origin.

After I found you, I asked Mew information about your species, and remembered that myth. You don't fit all the traits the story has, but no story is perfect. I'm sure it is you, and I intend to take you through the path that would make you the human of the story. We called it "The Wielder of the Legendaries"

"Wait, wait, wait...are you saying...that I'm going to be that?" you say softly, stunned.

"Yes. If you wish to. As I said, you would work with Palkia and me, mostly. As such, the Wielder of Legendaries has some Time and Space powers. Now I'll provide you with weak Time powers, which will gradually get stronger, if you truly wish to be the one. Let's go for steps, okay?"

"Time powers...what is it? And how would you give me powers?"

"Well, we'll start with the easy stuff: stopping time for mere seconds. Then from there I'll train you to be able to do more complicated and important stuff, until you're at the peak of your powers. Then we'll see if Palkia will cooperate to provide the other half of your powers. As to how you'll receive them..."

The capsule opens, and you realize it had stopped. You step out of the capsule, and see that you're in the room with the pools. You don't understand why you're there, until you see the sparkly pool at the bottom of the room, which was out of your limits. Could it be that it was the way?

"Once you enter that pool, you'll gain them. Tomorrow we'll start your training"

"So, after this, do I go to sleep?"

"No, it is too early. If you wish to, you may go and explore more. Do what you want"

You nod, and stand on a side of the pool. The whole thing makes you nervous. You didn't seem like you were nervous, but you really were doubting if it was the right thing. What if you royally screwed up? You don't want to think of the consequences.

"Okay, here I go" you say loudly, and start entering the pool.

***

From afar, another Pokémon was observing Dialga. She really needed a good revenge.

After thinking for a good amount of time, the Pokémon had an idea. However, if she were to do it, she would need help. After all...it was something impossible for her. But with the right cooperation...with that in mind, she messaged a fellow Legendary Pokémon.

Raikou? Raikou, I need your help. I plan a revenge on Dialga.

He really had it coming, didn't he? I have been keeping track of all his antics.

Yeah...I have something in mind, but I can't do it. Maybe you know somebody who can!

What do you need?

Somebody...small, or who can shrunk itself. Resistant. Also, whoever you choose, must be able to infiltrate that dragon's body, and inflict pain from the inside. Not enough to really hurt him, but enough to be a real bother and a pain in his ass. Just what he deserves

Ah! You don't need anybody special. I can think of one...it is more of a common species, but it should be good enough. Small, and doubt he'll notice it entering. And will be very annoying, and there is almost no way for Dialga to get rid of it. Do you have a plan of how to send it to his body?

Dialga will eat anything. That should be the way

Sounds good! However, there is something you should know...there is a human living inside. I'll add instructions so the human doesn't get hurt

I knew that. You do it. So Raikou knew about it as well. That made the chances of it being true bigger, but she wanted a more reliable source of information.

Meet me in an hour or two. I'll have convinced it from doing it. It shares my elemental type, so it shouldn't be hard.

Wait, what do you plan? I want to know if it is what I need

Keldeo was the one to tell me about them. I have now studied that species, and I know it is the best for this. Have you, by any chance, heard of the Joltik species?

Suicune smiled. She knew very few things about them, but it did felt like the right help for the job. She left the place, ready to start her own side of the plan. Food to camouflage the little bug.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Later in the Afternoon

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The moment you entered the pool, you know that there is something different about it. As your feet submerged within the bright blue water, the tingling feeling of electricity traveled up your body. In contrast with the shocks you endured in the Temporal Region, the energy here felt a lot more gentle and made you more vigorous as a portion of Dialga's power is transferred to you. It is hardly believable but a Legendary Pokemon has just shared his abilities with you. The fact that you're part of a Pokemon's legend still need some getting used to. What makes your current state truly incredible is that Dialga and his friends seem to believe that you are some kind of chosen one, a "trainer" to them perhaps, who'll lead them into a new era. This isn't some common occurrence. Under normal circumstances, asking a Legendary Pokemon to grant you his/her power is a surefire way to get yourself in trouble. In Dialga's case, he'll probably send you to some bizarre world to serve serve as a punishment for such intrusion and that's just taking it easy. You shook your head as your thoughts veered off topic again. The answer to my eventual role will soon unfold.

A good five minutes later, Dialga tells you that the process is complete and tells you to exit the pool.

"You are now bestowed with some Time power, human. .", Dialga said, "You can now stop time for about 5 seconds and make minuscule alteration to space. With such powers available, you can perform some more important duties for me. Some of which will include helping me locate any anomaly in time and learning more about the nature of your new-found powers through on-site experience. Once you're skilled enough, we can move on to the next level of training."

"Sounds like some cool stuffs. I always wanted to see what it's like to be able to manipulate time.", you commented, "But...won't handing me such power cause any problems? You know, disrupting the balance of time and ending up like that close call induced by Palkia. Doesn't that worry you?"

"There is no need to worry, human.", the Pokemon replied, "Several safeguards are in place and I won't let you do anything too risky. Besides, your powers are still too minuscule to affect space time in any significant ways. You have a tendency of overthinking any given problems."

"Well that's good to hear. I'm just a bit more careful when it comes to making decisions. So, what are we supposed to do now?", you inquired.

"We'll start our training tomorrow. For today, you can do whatever exploring you want."

"Thank you, Dialga. I'll do my best to fulfill my new role. Any area in particular you'd like to show me?", you asked.

******
On the other side, Suicune continues to observe Dialga and plan for the big revenge on him. It's been some time since she last messaged Raikou and he hasn't replied back when he told her he'll be looking for a Joltik. Suicune became a little desperate and messaged the Electric Pokemon.

Raikou, any luck at finding a Joltik willing to perform this task? We've gotta hurry. Dialga could jump dimensions again and we'll lose track.

So far, I haven't gotten any luck in that. Things aren't going as smoothly as planned, Suicune. The Joltiks are well-known to be elusive. The few I managed to find either outright refused to be "eaten" or make outlandish demands of giving them all the Rare Candy we can find so they could evolve. They are very insisting. I try to ask a few more of them. If none of the Joltiks are willing to help us, I guess you probably have to come up with a better plan or wait until next time to seek your revenge.

ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME, RAIKOU?!!! Are you really suggesting that we give up? Dialga is one of the most annoying idiot I've met and you have no idea of the full extent of the damage he's done to me. I don't care what it'll cost me, just find a freaking way to inflict harm on Dialga. I have this planned for so long and there is no way I'm GIVING UP! DO YOU HEAR ME, RAIKOU, I... WANT.. MY... REVENGE... NOW!!! Just think about something, okay.

Oh, wow....wow...Easy there, Suicune. Calm down and think about it. If we move forward so brashly, we could harm the human inside. Don't you want to know more about the human? Isn't that one of the reasons you're here?

.......You're right. I got a little too caught up in my personal grudge with Dialga. It's just that the many pranks he's down on me has affected my standing badly. It took me weeks to clear myself of that rumor that I have a crush on him.

So he's the one spreading that message around. Dialga probably had fun at your expense. I'm curious, Suicune. How did you two first met? And do you really have feeling for him?

You better stop asking those questions before I consider you my No.2 enemy. What options do we still have?

You wouldn't believe it.....One of the Joltiks just offered to shrink us down. That way, we'll be able to enter Dialga and execute our plans. What did you think of that?

O_0 Entering Dialga? I had enough of him when I'm out here. To think that I have to enter his body....urghh.

It's the only choice we've got now. If we dither any further, Dialga will be traveling again. We got to make a decision quick, remember.

It seems that destiny has a strange way of playing tricks on me, as that Pokemon used to say. Alright, let's get everything ready in half an hour. And please take Keldeo along with you, he's been hanging out with Dialga a lot lately and must know some info.

Got it. Let's meet at the lakeside 30 minutes from now. Should all things go as planned, we'll be in him within an hour.

I'm about to enter the body of the Pokemon I hat the most. A truly bizarre turn of events.....I may have a slight miscalculation at Plan A, Dialga, but I got the perfect Plan B to deal you.........
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Receiving Powers

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You walked inside Dialga, wondering where you would be taken now. After you asked him for a recommendation, he had commented that there was a place he thought you would like. You entered and encountered a room, with bright colors and steel decorations. A counter, several stools, and a TV on a corner. It reminded you of a bar, for some reason.

You sat on a stool, and waited to see what happened. In front of you, on the counter, a screen appeared, and turned on. It seemed like some sort of menu, listing a series of drinks and similar stuff. You decide to at least enjoy whatever the place had to offer.

The screen disappeared, sinking into the counter. Minutes later, the portion of the counter that was gone reappeared, this time with a large cup with what you had chosen. You calmly took it, and asked the question you had intended to ask.

"Why did you want me here?"
