"I want you to do your cleaning as gently and slowly as you can, human. I don't want any rough actions that might ruin my lustrous coat. Have I made myself clear?" Suicune said as she holds a brush with her tail.

"Yeah yeah. Let's just make this quick, okay? I'm kinda tired here," you said half-mockingly.

"Then why don't you start cleaning me right away, human," the Pokemon said, "You don't want to keep a lady waiting, do you?"

Suicune whisked herself off the bed and started walking to another opening in the chamber. You followed right behind her and was lead to another interconnected room that intends to be a shower room. A large recessed tub lies at the center. Once again, the decors are designed to supposedly fit Suicune's taste. The walls are decorated with colors to resemble aurora while blue diamond crystals are studded onto the floor in a crisscross pattern. The centerpiece of the chamber is on the ceiling where a painting depicts Suicune and Dialga in regal and, bluntly, suggestive pose. Both are embracing each other with their ecstatic gaze trained on each other. You face immediately blushed upon seeing it though you have no attractions of any sorts toward Suicune. While looking at it, you wondered how Suicune could find this location with relative ease. And just how obsessive can Dialga get with her? With this kind of devotion to Suicune, it's outright narcissism and delusional,you thought.

"Arceus damn it...that pervert had to keep that painting up there. I'd thought I told him to remove that abomination," Suicune grumbled. As if she suddenly remembered the reason she's here and look at you with commanding eyes.

"We're gonna use that tub right there and I want you to use that bucket of water to clean me. From there, you will brush my fur in a single direction from my head toward my rump. You are not to stop until I said so. Anything done the wrong way will be immediately punished. Now, get to work!"

You are barely able to listen to Suicune's instruction after the exhaustive ordeal of the day. It's challenging to maintain an appearance of alertness when you are about to fall asleep. Maybe it's just because of the fatigue, but you felt an urge to talk back to Suicune and disobey her. But still, it's better to comply with her demands than to find out what kind of punishment she could enact. You sighed in resignation as you grabbed the brush from Suicune and examined her body. At a distance, the Pokemon's fur looks uniformly smooth but closer scrutiny reveals obvious problems. Some parts of her coat looks matted and disheveled. Her paws are all grimy, brown, and a little sweaty; signs of an exhaustive day.



You carefully used the brush to gently stroke her coat in a slow, rhythmic pattern. You can hear Suicune give a sigh of relaxation and feel the tension on her body start to loosen. A lot of tangled or loose clumps of fur came off her along with all the dirt hidden deep inside. Her fur is softer than you imagined, silky yet prickly. Your brush sometimes got stuck on the fur which makes Suicune yelps in pain. Her red eyes glared deeply at you.

"Hey!!! Watch where you're brushing!!!" Suicune barked, "One more of mistake and removing my paws from your rump will be the least of your worries."

That soul-piercing glare...... It sends a shiver through your body and is enough to make you double your efforts at cleaning. When all visible dirt are removed, you took the a small ladle from the pail and pour the water on her body and brushed a little harder. The water carried with them all the sweats and grime accumulated over long periods. The most challenging place to clean are her paws because they have a lot of gaps and crevices which are difficult to reach. That girl is either bent on making my job hard or she has a passion of making males suffer. Well at least she didn't order me to brush her nether region. I'd rather her punish me than be made to scrub 'there.'


An interesting effect begins to manifest on Suicune. Her coat glowed brilliantly where it has been cleaned. It's reminiscent of stars and auroras. The beautiful glow mesmerized you at times. You complimented Suicune on how beautiful her fur looks when they're cleaned.

"It's nice to hear some praises after a rough day, human. The lustrous effect on my coat is the physical embodiment of my role as the Guardian of the North. Usually it'll glow even brighter under a full moon when I'm recharging my power but I can't afford the luxury of that at this time. It's also the reason why you need to scrub me; I can't stay clean without a lake or moonlight."

It made sense to you: Suicune represents the northern light and the forest. Legends said that she's responsible for keeping lakes crystal clear around the world and enacts punishment upon those that fouled them. One ancient account even go as far to say that she will find a human who truly cares for nature and make him one with her.



It took you longer than you anticipated but Suicune was completely clean and free from any dirt.

"Hmmm...not as good as I expected it to be but still an adequate effort for a starter," Suicune said.

You are a little put down by Suicune's comment but you are relieved to know that you are finally free to go.

"Alright human, I hope you learned your lessons today. Let's go and take some rest."

Both of you head back to the bed chamber and settled in your respective beds. A question you've always wanted to ask Suicune popped up in your head as you are tucking in the mattress.

"Suicune, I don't know if it's okay for you to answer this question I've been thinking about. Have you ever thought about the reason Dialga is attracted to you? I mean like the dynamic behind it," you asked quietly.

An unreadable expression briefly formed upon Suicune face. Her eyes sternly focused on yours. You are afraid that you might have asked the wrong question. The Pokemon marched in your direction. This can't be good. You squeezed your eyes shut and prepared for the pains. Seconds passed but no punishment materialized. Instead, you only felt a paw upon your shoulder. You opened your eyes and saw Suicune looking at you with a faint smile.

"Nope. I don't and I'm not interested in finding out. It's probably for some odd reasons. Dialga is a very enigmatic and there's a lot, excluding those fantasies, that we'll never find out," the Pokemon answered casually.

"I've been with Dialga for a little over a week and he's already upsetting me with his recent attitudes. It's hard to imagine how you dealt with him for so long and yet still remain sane," you chuckled.

"Barely," Suicune added, "His presence alone makes me nauseous."

"I feel for you, Suicune," you said sympathetically.

"You know, human. I have to admit, I initially neutral about him. He was almost likeable back then. His tricks then were pretty playful if you're willing to accept his definition of fun. I never really disliked him.....until he started receiving all these new powers from Arceus."

"Arceus?" you inquired.

"The Legendary One who created the Pokemon world and all tangible things. Dialga is his protege. After receiving more temporal powers from Arceus, Dialga kinda went over his own head and started testing his power out on everyone in a show of superiority, especially me. He always tried to find the opportunity to teleport me to another dimension to 'proclaim' his love and flaunt his powers. I truly wonder what was going through Arceus' mind when he accepted Dialga."

"For a powerful Legendary, Arceus really screwed up on this one."

"All thanks to him, I avoided Dialga at all cost. But he messaged me endlessly and it drove me nut. Eventually I just ignored him. That went on for decades until that message you popped out at me and here we are, trapped in the very thing I despised the most," Suicune gritted through her teeth.

"...It's all my fault that you and Raikou are dragged in this quagmire," you sighed.

"What, human? There's no need to feel bad about it,", Suicune said, "We're in this together now."

"Right.....and don't forget what will happen to us the next morning once Dialga restarts."

*yawn* "We'll figure that out tomorrow. It's sorta late right now, let's get some sleep, okay?"

"Alright, let's just hope we make it to tomorrow."

"G'night, human. Rest assured, I know how to deal with this prick."

As you made yourself comfortable in your bed, you thought about Suicune's behavior lately. Although she's acting all commanding and domineering to you and Raikou, you are beginning to like her more.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Cleaning Suicune

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You woke up, and stretched. You looked around, recognizing the place. Suicune was still asleep, Raikou was nowhere in sight, and nothing around was moving, which you supposed meant Dialga was still asleep.

Once you're fully awake, you try to wake up Suicune.You do it carefully, trying not to anger her. Thankfully, nothing bad happens to you, and soon she is ready for the day. -"What will be done today, Suicune?"-

-"I'm not done yet here. But once I'm done, we're getting out"-

-"Any plan?"-

Suicune only smiled enigmatically. -"You'll see. Go get Raikou and some food for us three. I'll be going to the brain. Don't take too long"-

The legendary and you exited the room, and parted ways. You walked around for a while, trying to think where Raikou could have gone. Dialga's body is pretty big, so he could be practically anywhere. You search for him around, but you can't find a trace of him. Where did he go? Could Dialga have awoken at some point, and punished Raikou without he being able to notify Suicune or you? You don't want to think that is what happened.

You go look for food, trying to calm down. Before you left the room, Suicune gave you instructions to get to the room where Raikou had found the food last time. You enter, and quickly see some sort of storage, divided in different types. You take what you remember Raikou had brought the last day, and went to the brain.

Suicune was already near the same platform from yesterday. Looking around, you see everything is inactive, but one of the screens shows that Dialga is almost fully rested. -"I see you got the food, but where is Raikou?"- Suicune asks, with a hint of annoyance.

You leave the food on the floor, and inform Suicune about how you can't find Raikou. Her annoyance seems to be gone when you're done talking. -"Ugh, did he get lost? Possibly. I'll try to find him in these screens, but it'll take a while"

-"Meanwhile what? If Dialga finds him before you..."-

-"Stop worrying! I'll continue where I left yesterday. You start searching for Raikou. Think of where he would like to be, think of what he would be interested in. I'm willing to bet you'll find him if you try to think like him"-

You nod, and take your portion of the food. While you step out, you hear some sounds behind you. You suppose it is Dialga waking up, and Suicune starting to control him. You decide to focus on your searching of Raikou. You're not too worried at first, but the more you walk, the more you hope that Raikou didn't get in trouble somewhere in Dialga's body. Who knows what that legendary could be doing in some point of the dragon's body.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Next Day

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The search for Raikou proved to be much more difficult than you had anticipated. It was further compounded by the fact that you've technically conspired against Dialga and asking him for help would be out of the question. With Suicune at least, you won't have to worry about the Temporal Pokemon coming after you for your betrayal. The potential comeuppances is what sent a chill down your body. Why is Dialga the one with overreaching metaphysical power? And why did I even trust him in the first place, especially after snooping on me with his 'mind-reading' software and trackers? When I meet this Arceus mentor guy, I will "politely" inform him of Dialga's power abuse., you thought.

When the frustration with Dialga subsided, concerns for Raikou is at the forefront again. You tried your best recounting every last memory you have of the Pokemon from you first meeting to last night when Suicune sent him on night watch duty. Nothing seemed out of the ordinary from his behavior. To be honest, Raikou and Suicune seems to get along pretty well so far despite him being more of a follower. You tried convincing yourself that nothing bad has happened to him; he just probably wander off to explore places like the curious nerd he is.

If that's what he's up to, then Suicune is within her right to freeze up his balls for the panic he has caused. You resigned yourself to the inevitable long search. There's just one little problem...Huge portions of Dialga remained unexplored and, frankly, dangerous. There will be obstacles, mazes, and perhaps even surveillance apparatuses that are still active in here. You carefully continue down the path, wishing that your mission could end soon.

An hour into your search, you are now far off from the brain section and no idea where you're heading. You've entered countless grand corridors and chambers, finding nothing but featureless steel walls and neon blue strips to luminate your way. The occasional rumble and tumble of Dialga's organs made you stopped and hide; fearful that he might have caught Suicune and started looking for you. The rooms are filled with server-like devices that goes toward the ceiling. The hums generated by the machines echoed loudly. Pipes and wires are interconnected everywhere, transferring data or body fluids out to the main corridor to a location ahead. There is no indication of what these machinery are for but they must be vital to Dialga's body functions. You moved through several more halls of the same things when the passage opens into a larger chamber where a large towering monolith stood. It has a dark obsidian-like edifice and runes scattered across its face. The wires from the server rooms runs directly into it in thick bundles. The most relieving sight is that of the elusive Electric Pokemon before the entrance of the complex, seemingly mesmerized by the sheer size of the structure.

"Raikou!!! Thank goodness I found you," you called out.

The Pokemon spun around and looked at you with a grin on his face.

"You found me! Oh my, oh my, oh my....You're not going to believe what Dialga has stored here! This is something we gotta tell Suicune," Raikou chirped, ignoring the concerned look on your face.

"You know, I've spent hours looking for you. At least you could say something along the line of 'thank you'. And Suicune won't be happy when she discovered you wander off without her permission. You do know what will happen when you displeased her, right?"

"Oh, come on. Suicune won't do that. She's always the one to threaten me but never actually carry them out. Besides, Dialga was completely crashed the whole night and I got bored from watching those blank screens and sleeping is totally not my thing."

"Ooookay...So what led you here?"

"Nothing really. Random stammering around all night in the bows of Dialga and here I am, discovering Dialga's deepest secret."

"So what's this thing anyway?"

Raikou pointed toward a sign on the monolith's wall:

"Suicune Center- Everything there is to know about Suicune. Everything!"

The sign's emphasis on "everything" caused an uncomfortable feeling to swell between you and Raikou.

"I know Dialga is weird but this one sure takes the cake. Whatever is in there will be worse than that dating simulator," you said with apprehension.

"He's gone way beyond that already," Raikou added, "At this rate, he'll be mind controlling her in no time."

"That aside, we better tell Suicune first before we go in. I don't wanna imagine what a week-long servitude would end up like."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Searching for Raikou

choices: You decide to go with Raikou
You decide to go with Suicune
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Raikou walks to the entrance and looks insider curiously, aching to enter. Obviously he let up to you the task to call Suicune. You sigh and manage to contact Suicune through the net. You tell her that you found Raikou, but that also he found that Center structure. Suicune is really not happy to know that such thing existed. She commanded you and Raikou to explore the Center and inform her of your findings, to "decide how much she would punish Dialga that day". More than what she had planned originally, that is.

-"Let's go in"- you tell Raikou. He enters before you, and you follow slowly, unsure of what you could find inside.

You two arrive to a lobby, with a huge and incredibly detailed statue in Suicune looking upwards. She looked majestic in that statue, and approaching, you could swear you were able to see every hair of her fur, sculpted. Raikou looks at the entrances to several areas. -"According to the signs, this place is like a very detailed encyclopedia of Suicune. Maybe it isn't as bad as we thought!"-

-"We won't know until we check in depth"- you remind him, while entering the first hall you found. There are drawers filled with videotapes. Lots and lots of them. There is also a screen, although not very big. This place was possible not a place you were intended to visit. If Dialga found out you had entered here...what had he say he would do, again? You already forgot. You put one of the tapes in a slot under the screen, and see it turn on.

You see Suicune going through her duties a a Legendary. You're impressed to see the amount of power she harnesses, but Raikou seems to be more focused on how Dialga recorded Suicune. You two watch for a while, then put another tape. It is the same thing, just on a different day and with different activities, but it is clear it is still her duties. After testing several tapes, you two come to the conclusion that this room is focused on Suicune and her powers as a Legendary.

The next room you visit is full of colorful diagrams about her powers. This is more focused on the workings behind them, something you would expect more from Raikou, than Dialga. -"This is some amazing information, human. What I wouldn't do to have this stuff?"-

-"Hopefully not the same Dialga does"- you reply. Raikou isn't really amused with the implication he would.

After that, you visit a third room. This one is filled with small structures, put over pedestals. There are plaques near, with text. You approach one. It seems to be some sort of mechanism that opened a trap on the floor. You can't identify what is on the bottom of the trap, but it seems mud. Under it you read the description. It is a detailed narration of how Dialga used it on Suicune. It doesn't take long before you figure out what the meaning of this room is. It is filled with the many pranks Dialga has ever done on Suicune.

You spend a long time taking a marvel on Dialga's inventive. A lot of those pranks were pretty detailed, and very few ended being embarrassing for Suicune. At least Dialga had a good trait in his interactions with Suicune. Not that it forgave everything else.

After that, you two decide to end the exploration. There are many rooms left in the center, but sooner or later you would find something very bad for Dialga. So you call Suicune and tell her that there is nothing to worry about in there. You tell her it is mostly general stuff, and thankfully, she believes you. Raikou and you start to go back to the brain to see the last stuff Suicune would do with Dialga's body.

While you're walking, Raikou asks you something you didn't think.

-"What will you do after we're gone?"-

You shudder at the thought of what Dialga could do to you. He certainly wouldn't be happy with you.Who knows what he would do, but you also had some matters to discuss, if he dared to punish you. You could maintain control, and you tell Raikou that.

-"Why don't you come with Suicune or me, then? We both aren't going to be around for long, but you could live with one of us. We'll return to normal size, but if you don't want to, then come with one of us"-

That isn't a bad idea. It could be fun. You take a decision right there. You'll go with one of them while you settle things with Dialga. But who will you stay with after you get out of Dialga's body along with them?
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Suicune Center

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The option of leaving Dialga sounds more and more attractive to you. Deep down, your view of the Pokemon has greatly deteriorated over the past few weeks. Everything from his intrusive thought surveillance to his unsettling obsession with Suicune made him more of a disturbing, out-of-control guardian. The fact that he could control time and space adds several dimensions of creepiness to it. You could only imagine what else he had done to you without your consent. Besides that, Dialga seems to be actively avoiding your question about how he plans to restore you. When asked, he always responded by saying he is searching for the solution as fast as possible. Frankly, it never looks like he's serious about it. He's most likely making an excuse to keep you as a test subject just to learn more about humans. A hidden agenda on the Pokemon's part, perhaps. It's all starting to make sense. The body scanning, the abrupt and unwelcomed thoughts, and even the powers Dialga granted you are all one big scheme to see how you would react. In your opinion, that just further demonstrate that this 'demigod' is just playing you for fool.

You weighed your options and made a decision.

"I'll come with you, Raikou," you answered the Electric Pokemon, "Perhaps you would be a better host for me in light of the recent discoveries about Dialga's snooping practices. Between all of this, I just about had enough of him."

"Excellent. We'll tell Suicune about it and see what we could do for you," Raikou smiled gently, "Once we're out of here, we've got all the time we need to figure out a solution."

"But how exactly can we make it out of here without Dialga knowing? Once Suicune leaves the brain he'll regain full control and I doubt he would be happy about us."

"Unfortunately, that's the trickier part of the escape. That and the various security features in here are what we have to deal with. It won't be easy."

"Didn't Suicune deactivated all surveillance equipment in here?"

"No, that's only about half of it. You see, when I explored around this morning, I noticed that Dialga's body has several layers of safeguards that are independent of his consciousness and control. The security apparatus ranges from basic antivirus sensors to encrypted password entry/exit processor. It similar to the autoimmune system of organic beings. Their job is to prevent anything malicious from entering and data from exiting without authorization. There is also a set time window where Dialga's body with perform routine scans to check the system for alteration and corrections. Effectively, without some kind of hack 'key' or computational error, we're out of luck."

"Can't we figure out a way to send a virus or at least glitch his system? Dialga's a giant walking computer after all," you asked.

"Not possible. Dialga isn't some cheap Pokedex that you can modify at will. He's more a sentient supercomputer armed with metaphysical properties. The best electrical glitch I can come up with will be mere parlor tricks."

"Shit...Let's hope that Suicune has better ideas up her sleeves, Raikou."
___

Meanwhile, Suicune is back at having fun controlling Dialga, making the dragon do all sorts of silly gestures and walking. Suicune smiled as she felt triumph for the first time over the Pokemon she despised the most. On the display screen Dialga is still trying his best to persuade Suicune out of controlling him. Offers of forgiveness and cessation of unwanted advances did not shake the Aurora Pokemon's resolve.

>>Come on, Suicune. There is absolutely no need to go down this route. Just step away from the control and I'll give you several Ancient Power upgrades you wanted so much. We can resolve this in a calm and mature way. After that, we can just forget about this whole thing and move on.

"Nope, proposal denied. Just shut up already. You've been parroting the same thing for like an hour already and I'm getting sick and tired of it," Suicune said annoyingly.

>>Aren't you at all interested? These powers could make your reign much easier. I'm sure that Entei would be impressed if you show him the abilities I'll give you.

"Still a big NO. The thing I'll be more interested in is whether or not your dick will stand a second impact which I'm more than happy to give you if you don't stop," the Pokemon barked.

>>Still being a mean girl, huh? I'm really hurt by your remark. And that ramming did a load to my 'pride'. I'm offering an easy way but still you refused to take it?

"I know your bait-and-switch all too well, Dialga. Like last time when you tricked into an ice cave that you claim contains energy crystals. Rather than crystals, I found you once again pestering me to no ends. I'm glad that Entei came and gave you a whipping otherwise there is no knowing what you would do to me. Perhaps, that perverted dating simulation is a dress rehearsal. Am I right?"

>>...Let's not talk about that, shall we? Before you ask, I know that game that you're up to. You are trying to take the human with you. No way I'm allowing that! Now, back to the topic for you to relinquish control of me.

"This conversation is getting us nowhere, Dialga. There is no purpose in continuing it. No chance I'm letting you take advantage of me or the human again. So you can save your batteries and just let me have my fun."

>>You are really getting on my nerves now, Suicune! Step away from the damn control!!!

"What's the matter? Can't stand the taste of your own medicine, Dialga. You have no rights to complain. You had this one coming a long time," Suicune smirked.

>>You're taking this as a FUCKING joke, Suicune?!! If you were ever a program file on my system, you know what I'm gonna do to you? I'm gonna quarantine you within several encrypted file layers, slowly run all thinkable 'torture programs' on you, ram you several times through a firewall before I DELETE what's left of your pathetic codes from a miserable existence!

"Sure sure. And how do you plan to do that, huh? ...Oh I remember, you can't. Because you don't own me, idiot!" Suicune said sardonically, "So much for the peace offer."

>>...... Words....cannot express how much I hate you right now. >: - (

"I could've said the same thing about you."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You decide to go with Raikou

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You started walking towards the brain. It was going to be a long walk, so you intended to discuss the plan while you walked. Hopefully the escape could start as soon as you got up there.

Raikou set for you and Suicune a place to be able to talk. You started.

-"We need to escape, but it won't be easy. There are many ways out of Dialga's body, but chances are that we won't be able to just walk through them. Any ideas?

-"I propose to knock Dialga out, then we take that as a chance to escape. I can make him fall pretty easily"-

-"Even with him unconscious, there are several defenses that we can't disable"-Raikou added.

-"If Dialga is unconscious, then he can't actively try to stop our escape, and we'll have better probabilities of being far when he is awake. I say we put that in the plan"- you proposed. There were no objections.

-"There are other ways to bypass the defenses. Apparently, the most basic functions aren't as protected. Suicune and I entered disguised as food. As much as I dislike it, we could come out disguised as.."-

-"Stop talking. Right now."- Suicune interrupted -"Mark it as Plan Z, but there is no way I go through that experience willingly"-

-"I think that we should use a way out that is close to the brain, so we don't waste time. There are several options. Which one could be the most unprotected?"- you ask.

-"We can rule out the mouth. I can't see how we could open it from inside"-

-"If some sort of command from Dialga is needed, then what could we do? No matter which way we choose, then we would still be stuck"-Raikou pointed.

."I can deal with that from here. If there is a password, surely it is about me, or about how great he is"- Suicune was confident.

-"Raikou and I could go ahead through the chosen path and check any obstacles. If we find any, we could notify Suicune, and she tries to deactivate it. Then once the path is clear, I could stop time so she can reunite with us. It'll be only for a short amount of time, though. I don't have full control over this time stuff"-

-"After we're out then we'll have to run. At least we're fast, so despite our actual size, it shouldn't be a problem, while Dialga is unconscious"-

-"The human will have to ride one of us"- Suicune added.

-"I'll carry him. The human is going to stay with me after I return to my normal size. I'll leave him in a safe place while you and I go and get ourselves back to normal"- Raikou replied

-"I think that is all there is to discuss"- Suicune finished. You agreed. It seemed like a pretty simple plan, but one never knew what problems there could be.

Raikou and you finally arrived the brain, and looked for Suicune. She was still taunting Dialga, and getting more angered responses from him. Once she noticed your presence, she nodded. She was getting ready to knock out Dialga.

-"What path will we choose?"- Raikou whispered. You meditated the options. You could think four possibilities in the head. Which one could work? You made your decision.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Discussing an Escape Plan

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
"Hmmm....going through Dialga's mouth isn't feasible," you said, "So we're left with the option of either going through the ears, the snout or, less likely, the narrow crevice in the eye socket. I'll say the snout is our best bet."

Your thought is interrupted by a loud "WHAT?"

"Can't we choose somewhere else to make our exit?" Suicune asked with obvious disgust, "NO way I'm going through there. I can only imagine how filthy it'll make all of us."

"It really makes no difference," you replied, "Even if we went through the ears or eye sockets, contact with body fluids, grim, and the likes is inevitable. We might have to get a little dirty here. We got choices to make or are you willing to be forever a resident in Dialga?"

"Agreed. The human has a point. No better alternatives I could think of, Suicune," Raikou added.

"Forever a resident in here? But I.....no........"

Suicune imagined herself several years from now. She is still trapped in Dialga all by herself. The human and Raikou had long been banished to dimensional limbo in perpetuity for their foolish attempt to escape a Temporal Pokemon. Dialga has remade his mechanical innards into a gigantic residence solely for Suicune but it feels more like a prison for the Aurora Pokemon. Since control has been restored that fateful day, Dialga followed through on his promise of sweet revenge and made Suicune run all sorts of services in his body. Most of her time is spent on making metalwork replacement parts, fixing errors, and watching the creation and destruction of the cosmic as Dialga transverse time space. Days are often long and slow and perhaps, Dialga deliberately made it so. Escape at this point is impossible for her; her entire brain, thoughts, movements, and power were closely watched by Dialga's internal computer. Many evenings, Dialga would take Suicune out on a date in various computer-generated environments that he thinks suit the mood. On occasion, he would simulate Suicune's forest home to cheer her up. But his clumsiness and unrealistic expectations about her has only gotten worse since. A pre-written script sometimes provided the 'story' that Dialga has written for her to act out, some of them with intimate endings....


Suicune cringed at the thought of the possible consequences for her.

"Okay, fine. But once we get out of here, I'll get back to you on this, human. You owe me one!"

She gave him a quick nod in acknowledgement and prepared for what will be the grand finale she had longed for her whole life. Now, Suicune needs to find a suitable spot to give Dialga just the right force to his head. Even with a metallic skull, a blunt force trauma should do the job of rendering her out cold. The Pokemon spied a thick tree trunk directly in her line of sight. The tree looks solid and wide enough to handle the force of impact. Perfect, she thought.

"Hold on tight, boys," Suicune warned.

She bared her trademark smirk and rammed down on the control at full speed. The entire room jerked and tumbled, knocking you and Raikou off your feet. Suicune held on tight to the floor with her claws and watch the screens intently. The trunk gets larger and closer by the second. Then... a large slam reverberated in the chamber. Everything became a blur.

>>AHHHHHHH NOT AGAIN........DAMN YOU, SUICUNE!!!!!!!! ~~~~~ @ER##46810& System Fail___

As the rumble subsides, you gradually recovered from the impact and stand up to see that all of Dialga's screens are displaying error messages. Suicune has succeeded.

"Congratulation Suicune! Dialga will not be able to recover until 11 hours from now," Raikou exclaimed, "No time to idle, let's get out of here now before more trouble comes our way."

The three of you quickly left the the Control Room to find the way to the snout. The impact seems to have damaged a lot of the electronic doors, forcing them wide open for you to easily walk through. Electric sparks are shooting out of the ceilings and side panels at random points like a short-circuited computer underwater. Suicune and Raikou are dashing as fast as they could to check on every side tunnels and chambers, sensing the exit solely by intuition. Your mind is completely focused on finding the exit, only momentarily interrupted when you try to catch your breath.

A couple flight of stairways down, the nostrils were located. As you imagined, the passage is dripping with glowing mucus and boulder-sized dirt on walls and the floor. Blue sparks jumping off the mucus indicates that they're electrified. That's something original, you thought. You warned the two Pokemon about it and carefully transverse the passage. You all carefully made your way through the passage, stepping only on areas that are dry and moving your heads to dodge the gunk dripping from above. The end of the tunnel is guarded by a single working security station. You can see lights underneath the door. When you activated the station, it requests a password and gave you a hint:

A pair of rubies that captures my soul amid rainbow hues. I see my smiling reflection in them as you welcome my lips with a blissful tongue.


"Goodness. I was right. His password really is me," Suicune muttered under her breath.

You typed: suicune........Access granted.

The lock opened and revealed sunlight. Suicune and Raikou were the first to step out, relishing the fresh air and warmth of summer. You remained behind at the security station to type one final message for Dialga.


Dialga,

It's time for you to realize something. I know of what you did behind my back. Raikou and Suicune told me everything. All those thought-monitoring is pretty fun, isn't it? I don't find it amusing at all. You never intended to return me to normal. Instead, you kept me as a test subject for your weird purpose. I strongly object to your practice. Most of all, I find your treatment of Suicune is be the worst. It's clear the girl never wants you. That's why I'm leaving you for good. Good Bye and don't try to find me. Maybe Arceus would love to hear your story.

Your Former Captive

p.s. thanks for the temporal power, they'll come in handy for me :P




You smiled as you head for freedom without looking back.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Finally Escaping

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The moment you stepped outside, you shielded your eyes. The natural light was a welcome thing for you. Once you got used to it, you looked towards the ground. Raikou and Suicune had already descended, and now were waiting for you. You didn't even look back to the cave you had came from, and started to descend through Dialga's skin. It was a slow task for you, but soon you managed to step on the solid ground.

-"Good! Now let's get out of here"- Suicune said, impatiently. Raikou told you to ride on his back, and once you were properly secured, the Pokemon started running. There was silence for a good while, until you asked something that had started to bother you.

-"How will you two return to normal size?"-

-"It's complicated. Maybe it could work for you too? How did you get shrunk?"-

-"Palkia did it. It was an accident"- you replied.

-"Oh...then it won't work. It'd be better if Palkia fixed your problem. I'll talk to him, don't worry, I'll deal with it"- Raikou said.

Soon you and the Legendaries arrived to a forest. There was less speed now, due to a lot of obstacles. After wandering for a while, Suicune approached a hollow section of a tree. -"The human should hide here while we go to get our normal sizes back. We'll go faster without him on your back"-

You pointed that you were fine with it. Once they made sure you were well hidden, they got ready to leave. -"Thank you for everything, human. Don't fall inside Dialga again"- she said before leaving. Raikou told you he would be back as soon as possible.

You spent around half an hour hidden, hoping that your soon-to-be-host would return soon. You finally hear his voice outside, and see a yellow toe outside. -I'm back, human! You can come out"-

You step out of your hideout, and you instantly feel overwhelmed by Raikou's normal size. You had gotten used to see him as more or less your same size, but now, despite him being three times smaller than Dialga, he was now humongous to you.

-"Are you ready to come with me? I have prepared the most basic stuff for you"-

You tell him that you're ready. Raikou lowers his head and opens his mouth. You can't avoid recoiling for a moment, but you gather courage and enter his mouth. It takes you a moment, but you manage to get on his tongue, but before you walk towards the throat, Raikou talks again. -"We should start moving again. The further we're from Dialga, the better. Hold on tight, human"-

You Reacted quickly, and grasp as much tongue as you can. You could swear you could see the tastebuds, once another reminder of your size. Then Raikou started running, full speed. If you hadn't grabbed the tongue as strong as you could, you would have flown to the back of Raikou's throat.

You don't know for how long you held on the tongue. While you were doing that, several thoughts crossed your mind. Raikou said he would talk to Palkia. It kind of worried you, but you calmed down thinking that Raikou was capable of dealing with it. And even if Palkia gave a solution...was it really needed for you to return to normal in that moment? You were surprised to notice that you were interested to explore Raikou's insides. Unlike Dialga, your new host was a fully organic Pokemon. Surely there were many differences betwee Dialga's body and Raikou's body.

Your host stopped running. -"We're pretty far now. We can relax. Are you okay, human?"- You reply that you're okay. Raikou starts talking in a more excited tone now. -"I can't believe a human will live inside me! I hope I can make it interest for you"-

-"Surely you will"-

-"Great! Now why don't you go down and start your journey inside me? You know the path. Once you get to my stomach you should be able to go to other places. Sorry if there is a mess in there"-

You turn around and face Raikou's throat. You felt a growing excitement too. You stood up and started walking to what would be the beginning of your stay inside your new host.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: A Safe Place to Wait

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Near the end of Raikou's tongue, you looked at the deep throat the leads down toward your new home. Even in the darkness, you can still make out muscles and fleshes squirm and contracts as warm, moist air rushed against you. A giant uvula above dangled in the strong wind like a pendulum within a well-tuned clock. You remained in place only to feel Raikou's heavy breathing threatening several times to knock you off balance but you luckily secured your feet between the taste buds.The prospect of falling down yet another dark chasm no longer really scares you. In fact, you are more intrigued by the organic nature of your new host and what you might find down there. Raikou felt you remaining on his tongue for the last 10 minutes. The Electric Pokemon reassured you that living with him would be a remarkably different experience and promised you that he won't do anything invasive without you agreeing to it. You appreciate his straightforwardness which is a vast improvement over your last accommodator which you would rather forget soon. That Pokemon is now a mere afterthought as you prepared to make your leap.

You leaped off the ledge and began to free fall in the dark.

The fall isn't as bad as you remembered but the feeling of your stomach turning is still a nauseous one. But there is no way in alleviating that this time seeing that Raikou lacks that ability to slow down time to reduce your imminent impact in his stomach. Within a snap second, you mentally smacked yourself in the head when you recalled that you still have some temporal power left over from Dialga. You started focusing your mind and try to access the power that is stored within it. It took some efforts for you to concentrate amid the disorientating direction and nausea but you managed to slow yourself down slightly. By your own calculation, you're still falling too fast to make a comfortable landing. You know it's too late to try again as you swiftly sailed past the opening to the stomach and toward the welcoming pool of stomach acids. Brace for impact.

SPLASH!!!

You felt warm liquids washing over your face and a sharp acidic odor invaded your nostrils. Your tongue caught a few drops of the acids which made your mouth pucker up in disgust. You flailed your arms wildly in an attempt to find the right side up. When you did emerge on the surface, you are once again assaulted by the smell of acids around you. You held onto your breath and swam toward the edge of the stomach which fortunately contains a dock of some kind. You climbed up and spent several minutes trying to remove any bits of food clinging to your body. The dock gave you a general view of the stomach which is filled with unrecognizable pieces of a previous meal. Behind you are a dozen or so closed openings that will soon be yours to explore.

"Heh...heh...Sorry about the mess," Raikou said sheepishly, "I guess I shouldn't have eaten that much for breakfast."

You shot a glare toward the source of the Pokemon's voice.

"Very funny," you deadpanned, "Aren't you supposed to warn me about this?"

"I thought I warned you on your way in but you probably missed it in your excitement."

"Couldn't you have drained out your stomach first before allowing me to fall into some soggy remnants of a Berry pie?" you tried to say while breathing as little of the air as possible.

"As much as I liked to, I can't control most of my body functions the way Dialga did it. Everything works the natural way in my digestive system. Again, I'm sorry about it. Please don't be mad at me," Raikou said in an attempt to placate you.

"...I'm not really mad at you for this, Raikou. It's just that in addition to ruining my only clothes, I now smell like a person who hadn't bathed in a week."

"Oh, come on. You don't have to hide you feelings from me, you know. I can feel your frustration lingering beneath that veneer of calm. I'll see what I can do to make up for you."

"Right. Doing something about this smell first and my clothes will be a good place to begin."

"Point taken."

A sphincter behind you opened up to reveal a set of stairs for you to take.

"Take the stairs up. I have prepared the appropriate things you will need in your room."

"Thanks. I appreciate that," you said, "And by the way, you should slow down on all those berry pies or you'll likely get 'thunder thighs'."

"I wouldn't say that again if I were you," Raikou shuddered.

"Why not? 'Cause the term can be used literally for you?" you jested.

"Nope. It just reminds me of this one time where a Luxray friend of mine used the same word to describe Suicune, right in front of her. The guy was flirting with her and attempted to ask her out. He was far less obnoxious than Dialga but she still take kindly to him using that term. He got all his electricity knocked out of him."

"Ouch."

"He kinda deserved it anyway for being foolish and oblivious to the meaning of 'thunder thighs'. Maybe he thought it's some compliment used for an attractive electric Pokemon. Lucky for you, Suicune isn't around here; She's keeping it low for the time."

"Wait! She can't be all alone out there. I bet Dialga is feeling mighty pissed right now. At any moment he wakes up, she'll be the first he'll be looking for. I can imagine the murderous look in his eyes as he stormed every corner of the world, searching for his prey. Poor Suicune didn't know what coming for here."

"Don't you worry! I told her about my worries which are similar to yours. After much persuasion, Suicune decided to remain small and guess where she is right now?"

".....no way. You're also keeping her in your body, aren't you?" you asked.

"Yup," Raikou answered as matter of factly, "The least-likely place that Dialga would look."

"Looks like we'll be sticking together after all. Alright then, show me the way up, Raikou."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou's Insides

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You started going upstairs, through the path Raikou had opened for you. From time to time there were other branches, but Raikou always closed them and led you through the right one. After a good while, when you were starting to get tired, you arrived to a chamber, where you found two odd mounds. You approached one, and found that it was soft and cozy. You guessed that it was going to be your bed.

-"This room is pretty empty, don't you think?"- you say, looking around. Besides the lumps that would be the beds, there was nothing else, just two doors. You had entered through one of them, while the other was unexplored so far.

-"I said I only had the very basics ready"- Raikou reminded you.

-"Where's Suicune?"-

-"She is looking for a place for her to relax. You should go meet with her later"- he suggested. You nodded, and walked to the other door. Behind it you found a big pool of what seemed to be clear water. It was a nice sight, as you really wanted to take a bath. You took all the dirty clothes quickly, and entered the pool. The water was cold, but it was pretty relaxing. You let yourself sink until you were fully covered.

You held your breath for a minute, letting yourself be fully soaked by the water, and when you couldn't resist more you resurfaced. You swam around, enjoying the pool. Staying inside Raikou was going to be a good experience.

When you judged you were finally gotten rid of any traces of the acids and the bad smell, you exited the pool. Raikou notified you that he had left a clean set of clothes inside your 'bed'. You picked up your dirty clothes and saw a chute on the floor. You threw them in it, supposing it was a toilet or similar. Raikou confirmed that it was, when he asked you why you had done that.

-"I could try to retrieve them for you, if it was an accident'"- he offered.

-"I'm not wearing them again. I didn't like them that much, though, don't worry"- You reentered your room, and found the clothes that you had been offered. It was a yellow and black simplistic design, with a stripes design. After getting dressed, you took a moment to evaluate your first hour inside Raikou. It had been a relatively nice start, leaving aside the unwanted plunge into the stomach content, and the prospect of living with Suicune for a while was actually appealing.

-"Are you ready? Suicune is over at the Leisure Room, let's call it that. It's the room with the big platform in middle, it's near your actual location. So far it's empty besides that, but in the future it should have ways for you two to be entertained"- he indicated.

You went to meet Suicune. You peeked through several entrances, until you found the right one. There was Suicune, sitting on the platform, clearly waiting for you. You stepped inside
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Up the Stairs

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The Leisure Room, as Raikou named it, was a fairly large room. The ample spacing is enough to accommodate your old bedroom several times over. Memories of your old room and stuffs you did in your free time reminded you how long you've been removed from your old life. Though, admittedly, things are more interesting now, you kind of missed your home. You placed your thoughts aside and surveyed the room for more details. The velvety walls are colored pale blue to match a light yellow carpeting which feels like thick fur. Lighting is provided by the ceiling itself which gives off a soft yellow ambiance. By the look alone, you could tell that this chamber is designed for comfort and Raikou did quite a good job at it. Other than the center platform, the room is devoid of anything else excluding you and the Aurora Pokemon.

Suicune heard faint footsteps and took notice of your entrance into the room. She turned her head toward you and smiled.

"Welcome back. Good to see ya again. Come on over."

She beckoned for you come closer. You complied and walked toward the Pokemon. When you got to her, an indecipherable expression found its way onto her muzzle. Suicune's eyes scanned you several times, scrutinizing every inch of your body. Upon her fourth head to toe scan, she placed a paw over her mouth as a light chuckle came out.

"That's some cute Raikou costume you've got there, human," Suicune complimented, "I must say that you need to substantially improve your sense of design when it comes to imitating a Pokemon's appearance. Raikou's gonna have a laugh out of that."

"These aren't mine," you corrected her, "Raikou let me have these after he ruined my old clothes with a stomach full of Berry pies. My goodness, he sure has a voluptuous appetite. You know, it took me several dunks in the pool to remove that horrid smell from my body. As kitschy as the designs are, it's still better than no clothes at all."

"Well, Raikou got lots of improvements to make then. It still looks cute on you though," Suicune giggled, "I always wonder why humans always insist on wearing clothes. It's not like we don't know the details of each others body," Suicune commented.

"It's more of a modesty thing among humans, Suicune. You see, being without clothing is frowned upon in our society. You'll be considered weird at best. It's analogous to walking around without your fur," you said as you pulled the long sleeves of your shirt to make a point.

"Me, without my fur? That's sound awful! I wouldn't want to be caught in those situations."

"Our clothing is also used to obscure our more intimate part of the body," you continued, "Having those parts visible will be viewed as making advances for each gender."

"Well, there's no other humans around here so there's no one to judge you. And clothes aren't really useful for Pokemon unless they're attending some beauty contests. I wouldn't feel a bit uncomfortable if you're without clothing. Seems more natural to me."

"Wait, are you suggesting that I go naked in here? No no no. I couldn't just do that. It just feels so.....wrong for me," you exclaimed.

"What? I didn't say that. You're getting the wrong idea here, dude," Suicune said with a light blush, "I'm speaking from my perspective as a Pokemon on human stuffs."

"Heh heh heh sorry. So how exactly did you made it into Raikou without getting all drenched in acids like me?"

A light frown formed on Suicune's face.

"I had it just as worse. Raikou didn't even warn me about his stomach content. I plunged head first into that stuff and nearly got sent into his digestive tracts. As for the smell, if it could linger that long on your skin, just imagine its effect on fur."

Suicune shot a look toward the ceiling as if to catch Raikou's attention.

"Did he have any idea of what he did to me? Why didn't he warn poor little Suicune that she's about to be drenched in his breakfast?" Suicune said with mock melodrama, "I thought I would lost my fur to the acid. Oh the horror..."

"I'm sorry to hear about your misfortune," you said, "Hopefully, Raikou would be more careful next time around."

"He better be! One more mistake and I'll be more than happy to do a rerun of Dialga on him," the Aurora Pokemon growled.

"I think he'll get your message, Suicune. What you did back there is more than enough a deterrent," you assured the Pokemon.

"I hope so. Anyway, what could we do now? I'm getting bored by this empty room."

"Raikou didn't tell me much other than this Leisure Room. Maybe there's something we could do down the passageway."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Reuniting with Suicune

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You leave the Leisure Room, and start on the passageway, trying to look as far as you can. There's something exciting on just exploring mindlessly around, without knowing what you can find.

-"We're not going back to the stomach. I don't want to enter that place during the rest of my stay in here"- Suicune said grumpily while she came out of the Leisure Room.

-"We won't, I hope, but if we don't find anything, we could take another route from there. I saw a dozen entrances or so in the stomach"-

You started walking down, and entered through the first possible path you found. You're now in a cramped room, with a lot of small glass spheres. You pick one, and examine what's inside. It's a piece of a leaf, looking as if it had been recently tore from a plant. Other spheres has different samples of leaves, roots, mushrooms or fruits.

-"Oh, the first thing we stumbled upon is a testimony of Raikou's bookworm status. Not the best first choice, human"- Suicune comments

-"Should I be insulted, Suicune?"- you hear Raikou -"You two are now in the place where I keep my samples of the stuff I have tried before. I like to check the different effects certain plant elements has on Pokémon"-

-"So you try them on yourself?"- you ask

-"My own body is the most reliable testing ground I know. I can feel every single effect, and based on that I remember which plant elements are beneficial and which ones are harmful"-

-"That sounds actually dangerous! What if you eat something poisonous?"-

-"I'm very careful, always having small doses and antidotes ready if it ends being toxic. Besides, I'm much more resistant than you think, human. If Suicune or you ever feel sick, tell me. These samples will help you. They're too small to cause any effect on me, but they'll be perfect for you two. I have a few new samples I collected from that forest where I returned to normal"-

You're somewhat impressed by Raikou's dedication. There are dozens of different samples, and several of them seem to have caused adverse effects on him. It does take dedication to take risks like that.

-"Let's go somewhere else"- Suicune said, pushing you towards the entrance. You comply, and go down the passageway until you find another possibility. This time there's a small tunnel at the other side, where you need to crawl. At the end of it, you're knocked down by the wind, just when you stood up.

-"Suicune, I think we're in..."- you start saying, but Suicune interrupts you.

-"We're in his lungs, yes. I'm not completely satisfied with your luck choosing places to visit, but at least here we could do something"-

-"Something like what?"- you ask. There isn't anything remarkable in the huge chamber you're in.

-"Something like...you're it!"- she tackles you, once again causing you to fall. She runs away, bouncing and letting the wind carry her around. You didn't expect her to want to play games around, but you chalk it up to it being her way to coping not having anything else to do.

---

Palkia finally appeared as online.

Hey Palkia. There's something I need to tell you about. It's an, eh, curious case

What's it now? Again got killer cramps from eating random stuff?

No. There's this tiny human, and he needs help to get back to normal. I was wondering if you could help him

I can, but I thought it was with Dialga

So you knew about him? He is inside me right now

I suppose Dialga screwed up. And he says I'm the one who makes big blunders. What did he do to the human?

It's a long story. Can you help him?

I could but I won't. Raikou, that human is not just a simple human. That's why Dialga gave him minimal temporal powers. The human fits one of those legends you should have read about.

What should be done, then?

Keep him for now. I'll try to find somebody who train the human to enhance his temporal powers. Mew should do it, she's not as good as Dialga, but she can do it. The human won't even have to leave your body to receive the training, she could train him telepathically.

Should I tell the human? Seeing how big part of the problem he had with Dialga was that he didn't tell him everything...

Do it, then. I'll contact Mew. Meanwhile, tell me everything that happened with Dialga. Don't worry, I'm on you and the human's side
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Let's Look Around

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The sudden tackle by Suicune was hard enough to make your chest hurt. You lie on the floor trying to catch your breath and get those sparkling stars out of your vision. It never ceased to amaze you how unpredictable the Aurora Pokemon could be. Her mood swings is at work again. It's gotta be that impulsive, competitive streak in her. You slowly righted yourself up as the aching in your torso gradually fades. Suicune stood right next to you giving off a confident smirk that's getting wider by the second.

"Hey!" you exclaimed, "Could you've at least given me some warning? Humans aren't exactly as well-built as Pokemons are."

"Couldn't handle a little bump, human? I thought you could get used to a little surprise. Haven't any other Pokemons tackled you before?", Suicune asked curiously.

"Well yes, but they are way smaller and lighter than you, Suicune. I could handle a Skitty or two, but you would crush my ribs with those strong paws of yours."

"I didn't even use a quarter of my strength yet you looked shaken already."

"You could've injured me or worse," you complained.

"Hmm...you seem fine to me," Suicune said as she eyed you, "Toughen up, will ya? By the way, it's your turn to catch me now."

"Wait, what? I haven't even..."

"Hey!" Suicune exclaimed, "Quit the talking and start playing. I said that you're it. Come on, I wanna have some fun."

Before you could protest, Suicune went off and resumed jumping around in the lung. I don't even know what to think of her, you thought, she's just so random.

You started chasing after the elusive Pokemon. Several times you came close to grasping her flowing tail. But Suicune always finds a way to evade you at the last moment. She giggled whenever you made a frustrating grunt, teasing you about how she overestimated your ability.

"Is that the best you can do, Slowpoke?" Suicune taunted, "I'm starting to get bored. Yet another reason why Pokemons are the best."

She pounced around the lung faster than your eyes could follow. To you, she is just a quick blue blur. Seeing her filled with excitement is surprising given how she tried to project herself as serious and analytical. Though she may come off as a little dickish sometimes, you bet that she's really just trying to coverup her soft side. It's uplifting to see Suicune enjoying her time even though it's tiring you out.

There must be a way I can catch her. Her movement is far faster than an average human with her flexibility further aiding her. Without some form of power, chances of catching her are close to zero. Using my temporal power would be a bit low but there's no other choice. I just gotta make it believable.

You concentrated and focused yourself on slowing time to about 3/4 the normal speed. A faint aura formed and radiated from your head and spread out across the lung. Its effect was immediate. Suicune slowed down enough for you to make out the confidant smile still plastered on her face. You took the opportunity and slowly walked toward her. You exaggerated your arms swings and take wide steps to make your "running" more convincing from Suicune's point of view. In no time, you touched her sides as a look of shocked slowly formed on her face.

"You're it, Suicune"

"Thaaaat'sssss immpossibbleee. IIIIII'mmmmm caaughht," Suicune said.

You laughed at the low and prolonged effect your temporal power had on her voice. You quickly restored time to
it's normal pace.

"Probably a stroke of luck I guess," you smirked, "Or...perhaps you've had a generous amount of cake yesterday."

Suicune's shocked expression quickly turned into a knowing look.

"You used temporal power, didn't you?" she asked.

"Umm...yea. It's practically impossible to catch you without some additional help."

"That's cheating! I demand a rematch!"

"But Suicune, you even said that no one has ever caught you in this game before. You even said that you are bored by the same results everytime. I thought I could do something a bit more refreshing by using a bit of strategy. Plus, you didn't exactly prohibit me from using my powers," you explained.

"Whatever. But I'll get back to you real soon," Suicune groaned, "Could we do something else now? I need something to get my mind off losing."

"Let walk back up the passage to see if we missed anything."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Playing Tag

choices: You enter through the mouth again
You look for another way in
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You followed Suicune while she started to go upwards through the passageway. She was faster than you, so you were always a few steps behind. Even though she went in front of a lot of entrances, she didn't stop at any. You're amused at her intent at beating you.

-"How longer will we keep going?"- you ask, starting to feel tired.

-"I'll tell you when we're done"- that was her reply. You have the feeling she's trying to exhaust you. However, her plans come to an end when the path just ends with an entrance. Suicune opens it, grumbling. You follow her, trying to regain your breath.

-"Where are we?"- you ask, before even taking a look around.

-"Judging by the two giant pupils in front of us, then I think it's obvious where we are"- she says bluntly. You finally bother to look around. Indeed, you saw what Suicune was talking about. You also noticed the perfect roundness of the room, and how it was paler than the rest of the places you had seen so far. There was also an odd wire thing at the back. It's perfectly obvious for you that you're in the space behind the eyes. It's odd that they aren't separate eyeballs, but a big room divided in two sections.

-"Why don't we rest, Suicune? I'm about to faint"- you say, exaggerating how tired you are, in an effort to make her stay for a while. It works, as Suicune laid on the floor. You sat, and took deep breaths.

Suicune and you spent around ten minutes watching whatever Raikou was doing. Your host was walking around the forest, without a destination. From time to time he picked stuff from the floor, which you suppose are stuff he'll check later. There's something relaxing on watching him continue his life, as if he hadn't gotten out of another Pokémon a few hours ago or now had a human and a Legendary inside him.

Soon you felt good enough to continue going around, hopefully without Suicune forcing you to run out of energy. Before you stood up, Suicune approached the eye itself.

-"Wow, you have to check this, human!"- she said, surprised. You approached, and tried to see whatever it was. In that position, it was hard to see through the eye. -"Lean closer. It's amazing"- you leaned closer, trying to see what had caused so much amazement from Suicune. Suddenly you felt yourself pushed through the eye, and you felt in a harder surface. A quick look around shows that she pushed you out of Raikou, somehow.

-"Damn it!"- you start pounding on the eye, inadvertently causing pain to Raikou.

-"Stop that!"- you hear him say. You tell him what Suicune did. At the end, he nods, almost making you lose your balance.

-"As I see it, she's trying to ascertain her superiority over you. It's possible that she's also taking a small revenge for you making her go through Dialga's snout"-

-"I need to stop that before she does something else"-

-"Then you should show her that you're superior. Do something that shows she'll never beat you. Once she realizes it's useless to resist, she'll leave you alone. But be careful not to exaggerate, or her small games may turn into something real big for you"-

You listen to him, and start thinking of ways you could do it. It's hard to think of something good enough but not too harsh. -"I'll think later. For now I want to be back inside"-

-"My eye isn't an entrance. You'll have to enter through some other way"- he informs you. You walk to the edge of the odd mask thing you had seen on Raikou before, and look down. You had to enter the body again. The mouth was good enough for this, as long as you didn't go and splash into the stomach again. Maybe you could walk slowly down the throat until you find a way that isn't the stomach? Or maybe you could enter into Raikou through some other way. Whatever you chose, it had to be quick, before Suicune had the time to prepare something else for you.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou's Eyeballs/ Pupils

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You turned and looked back at Raikou's eyes which are now focused on you. Those red mirrors glimmered with concern and fear for what Suicune may have planned for you. They are eyes that have seen what the Aurora Pokemon can wreak if you slighted her. In response, you nodded and confidently gave Raikou a salute despite being unsure yourself.

Behind the worried look, you can see Suicune in his pupil barely containing her laughter as though she just watched a comedy. You can't hear her laughter but you knew that she likely witnessed the entire exchange between you and Raikou. You glared at her and told her that you won't put up with her behavior any longer. She just winked at you and mouthed what you interpret as "smell ya later" before disappearing from view. It made you even more lurid.

Suicune is so dead for pushing me out like that. I swear I'll find her and push her off Mt. Coronet if I need to. Well, it's partially my fault for trusting her so easily. I really need to start taking her words with a grain of salt. Is she still pissed about the tag game? Very likely and this is just the beginning for her. But it'll take a lot more effort before she could assert her superiority over me... I'll never understand what's going on behind that girl's head.

You climbed your way down to Raikou's muzzle. Going through the mouth may be the safest option for the time even if it means taking another plunge into the stomach. You told the Electric Pokemon your plan. He agreed and instructed you to follow the contour of his mask, reminding you that the mask is quite steep at your size. Once you reached the edge of his mouth, you are flanked on either sides by two colossal fangs. The Pokemon felt your arrival and promptly opened it and allowed you to enter. You walked toward the edge of the tongue when uncertainty clouds your thoughts
once more.

"Raikou, I really don't wanna get covered in digested muck again. Is your stomach the only way I can enter your body?"

"Unfortunately, that's the easiest way in and my breakfast isn't going through my intestines anytime soon." The Pokemon's deep voice resonated throughout the mouth.

"Aw, man," you groaned, "You got so many routes in and out your body. There must be some that we haven't gone over yet."

"If you thinking about alternative openings, are you seriously considering using the 'back door' or even my dick for a lack of better word?" Raikou asked bewilderingly.

You recoiled with disgust at the other options. There's no way you would go to either place unless necessary.

"No. I crossed out those choices long ago. What I meant to say was: is there any other places I can go to down your throat."

Raikou paused and thought for a moment.

"If that what you want, then there is one place you can go to. Midway between my throat and stomach, there is another opening which will direct you to the Research and Analysis Center."

"What's that?"

"A place where I observe and record things for my research. You really gotta see that place. All subjects that goes here will be tested by the most advanced apparatuses I have. The information I gained will be transferred to a encyclopedia in my brain for personal use. I have collected plants, rocks, minerals, and other things. It's one of my most awesome accomplishments!" Raikou said with nerdy squee.

"Uhmm, Raikou. You're losing me here."

"Heh heh, sorry. Got carried away again. It's just that I'd like to ask if you want to allow me to do some research you? Previously, I can only make visual observation of Pokemons around me and less so for humans. You'll be the first living thing and first human subject to be observed and analyzed."

"Uh, are you sure you know what you're doing?" you asked worriedly.

Don't worry, human. All things you disclosed will be purely voluntary. Unlike Dialga, no mind tricks will be involved and no information will be shared to others or the PokeWeb. All will be safely here with me."

"Suicune won't find me, will she?"

"No, while I'm conducting the research, all entrances to the center will be sealed off. She has no idea this placed even existed."

"...Okay, I'll give it a try. For knowledge, I suppose."

You jumped down the throat and instead of falling into the stomach, you are guided toward another opening in the gullet.

"Oh, this is gonna be so great! What should I collect first? Fingerprints, eye scans, voice print, sample collection, measurements, brainwaves, questionnaires, cultural studies...etc......!!! So many things to do!" Raikou said with increasing speed.

"Raikou! Calm down! You're kinda creeping me out."

"Oops..sorry. Just too excited at the opportunity."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You enter through the mouth again

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You slid for a few seconds more before falling into a bright room. You covered your eyes, until you were sure you could look around without being blinded. You removed your hands and examined the new place. It reminded you too much of Dialga’s insides.

Several screens filled the walls, with small blinking numbers in them in constant changing. Machines of unknown purposes littered around the room. –“This place is the most technological you’ll see inside me”- the host’s voice commented –“Sit on the chair, and we’ll start”-

You make your way to the chair. You’re very nervous, as you really don’t know how gently Raikou will examine you. You kind of feared he’d go overboard with his excitement and accidentally hurt you. You sat, and long wires fell from the ceiling. Raikou instructed you to stick the wires in key points of your head and chest. –“Yes, it’s all set. We’ll start with the most basic stuff, and then we’ll progress into more specific. Now type into this keyboard your answer to the questions I’ll make now”- just as he said that, a keyboard rose from the floor. Definitely this place was too much like Dialga.

Raikou asked you a lot of questions. Some of them were obviously made as a way to test your responses and how you reacted to them, while others were more about your past life in human society. Raikou kept musing ‘Oooh, that explains it!’ and ‘This is some good data”, although you were sure that at times those words weren’t directed at your answers.

He also made you go through several physical tests. Treadmills, weights, ropes, among other different stuff, appeared with each test. You did your best. This too brought back memories from the time when Dialga supposedly tested you on several stuff, and now that you see it could be done in a safe place like these testing zones, you were sure that Dialga was messing with you and making you through those experiences just because he could.

-“You have been very patient, human. Just one last test, please”-

You were already tired, but you accepted, asking what it would be. Raikou continued –“I need you to use those temporal powers of you for a moment. Slow time or something”-

You complied, and focused. Soon you felt the energy going through you, and knew you were doing it. The numbers of the screen seemed like they were appearing slower, although you had no way to know if your efforts were what did it. You stopped, and the numbers instantly went back to their usual rhythm.

-“That was amazing! Dialga would have never let me see from so close his powers in action. This blew my mind…and almost did it literally, too. I have a headache now”-

-“Oh no, I’m sorry. Maybe I shouldn’t have accepted”-

-“Don’t worry, I’ll be fine. I’ll just rest. You should go relax too, human; we have been doing this for quite some time already”-

You took off the end of the wires, and looked around once again. Most of the machines weren’t even touched. –“What are these things for?”- You asked, looking at the screens.

-“Those screens measure my body functions. Any effect my experiments have on me will be recorded by those screens, so I get to my conclusions. The other machines in that room let me perform different experiments in rocks, mineral, between others. You wouldn’t like to go through them”-

The machines themselves have several pointy elements that make you agree. You leave the testing area, and go back to your room. All those tests have you tired, but you don’t feel like going to rest now. You go once again take a plunge into your pool, and just let yourself float. You feel good enough to go do a few more stuff before going to sleep.

You go to eat, and while you’re in it, you remember the other Pokemon that is supposed to be with you. –“Where’s Suicune?”-

-“She’s just exploring around. I bet she’s looking for more ways to make you have a hard time. Have you thought of what you’ll do to triumph over her?”-

You didn’t really think about it, the tests had you distracted. –“…no, I haven’t”-

-“You have a lot of time for that, but be careful. Suicune can be really pesky at times! Hey human, I finished the Leisure Room. Now it does have stuff inside besides a big platform. Want to take a look?”-

You do. What could there be in the Leisure Room, now that it was finished?
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou's Research

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You traced your steps back to the Leisure Room. When you entered the room, you saw that the room is now filled with several different entertainment devices. There are several board games on tables in one corner. Some are familiar like chess, but you've never seen the other games before. You examined one that is a large cube with a lot of elemental symbols on each side. Another one beside it is a hexagonal board mark with a map of the Kanto region. You looked at several more of the game on each table, each adding a new layer of mystery. If these are games that Pokemons have invented, then you are truly amazed at how advanced they are. Not only can they communicate with each other with their mind, they have also developed some form of games with or without human inspirations.

"The games you see are some of the most popular games in the Pokemon world. My guess is that you would eventually be bored if all the games are familiar to you. So I decided to do some cultural exchange and introduce you to some of my favorites. Once you get to know the rules, I guarantee that you will be addicted to them." Raikou tells you.

"Is there any favorites that you can share with me?"

"I don't where to start, human. But can tell you two I played recently. The first one is 'Elemental Bets', a game where players make bets based on their respective element. If the cube falls on an element that matches yours, you can do whatever you want to the next player. But if the element doesn't matches yours, you have to perform something that embarrasses yourself the most."

"Pretty similar to 'Truth or Dare'," you commented.

"And the second one is called "Trainer!" In that game, we role-play as a Pokemon trainer as we navigate him through all the cities of Johto. The goal is to defeat all the gym leaders and the Elite Four. Players will take turn making decisions on how to move the trainer within their move limits each turn. Winning or losing Pokemon battles in the game will either increase your move limits or knock you out of the game completely."

"I guess I can try some of those later," you told Raikou, "You play these games frequently?"

"Yeah. Whenever I'm not training or not at Suicune's whim," Raikou said nonchalantly.

"I'm intrigued. But how did you play games when no one's in here?" you asked.

"Most of them are done telepathically with the other Legendaries. Having multiple players is a lot more fun. If you ever want to try them, you can always ask me to teach you the rule. One thing to take note of: don't ever play with Suicune at your first try. She's a wiz with these games and I haven't beaten her ever since I knew her. But I don't think she's in the mood to play with you now. Go and look around while I keep an eye out for Suicune. There's a lot more things I created for you."

You walked across the room and found a large screen with a cool-looking console hooked up to it. The console is a cube with electric yellow details. There isn't a tray for loading a disc or card slot to insert the play media. You pressed what you assumed is the power button and hear the console rev up. The display screen flickered to life. An interface popped up and displayed a list of games to choose from.

"This is one of my proudest creation: the Pokebox. I created several games for the console I figured that you would like."

You picked up an T-shaped controller and looked at the choices you got. Many are games you already knew but with Pokemon theme. One in particular caught your attention: "Adventure of Suicune: Legend" You asked Raikou what it's about.

"That one is inspired by recent events we endured together. It's an adventure game starring the titular character trying the save her realm from the sinister Dialga. Wanna play with me? I can can multi-player with you. Just put on the head and start."

You grabbed the controller and place on a headset and ready for a long time of gaming with the Electric Pokemon.

"Just don't let Suicune find this game or we're toast."

_______

>System check.....
>Scanning for possible error==@@#}
