>No errors found=0
>Syncing time, date, dimension...
>Restarting system.......all sys go!
>Booting 'main data_dialga'...

>>>SYSTEM_RESTORED

>1 unread message from unknown
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Back into the Leisure Room

choices: You awake in the strangest place you had ever seen
You awake in the nastiest place you had ever seen
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You glanced at the headset. It looks really uncomfortable, and not something youd really like to have on your head for long. The game Raikou made better be worth it you thought, putting the headset on. You were right, it felt like you head was on a vice.

-"I got this on. Lets start"- you grabbed the controller, just in case the headset wasnt enough. Sure enough, the screen turned black, and some credits appeared. A rather gaudy start screen filled the display. You saw it automatically move to Multiplayer, so you suppose that Raikou was already controlling his part of the game. Soon a forest appeared. The graphics were actually good, although you considered them outdated, but you cared more about whatever story there could be.

You were controlling Suicune, and to your side, a Raikou model was walking around -"Thats you, I bet. I mean, youre controlling it"- you say outloud, and your partner does confirm it. Suddenly a really thin section of the headset lights up, and you see a map with several shapes and a group of red points in some areas. -"Oh wow, whats this"-

-"Thats the game map, itll be very handy for you if you want to really play"- Raikou explained the mechanics of the map. Apparently the red points were something like Dialgas mooks, metallic creatures with very minor temporal powers. There was no sign of the Legendary Pokémon himself yet. -"The game is divided in missions. Your actual one is to push the invaders out of the area over there"-

-"And I do that...like this!"- you managed to use Ice Beam on a tree, freezing it -"Oh whooops"-

-"We cant do it alone. Lets gather some allies"-

-"Are more people playing this at the same time than us"- you ask, impressed. Raikous reply disappointed you, though

-"Im talking about NPC. There are a lot to choose! You just need to know where to look. Let me guide you for a while, then you do the rest"- he proposed, and without waiting for an answer, his model ran into the woods. You stumbled with the controls and after making Suicune crash against some trees and rocks, you manage to follow Raikou.

The game was pretty much alright. Raikou found several unevolved Pokémon, which you supposed would get stronger in battles. He also made you train them by attacking them or making they fight between themselves. Later when you considered you all were ready, you lead all of them towards the enemies you had to get out.

The ensuing battle was largely a loss for you, mainly because you hadnt discovered all of Suicunes attacks yet, and when you accidentally used one, at times it hit one of your allies. The only positive side of the ordeal was that everybody gained experience, which was some progress. -"That was bad. Reorganize and try again"- your partner said. For the next half hour you made an effort to find as many moves as you could, and practiced against moving targets Raikou had somehow inserted. Soon you felt confident enough to attack again, and this time you and your army managed to get a win. Dialgas invaders retreated to a farther point, and you celebrated it.

-"That should conclude the first mission. Dont get cocky, human. Youll also need to defend yourself and your turf, in case of more invasions. If all your areas are defeated, its a game over"-

-"How am I supposed to do that"- you ask, wanting guidance in this new side of the game

-"You should place some patrols oveeeeer...this part, I think. Flying types work specially well if you want to have a heads-up"-

Raikou and you continued playing, clearing several missions while also having drawbacks at times. Your host even gave you some food right there so you could eat and continue playing, at the same time. You spent around six hours playing, until the screen turned all blurry for you. You were just too sleepy to continue. -"I think thats enough"- you took off the headset, and rubbed your temples -"Why dont you want Suicune to see the game} It seemed great to me"-

-"There are some parts of the game where she isnt really portrayed in a way shed like. Im not saying theres anything like Dialga did! Its just that in the game she isnt as great as she thinks she is. You know how she is, shell be likely to react wrongly"- he explained. To you it seemed like a bad explanation, but you werent willing to see by yourself if it was true. The secret was safe.

You stumbled around until you returned to your room, and plopped on your overly-soft bed. You notice that Suicune was on her bed as well, apparently sleeping. Where had she gone all this time is your last thought before you drift into sleep.

---

Suicune raises her head and looks at you, smirking. Then she stretches. The human was vulnerable now, but he also was sleeping. What could she do to show that she would be several steps ahead of him...of course! She had found several paths throughout the body, leading to a variety or organs, and several of them would be a nuisance for the human, for whatever reason. It would be matter of dragging him, and he would have a not-so-nice awakening in the morning...but what kind of place would it be...Suicune stood from her bed and carefully grabbed with her teeth the humans leg, trying to not to wake him up, and slowly got him out of the room.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Gaming with Raikou

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The air felt still and cold. Much more so than you remembered. Your body shivered from the frigid sensation of wind against your body. Wild dreams faded as you slowly returned to the realm of reality. You stirred and snorted as you tried to regain you sense. Did Raikou left the window open again? Great, now I probably caught a cold., you thought absentmindedly. The first thing you do is to grab for the blanket and curl up in its embrace. However, your desire for warmth was cut short when you can't feel the blanket anywhere. Moving your legs around yielded a similar result. The bed also feels a lot harder. You gave an annoyed grunt and opened your eyes preparing to catch whoever disturbed your peaceful slumber.

But your eyes showed you a very unfamiliar environment. You were no longer in your bedroom but rather lying on the metallic floor of a large chamber. You jolted up and slowly take in the new surrounding. The floor you're on is actually a square shaped island in the midst of a neon blue liquid. Electrical sparks can be seen flickering near the surface of the unknown mixture. Tall rods protrudes from the substance and punctured the ceiling into other places above you. The scene is surreal enough but the shock is further compounded by the fact that you are missing your shirts. Your underwear is in full view as you noticed your pants hanging precariously on one leg. Something is definitely wrong here.

"Raikou? Can you hear me? Where am I?"

Silence...

"Come on. Please answer me. If this is one of your weird experiments, I'm telling you that I don't find it funny at all."

Raikou didn't reply, leaving you calls to echo unaddressed.

You heard faint footsteps behind you coupled with a muted giggle. There is only one Pokemon left as the culprit.

"Suicune!!!" you shouted, " I thought you're better than ambushing your opponent in their sleep."

"Did someone called me?" A familiar voice replied sweetly.

You spun around and saw Suicune perched atop a balcony way above you looking at you with a mischievous smile. Her red eyes are gleaming at her own handiwork.

"Hi there. Missing me already, human? And I thought I have to be the one to reveal myself to you. Killjoy."

"You dragged me done here, didn't you?" you glared at the Pokemon.

"Correct again, my dear human. Boy, were you such a heavy load to get here. First I tore your shirt while biting it. So I grabbed your pants, but it kept sliding off. it was worth the sweat and muscle ache in the end. The good thing is, I got to see what human male anatomy looks like. Those are some fine ones you have."

"You...what? You can't just..." your eyes twitched, "Don't you think you're taking this too far?"

"I told you that I have my ways to be better than you. But you refused to take my threats seriously enough. So I figured that I need to make my moves memorable," Suicune chimed.

"I shouldn't have let my guards down around you. Where exactly am I?" you demanded.

"Allow me to tell you, human," Suicune said with fake sweetness, "You're in Raikou's Electrical organ. It's where all his electricity is stored and generated. I found this place when I was exploring. I figured it's the perfect place for my little scheme."

"And your point of getting me here is....."

"Are you aware how much voltage Raikou can store in here?" Suicune interrupted.

You shook your head.

"Approximately enough to power an entire city for ten minutes. The liquid before you is the source of all those electricity. I assume you know what would happen if your body touched it. There will be a firework show."

Your muscles tensed up at the gruesome imagery.

"*Gulp* Can we talk this over please? Look Suicune, I know you're still pissed about me using temporal power to win that game. But, seriously, do you have to put my life in jeopardy because of that little slight?" you said.

"Awwww, but I was having so much fun with this, human," Suicune's voice whined, "I wanted to teach you an unforgettable lesson. The only way out of this is to play my game."

"Game? Let me guess. Some kind of trial that I have to play to your rules, huh?" you answered sarcastically.

Suicune's expression brighten up at the remark. The Pokemon suddenly jumped off the platform and landed besides you with precision.

"You just have to ruin my fun, don't you? Hmmph." Suicune turned her nose up at you melodramatically, "You are right. I have a game planned for you. If you win it, consider us even and we can reset our relationship...but if you lose, you'll gonna have to do what ever I asked of you for two straight weeks."

Suicune brushed up against your body, allowing your upper body to feel the silky warmth of her coat. She used her long tail to lift your head and make you face her.

"Got it, human?" she said.

You nodded nervously.

"Okay. Let's start with the rules."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You awake in the strangest place you had ever seen

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
-"I'm going to make it simple: first than all, no temporal powers. That's cheating and an automatic loss for you. I'll know when you make use of them"-

-"...How?"-

Suicune didn't reply. She smirked and continued. -"Second: you're not allowed to make use of anything besides your own abilities, which is whatever strengths and wits you have, which I suppose isn't certainly a lot"- she taunted you. You groaned, annoyed.

-"What are you planning me to do?"-

-"I'll tell you when I'm done. Third! You're not allowed to even lay a finger on me, unless what I challenge you to do explicitly tells it. I'll be doing everything in my power to stop you from being successful, and you can't do anything about it"-

-"But that's completely unfair!"- you protested -"I'm already following this game of yours!"-

-"Remember that if you don't, you'll be left here for a while"-

-"And I don't think Raikou would let it happen"-

Suicune looked like she hadn't considered that, but soon recovered her former attitude. -"It's matter of telling him that this is a game between us two, and that mingling with it won't be nice for him. He knows how serious I am in these matters"-

You knew that if Suicune told him to stay away, he surely would. Looks like you had to defeat her on her own terms. -"Anything else?"-

-"I think that's all. It's time to now tell you what the game is"- she paused dramatically. -"I have prepared a little game where the end goal is your own bedroom. I'm ensuring you won't be getting back to it or stray far from the path I have outlined for you. Automatic loss and all that. Remember that if you lose, you'll do anything I tell you to do, for two weeks. And do you think I'll be a good mistress?"-

You couldn't say you expected her to be kind and considerate, so defeating her was your high priority. You told her to continue and get to the point. -"Now I won't tell you all. We'll go along the path, okay? Now, for the first obstacle in our fun game would be to..."- she formed an arch of ice, going from the island you were on, to a safe edge on the far point of the organ, near the exit. She walked on it as if it were stone, until she got down at the other end. -"...to cross this arch until here"- she finished.

-"Thought so"- the arch was pretty round, and it actually seemed to be pretty risky to cross, even climb. You had no idea how you would do it. The reminder that right now you didn't even have a lot of clothes on you and that you'd be in contact with the ice was even worse. Suicune really meant her games.

-"Well, what are you waiting for? Go, do it! Or are you giving up now? Oh, and if you fall from it, don't worry. I'll make sure you'll be okay, although you'll fall down again at that island"-

-"Eeeeeeh..."- you walked to the arch, and touched it. Exactly as you expected. It was going to be a really grueling task.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Suicune's Game

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune's muzzle curved into a satisfying smirk. She had you where she wanted knowing that there's nothing you could do about it. The Pokemon took pleasure in watching you sliding down the slope while feeling the chill of the ice. Shooting her glares is the most confrontational thing you could do without breaking the rule. The frigid surface of the arch stung your skin where your belly came in contact with it. It was an uncomfortable task. And to make matter worse, the ice felt colder than what you're used to, perhaps because it was created with Suicune's Ice Beam. Legend has it that she has blizzards and ice storms at her beck and call, wreaking havoc on those who dared to foul her forest. If the stories you heard in Pokemon Centers were to be believed, they said that a group of loggers once went in that pristine forest to search for ideal materials to build houses. Once they spotted the good trees, they marked the trees with knife marks and cut off a few smaller ones for fire. Things went as planned for a few days until one evening when all contact broke off with them. Search parties were immediately formed to look for them but only found their campsite covered with thick snows in midsummer. The authorities presumed that rogue weather had something to do with their disappearance. A week after all had given up on finding the loggers alive, they emerged from the forest, pale and traumatized by their encounter with a mysterious Pokemon they say followed them day and night while lecturing them about respecting nature. One even said it sounds like a record being looped. Now that you recalled the legend, you find it sorta fitting that she would punish you with this trial. Perhaps you should consider yourself lucky that she didn't intend to torment you with some speeches.

Time dragged on and you hadn't have much success in climbing. The arch wasn't getting any kinder with you. Your hands and chest are numb from all the tries. Suicune sat down and watched your futile attempts to scale the structure. She seemed to take pleasure watching every fall you made.

"Hey human, why don't you just forfeit the trial and serve your mistress for two weeks? It'll be a lot easier like that," she taunted.

No, you're not going to give in. You'll not become her plaything again. Serving her for two days previously was more than enough. If the word 'mistress' doesn't raise a red flag, you're sure her behavior will. You're not even sure if you'll last two weeks.

"Sorry. Can't do, Sui?"

"Ooh yes you will," she nearly sang.

"You're just trying to push my buttons, huh?"

"Nope. Just reminding you of the awesome alternatives you've got," Suicune shook her head, "We could let this go on for hours and still you wouldn't make any progress. Just admit that I'm the superior one here and get over with it. What are you gonna choose, the chilling arch? Or a warm, loving embrace from the mistress."

"Sorry to disappoint you but I'll go with the former," you said, "One time is enough for me. Leave me out of your fun."

Suicune pouted and put on a sad face, looking at you with big watery eyes.

"You're so mean," she said mockingly, "Refusing to give lil Sui a nice cuddle."

but you chose to ignore it. You refocused your attention back toward scaling the arch. After numerous tries, you learned that climbing the slope directly isn't gonna work. You looked at the structure, analyzing every inch of it. There are numerous icicles jutting out on the side. They look hard and sturdy. You gave the ones closest to you a swift kick, breaking them into a rudimentary picks. Holding them like ski poles, you thrusted the pointed end into the arch. It punctured several inches deep and allowed you to gain a foothold. Within five minutes, you scaled the peak of the arch and slid down to Suicune's side. A large smiled was plastered into the Pokemon's face.

"Impressive show of ingenuity, human," Suicune congratulates, "But can you take on the next challenge?"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Climbing the Arch

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune doesn't wait for your reply. She turns around and walks out of the organ. For a moment you consider running away, but you guess that if you did, Suicune could freeze you solid as punishment and call it 'automatic lose'

-"What will it be now, Sui?"- you asked. She walked as if she had done it several times already, until she located the path she wanted.

-"You know what I want. Now let me show you what's behind this door"- she opened the door, beckoning you to enter. You're now in a brightly illuminated room, stretching into the distance. There's an huge hole in middle, with only one thin catwalk as the connection between each side. You look at the liquid that's pouring from the walls.

-"The liquid you saw before didn't come from nowhere, human. So you better not fall again"-

You peered down the hole, to the bottom. The substance pooled and leaked through a small hole, which you suppose went directly to the place you just visited. Falling in still meant instant death, or at least you supposed. Suicune confirmed it with her words.

-"So what will I need to do now?"-

-"It's easy. Get to the other side"-

It did look simple, but you knew that Suicune wasn't just let you pass without some sort of obstacle. The catwalk was thin enough to warrant a careful footing, so if there was some other challenge, it'd be a problem.

You hesitated, but took a step forward. You only advanced when you were sure there was stable terrain, just in case the challenge was that some parts were weak. Suicune stayed behind, watching your progress. When she judged you were near halfway, she gathered an Ice Beam and fired.

You heard the sound of it approaching, and ducked. You saw how it hit the opposite wall, forming an icicle. -"What was that?!"-

-"Think fast!"- she fired again, forcing you to stumble back to not to get hit.

It was clear that she'd continue firing Ice Beams until you gave up or completed the challenge. It was much harder now. You needed to move quickly to avoid getting frozen, but soon you started to get the hang of it. If you were allowed to use your temporal powers, it would be much easier, but you now were able to win just with your own physical agility.

At times, the beams hit the catwalk, leaving a patch of ice. In those cases, you laid down and slid over the ice carefully, doing progress and defending yourself better against the Ice Beams

You finally reach the other side, shivering due to all the ice that had gathered on that side. Suicune scoffed and walked gracefully through the catwalk. -"Okay, second challenge done. That was entertaining"-

-"I'll keep winning, Sui"-

-"Let's see, then. The third part is right after this point"- she looked at the new path, among the ice. You bravely marched forward, ready to encounter whatever Suicune had prepared for you. You sensed that you were entering a new chamber, but in contrast to the other places you had seen inside Raikou, it was pitch-black.

-"Where am I?"-

-"Ah, nowhere special. It's just an empty room"- Suicune replied, behind you -"You have to get to the other side"-

-"And what's the catch?"-

-"This place is full of holes. Not even I know what's at the bottom of the holes, they're too deep for me to see, but just to be in the safe side, don't fall in them"- she bolted into the chamber and ran to the other side. You listened to her steps, until they stopped. It seemed that the chamber extended for a while

-"Come over there!"-* you knew she was able to see you despite the darkness. Sighing, you prepared to walk ahead
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Second Challenge

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The creeping darkness of the room made you uneasy. The pitch black caverns you visited on Kanto don't hold a candle to the one you're in right now. Even then, you had a Pokemon who knows how to use Flash to brighten up the cragged rocks and passes. This time, however, your Pokemons aren't here to save the day like usual; you've left their Pokeballs back at your house when you took that leisure stroll. Thinking back, it was a little walk in the forest that started it all or more precisely, Palkia. You kinda regretted overlooking the maxim all trainers learned: Never leave your own Pokemon behind. The way Suicune described your challenge didn't help either. There's a feeling that she deliberately said that to strike uncertainty and make you fail your challenge and force you to be her personal servant for two weeks. This is an obstacle course that she has deliberately set up as a test. There's no telling what she would do next. Bodies don't have endless holes, do they? If I fell into one of them what will happen to me? Will Suicune leap out to rescue me? You didn't intend to find that out. If only you could see through this darkness, you would find the Pokemon smiling sinisterly as she watched the human from the safety of the finish line.

"Hey! Are you moving or what? Don't tell me you're chickening out," Suicune scoffed.

"Not just yet, Suicune," you fired back, "I'm just planning my next move. Formulating a strategy to win your little game."

"If so, then stop idling and take the challenge. Or...you can just admit defeat and enjoy two weeks pleasing your mistress," the Pokemon taunted.

"Screw that! There's no way I'm not going to end up playing maid for you again. No ma'am."

"Awww...Isn't cleaning me good enough for you? Perhaps massaging and body pillow would be nice additions."

"Suicune, I hate to rain on your parade but that isn't gonna happen except in your dreams maybe."

"Hmmph...just get started, okay?"

You gather up what's left of your courage and move forward in the pitch dark chamber slowly one step at a time. You took minuscule steps, carefully feeling for solid ground before making the next step. You carefully swept your feet around the floor to search for the holes that you might end up trapped or hurt in. The holes ranges in size from the diameter of a beach ball to those large enough to swallow you whole. Occasionally, it is necessary to crawl on narrow ledges between the gaps. The sounds coming from the bottom of the holes do not sound welcoming at all, resembling a combination of growling stomach and wind. At one point, you nearly slipped down into one of them. Suicune's laughed and taunted you, advising that it is best for you to give up because humans will never be up to par to Pokemon when it comes to prowess. By now, you are well-used to Suicune's antics and decided to ignore her and focus on winning.

It took half an hour for you safely navigate to the other end of the chamber. Your clothes and body are wet from both sweat and the moisture from the surrounding flesh.

"You see that, Suicune? I completed this challenge despite your dire predictions. I hope I haven't surprised you too much. Heh."

Suicune emerged from the darkness with a pair of glowing eyes she used as lighting. The sight unsettled you slightly. It is rare to see a Pokemon with this type of ability. She focused the beams on you, temporarily blinding you with their intense brightness.

"Hmmmph...Not bad. I guess my opinions needs some change. You better but still not good enough, human," Suicune said. It is evident that she is doing her best not to growl in frustration at your little victory.

"Upset that I ruined your plan?" you rubbed her mentally.

"Grrrrrrrr.....Let move."

Suicune quickly led you out of the dark chamber and back into the welcoming brightness of another hallway. This hall is wider than all the other you visited so far. You followed Suicune down until you reached another door. The Aurora Pokemon opened that door and motioned for you to enter. What you see on the other side is shocking. The room is completely blank and white in every direction. There is no telling if there are walls, ceilings or floor; everything is just plain white. It looks like something that only exist in a surreal dimension. You and Suicune are the about only thing in the chamber that can be distinguished from the surrounding.

"This is Raikou's Environment Simulator. It is environmental emulator that can recreate all sorts of stuffs based on the desire of the user. Everything from cityscape and mountaintops can be created in an instant with the sophisticated computer in there. In this case, I will decide the what you will have to face. You will have to accomplish the objectives I've set or else I will consider that you forfeit this test. Do you think that you can take on what I have in store for you?"

"Since I technically can't lay my hands on you, I have no way to prepare against you. But that doesn't mean you can do whatever you want. If things go too far, I reserve the right to self-defense. In short, show me what you got!"

"A word of caution, though. I'm gonna make it hard for you this time and I mean it! Prepare to face the challenges within my imagination."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The third Challenge

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The whiteness around you was quickly replaced by the last thing you expected: water. Suddenly, everything around you started representing some sort of underwater scenario, and you instinctively held your breath until you couldn't resist anymore. Luckily for you, the water was simulated. You concluded you weren't going to drown, so you relaxed.

Still, swimming was definitely not one of your fortes. You could do it, but do a challenge while swimming? That was going to be really hard. You waited to see if there was any clue of what Suicune could do as your challenge. Suddenly, you felt you were in danger. Something primal in you awoke and started to tell you to run.... or swim, or whatever. What mattered is that you needed to run away. But from what?

You glanced around you. It seemed like the seabed. Nothing but kelp, conchs, corals and other similar elements littered the ground, but you didn't see anything unusual or dangerous. The bad feeling didn't fade away, though.

Then you saw a silhouette at the distance. You could see that whatever formed it was huge, but you couldn't distinguish was it was. But it was approaching quickly. You started swimming away from it, as fast as you could. When it got close enough, you finally could see what it was.

Kyogre. Even through you knew it was merely a simulation, you were still greatly intimidated by it. You were at your normal size, but it still was huge. Kyogre lunged towards you in what was a pretty clear attempt to maim you. You managed to dodge it, and you grabbed onto its skin. Kyogre didn't like that. He started shaking around, trying to get you off. Seeing how you tenaciously held on for dear simulated life, it started to swim ridiculously fast towards the surface.

The simulated Pokémon jumped over the surface of the sea, ready to slam you with its back. You let go, and when Kyogre falls, the splash pushes you far. You really didn't know what you were supposed to be doing, but after you saw Kyogre again charging towards you, you supposed that your objective was to defeat Kyogre...somehow.

When it charged towards you, you didn't fret. Instead, you held your hands to the front and grabbed into its snout, avoiding its razor teeth. You quickly moved until you were looking directly into an eye as big as your head. Knowing it was a simulation, you were okay with what you were going to do. If it were the real deal, you wouldn't even dare to approach.

You punched Kyogre in the eye.

Kyogre let an huge scream of pain, and tried even harder to shake you off. You were forced to let go, so you were disorientated for a moment, until you saw Kyogre swimming around, trying to find you. You approach as stealthily as you could, until you grabbed onto the skin of the tail. While it once again tried to get rid of you, you crawled over the back until you found the other eye. You punched it as well.

Kyogre, now blind, started swimming erratically. This time you managed to hold on, but you didn't know what to do now to subdue Kyogre. However, you managed to find something curious: when it felt you, it instantly swam in the direction it felt you. You had an idea. Soon you positioned yourself in front of its snout, making it charge ahead, trying to bite you. Then you daringly pushed down.

Despite the sudden change of direction, Kyogre continued the same strategy, charging forward without a second thought. hen you saw the seabed approaching, you jumped and tried to swim, bracing for the impact.

Kyogre crashed against the soft floor, and didn't move. You really managed to knock out a legendary Pokémon...well, a simulation, but it was still very satisfying.

You didn't have long to rest. Before you knew it, the environment around you had changed. Now rivers of what looked like lava flew in several parts around yo, among lots of rocks and spiky flaws in the terrain. It looked like you were in a volcano.

Suicune appeared -"I can't believe you really managed to defeat Kyogre. That was...fairly impressive, yes. Okay, I accept it. You're tougher than I thought"-

-"If I'm so tough then make this the last challenge, alright?"- you replied. Suicune thought for a moment.

-"Okay. This will be the last one, but don't expect me to make it easy. In fact, why don't you find out by yourself what you have to do? Oh, and don't touch the lava"- she smirked -"It may be simulated but it'll still hurt a lot"- and with that, she disappeared.

Knowing that this was the last task you'd need to do, you got ready to start
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou's Environment Simulator

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The lava boiled with fierce intensity that made Mt. Coronet's crater look like a child's play. Superheated winds blew against your face, forcing you to squelch your eyes upon the barren landscape before you. Sweats started flowing on your forehead as the relentless heat baked your body. You quietly cursed Suicune for rendering this difficult course as the final challenge. She really wanted to test your limit; perhaps human limits would be the more appropriate expression. The path that the Pokemon has created spirals precariously along a steep cliff that leads down into a red glowing inferno of fire and molten rocks. The path ended at a plateau some distance away. Suicune didn't elaborate much on what to expect but you know that whatever you'll encounter would be just as dangerous as Kyogre.

There is no backing out now. You've come too far to take that option. The taunting voice of Suicune echoed in your head, mocking you for your failure and teasing you into submission. Thankfully, the rumbling lava brought you out of your thoughts before it gets disturbing. You'll prove her wrong; that's one thing you're certain about. Gathering all remaining strength, you pressed forward onto the narrow path.

You made your way slowly up the cragged mountain, cautiously navigating the narrower section by sidling along the rocky walls and jumping over the little gaps that appeared intermittently. An occasional distant eruption would shake the floor and send pebbles raining down on you. Even though you know this is simulated, the threats felt extremely real. You feared that the rocks below you might collapse at any given time and drop you into a fiery end. Each step was taken with all courage you could mustered. To your utmost relief, that never happened.

An hour of hair-raising trek later, you safely made it to the plateau. The flat surface is about as large as your typical Pokemon arena. White smokes billowed in all directions but you sensed that there was something lurking in these veils. Your suspicion was answered when a bone-chilling roar emanated from behind. You slowly turned your head only to see a towering four-legged figure looking at you menacingly. The creature gave a low rumbling growl that shook your very heart. Its red eyes focused on you as the smoke slowly cleared away.

The figure has a thick brownish coat, a flowing gray mane and tail, jagged plates on its back, a star-shaped red-gold face mask, and large paws bulky enough to crush you. The Pokemon observed you with a curious expression on its muzzle.

"Well... Finally a human brave enough to venture into my lair? Interesting," its baritone voice mused as the creature approached you.

You are too intimidated to make any sounds.

"You are a first I suppose. A lot of trainers dare not to take even one step up my mountain. Those who did made it to the entrance were scared speechless by the mere sight of me."

"....."

"Hmmm. My... Is that fear I'm seeing on your face, human? Unfortunately, it's too late to change your mind now."

"You're...y-...you're...," you tried to speak.

"Entei," the Pokemon added with a slight annoyance, "But that isn't important; you aren't here for me to remind you what to call me, is it human?"

"....."

"I'll assume by your silence that you're here to fight me."

You nodded fearfully.

"Impressive...A brave yet foolish feat I might add. Most trainers used their Pokemons in a futile attempt to capture me, but I see that you haven't brought any with you. Perhaps you're looking for a more original form of dual. If that's what you desire, that I can accommodate."

"Wha....what do you plan to do with me?" you asked.

"It'd be unfair for me to challenge you to a physical fight owing to vast differences in our abilities. I propose that we dual in a location where our powers are more matched," Entei said as he got even closer to you.

"Uh.....what?"

"I guess it's better to show you then," Entei said.

The Pokemon stood tall in front of you and looked you in the eyes. Your head barely reached his chest. Entei leaned his head closer to you and narrowed his eyes.

"Extrasensory!" he roared.

The Pokemon's eyes widened and a bright flash emanates from the pupils and you were suddenly unable to move your body. A indescribable heaviness washes over you as your gaze remained fixed toward the Pokemon's red eyes; there is some force preventing you from breaking the contact. You felt nauseous as though you're on the brink of fainting. The mountains and lavas gradually faded from your field of vision as your consciousness is pulled toward Entei's stare.

"Look deeper...you shall find your arena soon enough," Entei said your mind got thrust into his hypnotic gaze.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Last Challenge

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You felt like you had gone through a washing machine cycle. You were disoriented and tumbling around, until you finally felt steady enough to stand straight. When you focused your eyes, you noticed that Entei had been watching you with an amused expression.

-"About time. You really spent way too long bumbling around"-

You avoided replying what you wanted. Instead, you put on the bravest face you could and replied -"Enough! "here am I?"-

You looked around, confused. It was a round room, richly decorated. You could see several marble statues depicting Entei, almost like this were a temple. Were you in a temple?

-"You're in my mind. It's the only way we could have the same level of strength"-

You glanced at the Pokémon. -"I don't feel any different"-

-"I do. I feel infinitely weaker, so now we are in the same level"- you felt insulted, as Entei expected. But he was still way taller than you, and even if he said you were both with the same strength, you really didn't feel like you had a chance. -"Now we're going to fight. Get ready!"- he started running towards you before you could be ready for an attack.He tackled you, making you fly towards one of the statues. You crashed against it, feeling as if a steamroller had gone over you.

-"We can't really have the same strength..."- you muttered while you struggled to stand up. Without letting you recover, Entei grabbed you with his teeth and threw you to the other side. He was clearly overpowering you, and you had no time to counter. For a while Entei had fun, until he finally let you lay down in middle of the room.

-"This is being way too easy. Fight, human, this is starting to be boring"-

You weakly stood up and tried to punch him. You managed to hit his leg, which was like a mere bug trying to bite him. -"Damn it"-

Much to your surprise, Entei didn't attack. He instead fell down to the floor, laughing hoarsely at your puny attempt. Very annoyed, you approached and punched him in the throat. He stopped laughing, and instead tried to breath. You saw that as your chance, so you hit him once again. Apparently, even your weak punches could hurt if you hit the right points.

When Entei tried to stand up so you couldn't reach his neck anymore, you promptly kicked him in the shins, in rapid succession, hoping to cause enough discomfort. Entei didn't stay down, but the delay let you climb on his back. He didn't thrash around, as you expected, so making him crash against something wasn't really an option. You decided to go for something drastic.

You moved until you got to the back of his neck, and tried to choke him. You knew this was merely a projection, and that chances are that you wouldn't kill him, but you hoped you'd knock him out. You held on with all your strength, feeling him trying to take air. Due to the his size, it took a good while of him trying to get you off and you clinging on until he was weak enough to be defeated by the lack of air. Entei fell down.

The room around you warped, until it turned again into the plateau you had been on before the fight. In front of you, Entei was in the same state you had left him while in his mind. You approached, somewhat worried, and checked if he was still alive. You were relieved to see that he was merely knocked out.

-"...damn it. Damn it. Damn it!"- Suicune was at the other side of the plateau, clearly unhappy. The environment faded until it turned into the completely white void you had seen before the challenges started in that place -"I can't believe you really could do that without using your temporal powers"-

-"Are we...are we done?"- you panted, hoping the answer was positive. Suicune nodded, upset

-"Okay, we're done. You win. Congratulations"- she says without enthusiasm, and a way appears in middle of the void. You go through it, and follow the hallway until you reach your room. You practically collapse on your soft bed, falling asleep quickly.

Suicune observed you, until she heard Raikou -"You really left him exhausted"-

-"Not my fault"-

-"It was a good show. I didn't think he'd manage to pull it off, but aren't you worried of possible retaliations?"-

-"I can deal with anything he does"- she says confident.

-"Okay. Let him sleep. I found a way to let him continue sharpening his temporal powers. Mew could do it"-

-"Mew?"- Suicune left the bedroom -"I don't see how"-

-"Her powers are much less powerful than Dialga's temporal powers, but she should be able to give him the bases for him to continue. After all, some part of Dialga's genes are into her, albeit a very small part"-

-"And how is he going to practice with Mew if he's inside you?"-

-"She's a Psychic type. Even telepathy would be enough, but knowing her, she'll do something like an image of her appearing in front of him or something. I don't know. She'll arrive later"-

Suicune and Raikou spoke for a good while about the human's potential, while the subject of their conversation slept.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: A Battle in the Mind

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune woke up from the chilling winds she's feeling. The Pokemon blinked her eyes and focused her gaze upon the ceiling. The room was still dark and the human's snoring could be heard coming from another bed across from hers. The gentle heartbeats and breathing several floors below them indicated that Raikou was, too, still asleep. The Aurora Pokemon checked the clock on the wall. It was 6:00 in the morning. Another indicator beside it showed that Raikou won't be waking for another 4 hours. Suicune was perplexed at how her friend managed to sleep so long. It was beyond her. Though Suicune was used to living places that are dark for a good half of the year, her internal body clock always woke her at the right time with virtually no errors. Suicune was both appalled at the length of Raikou's sleep and how she has to live with these two heavy sleepers for who knows how long. Look like it'll be my job to be their alarm clock from now on.

-----
"Get up sleepyhead," Suicune's voice chimed as she pawed at your body.

"Huh....what Suicune?"

"Up up up...morning is here already," the Pokemon said.

You groaned as you lifted you hand and read the watch.

"Jeez....it's only 6:04am, let me sleep some more," you said while tightening the blankets around your body in a futile attempt to shield yourself from Suicune.

The Aurora Pokemon jumped on you and pinned you down. Her paws felt like clamps pressing down on your chest. She lowered her head and beamed a cocky grin at you. You returned the favor by glaring at her intensely. But that only seem to widen the grin plastered on Suicune's muzzle. Her eyes sparkled with determination.

"You may have won the tests I set up, but that doesn't mean I can't order you around. Now get up!"

"I thought we had a deal. What's with all the talk about you considering me an equal after what I had been through yesterday?" you asked.

"Equal as in my respect for you. But I'm still on top of the hierarchy here. Even Raikou knows his place."

"Did you just imply that you are some type of alpha female here?" you asked quizzically.

"You sure have a clear picture of what's going on here. Just know your place and I will make you stay the most comfortable."

"Nice, you can start by giving just 10 more minutes of sleep," you smirked.

"Nope. Can't do. For now on, you'll have to learn to get up early. Now come with me. I'm planning on waking Raikou. Time to get him out of his dreamland."

-----

There are few times where a dimensional being feels this much rage building up inside him. More often, he let his anger subside for fear of allowing it to affect the cosmos. Dialga tried concentrating on all positive things in his mind and breath deeply. It was a trick Arceus had taught him during his training long ago. But that obviously didn't work in this case. Dialga could feel the massive flame building up with him. He was angry at being played and controlled like a rag doll by Suicune and shocked in the balls by Raikou. But those two are an annoyance compared to the rage Dialga reserved for the human as he read the message he had left on his system. Each word made the Pokemon visualized all the possible ways of eternal torment. The human didn't just taunted him, he also made fun of the temporal power, powers the Dragon Pokemon considered sacred and revered. The human also knew of his invasive research method, making any future cooperation impossible. Only one way left to deal with this.

"There is one thing you should have never done, human: Pissing off a demigod!"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Waking Up

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You sleepily walked behind Suicune, wondering how she managed to be so energetic and even chipper so early in the morning. Not even in your journeys you had been awaken so early barring an emergency. Even your Pokémon shared your habit of sleeping until the sun was already high in the sky, so it all worked wonderfully.

Now Suicune wouldn't let it happen.

-"How do you plan to wake him up? I doubt pawing at the flesh will be any good"- you said, trying not to yawn. Sicune smirked.

-"I have my ways. Around here there should be some sort of nerve. Once I find one it'll be very easy"-

-"Don't tell me you're going to torture him until he wakes up!"- you protest, more awake now that Raikou was apparently threatened. The Aurora Pokémon looked at you, offended.

-"What kind of monster do you think I am? I won't do that. I'll merely force him to wake up´"- She continues walking and looking around for any weak points that could lead to a nerve. After a while, she finds what seemed like a bruise. She carefully touched the flesh until she managed to make a small hole. You could see a rubbery cord, what you suppose is one of Raikou's nerves.

-"Great, now what?"-

Suicune didn't reply. Instead, she aimed at the hole and released a very weak Ice Beam on the nerve. You're sure you saw the nerve shuddering at the contact with the ice, until suddenly everything around you jolts in surprise.

-"What the...Suicune, what're you doing?!"- Raikou shouts. Suicune stops the beam, satisfied.

-"It's time to wake up! There's no time for idling around. The day has started"-

-"Don't worry Raikou, she woke me up too"- you mutter.

It takes a while before Raikou begrudgingly accepts that Suicune won't let him sleep any longer, so he starts his daily routines. Suicune and you go back to your rooms, where you wait for your breakfasts, now everything in a friendlier atmosphere.

Once you're finished, you hear Raikou again. -"Human, please come to the Leisure Room. There's an important matter you need to know"- You quickly get to the Leisure Room, expecting to see something different, but when you enter you notice nothing has changed. Suicune followed you, too, not having been in that place before.

-"What is it, Raikou?"- He had sounded oddly serious, for somebody of his demeanor, so you were a bit worried.

-"There's a friend that wishes to talk to you in person. She's going in"-

-"Oh, I know where this is going. Good thing I woke him up early, or else she'd have found him sleeping"- Suicune says -"You better be ready. You need to be better in time matters that Dialga, or else I'll be sorely disappointed of you"-

-"What?"- you say before seeing something forming on the platform in the center of the room. Soon pink fragments start gathering until it forms what you recognize as Mew. You somewhat remembered talking to her, she had stricken you as excitable and cheerful, mostly. You hope that being with her isn't as exhausting as you think it may be.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Raikou's Rude Awakening

choices: A Long Distance Call for Dialga
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
"Greetings, human. I'm Mew," the Psychic Pokemon smiled. The small form of the Pokemon hovered closer to you from several feet away. This was the first time you heard her voice which can be described as innocent and childlike. A much light-hearted voice than you imagined she'd possess. The way the Pokemon talked reminded you of soft wind chimes.

"Hi there, Mew. Nice to finally meet you in person," you offered. The pink catlike creature levitated herself in front of you and looked at you with her big, watery blue eyes. She momentarily put on a serious look while she looked at your features. Mew turned over to Suicune who gave her an acknowledged nod before turning her attention back to you. Her smile and grin popped back on her face.

"You must be Dee-al-ga. I'm so happy that I finally had the opportunity to meet you in person," Mew beamed as she circled you.

"You're still using that nickname?" you asked surprised.

"What's wrong with it? I think it sounds cute. Just like you! Hee hee..."

You blushed, unsure whether to feel awkward or take Mew's statement as a compliment. But when you looked at those innocent pair of eyes, you couldn't help but smile back.

You all seated at a round fur-covered table and made yourselves comfortable in plushy chairs.

"So how are things going so far, Dee-al-ga?" Mew said, playfully enunciating your nickname.

"Not as well as I wanted. But I'm learning to get by with what I have," you replied, "After what Dialga did to me while I lived in him, I learned to be more cautious and vigilant about those around me. Besides Dialga, Suicune here is another good example of a Pokemon you should keep your eyes on."

"Hey! Watch your words, human!" Suicune shouted, her face red with embarrassment, "At least I'm not as bad as him, right? You fared far worse under that numbskull and you had the nerve to put me on the same page as him? One more of that nonsense and I'll make you lick my paws clean for three weeks."

The faux cheerful way Suicune said the last sentence send a shiver down your spine. But Mew, somehow, was laughing uncontrollably at Suicune's outburst which earned her a death glare and a low growl.

"Sheesh, Suicune. Why the hot-headedness? No harms been done in any way," Mew said as she attempted to stifle her laughter, "You really need to lighten up sometimes. "

Suicune kept her crimson eyes on the tiny Pokemon.

"You. are. so. dead, Mew...", she growled. But her rage went unheeded when Mew turned her attention back to you.

"You are taking the situation a lot better than I expected. Good to see that you have such excellent adaptability."

"Thanks. So, what brings you to us, Mew? Is it urgent?"

"Oh dear," Mew exclaimed, "I was having so much fun talking with you guys that I forgot why I came here in the first place. Heh heh, sorry bout that."

"It's alright. So what's the problem?"

"Okay then, back to the important stuffs. From what Raikou told me, I understand that Dialga is causing trouble again. PThis time dragging poor Dee-al-ga along for the ride. That scoundrel has caused enough trouble for the Pokemon world and now he wanted to get a human involved. Man, as if he isn't a big enough problem for me!"

"So Suicune and I weren't the only victims of that guy," you said.

"Oh no, Dee-al-ga, you haven't seen how he deals with the Pokemons around him. You either have to subject yourself to his hurtful pranks or listen to and obey his every whim. Refusing him can be quite disastrous. Even Palkia got constantly pushed around by Dialga. Because of him, I spend a lot of my time saving various Pokemons he trapped in the dimensional realms, which is a very power-consuming task for me," Mew explained.

"Sorry to hear about that. I could barely stand a week of his mind surveillance and manipulation. It must've been awful hard work for you."

"...How far have things fallen?", Mew sighed, "Dialga and Palkia were once students of the Great Arceus, the Creator of the World and Pokemons. Dialga is always the one to test the norms and get into trouble while Palkia is the clumsy but nice one. They never got along really well despite being assigned together by Arceus. Years after years, Dialga became more and more out of bounds the more ability he mastered from his teacher. On the day Arceus send them out on their first day on their jobs, Dialga nearly destroyed the universe by attempting to harness its power for himself. It took a 200 year detention to bring him down a few notches. Can you imagine what Arceus would do if he knows about Dialga's recent adventure?

"I don't want to think about that," you dreaded, "But what does this all have to do with me, Mew?"

"Well, the interesting part about you, Dee-al-ga is that you were vested with some of Dialga's temporal power which gave you a bit of power over time and space. Dialga never granted any other a portion of his power, so this is a rare opportunity for us to analyze his power."

"Good thinking. I hope this power will come in handy one day. So what's your plan, Mew?"

"I got a few on my mind at the moment. But first, I'm giving our old friend Dialga a little call. You two can drop in the conversation if you want. He'll hear your voices as mine so no worry about him finding out about you two. I wonder what he's up to?" Mew thought as she activated her messaging system.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Meeting Mew, face to face

choices: You decide to discuss with Suicune what to do for the future
You decide to start thinking ways to get away of Dialga
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
For a few seconds there was no sound. You hoped that meant Dialga was busy, hopefully not plotting your immediate demise, but small sounds soon resounded around the room. Dialga was on the line.

-"Hello? Hello? Dialga? Are you there, Dialga?"- she spoke.

-"You called me, Mew. Of course I'm here"- Dialga said in annoyance. For once since you got away of him you agreed. Mew could be tiring at times, judging by her behavior.

-"I heard some interesting news that I'd like to confirm! Like for example about a human! Have you seen a human in your body recently?"-

-"Who told you about that?!"- Dialga roared before Mew could even finish her sentence.

-"You did, remember? I even talked to the human while he pretended to be another of your species!"-

Silence filled the connection. Dialga had clearly overreacted. Mew nodded, as if she had realized something important. -"Oh, true. I forgot"-

-"Yeah, sure"- Suicune muttered under her breath, but it sounded like Mew had said it. Dialga refrained from asking what was that, although his words showed he had heard it.

Mew surprisingly talked to Dialga with expertise, prodding him around while she measured his mood. -"You seem really stressed, Dialga, is there something wrong?"- you asked, just to see what his answer would be.

-"I went through a bad experience thanks to a prank I don't want to remember"-

Suicune beamed with malicious pride, and you shared a knowing look with her. What Suicune and Raikou had done inside him wouldn't be forgotten soon. -"Oh, that's too bad!"- Mew hollered.

-"Yes it was. When I catch Suicune and Raikou they'll find out what happens when they mess with a Legendary Pokémon"-

-"They're legendaries too, knucklehead"- Suicune said. Mew glared at her quickly while Dialga asked what was that.

-"I, ehem, I coughed. *Thlgdtalehead*"- she did a very unconvincing fake cough, and changed topic hurriedly -"And what about nthe human? Can I talk to him again? He seemed like a nice guy"-

-"He isn't nice. I returned him already to the world he came from"-

Hearing Dialga lying without an apparent guilt enraged you. Mew quickly put her paw on your shoulder in an effort to calm you down before you ruined the cover. -"Oh, that's too bad. you had another being inside you! I have always wanted to have something inside me"-

-"You're not missing anything. It's more a pain than a fun thing"-

Being an unwilling test subject isn't fun either you thought, clenching your fists.

With each second it was apparent that if Mew continued the call sooner or later you or Suicune would ruin everything, so Mew hurriedly said goodbye and hanged. -"Uf, that sure was a handful"-

-"He's a handful"- Suicune retorted.

-"He isn't so bad, but he does have a very warped sense of what's correct and what isn't. I have known him for a long time"-

-"What did you get from this call?"- you asked, not really seeing the point.

Mew worriedly landed on the floor. -"Nothing good. He's clearly planning something bad against you three, specially towards the human. Note how he said he had left you in your world. I think Raikou and Suicune will manage to not be too affected by a confrontation, but you're a human, and shrunken, to boot. I fear for your life"- she talked with a seriousness you hadn't expected to hear in her voice.

-"Then let's get him home quick before Dialga finds him!- Raikou said, but Mew argued that Dialga would still find you, and without Suicune and Raikou's protection, it'd be even worse.

-"The only solution I see is to prepare you for when the inevitable time arrives. Dialga is a tenacious Pokémon, and he's really pissed off"-

-"And how can we prepare him?"- Suicune asked. Mew started to float again, recovering some of her cheerful state

-"I have no idea"-

-"Don't strain yourself so much helping"- you groaned.

Mew thought for a moment before clapping excitedly. -"I could try to help you! You still have those powers, I more or less know some tricks for them. They'll never reach Dialga's ability, but I do think you could at least survive unscathed if you do train"-

-"What else can be done?"-

-"Raikou is already running away. Keep moving everyday, and never stop to rest. I think that at some point it'll be good that the human leaves you two"-

-"No, no way. Where would he be without our protection?"- Raikou refused to leave you.

-"I'm not saying to leave you two now. I mean when he's stronger, but it's for you two's safety. Besides I'll find a good host for him when the time comes"-

-"So I won't even be in my normal size?"-

-"It'll be easier for you to be hidden if you continue being small"-

The perspective of having to hide from Dialga by being small doesn't make you happy, but you do know that until the whole deal ends, it'll be necessary. -"And I suppose you'll be the host"-

Mew giggled. -"Hihi, maaaybe! But if you do reach your potential then it'd be better if your host is somebody you can help. After all, you could be that human in our legends, the one to stand with the Legendaries Pokémon. But we'll see when it's time. For now focus on getting stronger"-

Mew started vanishing, waving at you. -"I'll be back in a few hours, I'd like to help Raikou find a nice safe place for now. Think of everything that was said and get ready!"-
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: A Long Distance Call for Dialga

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Once Mew has vanished from view, both of you are left alone in the Leisure Room. The chamber is silent save for the air vents pumping in fresh air from Raikou's lungs. You and Suicune remained in your seats without talking for the better part of an hour. Even Raikou left you two on your own as he busied himself with another lengthy discussion with Mew about the next step. For the first time, Suicune was looking neither cocky nor loud. Rather, she is looking at you with a contemplative expression as if she was still taking in what Mew had just said. Many times, the Pokemon looked like she was on the verge of speaking, only to held herself back at the last minute and heaved a long sigh. The longer those ruby eyes are set on you, the more you could tell that there was an unspoken sadness hidden in their depths. That brief glimpse of emotion was quickly reburied under Suicune's stoic face as she tried hard to keep up her usual demeanor. You could no longer stand the silence and was the first to break it.

"So what do you think we need to do now?" you asked Suicune.

The Pokemon heaves another sigh before speaking.

"It depends," Suicune answered calmly, "We don't have a clear picture of what Dialga would do and we don't exactly know the full potential of your temporal power. Besides, Dialga isn't exactly as dumb as I always like to make him. He can be very ingenious if he wants to. In fact, I would consider him an excellent strategist were it not for his unlikable personality and immaturity."

"A strategist? In what sort of ways? Being an expert in pissing people off doesn't count," you said sardonically.

"Let me ask you this, what do you think he's gonna do with the information he collected when you lived with him? Every movements you've made, every little details of your life you confided to him, and all thoughts you might've had."

"Dialga knew those, so what?" you said frustratingly, "I don't want to relive those experience again."

"Think about it, he had done intrusive experiments on the both of us and most likely will have a copy of our memories saved in his vast data continuum."

"..."

"Remember, Dialga's innate power allows him to have a vague idea of the immediate future. Though not entirely accurate, it give him a rough picture of upcoming events. He can and will use our knowledges against us."

"...Shoot, I totally forgot about that," you gasped, realizing the implications, "Does this mean that our plans are potentially compromised?"

"Not really. You see, Dialga cannot see the specifics of the future and any memories he downloaded from us would be outdated in the sense that no traces of our current 'state of mind' would be found. The best he could do is run a scenario test and the likely outcomes."

"That still is unsettling enough for me," you commented.

"Indeed it is very troubling. Mew said there is no knowing when that monster will catch up with us and obliterate us like some insignificant specks of dust. Which made it all the more important that we must get you to fully master your powers."

"But that means that we will be running and hiding for the better part of my training."

"What else can we do?" Suicune answered with a hint of annoyance.

"Can't we just find Lord Arceus and tell him that his star student Dialga is misbehaving again?" you commented.

"You want to take the issue to Arceus himself?! I suggest that you learn a little more about our hierarchy here," Suicune looked at you as if you made an offensive statement.

"Ummm...Did I say something wrong?" you asked nervously.

Suicune took a deep breath before focusing her attention back on you. She collected herself before speaking.

"Arceus is a deity to us and is consider the creator of us all. He is regarded with extreme reverence among Pokemons. You don't just walk up to his place and knock on his door and demand his presence," Suicune explained.

"Not even if you're a Legendary?" You asked.

"Even if you found favor in his eyes, finding Arceus isn't as easy as it seems. He is constantly traveling around the dimensions to maintain the delicate equilibrium between them. Additionally, we don't have the presumed authority to directly meet up with him. Only a select few of the Legendaries has seen him in person. The most that lower-tiered Legendaries can do is to go up to Mt. Coronet where there is a shrine dedicated to him and seek his presence. Unless he decides to show up, there's little else we could do."

"This isn't getting any easier, is it?" you groaned.

"Hmmm... I can ask Mew if she's got any news about Arceus if that offers you some reassurance. In the mean time, I will not allow Dialga to lay his dirty claws on anyone one of us, especially you! I couldn't wait any longer to give that bastard his comeuppance," Suicune growled with resolve, "Let's get moving!"

Suicune stood up and walked toward the exit.

The sudden determination in Suicune's voice caught you off guard. While you appreciate her encouraging words, you wondered why is she abruptly so protective of you? Is she doing so out of a sense of loyalty or did she see something more in you? Realizing where your thoughts are heading, you quickly banished the thoughts. After putting your mind back on track, you couldn't help but smile at Suicune, she can either be the meanest or the sweetest girl.

Maybe being shrunken isn't all that bad, you mused.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You decide to discuss with Suicune what to do f...

choices: You decide to let Giratina out of this
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune walked ahead, while the human followed behind immerse in his thoughts. The Aurora Pokémon had her own thoughts too, and she wasn't exactly willing to share them with the human.

She was never going to admit it to the human's face, but she had grown to respect him. At the beginning she had brushed him off as somebody who was in Dialga's body, getting into problems he never suspected. But now that she had spent time with him and, to lack of a better word, forced him to follow her whims, she had seen that he had strengths and a determination that rivaled hers...if he continued doing the effort.

Briefly she wondered if he thought of her as a friend. Not everybody was able to deal with her personality for long enough to actually consider a friend. So far only a very selected handful did that. Raikou, for example. Despite their differences in their personalities, they got along pretty well. At times they even got teased as if they were a couple, which always seemed to amuse Raikou.

So now what will she do? Fighting against Dialga was the priority. Beating him wasn't now just a matter of pride, it was also a fight for three lives. She was completely sure that without her help the bumbling airheads that were her actual partners would be doomed. But another thing she didn't want to admit is that she was at loss of what could be done. Dialga had time on his side...literally. And while the human had some of those powers too, they were insignificant compared to Dialga's abilities.

I'll be damned if I don't get us all out of this mess. I'll show everybody that Dialga isn't as tough and fearsome as they think he is...if we do defend ourselves correctly. She definitely didn't want to think what would happen if Dialga saw a weakness among them. As she saw it, it all depended on Mew for now. If she brings something new and useful to this group then we'll have better chances

When they got back to their room, Suicune laid on her bed. -"Sit there and think, human. Don't make the legendaries do all the work"- she said, hiding her concern under what looked like an unhealthy amount of confidence on herself.

-"So will we ask Mew about Arceus?"- the human asks. Suicune rolled her eyes at his stubbornness. She had explained that Arceus' chances to intervene were astronomically low but he insisted.

-"Yeah, yeah"- Suicune shouted at Raikou to get Mew inside again. -"And I don't care how you do it, but make her come to our room. We're not going back into the Leisure Room"-

Raikou sighed. -"She's not here right now. She'll be back in an hour"-

-"So now what?"- the human asked, still not giving any ideas by himself. I really do need to do everything here

-"I'll tell you what we could do: round up some back up. If we do show how Dialga was in the wrong here we can get them onto our side"-

-"I don't feel comfortable letting everybody know I'm shrunken and inside other Pokémon"- the human said.

-"Who else have you talked with?"-

-"...Keldeo and Palkia. Palkia is more or less on our side, I think"-

Suicune was very hesitant to get Keldeo on the whole mess. -"I don't think Keldeo would be a good idea. He doesn't have the gall to fight Dialga"-

-"Then do you think there is somebody else?"-

Suicune smirked. -"Giratina could be an option. Dialga more often than not hates to see that dragon involved in his matters. If we get Giratina in this then we could have an edge"-

The Aurora Pokémon waited for the human's answer
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Suicune's Thoughts

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune observed the human lying motionlessIsly on his blockedbed. His facialexpression remained ambiguous as he considered her suggestions. The Aurora Pokemon looked at him and wondered what his life used to be like and what he was doing before his problem started. His life must be pretty interesting. You get to go on adventures around the world, meet new people and Pokeminterest you told me that you haveons, and battle the champions. A trainer lestartingads a life filthought you were in dangerled with passion and teamwork as Raikou likes to say. Our bookworm knows far more about them than I ever will. Out of the many things she thought about, Suicune briefly mused whether the human had any friends or even a girlfriend. Will he like a tomboy like me if I were a human? Or will he prefer me as I am? Man, I'm getting a little lovey dovey here. It's a silly idea but she quietly smiled at the idea of being together with hum before shaking it off.

Finally, the trainer seemed to have collected his thoughts and sat up on the mattress.

"Giratina, right? He's the third of the Creation Trio if I'm not mistaken," the human said, "From what little knowledge on mythology I have, Dialga and Giratina aren't exactly on good terms with each other."

Suicune adjusted herself in her bed and cleared her mind. She vividly remembered how Dialga told her that story... more than a hundred times.

"You're right, human. Dialga, being the petulant idiot he is, has countless arguments with him about what is best for the worlds they oversee. Giratina had to spend the better part of his day hearing Dialga whine about how bad his works are or why wasn't he given more important roles in the creation process. Many times, the arguments got out of hand and became full scale inter-dimensional fights. One fight 200 years ago nearly destroyed our planet."

" I think I heard about that one. There's some kind of stone carvings in Celestic Town that mentioned a world-ending battle between Dialga and Giratina. Is there any precise cause of this dispute?" the trainer asked.

"To understand their conflicts, you must first learn about their worldviews. Giratina believed that any world created should be free of any' divine' interventions; their job is to make the worlds and let the continuum take its course. With the exception of monthly visits to various dimensions, nothing is directly altered by him. The current world we're in uses Giratina's policy; that's why the existence of the Creation Trio was only a myth among humans and remained so. But Dialga differed on that. He argued that being the creators of the world gives them the inherent right to be the supreme leader of anything within them; existence itself is merely there to serve him. When Dialga proposed this to Palkia, Giratina and his mentor, Arceus, they strongly disagree with that, believing that such ideals only meant to serve Dialga's own purposes."

"I totally agree with the others. I'd hate to imagine what my life would be like under a megalomaniac, metaphysical Legendary if my time with him was any indication."

"Not only that, Dialga, in a desperate attempt to get the others to approve of his 'blueprint' for the world, destroyed countless dimensions Giratina had created just to rile him up. Needless to say, Giratina was extremely upset about it; what he had spend eons building and nurturing was gone in hours. Their relations have gotten so strained that they haven't met each other for approximately 1000 years. I have no doubts that Giratina still has a few unsettled scores with Dialga which we will use to our full advantages."

"Not hard to imagine Dialga doing that," the human remarked, "I'm curious, Suicune, you seem to know a lot about what goes on between Dialga and Giratina. How exactly do you know these things?"

"I had the misfortune of hearing Dialga bawling himself out to me (waterworks and all) about how mean everyone is treating him and how no one likes his ideas. He even used that creepy mind trick against my will to make me see his side of the story. It was my most awful day. The short version, he always blamed Palkia and Giratina for sidelining him but he never cared to take a hard look at himself or his ideas. He also hated how Arceus treated him like a kid which I think is an honest assessment. Even when Arceus threatened to revoke his temporal power, he never seek a compromise. It's absolutely useless to talk sense into his thick brain!"

You can feel Suicune's anger rising as she talked more about Dialga. It probably better to calm her down before her temper got out of control.

"I see...we'll contact Giratina then make our next move to get more allies on our side."

"Fine...you can use the computer hub on the desk but I doubt we'll reach him."

You got out of the flesh bed and went to a device resembling a laptop embedded into the desk. It was far smaller and more organic-looking than the one in Dialga's steel-clad interior. The electric yellow computer has an elastic display and a keyboard encased in a gel-like membrane. A simple touch of the screen turned on the interface. You heard Suicune walked up beside you to have a better look at the screen. There are several apps on the menu.

You selected the icon indicating the PokeNet Messenger to start the software. A list of Raikou's friend popped up; a list that's longer than Dialga's. The message board seem to be very active at the moment as dozens of messages flooded in. Most of the conversations are filled with concern for Raikou. A lot of them are talking about how Dialga is spamming them with a message asking for the whereabouts of Raikou and Suicune or whether they've encountered any shrunken humans.

Dialga claimed that you, Suicune and a human plotted to kill him, is this some kind of joke, man?, a message from Ho-oh reads.

"Oh boy, Dialga sounds mighty pissed at you, Raikou. An advice from an old friend here: time to get your ass out of the galaxy :P" another from Xerneas reads jocularly.

"Dialga is really hellbent on getting everyone involved, is he?" Suicune gnarled her teeth.

"I bet he's doing so to score a few sympathy votes from whoever fall for his story."

"No one's falling for that dumbass unless they're accomplices. Raikou, tell your friends that Dialga is being himself again. Nothing to take too seriously. If any if them are still curious, tell them to join the group chat "Dialga Debate" under your name," Suicune ordered.

"Okay then," Raikou replied.

You went through the friend list and found the information for Giratina. Fortunately, he is currently available. You clicked on the name and started a conversation. You placed the conversation under 'group chat' and allowed the other Pokemons to join the dialogs.

H. Trainer: Hello? Are you there, Giratina?

Gira0523: Yes, this is Giratina. Who is this I'm speaking with?

H. Trainer: I'm am a human who got shrunk and is currently living with Raikou and Suicune.

Gira0523: ??? I don't understand you. What is a human like you doing with the Raikou? If you are trying to prank me here, I must let you know that I do not appreciate it.

"I don't think it's a good idea to directly state your identity to yet another Pokemon," Suicune whispered.

"What else can I do? Mention Dialga's name and risk angering him?" you hushed back.

H. Trainer: No. I'm not. I am living inside of Raikou because of a mishap done by a certain dragon Pokemon.

Gira0523: Huh? What exactly are you trying to say?! I don't know who you are or what you're doing but your claim sounds really dubious here!

H. Trainer: Dubious?

Gira0523: Yes, dubious! You are worse than Dialga at fooling. Come on now. Tell me who you are and we can end this unconstructive conversation soon. I don't have the time to clown around with you.

"You are about to blow the whole thing up. If he disconnects, we are screwed," Suicune snapped and facepawed, "Get Raikou into the conversation!"

H. Trainer: I think it's better to allow Raikou to explain. He knows how to deal with this.

Gira0523: Huh?

RaikoutheJolts: Hey there, Gira. Long time no see.

Gira0523: Raikou!!! Are you alright? Someone claiming to be a human just messaged me and told me he's living in you?... Wait a minute, I get this...Is this one of your jokes again, right? It's one of those weird fantasies you told me about. Ha ha! Such a way to start a conversation with your friend! :D

RaikoutheJolts: Actually I'm not joking her, pal. The human is actually shrunken and we are on the run, Gira. We need some help here? Me and Suicune are in serious danger here.

Gira0523: Alright alright. I believe you, silly! :) What can I do for my little jolter? :P

RaikoutheJolts: ....I hope you're ready with what you're about to hear. It's about Dialga. He's caused trouble again.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You decide to contact Giratina

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You stopped for a moment, trying to organize your thoughts into a concise story. If you wanted Giratina to be on your side, then you needed to make clear that you were the one who did nothing wrong...although you do have the feeling that what Raikou, Suicune and you did wasn't exactly innocent, despite how much Dialga deserved it.

Gira0523: What's taking this so long, Raikou? Thinking too hard about how to continue your joke? :O

Suicune huffed in annoyance and pushed you, almost making you fall. -"Hurry up!"- You steadied yourself and decided to get over it.

H. Trainer: It started when I was taking a stroll through a forest, several days ago. I black out or something and found myself on a strange place, like another dimension. I noticed I was shrunk, then I saw...

The more you typed, the more easily the words flowed through your fingers. You mentioned how at the beginning it all seemed surreal yet alright, and how slowly you realized Dialga was behaving shady. You described how you encountered Raikou and Suicune, although you avoided mentioning any vendetta they had against him, just in case. From time to time Giratina asked a question, but Raikou always told him to wait until the end. You ignored him and finished your story with how Raikou had taken you into his body and how you had lived in him for a while.-

H. Trainer: And it isn't bad at all, Raikou's insides are very interesting

RaikouTheJolts: Hehehehe, good You knew Raikou was flattered with your opinion.

Gira0523: Most strange compliment I have ever heard. Now is that all?

You frowned at Giratina's reaction. You expected more surprise. All the questions he had asked before were left in the oblivion.

H. Trainer: What do you mean with that?

Gira0523: Raikou, buddy, you knew that I didn't need much of an excuse to mess with Dialga, a whole explanation wasn't needed :P

RaikouTheJolts: But you needed to hear about this before Dialga attempted to lie to you

Gira0523: I wouldn't have believed him! Besides if you had simply told me "I have a tiny human inside me and Dialga is going to injure me and it" I'd have been on board

RaikouTheJolts: ...I knew that

Giratina started teasing Raikou. You got the impression that they both were very good friends. You wondered what was their story, and made a mental note to ask about it at some point.

Gira0523: So you want me to help you and the human? Ah, and Suicune. She's with you, right. What can I do?

RaikouTheJolts: Dialga surely is looking for us, we need protection from him

Gira0523: And you want me to host you three into my body? :P Just kidding, just kidding. That was your fantasy, not mine, hah
