But on the other hand, this is my opportunity to explore the personal thoughts of Suicune. What kind of fantasy would she have? Are they similarly as intense as those of a human? Perhaps it even involves humans. It's a topic worth delving into!

Ever since you've completed all the challenges, you could tell from her occasion stumbles that despite her cockiness and tough-girl image, the Pokemon has shown all signs of becoming attached to you. She would never straight up admit it but her actions said otherwise. I'm starting to enjoy her sarcasm and threats. It's like I'm also falling for her in some ways. She does look rather cute when she's all bossy yet affectionate. There's a lingering curiosity within you. You wanted to find out more about Suicune and what else is there beneath her tomboyish facade. Who exactly is this Legendary Pokemon? What made her demeanor so attractive? That's it, you're going with her.

You quickly ran up the steps and hurled toward Suicune, who was about to enter the doors to the testicle.

"Hey! Wait up there, Suicune!"

The sprint went a little too fast and you soon lost your balance. She turned her head in time to see you coming her way. Suicune's eyes momentarily widened in shock as she saw tumbling toward her. You bumped face first in to her body and fell back with an 'ummph'. She shrieked in a way very unlike her usual self and fell back on her rear. Stars and images erupted in your field of vision

"Ah! Easy there. You almost plowed yourself on me," Suicune exclaimed as she dusted herself with her tails.

"Sorry..."

"Couldn't you stop being so reckless?", she chided you, "It's almost like you're doing it on purpose just to get your hands on me."

"I got a bit too excited, that's all."

"Too excited, huh? Are you trying to 'score' some advantages with me?," she said with an raised eyebrow.

"Absolutely no way, Suicune! I wouldn't dare do that. Why on Earth would I attempt that and end up being added to your personal ice sculpture collection?"

"Because you secretly like being tormented by me. Admit it! You like it!"

"No!", you said as your face turned red, "Dialga is far more deserving of that treatment with all his weird fantasies. You should take it out on him."

Upon mentioning the long-forgotten Pokemon, Suicune momentarily looked at you awkwardly.

"There's no need to mention that sicko again. But you didn't really answer my question," the Pokemon grinned, "That's fine, I'll find out soon enough. Anyways, what''s on your mind?"

"Yeah uh...I want to come with you and see what this Fantasy Resort is about. Besides, this is an opportunity for you to understand each other a little better."

Her expression was unreadable for several second but then Suicune's muzzle cracked up into the most mischievous grin you've ever seen.

"So you're tagging along with me after all. We all got "needs" after all. I wonder what things you've got in your little brain. There are maybe even some fantasies involving me. Mind if I take a look at those later?" Suicune playfully jabbed you.

You were taken aback by the blunt request.

"I don't know if I'm okay with that. Those are personal," you blushed deeply at the Pokemon's suggestion. Her smile only seems to get wider as she realized that she may have struck gold.

"Oh, don't worry. You won't regret your choice, human. This will be different from your previous experience. I'll make sure of that."

The way Suicune said the last portion is starting to sound kinky. You are worried about what tricks she might be playing but you're also piqued by her suggestion.

"Let's just get in the and find out our options, shall we?" the Pokemon motion to the entrance with her tail.

You agreed with her and went in through a set of doors flanked by a pair of Raikou statues. Crossing through the door, you are greeted by an interior that is even larger than Sperm Bank. At least ten times the size of your average Pokemon stadium by your estimate. The first the you noticed is the vast white-grayish ocean and that you and Suicune are on some kind of pier that leads toward a large island. The dome-shaped ceiling depicts an artificial cloudless sky with the sun shining down brightly. There's heat radiating from the blinding orb overhead.

You looked down from the guardrail toward the shimmering sea and a distinct smell of the substance wafted toward your nose from the pounding waves below. The said island in the distance is a large mass of cartilage. From several hundred feets away, you can see two imposing buildings on the massive island along with small two-story buildings along a 'waterfront'. You can even make out the beaches that are lined with artificial-looking palm trees and deckchairs. Behind all of that is a mountain that overlooks the entire resort. There is something gleaming brightly at the peak at intervals but you're too far away to make out precisely what it is. The efforts and details placed into this place far exceeded your expectations.

"Looks like Raikou placed a lot of efforts into this place," you said to Suicune, "Looks like it will be good."

"We can't be sure yet. Large and majestic don't always equal good. Wait till we try out this place before passing our judgment."

The two of you walked on the bony pier for several more minutes before reaching the shore of the island. If it weren't for the white sea or the rather organic-looking structures, you might be as well on some vacation islands off Sinnoh. The grand entrance to the resort is a large public square decorated festively in yellow and purple. A large statue of Raikou and a plague at his paws that reads:

RAIKOU'S FANTASY FULFILLMENT RESORT
Fetishes, Transformations, Legendary Kinky Stuffs, and Everything In Between!!!

"Welcome to my most prized and proud creation!" Raikou voice echoed from an intercom speaker in the statue, "This resort is a culmination of years of research and many of the places are modeled on real locations I traveled to but with my personal touches to them. I hope you two will enjoy this place."

"Of course I'll do! I busted my flank for this so it better be good as you suggested!" Suicune fussed, "So what do you have for us? Don't tell me this is a kitschy romance vacation spot straight out of your imagination. I don't want any of those stuffs."

"It's better than that! As you may notice, this location is more than just the hotel. It's got virtually everything you could possibly find in a real resort town. Dining, shopping streets, waterfront beach, rooms for two, atmosphere, kinky shops, etc."

"Sounds interesting. Where should we start then?" you asked Raikou.

"That's up to you to decide. It's your vacation after all," the Electric Pokemon replied, "But as an advice just follow these guides that I have personally prepared for best experience. I am an expert in this type of situation."

Two pamphlets materialized on a pedestal in front of the statue. The cover page reads "The Best Fantasy Experience for Two!"

"Uh-huh," Suicune answered with an unamused expression, "That still looks rather campy to me and since when are you good at making itineraries?"

"Hahaha... Stop being such a killjoy or you'll never get on a date, Suicune. I'll be busy with something else right now. Have fun you two!", Raikou said before the statue went silent.

"*sigh* Some days I wish I could strangle that ditz," Suicune muttered.

You and Suicune walked down the waterfront of the island, taking in the sight of the boundless "ocean" and the random buildings that lined the shore. You were studying the guide like a tourist in a new country.

"So where does that cheesy guide want us to go?" Suicune asked you as she strolled beside you.

"Lemme see...It recommends that we can go for the Shopping Arcade first."

"I knew it! Raikou's recommending the classic dating routines," Suicune said in an exasperated tone, "After that, he will probably want us to go for the restaurants, then the strolls, some more cliched blah blah blahs, and finally the big night finale. Typical storybook endings."

"....It's basically what you just said," you said as you scanned the brochures.

"Trash those guides! They're just lame and predictable! Nothing more than junks lifted directly from books he read. Let's do this our way and Raikou can't do anything to stop us. Give me that!"

Suicune grabbed the guides from you and shredded it up with her mouth until they are nothing more than confetti.

"So where are we gonna go from here then?" you eyed Suicune inquisitively.

"Want something more fun and unpredictable? Just follow my lead then, human!"
_____

Surprise, surprise...I knew you wouldn't follow my guide, Suicune. But I got more things planned and you two are gonna love it!
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: You decide to go with her

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
It was fun to see Suicune grumbling about how Raikou had no idea what he was doing. There was something charming in her energy, and so you followed her.

"So what's the plan?"

"This is a simulation of a beach resort. He was going to do a pretty cliché itinerary lifted from who knows what books he has read, but we'll show him we're not going to follow that"

"Yes, but what's the plan?"

"Just follow me and do what I do"

Suicune trotted to the rows and rows of buildings of unknown purpose. You suspected that their content was defined by the fantasies Suicune or you may have. You didn't like very much the perspective of laying your mind wide open for her to peruse. "Tell me we're not going to enter any of these"

"We're getting out of her to the wilderness. These buildings surely will have copies of Raikou and I don't want to have him around" Suicune didn't stop to explain further. You barely could keep her pace while the buildings were replaced by hills and trees. The road turned rockier until they arrived to the highest hill in the simulation. Effectively it was an island, and there was a logs cabin there. When you arrived to the top you barely could breathe, but Suicune didn't seem tired in the slightest. She looked around, evaluating the different places.

"We'll start here. This is a simulation, we may as well cause some chaos. That'll deviate enough from whatever Raikou has planned he'll be forced to acknowledge he lost and I won.

---
Raikou was listening to everything Suicune said, amused. That was going exactly as he supposed it'd go. I don't need to do much to know how this'll go. The water level of the sea started to slowly raise. After a while the island would be covered under the tide, leaving only the top of the hill and the cabin as the available terrains. They'd be forced to enter the cabin, which was always supposed to be the final point of the simulation in his guide.
---

"Chaos?" not that you didn't like the idea. The mere thought of not doing what Raikou wanted was enough incentive for you to agree.

"Yes! We'll run this simulation to the ground doing what Raikou less expects. The more extreme the better"

You smiled. "Good. How do we start?"

"That kitschy beach town is within our reach. Let's jump in. Hop on my back"

You tentatively got on Suicune's back, not sure where exactly you should grasp. The last thing you wanted was to pull her mane and get rewarded by getting thrown down the hill into the sea. Simulation or not that was going to hurt. "I'm ready" you said, settling to hold onto her shoulders.

"Then here we go. Let's drive this simulation to the ground!" Suicune ran forward and once she got to the very edge of the hilltop she jumped in direction to the city, soaring with grace. You felt the wind and the buildings quickly approaching. You noticed that Suicune's paws were being surrounded by ice. All hinted there was going to be quite a ruckus once she landed.

And curiously enough, you couldn't wait to see what else she had in mind
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Suicune's Plan

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Once Suicune's paws came into contact with the ground, explosive colors of the aurora spread out and engulf the entire island. The force of the impact almost threw you off her back but you held on to her neck for dear life. Harsh sounds of glass and the stone floor grating on each other filled your ears, screeching and popping. You opened your eyes slightly and saw the Pokemon glowing with an ethereal blue haze around her body. Her purple mane sparkled and brushed against your face causing a chill wherever it touched you. You also note that ground where Suicune was frozen with blue crystals that spread out like an infection from the point of contact.

"Let the chaos begin!" Suicune cracked a grin bordering on manic.

The ice crystals expanded and started covering the fake tree and the storefronts on the island. Multiple copies of Raikou ran wildly out of the buildings in an attempt to flee the onslaught of the ice. But all of them failed and became ice statues in the process. Although you knew that those were simulations of Raikou, it still felt unsettling. Suicune blasted them with a powerful blast of Ice Beam and shattered them into thousands of fragments. You could only look on with both fear and curiosity at her powers. The Pokemon then extended her double tails and hardened them into blades and thrashed at the store buildings at unfathomable speed and retracted them back. Within seconds, an entire block of buildings collapsed and sent a cloud of debris your way. It felt more like a cold blizzard than the musty concrete smell you expected. When the dust settled, Suicune looked back at you with her glowing eyes and gave you her trademark smug grin.

"Was my little power demonstration too shocking for you, human?"

"Ummm...Was it really necessary to do this, Suicune?"

"Of course! I have to make him admit that he's weak and needs me to get anything done. Besides, my threats aren't bluffs and he's asking for this."

"That's a bit mean though. But I'll stick to your side. I have this interest for destruction so this kinda suits me well."

"Well," Suicune smiled and gave her neck a playful shake, "The demolition isn't even half done yet. You wanna see more?"

"Go ahead."
_____

While you and Suicune are enjoying tearing down the resort town, Raikou doesn't enjoy the feeling one bit. With each Ice Beam blast, a stinging sensation shot through his testicles."

"Ow ow ow ow...This... isn't what I... had in mind," Raikou cringed as he held his paws to his testicles, "Maybe it wasn't a good idea to invite the girl to a place she previously threatened to obliterate. Damn it, Suicune, you sly dog."
_____

As the hour went on, the resort island gradually resemble a war zone as Suicune continued her unbridled destruction of the place with Ice Beam and Blade Cut. The trees were being blown apart, roadways shattered, the scenic piers sunk, cafes and shops rendered into rubbles. After destroying the last of the buildings, Suicune inspected her handiwork: an island that look like a hurricane went through it. She frowned at the sight, still dissatisfied with the results.

"This isn't enough yet!" she said, "Time to the finishing touch to chaos!"

The Pokemon jumped high into the air, enough to surpass the island's tallest peak, and focused an energy ball in her mouth at the center of the island. Your eyes grew wide as it gradually grew large enough to encompass the two of you. Suicune smiled victoriously as she fired off the ball of ice.

"Say goodbye to your precious plan."

A few seconds later, an explosion unlike any previous one erupted. A white blinding flash covered the entire area and a deafening boom shook you to your core. You see the outline of the island melting away as the brightness forced you to shut your eyes.
_____

"Ahhhhhhh!!!" Raikou screeched, "Screw you, Suicune...you..."
_____

You gripped Suicune with both your hands and feet as you felt her gracefully swooped down to the featureless landscape below. When you felt it's safe for you to look around, you gasped. The blast has completely blown away any remaining portion of the resort, leaving only the frozen wasteland below. The biting cold air made you shiver; you only have a shirt with you. Suicune must've sensed your trembling and quickly offered you her mane for warmth.

"Hey there. You can loosen up already," Suicune's said, "You're starting to rough up my coat, you know."

"Oh sorry," you said as you got off her.

"What in the world was that?"

"Avalanche Missile," Suicune said, "A move that I saved for the most extreme battle."

"Don't you think you overdid it, Suicune? Poor Raikou, he must be feeling very awful right now," you asked worriedly.

"Nah, That bookworm will get over it soon. And he is about to start whining.....now"

"NOOO!!! My beautiful resort, my testicle. Suicune! How could you?" Raikou's voice exclaimed.

"Ha! If you weren't forcing me and the human on the cliched date, your testicle would still be intact."

"You totally ruined my simulator. My resort is now gone. You destroyed and froze the place. All the efforts I spent crafting the place is for naught," Raikou said sadly, "How can I ever mate now?"

"Pfft...Don't be such a crybaby, will you?" Suicune rolled her eyes, "I did you a favor by increasing the likelihood you'll find a mate. I destroyed an unoriginal creation and replaced it with something far better."

"What did you mean by that?"

"Just admit that I'm the winner and you're the loser, Raikou! And it means that you have to create something to my taste now, you hear? If you make me happy, then maybe I'll consider unfreezing your ball," Suicune said triumphantly, "Ha ha ha..."

"I'm..." Raikou said as he felt like crying. Okay, you won Suicune! But only this time. What do you want me to do?"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Causing Chaos

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Suicune smiled slyly towards you. "You, stay here. I have something to talk with Raikou" While Suicune got a bit further away you looked around. Suicune sure did a mess, you really are glad you and her are in good terms. Imagining what she would do to you is something that send shivers down your back. "Note to myself, again: don't make her mad" you think, looking at the rests of what used to be a town. Although virtual the destruction was still impressive.

On the distance Suicune was saying some stuff you couldn't hear. You suppose they were her plans for the simulation. You wondered what she'd like to see, after all she now was shoehorning her fantasy in. Just in case you prepared yourself mentally for what could come.

After a while Suicune returned, jogging cheerfully "It's done. Come, human, it's finally time to do what I want to do" and so you started following her through the destroyed street.

Several minutes of walking later you arrived to a structure you were completely sure wasn't there before. It would have clashed with the simulated town, after all. Now on the beach there was a big temple made of basalt. There were fountains and streams of water falling into the sea, and the overall effect was one of ancient luxury. You could even see a couple statues of Suicune, which you had half-expected. "That's more subtle than I thought would be" you commented.

"What do you mean?" she said, from the entrance of the temple

"I thought you'd ask for something that would have you plastered all over it. This is milder than I thought"

Suicune grimaced "Are you insinuating I'm egotistic?"

"No, no! I didn't mean that"

"I'm not egotistic. You better not be thinking that" and with a huff she entered the temple. You followed her, unsure of what you would find inside. After all this is Suicune's fantasy, who knew what she had in that mind of hers?

What you didn't expect was that the interior of the temple would be only one room, modeled like a very well taken care of temple. Everything was bright and of different tones of blue, contrasting with the gray basalt. Suicune was sitting on what seemed to be a big pillow, with another one to her side. "What's this place?"

"It was my home some time ago. Humans do have a knack of adoring beings more powerful than them"

"You mean people built this for you?"

"Yes. Sit here" she commanded. You obeyed, relaxing. It wasn't the chaotic vortex of activity you had expected to see. It was more...subdued than wild.

"When I knew you would make Raikou create your fantasy I didn't expect this"

"Can't somebody like me just want to relax in a familiar place? I haven't been here for a while and since I'm on the run I won't be for a long time. I just wanted to...to be back here again. And if I can be with somebody I tolerate then even better" she put her head on your shoulder, thoughtful. You had the feeling you weren't merely 'tolerated', but you weren't going to ask for clarifications either.

"It's a nice place"

"If you don't have anything original to say then don't say it. I think I'd like some...some silence. Forget what's going on and just be here"

You nodded, hesitantly placing your arm over her. You two stayed in silence for a while, trying to forget you were being chased by Dialga and hiding inside the body of one of your friends.

***

When Mew returned Raikou was laying around pitifully, bitterly regretting everything that had happened during the last few hours. "Are they done yet?"

"If you're asking if they're not in my colon anymore then yes" Raikou answered, standing up "But it's not a good time to bother them"

Mew fretted, her usual cheerfulness gone for now. "Raikou, Dialga is causing more problems to Giratina than we thought. Giratina won't hold him for much longer"

Raikou paid more attention, disguising the discomfort he was feeling in that moment. "And what do you suggest?"

"Dialga will find you sooner or later and will try to hurt that human and Suicune"

"That's no problem, I can run away again. I won't let him catch me"

"Yes, but sooner or later he'll get you and you'll have to fight. Look how quickly he found out where you are now. Do you seriously think you can take on Dialga by yourself?"

Raikou obviously didn't think that. He was in great disadvantage against Dialga, fighting was impossible. "But won't you and Giratina help me?"

"We can, but at some point other Legendaries will demand an explanation for why we're attacking Dialga. It's possible they'll be on his side on they hear about Dee-al-ga because it's a human who has a bit of Dialga's powers"

"Can't the human help in the fight?"

"No! With its size and its budding time powers he can't! And I don't think I'll be able to train him in time for him to at least be able to harness those powers successfully. This is a bad situation..."

"Then what do you suggest?"

Mew floated around frantically "Dialga is looking for you, Suicune and Dee-al-ga. What if...what if we separate you three? If at least one of you is away from the rest that'll be a big obstacle on his plan"

"Then it'd have to be the human who'll be away. Suicune and I can defend ourselves already"

"I know, I know! Then we have to hide the human but Dialga will suspect anybody who was in contact with the human. I would host him but Dialga knows I have been involved in this, he could try to go for me. We need to hide it with somebody who hasn't talked with it but won't reject it. I don't know who, that's the problem!"

Raikou thought for a moment, it was a delicate situation and they needed to define everything now. "The other Legendaries won't help us if they don't think it's the human from the legend. The legend says that human will be of help to us, making us reach new heights we wouldn't achieve by ourselves"

"What about that?"

"If we can show them the human IS capable of doing that then the rest of the Legendaries will have to help protect him and make Dialga back off. That would be the end of this mess, once and for all"

"We can't say it helped us, we can't prove it"

"Let's give it the chance to actually help a Legendary, then. What we need is somebody who has a goal but isn't near yet of achieving it. If the human can get into that goal and helps to achieve it then everything will be okay!"

"It sounds to me like you have somebody in your mind..." Mew said tentatively. The truth was that she would have preferred to train the human's powers, but ironically there simply wasn't enough time for that. A more 'diplomatic' plan was needed now.

"Have you heard about the Swords of Justice? There's this Legendary who wants to be part of them but hasn't done it yet..."

"Keldeo?" Well that was a choice Dialga would never suspect. The human should be safe with Keldeo, but the problem was convincing Keldeo of accepting.

"Yes, Keldeo. If the human can help him to get into the Swords of Justice and Keldeo testifies about its help then everything will be solved. Besides the human already was in contact with him once, he knows how Keldeo is"

"...I'll have to talk with Keldeo, then" Mew sighed. She was proud of being able to call herself Keldeo's friend and she hoped it was enough for Keldeo to trust her judgment, accept the human and be its new host. When she was about to vanish Raikou stopped her.

"Wait! How long do we have?"

"I think Giratina can keep Dialga entertained for around twelve hours more"

"Look, I don't think it'd be good to talk to Keldeo without the human. If we let any time pass Keldeo can think it twice and refuse, take the human with you and make Keldeo accept in that very moment"

Mew nodded "You're right about that. Okay!" she made a flip in the air,starting to cheer up "I'll pick the human up tomorrow at dawn! Tell him what will happen and make him go to sleep, okay? He'll need to be rested for tomorrow!" she said before disappearing.

Raikou sighed. It was going to be necessary to interrupt Suicune and the human, but he wasn't really looking forward to inform them of the development. He knew very well Suicune was getting attached to the human and wouldn't hesitate to force him to go with Mew and Keldeo, but what worried him was what the human would say. He just hoped the human would trust them to know what they were doing, even if it was necessary to leave Raikou and Suicune in potential danger while it was transported into a safe host.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Continue

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Back in the temple, you've lost count of how long Suicune had buried her head in your shoulder. The Pokemon has been silent for the past 15 minutes, her thoughts likely tucked away at some other unreachable places. What was she thinking about? Was it about her old home? The uncertain future? Or is it about this new and close friendship she found in you? The rare serenity was a drastic change from her usual cocky personality and you really enjoy this different side to Suicune.

Your arm is wrapped around her soft yet solid neck and you felt the powerful muscles relaxing beneath her plush coat. Suicune's blue velvety fur gives you a strange appealing sensation that makes you wanna stroke it endlessly. Normally, this would have resulted in you being yelled at or pummeled beneath her paws but now it felt like she expected you to brush her like a love-seeking Skitty. You decided to humor het by gently gliding you fingers through her purple mane, eliciting a contented sigh from the Pokemon. Suicune lifted her head and smiled at you. Her half-lidded red eyes seems to shine with the colors of an aurora in the dim environment of the stone temple. You noticed that though her gaze has softened substantially since your first meeting, the lights within those precious rubies still danced with playful dominance. Instead of an unrelatable prideful Legendary, you see someone who's longing for a close friend. You moved closer to her head and gently leaned against her neck. Suicune felt you at her side and brought her right paw around you and pulled you closer.

"Now, there we go. Silence does get you all relaxed and comfortable, doesn't it?"

You shuddered at the sudden strong grip.

"Hmm... Looks like you're really enjoying my company. Don't you just wish that we could sit like this for a few hours more?" Suicune asked playfully.

"If that's what you want, we can sit here for as long as you desire. The lady makes the call."

Suicune thought about your reply for a minute.

"In that case, let me cuddle you some more. Also, I want to feel those hands on my coat and mane."

"Umm... Alright..."

Suicune turned her head slightly away from you and enjoyed the soft hand moving through her mane. She has to admit: it felt wonderful. The human leaning against her provided some much needed warmth. It's a feeling that's been missing since she left the idiotic Dialga. And this human, interesting and enjoyable, might be the one who'll refill that gap. Suicune collected her thoughts before speaking up again.

"Hey, human. Let me ask you something: do you think it's possible we can take our friendship further? Ever thought about me being your girlfriend?" she asked, her muzzle cracking up at the last word.

You did a double take at the question. Did Suicune just invited you to be her special person? Given the circumstance, you were half-expecting it to come up in your conversation at some point. But you weren't expecting it to come up so soon.

"Well...based on how things went so far, I think that's a given."

"Nah, I don't believe you. After I the way I treated you and Raikou like personal servants or playing the alpha female this whole time, I doubt that you would find my personality appealing ," she said.

"To be honest, that's what I find interesting about you. You were so unlike the typical Legendary; you don't do those stuck-up routines and always seek to push the fine line to the maximum. Plus, you are a magnificent-looking Legendary. Is it possible to find a second one like you in the world, Suicune?"

"And...here we go again with the typical girlfriend lines," she said while rolling her eyes, "But I'll give it that you're being honest about your thoughts."

Both you and Suicune fell silent again as you both contemplate each others words which was unfortunate ended by an uninvited guest.

"Hey, Suicune!" Raikou suddenly interrupted, "You there, girl?"

"Hey, nimrod!!!" she yelled, "Can't you see we're having some quality time together?"

"Sorry to cut short your time. But we've got a major problem: Dialga could soon be coming our way."

"What? If there's one thing that jerk is good at, it's the resolve of his stupidity," Suicune muttered.

"But I thought Giratina is taking care of him," you said.

Bad news human, Dialga is tougher than he'd anticipated. Giratina isn't gonna hold him down for long. Probably less than 11 hours from now, he'll track us down. I believe that we are all in grave danger."

"Damn it! You got any contingency plan? "

"Well, Mew told me that she could take you to another host," Raikou explained, "It's one that's completely out of the picture for Dialga."

"And who would be this host?"

"I assume that you have heard about the Swords of Justice," Raikou said, "Your likely new home would be the youngest and aspiring member of the group."

"You mean that Keldeo fella? Did he agree to this?"

"We'll convince him as soon as we meet him. Mew will be picking you up tomorrow so rest well, human."

"Wait, you're letting him go on his own?" Suicune asked.

"Suicune, I'm afraid the situation calls for that."

"There's no way I'm staying without the human," she said firmly.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Informing Suicune and the Human

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
When Suicune said that you felt concerned and honored at the same time. She really was serious about you being her significant other, but you knew you couldn't let that get on the way of everybody's safety. "Suicune, I think that..." you started saying but she shook her head with a lot of strength.

"You can't agree with that. We shouldn't get separated!"

"Raikou hasn't even said we're going to be separated"

"He hasn't mentioned me, it's obvious what'll happen. This is unacceptable!"

"Suicune, you and I can defend ourselves but the human is an easy target"

"We'll defend the human, that's what we should do" she said firmly.

"We can't let Dialga get close to the human in any way. We must send it away, it's for the human's safety"

"Then why can't I go with him?"

"Because it'd achieve nothing. Dialga is looking for us three, if he finds you two together he'll succeed in his revenge plan. This way he at least won't be able to do what he wants"

Suicune gritted her teeth. She knew Raikou had touched a point he knew she'd react to. She wanted Dialga to fail miserably, after all. Knowing this part of the argument was already useless to argue she went for the next. "Keldeo hasn't even agreed to it. We can't send the human to him"

"Mew will convince Keldeo, I'm sure of it"

"Keldeo is just a child, you're putting him in danger!"

Raikou sighed. "First than all Keldeo is what the human would call a 'young adult'. He's ninety years old, he hasn't been a teenager for forty five years already!"

"Um, yeah, that's definitely not a child, Suicune" you said meekly, but she ignored it.

"Keldeo isn't the kind to welcome somebody, let alone host anybody. How do you expect him to give the human safety and everything he needs?"

"I'm not a mindless pet, I can talk to Keldeo and we can arrange something" you said, and Raikou soon voiced his agreement.

"You...are you really okay about that? They never even asked you..." Suicune realized she was losing the argument and that you'd be sent away mere hours after she confessed her feelings towards you. You understood it was hard for her, but it was something that needed to be done.

"I know that they have our safety as their priority. We should trust them, Suicune, everything will be fine". You kind of felt that if you said that she'd accept it much quicker than if Raikou continued discussing it. Suicune looked at you for quite a while before sighing in acceptance.

"It isn't like you won't be able to talk with me, Suicune" you said softly, but Raikou interrupted.

"About that, well, we'd have to be very careful but we could arrange something, I suppose"

"How long will he be away?" Suicune asked.

"I'm not sure. The objective is that he'll help Keldeo get into the Swords of Justice, which would make him seem more like the human from the legends"

"You never mentioned that until now" you pointed and Raikou laughed a bit awkwardly.

"Sorry about that, but will that be a problem?"

"How am I supposed to do that?"

"I don't know. You'll have to find out by yourself. I know you can do it, human"

You now knew you had a new task piled on yourself. As if the pressure of honing your temporal powers wasn't enough now you needed to help Keldeo to fulfill his dream. Now that was something you had no idea how to do yet. I suppose I'll know what to do once I'm with Keldeo. Raikou continued talking. "Suicune and I will run far away in the morning after Mew picks up the human.You two should rest now"

"We will" you answered, touching Suicune's back. She had been silent for a while already, but she followed you. After several minutes you arrived back to your bedroom. You laid on your bed and Suicune cuddled near you.

After an hour or so with Suicune you had an idea to make the transition a bit easier on her. You carefully stood up, making sure not to wake up Suicune, and walked outside of your bedroom. "Raikou? Raikou are you awake?"

"What is it?" Raikou sounded like he was still wide awake. Maybe he couldn't sleep due to being worried about Dialga.

"I'd like to leave Suicune a gift. Do you have any gift store or something?"

"I do. Let me guide you there" Raikou opened a path you supposed led there. You wanted to give her something in the morning before leaving. It'd be the proper thing to do, in your opinion.

You'd find a good gift, go to sleep and the next morning you'd give it to Suicune before leaving with Mew to see Keldeo. That should be enough to calm down Suicune.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Convincing Suicune

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You looked back into the bedroom and saw Suicune still sleeping peacefully in the bed. Her soft face is covered by stray strands of her mane. Seeing Suicune like this only serves to dampen your mood. It wouldn't be easy for you to leave her behind for a long time. A temporary separation is the optimistic way of putting it. But in the grand scheme of things, you know that you have to. The blame falls squarely on Dialga, who not only threatened you, but also Suicune, Raikou, and many others who might fall on his list in the future. You only hope that you won't get too many others involved.

After making sure that Suicune is safe and sound, you traveled through the passage that Raikou had just opened. With a few hours left before Mew pick you up, you proceeded as fast as you can. The gift shop shouldn't be far.

"This is so nerve-wracking..." you sighed.

"I know this is a lot of stuff to digest, human. It might seem overwhelming but I trust that you'll prevail. We have to stay positive," Raikou tried to comfort you.

You heaved another sigh before continuing.

"But I don't know how long I'm going to be away from her. It's just depressing to think about it. Plus, it'll take some time for me to adjust to new places. I'm not sure if I can handle that."

"You'll be fine," Raikou proclaimed confidently, "Keldeo is one of the nicest Pokemon you could meet. He'll make you feel just at home. Additionally, Keldeo has a similar personality like yours. You two will get along almost perfectly!"

"I sure hope so. But he better not expect something big from me. I have zero idea on how to him into that Swords of Justice organization he dreamed about joining."

"We'll figure that one out later on. We still have a gift to choose, remember?"

You continued down the passage for some times before speaking again.

"You know, Raikou. I've moved from body to body, Pokemon to Pokemon for the last couple of weeks. If things went as planned, I would've been in at least four to five Pokemons. Now, that's a lot of mouths, stomach, chambers to visit. It sorta makes me wonder who's gonna be next in line?"

"No idea about that. Perhaps Suicune?" Raikou said jokingly to liven up the atmosphere.

"She's...," you thought for a while, "Probably not a good idea. She might make us personal servants again. Imagine being forced to clean her colon or her you-know-what."

"*gulp* Lord Arceus help us if that happens. Who knows what will happen then? But good thing that you two are close friends now. Maybe she'll even enjoy it if you do it for her."

"Okay! Let's not go down that direction, shall we Raikou? You sure have weird thoughts sometimes."

"Right. Sorry about that. We're almost at the gift store. But I must tell you, calling my place a gift store is a gross understatement."

Raikou directed you to another opening which opens into a large chamber.

You looked at the imposing structure with amazement.

Raikou's gift shop is a large tent made from translucent films of membrane. It's the type that reminds you of the Pokemon Beauty Contests that you attended a year before. A sign reads "Raikou's Emporium" hangs above the opening into the store. You saw Raikou's projection waiting for you at the entrance. Appropriately enough, the Pokemon is wearing an apron and a name tag. A large grin is plastered on Raikou's face as he beckoned for you to come over.

"Welcome to Raikou's Emporium," he said, "Allow me to make your shopping a fulfilling experience."

"Okay, thanks there buddy. I just wanted to find a present for Suicune. Something that's small but meaningful."

"I see. Small and meaningful. I have many items that fits that description. Follow me if you please."

You did as you're told, following Raikou's projection through the entrance. The interior of the store is similar to that of a shopping center. Items of all sorts are arranged on tables and shelves throughout the floor.

"Take your time to look around. I'll explain whatever things that caught your interest," the projection offered.

This is gonna be a bit more difficult than I thought. A lot of the item is Raikou-themed which made it rather difficult for you to find a more suitable present for Suicune. The first shelf is lined with Raikou's plush doll with size ranging from a keychain to a life size replica of the Pokemon. Beside Raikou plushies, there are also Suicune ones. You helped yourself to two of the hand-sized plushies and gave it to Raikou.

"Ah...Nice choices. These plushies are a nice choice for snuggling while your far away.," the projection said before placing it into a basket at his side.

You spotted a table on the opposite side that is stacked with photo books of Raikou. You opened one of them and browsed through endless pictures of the Pokemon in various scenic locations through the world. Another book contains photos of Raikou showing off his muscular body . One of the pictures depicted Raikou in a cave with a pleasure-filled expression while his paws are...You closed the book and tried to get the image out of your mind. Whoa! I didn't know you could use Electric Stone like that?

The projection barely contained his laughter at your encounter.

You moved on to the next couple of aisles: toys, posters, paperweights, stationeries, card games, cheap plastic jewelry and even exotic dolls. But no items seem like one fit for Suicune. They're either too kitschy, inappropriate, or mundane to make a good gift.

"I'm sorry, Raikou. But none of the items here really fits my expectation. I don't know what I can give to her."

The Electric Pokemon thought about his next steps.

"Looks like we'll have to find something from my special collection, then."

"Special Collection? What's that?"

"You find out soon," Raikou said cryptically.

Raikou took you into a deeper and dustier part of the store. Rather than the cheerful atmosphere of a department store, the air gives off an arcane and enigmatic vibe. It felt more like you stepped into an old curio shop in an alley. There are ancient artifacts that looks like they were collected from desert ruins; several you believe came from the same place you would find a Claydol or rune stones. On one of the shelves, you spotted gems and and amulets of all sorts. Other shelves consist of mirrors, stone-carvings, powerful-looking swords, crystal staffs, orbs, and necklaces.

"Where did you get all these trinkets and curios?"

"I acquired them on my adventures but some are my very own creation. Many have their own special powers that could aid the wearer. Feel free to choose one."

You looked at hundreds of items along the shelve. You scanned past the dusty items until one caught your eyes.

"Hmmm...How about that?" You said as you pointed to a pair of identical necklaces. Each has an transparent orb that glows with a soft multicolored light. The colors compliment Suicune's coat and mane. It also resembles an aurora, her favorite phenomenon. Something about the the necklaces mesmerizes you.

"You mean those pendants? That's a gift from Latias and Latios after I ran an errand for them. They say those were imbued with some of their abilities. But I haven't tested them out yet. No telling what powers they might have though I supposed they are safe.

"I'll have them. It's the perfect parting gift."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Looking for a Parting Gift

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Sleeping just a couple hours more was very hard for you. The uncertainty of the future was nerve wracking, to say the least, and you still had no idea if Suicune would be okay. Well, she would, she was stronger than you in many senses, but after the moment you had with her the day before it's understandable if you're worried for her emotional state.

Raikou spent the whole night awake, preparing himself for running away. He said he'd be able to get far away and you hoped it'd be enough for Dialga to not to reach him. You had come to appreciate both Legendary Pokémon and really wanted everything to go well for them.

Raikou notified you that Mew would be there in half an hour, and shortly after that Suicune woke up, stretching. "Suicune?" you asked softly, approaching. She seemed to be like always, not showing any weakness. She sat on the floor and looked at you.

"You're leaving soon. I'm going to miss you, you know"

"I do. I...I got this for you" you took the necklaces. One for you, one for her. It was kind of cheesy, but these were special necklaces, surely it'd be beneficial for both of you. "I'll take one too. Do you like it?"

Suicune stared at the orb on the necklace that'd be hers, smiling fondly. "It's beautiful. Where the heck did you find that?"

"...Family heirloom" you lied. You were unsure if Suicune would accept anything if she heard it was something that belonged to Raikou. Suicune tilted her head, clearly not believing that.

"And you were carrying two necklaces with you all the time without letting them go for even a moment? I'm not going to fall for that"

"Okay, it's a long story. I promise that when we see again I'll tell you" That should work, there may be enough time for Suicune to like it. Besides even if it was owned by Raikou first the fact you had picked those necklaces should be good. Putting yours and feeling somewhat strange having what's likely to be a sign of the bond between Suicune and you you spent the next half hour talking with Suicune about where he'd go. She was not convinced yet about Keldeo's efficiency as a host but had to admit she didn't know him very well. Raikou was closer to Keldeo and he wasn't even what they would call 'close friends'.

"Mew is here" Raikou's voice resounded in your bedroom. After hugging Suicune for a moment you followed a path Raikou opened until you got to his mouth, which opened quickly and extended his tongue forward. After getting used to the lighting outside, it was surprisingly bright for such an early hour, your eyes focused on Mew, huge as expected.

"Dee-al-ga! Are you ready?" she said cheerfully. Clearly she was the most optimist about the situation right now.

"I'm ready. Is Keldeo near...?" you asked, looking around as if you expected Keldeo to jump from behind a random rock. Obviously that didn't happen, and Mew made you know that.

"No! We're going to go to where he is. It's pretty far away but it's no problem for me" Mew made you levitate using her psychic powers and Raikou closed his mouth in relief.

"Have fun but don't forget what you have to do" Raikou said as a farewell "Thank you for everything Mew. We'll be in contact"

"Wait, will I be able to contact with you?" you asked to Raikou. Raikou seemed unsure for a moment, shaking his head.

"I don't know. I think it would be safer to be careful with that...maybe that's how Dialga tracked me, through my conversations with other Legendaries"

That was kind of disappointing, but you didn't let it show. You nodded, understanding, and Mew floated you to the top of her head. You were practically submerged in her fur, the tall tree-like strands reaching upwards. For a moment you had thought Mew would take you in her body while you were transported, this wasn't what you expected. You couldn't see Raikou but judging by the sudden running noise he was gone.

"Well let's get going!" Mew announced and without waiting for you to be ready suddenly everything lurched around you. It didn't last more than a second but it felt disastrous.

"What the hell was that?!"

"We're here!" Of course. What was that move called, again? Surely that was what happened. Mew once again levitated you, until you were on her palm.

"You had said you hadn't talked to him about this. What will you say?"

"Just trust me and be silent, I can deal with this" Mew said with firmness and you didn't protest. Keldeo didn't strike you as somebody that'd trust you at first sight, better let Mew keep control of the conversation.

It wasn't long before Mew got to Keldeo. The young candidate to the Swords of Justice was pacing from one side to another and when he saw Mew he let out a sigh of relief. "M-Mew, what was this urgent thing you wanted to talk about?" he shot without even giving a greeting. He was clearly nervous for some reason and you wondered what Mew had told him to make him come.

"Keldeo, there's somebody that needs help and only you can be of help. Are you willing to take the mission?"

"Do you think I can do it?" Keldeo lifted his head, satisfied that he was trusted with something important.

"Yes. You're the only one who can do it. A friend of mine needs protection, he's being pursued by evil!"

"...protection? I-Is it somebody I know?" Keldeo's flattered expression dropped, replaced again with bashfulness. "I'm not v-very good with people, Mew...people I don't know..."

"You trust me, don't you?"

"Yes..."

"And you'd trust somebody I call a very good friend, right?" You rolled your eyes, somewhat annoyed. It's true Mew and you got along but there was no way you could be called 'a good friend'. You weren't going to protest, though. You carefully climbed Mew's fur until you were able to see what was going on. Mew was smaller than Keldeo but due to your diminutive size they may as well be as tall as mountains. Your future host was looking at Mew with attention and it was a wonder he hadn't inquired why Mew had her hand in that position all the time she had been there.

"...I think I would...who is this good friend of yours?"

"It's a human and-" that was all you heard before Keldeo gave a couple steps back, stammering 'W-w-w-w-what?!'. It took quite a while before Keldeo accepted to listen to Mew's explanation, as he was clearly worried about being caught and imprisoned in a Pokéball. You briefly wondered if most of wild Pokémon had that fear, you never really considered it. Mew had to insist you were somebody they could trust and that everything would be fine, until he finally calmed down, breathing deeply. Raikou, you said his personality was close to mine. You're either insinuating I'm a nervous wreck or Keldeo is different towards those he fully trusts.

"F-Fine...I can give that tiny human protection...but I have never shared my home with anybody. I don't know if I can do it"

"I wouldn't have asked you if I weren't sure you'd be capable of it" Mew said softly. Keldeo nodded, cheering up a bit.

"Okay, I'll take that human home, but I'm afraid I'll lose it...with the size you said it had..."

"There's no problem about that! Your insides can be the perfect home for the human"

"...my insides?"

"Yes! This human goes through your mouth and..." You groaned when you saw Keldeo's pupils shrinking in horror, exclaiming. 'I'm going to eat somebody?!' It took another five minutes to calm him down and make him know nothing would happen to you.

"B-b-b-but I have never been a host to anybody! I don't even know how to modify my insides..."

"You'll learn quickly, I'm sure of it" Mew replied. You raised your eyebrows. So Keldeo didn't even know how to do that? You were starting to have some doubts about everything but it was too late to back down. The best you and Keldeo could do was learn quickly and get used to that ridiculous situation. "So! Here it goes! I have to leave now" Mew carefully left you on the ground in front of Keldeo. You looked upwards, your new host was looking at you with uncertainty. "Remember that secrecy is vital for this mission, Keldeo!" Mew said as a farewell and vanished away.

Keldeo and you stood there for a couple minutes, in awkward silence. "Sooooooo..." Keldeo nervously muttered, looking from one side to another "Do you...want to go in...now?"

At least he wasn't breaking down or anything like that. Maybe you really would get along with him. "I think that'd be good" you said as calmly as possible, hoping it'd make him relax. Keldeo nodded slowly and lowered his head as if he were going to pick you up with his teeth. "Eeeeh...no, please, stop!" you quickly shouted, moving away. Keldeo heard you and stopped, awkwardly placing his snout on the ground to look better at you.

"W-w-what?"

"First than all I'm way too small for you to pick me up or anything" you pointed "And second: I don't feel comfortable being between anybody's teeth" again, you were very small so nothing would even happen to you but it still made you nervous. Keldeo apologized profusely until you were able to calm him down. This was all another hint he was very unused to dealing with tiny beings. You once again wondered how living inside him would work. "Just open your mouth close to the ground, I'll get in by myself"

"Okay..." he accepted and did that. You took a deep breath, preparing yourself to enter your new host. You managed to climb the lips and the teeth, it was official: you were entering Keldeo. Peering towards the back of the mouth you went ahead.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Next Day

choices: Wait for Keldeo to return home before trying
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You walked toward the throat and peered down the dark chasm that expands and contracts with each breath the Pokemon took. Warm, moist air rushed up against your face while the gurgling sound of the body emanated from the depth. The feeling is all too familiar now. This will be the third mouth that you'll be jumping down in the last few weeks. But Keldeo's statement about not knowing how to modify his body has you worried. "I hope Mew knows what she' doing," you thought. Keldeo's booming voice dragged you out of any thoughts you might have.

"Are you sure this is a good idea?" Keldeo's voice is filled with concern but it sounds more like yelling with you near his vocal cord, "Nobody ever taught me anything about body modification before. Besides, I'm not sure how other members of the Swords of Justice will take the news that I am charged with protecting a shrunken human."

"We'll worry about that when the time comes."

"But I'm afraid that I might hurt you, or worse, kill you," Keldeo said worriedly, "I don't know what Mew was thinking when she chose me out of all Pokemons. Why couldn't she have chosen my mom Virizion or uncle Cobalion instead?"

"She believes that you are the safest choice."

"Hmmm...For her to be this desperate, you must be in some pretty big trouble."

"Actually. Mew believe that I'm some chosen human from the legends and wanted to train me," you explained, "The issue is that my personality still isn't quite up to the job yet. She told me that we both can learn from each other and strengthen ourselves."

"The Legend?" the Pokemon said with surprise, "Is she out of her mind? That's only a myth. There hasn't been a human with that description for thousand of years."

"Well, the other Legendaries beg to differ," you said, "That's not all. Try adding a maniacal Temporal Dragon hellbent on vengeance on top of my list of problems."

"Temporal Dragon? I assume you mean Dialga. Okay.....," Keldeo put a hoof to his horn to stop the migraine, "This is getting a bit complicated. How did things ended up like this?"

"It's a long story. I'll tell you more when we sort out how I'm supposed to live in you."

"I'm...still a little ambivalent about this. Alright......if you say so....you may proceed," the colt said, "But I want an explanation as soon as possible."

Without any second thoughts, you slid down the throat and allow the esophagus to carry you to your intended location. The warmth from Keldeo's esophagus surrounded you as it slowly squeezed you downward in rhythmic pulses. You were coated with a thick layer of mucus by the wall which greatly aided your travel. Another 20 seconds or so, you plopped down into the stomach which is half-filled with Keldeo's previous meal. Although it looks smaller than Raikou's, it's more than enough to accommodate you with rooms to spare. The stomach is also completely unmodified; it's just pink stomach lining with a pool of acid, the sight of which worried you. Maybe it isn't such a good idea to hide in Kedeo. You landed face first into a pile of crushed Oran berries. A small amount of the juice went up your nostrils causing a burning sensation to fill your throat. The pain made you scramble for a drier and safer part in the chamber. You coughed and gagged in an attempt to reduce the discomfort but the humid, stifling air only served to make it more stinging. It took you roughly 10 minutes before you felt good enough to speak again.

"This is just perfect...Why am I always ending up in digested foods?" you grunted.

"Are you alright, human?" Keldeo said nervously, "So...Sorry about that. I'm totally new to this body modification thing. Mew made the request rather abruptly so I didn't have time to practice any moves to help you."

"Besides crashing and choking your breakfast, I'm good for the moment," you said, "But you'll need to modify your body before your stomach mistakes me for lunch."

"Ummm...if it offers you any reassurance, I'm not a meat eater. If I even took a nibble of meat, it'll give me indigestion. First thing, I'll try and get those food out of there..."

You felt Keldeo change his posture and grunted a little. Then a rumbling sound came from the bottom of the stomach. The contents around you started churning and swirling.

"Whoa...whoa...what are you doing?!" you exclaimed as you tried to balance yourself.

"Relax, buddy. I'm not going to harm you. You're scaring me...."

The noise resembles a bathtub draining but on a larger scale and more gross. You looked in amazement as a large whirlpool formed at the center of the stomach, taking all the mush and acid with it into the intestines. It was rather disquieting sight to witness and probably ended your appetite for any berries in the near term. The burbling cacophony eventually subsided as the last of the Pecha berries disappear into the hole at the center.

"I hope you are a bit more comfortable in there now," Keldeo said timidly.

"That helps a bit. But I don't want to stay in your stomach for too long. And I'm getting a bit nauseous from the swaying. Please get me somewhere else."

You sat down in the now-empty stomach and wait for Keldeo to make his next move.

"For Mew to be so confident in my ability, it must be pretty easy. All I have to do is just focus on the body part I want you in and connect a path to the stomach. Come on Keldeo, this is nothing compared to the Swords of Justice entrance exam...," the Pokemon talked to himself with an uneasy tone, "I'll....give it a try then."

Keldeo focused the energy from his horn and directed it into his stomach. For a Pokemon his size, the concentration required creates a large strain if the groaning and panting is any indication. A patch of flesh near you glowed with a blue light, causing it to deform and open into a sphincter. The entire process took less than a minute to complete.

"Hey Keldeo. I think you had it figured out."

"But I'm not sure if I'm doing it correctly. Without any basic knowledge about body modification, I don't think it's not a good idea to do anything else. I'll need to head home and ask Virizion or Cobalion for further advice. In the meantime, try out that hole I made. Please....be careful."

You looked at the newly-formed hole that reveals a path going up. But that's no surefire way of knowing whether or not it'll take you to the right place. Is it worth the risk to try out?

Still, anyplace should be better than the stomach, right? you thought before stepping in.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Going into Your New Host

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
As you don't want to make Keldeo feel like you aren't grateful for his effort you hastily entered the sphincter he had opened in his stomach. The ascending tunnel wasn't very well done. While you trekked upwards you found it to be bumpy and uncomfortable to walk through, and in some places it wasn't even opened completely. You counted at least four times you had to practically squish yourself through pieces of flesh to continue. Despite all the problems you were having you didn't comment it to your host. The colt was already doing a lot of effort in a field he had no idea what entailed, you were willing to not to be fussy about the quality of the passageways.

As long as he didn't accidentally link a path to his colon or anywhere that could mean your doom you were fine with whatever happened.

"How did I do...?" you hear Keldeo tentatively asking. Judging by the volume of the voice you were nearing his vocal chords again. You told him there were no problem yet and to not to worry too much about this. There was time to learn to control his body.

A while later you finally arrive to the destination Keldeo had set. The tunnel ended on a curved platform made of bone, which had several holes that both ascended and descended. "Where am I?"

"I thought it'd be better if you were in a place with no risk for you so...I opened a space in my head" Keldeo explained. You frowned, frankly not liking the sound of that.

"I'm not sure it's wise to modify anything in your head when you're not experienced" the last thing you wanted was Keldeo accidentally hurt his brain physically while trying to keep you safe. You weren't sure you could bear the guilt on that. Keldeo was silent for a moment, realizing you were right. After he said he wouldn't try again for now you walked to the tunnels. There were very few that seemed wide enough for you to barely crawl in. "What are these ducts?"

"Um, they were a side effect, I think. They lead to other parts of my head, I think a couple even exit my skin"

"So, you're going to ask Virizion or Cobalion for details about body modification, right? I suppose you won't tell them about me" You had no idea who Virizion or Cobalion were, but hadn't Keldeo called them 'Mom' and 'Uncle'? Maybe they were related to Keldeo's species.

"I shouldn't do that, they wouldn't take it kindly. I'll go home now, one of them should be there" the bone chamber started moving slightly, sign Keldeo started walking.

"Who are they, by the way?"

"They're my family and they're also members of the Swords of Justice. Virizion adopted me a long time ago and Cobalion is just a friend of hers. There's also another member of the Swords of Justice but I haven't seen him for a while"

"Really?" You may as well get to know Keldeo a bit better "What did they teach you?"

"Well they have helped me to train. My Swords of Justice entrance exam is in a week" I have only a week. Huh. "Cobalion taught me to empty my stomach like you saw a while ago"

"That was gross, unexpected and impressive, all that" Raikou had said he wasn't capable of doing that and you wished he had.

"Cobalion says fighting or training with a full stomach is not a good idea. It makes me feel queasy so I don't do it often" Judging by Keldeo's tone he admired Cobalion a lot.

"What else have they taught you?"

"Virizion taught me this!" Keldeo proclaimed but nothing happened for a moment. It took a minute but soon the air at the other side of the chamber started glowing. Small dots of light gathered until they formed a shape on four legs, gathering and compacting. With a flash the particles melted together, showing Keldeo. You raised your eyebrows, pleasantly surprised.

When you had seen Keldeo's picture quite some time ago you had calculated the colt only would be tall enough to reach your waist, but the representation in front of you was as tall as you. "That's awesome!"

The Keldeo in front of you bowed his head, grateful of the compliment, and continued talking "It's good for training too, it's tangible and all. It's about channeling some sort of energy we Fighting types have and using it to create this. Normally I'd be exhausted to create a real size projection, but this is tiny...I can continue walking like nothing happened" Keldeo sat on the other side, keeping his distance from you. Looks like he wasn't ready to really approach you yet.

"You look young" you commented. Keldeo grimaced and for a moment you feared you had said something impolite.

"Apparently my species is...going to look like this for most of their lives. I'm not terribly young, I could even have offspring if I wanted and had a mate, but I'm going to have to be called 'a colt' for a very long time. Maybe someday I'll stop looking so...youthful" You made a mental note to avoid insinuating he's way too young. Calling him a stallion may not be completely fitting but it could make him happy. At some point I should do it.

"Do you have any questions for me?" Keldeo had talked about himself. You may as well offer to do the same. The colt tilted his had, considering for a moment the options and finally picked the one closely related to their situation.

"Have you been inside other Pokémon before?"

You nodded. "Raikou. He was my host when I first ran away from Dialga. He was a great host, although a bit tiring at times"

Keldeo stood up and approached a bit before sitting again. You could stretch your arm and touch him, if you wanted "Then...I have a few questions..." you signaled him to go ahead and the colt started to fire a rapid series of questions. "How will you eat? Will I have to start eating meat? Will you have to go to my stomach every time you needed to eat? Where did you sleep? Could you die inside me? Are there places you shouldn't go to? When you're leaving my body how will you do that? I won't have to push you out with my waste, right? What did you do to keep yourself busy the whole day-?" you raised your hand, stopping him. Keldeo's tone had grown more frantic with each question. You weren't sure how to deal with a panicking host, so you made him take a deep breath.

"I didn't hear very well most of the questions. Please, go slowly. I'll do my best to answer everything you want to know, okay? Think everything again and start over"

Keldeo nodded, calming down. You knew the colt was scared. He was burdened with a responsibility he surely never thought would have and you were willing to guide him as much as possible.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Into an Organic Skull

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The colt remained silent for the last ten minutes or so. In fact, it was so silent within the skull that you could pick up the sound of light heartbeats and blood rushing through the vessels. From the opposite side, you watched with both amusement and concern as Keldeo's representation seems to be attempting to make his mouth form words but his muzzle was locked tight as soon as they parted. Although the Pokemon tried to make himself look calm, his trembling forelegs and sweat-covered face tells another story. Admittedly, he looks adorable in this state when he is trying to figure out what questions to ask. Keldeo's blue eyes are glazed as they looked blankly at you. You could still hear him taking deep breathes and muttering indiscernible sentences under his breath.

Finally, the colt seemed prepared as he closed his eyes and took one last deep breath. When he looked at you again, you could tell from his posture that he is more mentally focused, but there is still a hint of uncertainty written on his face.

"Al...alright. I think I've made up my mind....on the key questions I want to ask you," Keldeo said.

You smiled and motioned for the colt to ask the first question.

"First of all, what kind of stuffs do you usually eat?"

"To answer that, I'm not much of a picky person over food. In my opinion, there is not much difference between meat and vegetables. I don't prefer one over the other. So there is no need for you to take the extra effort to eat something that you normally don't like. I'm perfectly fine with a vegetarian diet. Although..... you might have to slow down on the berries for a while," you said with image of digested berries still fresh on your mind.

"Oookay," Keldeo replied, "Next question: Where are you supposed to eat then? I can't have you going down into my stomach and getting yourself messy from the ordeal every time."

"Hmmm...that's a little more tricky. From what I know, Raikou always had a separate stomach to store all the foods that I need and another chamber for me to enjoy the food. He could transport the food throughout his body with his advanced network of tubes and openings. I guess that means that you'll need to learn to create a new organ. But I'm not going to demand that you learn it right away. We'll figure out how we can directly get the food from your esophagus once you're better trained."

"Alright. I don't want to do anything that could harm my body, we'll defer that one for now. Still, I don't like the idea of you being forced to slosh around my stomach content for food."

"But my choices are currently limited."

"It won't be for long once I get the basics from Vizirion. Eating aside, where are you supposed to sleep then?"

"That's up to you to decide. You can put me anywhere you want besides the stomach. As long as it's soft and reasonably quiet, I could make it my bedroom. This room, for example, is my current top choice."

"Okay. That addressed the issue of accommodation," Keldeo said, "Will you ever need get outside of me once in a while?"

"I could use a bit of fresh air every few days or so. It's a good idea but it'll be dependent on whether I'm in a safe environment or not. And I assume that I'll use your mouth as the primary entry and exit point, right?"

Keldeo blushed and looked at you awkwardly. "Well, obviously yes. I wouldn't think of putting you through my colon. Where else would you expect to go?"

"Hahaha...sorry, my mistake. I wasn't thinking clearly. That sure was a bad question to ask," you said bashfully.

"We all get "those kind" of questions so it's no big deal," Keldeo shrugged, "Anyways, on to the next question: Protecting you from external danger means that you'll be spending a good amount of time within my body, do you have any plans about what you'll do while you stay with me?"

"I have this plan here, Keldeo. Once you are more comfortable with modifying your body, I'll volunteer to be the first to explore the chambers and organs you created for evaluation. With some experience I garnered from Dialga and Raikou, I can advise you if there are any rooms(no puns intended) for further improvement. Particularly, if you ever mastered creating the "Body Control Room", please let me be the first to try it out."

"I'm..... not... too.... sure... about that whole 'controlling my body' thing. It sounds seriously like an creepy attempt to take over my mind," Keldeo said uncomfortably, "How exactly is this "Control Room" supposed to help me?"

"Well. You have the benefit of a second mind at the helm to give you additional brain power. I'm a Pokemon trainer and I may be able to offer you tips and strategies to help you use power in the most efficient way. Think of it as an energy upgrade."

"That does sound great but I still have to think about that...."

After about an hour, you sensed that the Q&A is getting to a close, so you decided to put the final note.

"...I think that brings our little session to an end," you said, feeling fortunate to make it through Keldeo's wall of questions.

"I think I may have one more for you: Under the worst case scenario, how will we explain to Vizirion and Cobalion should they find out that you are living inside me? What fail-safe should we prepare."

"In the event that my presence has to be revealed, I will personally explain to them my situation from start to finish. If they're skeptical, I can ask Mew, Raikou, or Suicune to corroborate if possible." It would a risky operation though. Any psychic communications could be picked up by Dialga to find me. Let's hope Keldeo won't be dragged into this.

"They are very reasonable and level-headed Pokemons but you need to be very convincing for them to believe you. For now, we'll keep your presence a secret."

You nodded.

"Okay, my home is around the corner. And Vizirion and Cobalion should be back from their practice by now."

Keldeo's representation stood up and you did likewise.

"Let me show you my parents then. Come on, follow me down this hole. I think this is the one that links to my retina. It'll give him a good look of my family. Hope nothing too embarrassing will come out of this."
______

Keldeo reached a clearing where a grove of trees where two tall Pokemons stood. The colt trotted across the tall grasses toward the grove where Vizirion and Cobalion are conversing. When Keldeo got within a few meters of the trees, the green quadruped Pokemon face the colt and smile.

"Hey, dear Keldy. How was your day? Did you have fun training yourself today?" Vizirion's cheerful voice beamed.
_____

You heard a female voice while you followed Keldeo down a hole.

"Yep. That's my mom for you," the colt blushed.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Questions and Answers Session

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Rolling your eyes at the 'Keldy' nickname Virizion used you followed Keldeo through the duct. Just like the journey to what was now your sleeping place it wasn't a very well done passageway. "I should have been more careful..." Keldeo grunted, pushing apart flesh with his hooves.

"It's not that bad for a first try or an accidental side effect" you replied.

While you were walking through you listened to what was going on outside. At least Keldeo had enough ability to not to say aloud anything he said to you.

---

"It was fun, I think it was good" Keldeo replied "I'm going to rest for the rest of the day"

"Rest before noon? Are you feeling well?" Cobalion asked, although judging from his expression it was more a joking question than real concern "You usually continue training until midnight"

"I think it's good. Keldeo has trained very hard during these months and should rest more" Virizion said to him before turning her attention to the colt. "Cobalion and I are going to have to leave later, I hope it's not a problem to be alone" Keldeo stepped back, looking at the ground.

"That's no problem, you know it..." Virizion laughed warmly.

"I know, I know. It never gets old to see you react to my words" Apparently Virizion liked to tease her adoptive son as if he were still a kid. Keldeo raised his head, pretending nothing had happened, and approached Virizion.

"I have to ask you something..."

---

Keldeo and you were observing what was going on from one of his eyes, even if the view wasn't really clear. While Keldeo had managed to make a small compartment for you two to stand on and see outside the eye was filled with liquids that turned everything blurry and unfocused. At least you still managed to distinguish shapes and could hear what was outside. "Virizion is the green one, right?"

"Yes. Cobalion must have been the blue form over there" Keldeo had the benefit of seeing clearly but he tried to imagine how you were seeing everything

"Are you sure Cobalion is just a friend of your mom?" You had the hunch they could be closer than that, but judging by Keldeo's blank stare he had no idea.

"What else could he be? I like to think of him as a parent but he's more like an uncle"

"Is that so?" Confirmed, the idea they could be together didn't even cross his mind.

---

Once Virizion and Keldeo were far enough from Cobalion Keldeo gathered courage to ask. Unfortunately he hadn't really prepared what he was going to say so he had to improvise and hope for the best. "What is it, Keldy?"

"I was talking to, um, Raikou..." Keldeo felt you facepalming at that "...and he brought up something about...about modifying one's internal organs. Is that something that really can be done?"

Virizion tilted her head curiously "It's possible. Why are you asking me that?"

"How does one do that? I mean..." Virizion hadn't changed her expression yet Keldeo was growing more nervous with every second "...I think I could find a way for it to be useful to me, to my training and everything"

"Are you sure? It's not something that's done easily. You'd need a lot of practice to be able to do it well enough"

Great, just what I didn't want to hearKeldeo thought. "Then the most basic concept could be good enough. Like how does that work?"

"It's simple in theory. You simply need to focus on what you want to do, picture it in your mind. The hard part is actually making it happen, using your energy to move your tissues and cells. You need to know a lot about your insides for it to work properly, otherwise you could screw up and do something you didn't intend to do" Keldeo supposed that's why the ducts and holes appeared in the small room he had created for the human. He surely was lucky nothing bad had happened.

"Is there a way to make it easier?"

"I have heard it's really matter of practice. Once one has mastered this one could do anything in their insides and not even blink. Are you interested on trying something like that?"

"Um" Keldeo thought quickly "After hearing all this I won't for the moment. I have to focus on my training for now and on , um, work in the Swords of Justice once I get in. Have you done it, though?"

"Not really. I do know how to do it without any problems but I don't have any reason to really do it" Virizion looked back to where Cobalion was waiting for her "If you ever are going to try remember to stay away from your head or your chest. It's better to avoid any trouble and it's less likely you'll be harmed if you adhere our kidneys to your spine than if your heart grows another chamber. If you're going to try please tell me so I can supervise you, okay?"

"Okay mom, I will"

"I'll be with Cobalion if you need me. Rest well, Keldy" Virizion said affectionately said before returning to Cobalion. Keldeo watched her go before settling down onto the floor with enough privacy, thinking what Virizion had said. It wasn't really of help but maybe he could work with that.

---

"Virizion sounds like a kind Pokémon" you commented, going back into the tunnel. Keldeo and you were going to return to your room.

"She's amazing. I knew you'd like her" he said, entering the empty space "Any ideas?"

"No, not really" Most of what Virizion had said went over your head. You had no idea how to help Keldeo with this. However it seemed the colt had other plands, judging by how he paced around thoughtfully.

"I can try. It can't be that hard and if I'm careful nothing will happen. I'll need your help, human"

"What are we going to do?"

"If I want to change my insides then I must first know my insides, don't I? Where everything is located, the general shape and how everything is connected, all that. I should have thought it before. I know what my organs are and their functions but it would be good to confirm everything, right?"

It sounded logical to you. "And how are you going to do that? Do you have anything like a map of your insides?"

Keldeo stopped pacing around. "I don't and I don't know where to obtain something like that but it shouldn't be a problem. I'm already inside myself, I can go ahead and see. It can work" And with that Keldeo trotted to the tunnel you had used to arrive there. "I'll need you to remember all of this and to guide me if you can. I'll create paths while we're near. I'll follow Virizion's advice and stay away from the head and the heart, everything else should be fair game" the colt started descending "I didn't do a good tunnel here!"

"It doesn't matter" you said, following him. You weren't completely sure of what Keldeo was going to do and how effective it was going to be, but you knew you couldn't leave him alone for that.
