After all he was doing this for you, it was your responsibility to see nothing happened to your host "So how are you going to see your organs?"

"Um" Keldeo stopped for a moment "How would this work better? We could take our time and be inside the organs. I'd see exactly how they work and all but it'd take us the whole day to be done. Or we could look from outside. That way we'd done quicker but I think it could be less informative. You tell me"

You considered the good and the bad points from both options. Combining them was the most obvious choice but the truth is that you'd need to predominantly go for one of the options. "Let's take a look..."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: "Meeting" Keldeo's family

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
"...Hmmm... I prefer to explore your organs from the inside," you said, "I want to know you a little better, Keldeo."

"...Sooooo... that means we're taking the more challenging way then," Keldeo smiled, "You know, I'm as curious as you are about my own body."

"You got any place on you mind?"

"The Brain and Heart are off limit, obviously. So you'll have to wait a while before attempting a take over with body control," Keldeo grinned, "We'll try with an easy and safe organ first. I was thinking about giving the Water Pouch a try."

"The Water Pouch?" you asked.

"It's a part of me that stores water that I could eject from holes under my hooves to let me walk across water," the Pokemon said as he lifted one of his forelegs to show your the opening.

You looked and studied the underhoof. "Looks interesting. How does this work?"

"Watch." Keldeo demonstrated the ability by using several small jets of water, allowing him to hover. You looked at the colt as he maneuvered by shifting his hooves, circling around you with a triumphant look. While seeing Keldeo perform various moves, you have to wonder how his small body managed to store water several hundred times the volume of his body. Your mind thought about several explanations: he could have drawn in moisture from his surrounding. Or alternatively, his body has some type of mechanism for producing water. While you were thinking, you failed to notice Keldeo hovering toward you. The Pokemon performed a few flips and rolls and playfully sprayed some water on your face to get your attention.

"Hey! What's that for?" you said, recoiling from the cold water.

"I just thought you could use some water to freshen up a little. Hahaha...," he replied as he landed beside you.

"You know, you claimed that you consider yourself to be a young adult but sometimes you sure act more like a colt," you commented.

"Oh come on...I love a good prank or two occasionally. Much of my target being random Pokemons around my home. But my favorite target is Cobalion. Virizion told me that we all need a good laugh once in a while much to his dismay. I'll admit, I can be a bit of a show off sometimes."
_____

Keldeo went for Virizion who was at the edge of the clearing talking with Cobalion. The colt walked through the tall grasses and flowers in the meadow to his adoptive parents. Keldeo thought up an explanation for his sudden interest in body modification. The green Pokemon took notice of her adopted son. She beamed at him and trotted toward him.

"Keldy, dear. There you are! Is there anything you need help with?"

"Umm...Yeah, mom. Actually, I was wondering if you have time to supervise me while I perform my first body modification," Keldeo said.

"Why yes, Keldy," Virizion smiled, "Cobalion and I were just discussing that it may be time for you to learn about that."

"Huh?" Keldeo's eyes widened.

"Keldeo," Cobalion replied with a calm tone, "We think it's time for you to learn about some of the more advanced moves a Legendary has to master. In light of your upcoming Swords of Justice exams, it's perfectly appropriate for the occasion."

"Umm...okay..."

"Awww, aren't you excited, Keldy? You will soon be part of our group. There's so much to being a member fo the Swords of Justice. There's new responsibilities and places to visit. You'll even get the chance to attend the Council. Where you can catch a glimpse of Arceus. Oh, I just can't wait for the day of your exam."

"Thanks mom," the colt blushed.

"No problem, dear. Come along now, we have some practices to do before you perform your first modification."

"Alright!!! Now that's what I'm talking about," Keldeo feigned excitement. Just as planned.

"Hold on there," Cobalion suddenly said, "I was wondering, though, why do you have such sudden interest in body modification, Keldeo You're usually more preoccupied with learning the Sacred Sword and physical training at the hills. This is so unlike you. Is there something you want to tell us in particular?"

"I......ummm...," Keldeo droned as he thought up a believable reason.

"We usually change our bodies to allow our virtual representation to make useful visits to any organs if we're aren't feeling well. Is there anything wrong, Keldeo?"
_____

Back within Keldeo, his representation is sweating profusely as he stood dumbfounded.

"Oh no....what have I done," the representation groaned, "Now, they'll realized that I'm up to something."

"You need to calm down, Keldeo. By the way you're acting, you won't keep me secret for long."

"Okay....okay....okay.......deep breath, Keldeo.....," the Pokemon tried to comfort himself, "Okay...let's try again. A believable reason...do not reveal any references to a shrunken human.....convince my mom and uncle....."
____

"Not really........I just......just wanted to learn more about my own body and power...that's all," the Pokemon blurted out.

Keldeo looked nervously Virizion and Cobalion's reaction. Both of them looked at the colt with a surprised expression and eyed each other with mutual realization.

"Keldeo....are you......," Virizion struggled to form words.

"Curious about certain body functions, are you?" Cobalion completed.

".......Ummm....yeah sorta like that.....," Keldeo said absent-mindedly before he realized what his adoptive parents meant. Oh no, what have I done! They have a major misunderstanding....I'm just digging myself deeper now. I don't know what to do about this.

"Come over here, Keldeo, the stag asked. The younger Pokemon complied and walked toward his uncle while his anxiety level crept up. Once Keldeo got beside Cobalion, the larger Pokemon looked at the colt deep in the eyes and sighed.

"Keldeo. it is perfectly normal for a Pokemon at your phase to be a bit more inquisitive."

Keldeo felt that the conversation has taken a very wrong turn and that he needs to quickly shift it back on track before things get any worse.

"Wait, Uncle Cobalion! It's not what you're thinking. I meant understanding the functions of my body parts. But it's not the kind you're thinking about! I want to learn how to strengthen myself. Nothing more than that," Keldeo desperately tried to explain.

"Don't be shy about it. We all get to be exploratory when we were young. There is absolutely nothing wrong with that. Let me explain some things to you," Cobalion said.

"Uncle, can you just let me explain myself please? Mom, please help me. You have to believe me. This is a big misunderstanding," the colt pleaded with Virizion.

"Keldy. You don't have to hide that. I know fully that you're a grown Pokemon and this is bound to happen soon. Even if you're not planning to use body modification for those purposes, it wouldn't hurt to listen to uncle Cobalion, would it? You could learn a lot from him."

"Not you too!" Keldeo whined.
_____

Back inside the body, you watched Keldeo panicking and twitching on the floor.

"This is just wonderful! I made uncle Cobalion give me 'the talks' out of all things," Keldeo's representation said as he whack his head against the floor, "Arceus save us, we're gonna have to sit this one out."

"It should be interesting enough though. I want to hear about it," you grinned before getting sprayed with a faceful of water jet.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: From the Inside

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Keldeo practically dragged himself on the ground, about to have a panic attack. You dried your face, amused. It was not very kind of you to be enjoying the show. How was it called, again? Schadenfreude? Wasn't that a german word about having happiness from other people's suffering? This was a very watered down version of that, but you couldn't deny you didn't want this to continue.

The tunnel finally ended and Keldeo and you entered to a very long and thin organ, stretching into the distance. There was a deep grove on the center, filled with water, and near you there seemed to be a deep hole. The water fell in waterfalls but the level of the water didn't deplete. It was possible somehow there was a duct in the legs that led unused water back to the pouch.

However Keldeo couldn't care less about the inner workings of his water systems. He was too busy brooding about the perspective of having the talk again to care about any of that. "Come on, help me here! What can I tell them to stop this?"

"This is almost embarrassing, Keldeo" you said with a smile "It won't be that bad, and look at the bright side: you have a believable explanation for your questions. It's all perfect!"

"But you'll listen to all that!"

"I'm inside you, it was to be expected"

"W-w-w-what are you, some kind of voyeur?"

"My interest is purely academical! Come on, it won't be for long. Open your eyes naively and pretend to not to know a thing. This is for the good of both of us...I think"

---

Keldeo had to fight his own self to not to grimace. "M-mom, really, I don't think I need this. I have known the workings of all that for a long time already! It's instinctual!" Virizion shook her head, somewhat annoyed at his protests.

"You may have learned it by yourself decades ago but your own words are showing your inexperience. Cobalion is male like you, he's the most appropriate to talk to you about this"

"Terrakion already talked to me about that before he left" Keldeo argued. Cobalion shook his head, clearly not believing that.

"Terrakion was never the kind to care much about that. Let's sit" Resigned to listen, Keldeo obeyed. The stag and the colt awkwardly held silence for a moment until the older Pokémon broke it. "So, when every Pokémon reachs a certain age changes start to happen in their bodies. You're not the exception, and the reason of these changes are so you can have your offspring in the future"

"I already can, you know" Keldeo mumbled. Cobalion didn't react annoyed, after all it was true.

"Do you need a reminder how the process goes? You don't want to screw up, right?"

---

"Oh goodie" you muttered, smiling awkwardly while Keldeo tried to bury his face in the flesh of the floor.

"Why is this day happening to me? That's what I want to know"

"That's something I have wondered several times during the last few weeks"

---

Keldeo had shaken his head with vehemency, but Cobalion hadn't paid attention to that. Instead he launched himself into a long speech about the miracle of life, the procedures of how to properly engage with a mate and overall specifications and precautions in the whole matter. Luckily for Keldeo, Cobalion was of a completely different species and therefore couldn't go into excessive detail about several things, but that just meant an extension of the talk would be required.

---

"I told you this wasn't so bad, Keldeo. I had a similar talk when I was a kid, mainly because in humans it isn't instinctual apparently"

"That doesn't mean I wanted to hear it a second time. I DID talk to Terrakion about this a long time ago,I just didn't want Mom or Uncle Cobalion to know I asked that"

"How long have you known Cobalion and...that Terrakion guy?"

Keldeo stopped trying to smother himself with his own mane and peered through it to you. "They have been there since my earliest memories. It's true I haven't talked to Terrakion in a while, but I remember they have always been part of the Swords of Justice. They're like my family"

"Right. Hey, listen, I think Cobalion is getting into a related topic to what interests you"

---

"The reason you want to learn to modify your body is so you can see by yourself the results of all the developments, right?" Cobalion asked lightly, as if it were something he asked to everybody every week "At this point of your life it's already finished, in fact I think you're around thirty years late. But really, it's just for that, right?"

"W-what else could I have in mind?" Keldeo asked imprudently and regretted it almost instantly.

"Well you may have wanted to try to improve the changes to your liking-"

"I have said it isn't that!" Keldeo shouted. Cobalion sighed for a moment before turning to Virizion.

"I trust him about that, Virizion. Do you?" Keldeo noticed relieved that Virizion nodded. "I believed that from the beginning but as I said: he could learn a lot from you about these matters" she said. At least they didn't think he was going to learn that to do it. If only they had agreed that before the whole spiel then maybe all this embarrassment would have never happened! Having confirmed that with Virizion Cobalion returned to the topic. "So if isn't that then I suppose you're really asking just for curiosity to see by yourself"

"I don't...agh, just finish this" Keldeo muttered as softly as possible, enough for none of them to hear it. Cobalion smiled coyly and continued "Ironically unless you learn body modification you won't see anything worthwhile. After all most of what happened was inside you. I know you can authentic create copies of yourself and it's possible you can create one so minuscule it could get to the innermost crannies of your body, but even then I doubt you'll like what you see. I haven't seen it by myself, never thought of doing that and I doubt I ever will, but it can't be pretty.

Modifying your body you could make it a bit more interesting, but I think Virizion would like to see you having descendants so maybe you should be careful about messing anything there, okay?" Cobalion was far from solemn. Maybe he was enjoying the whole thing despite Keldeo's reactions. "Why don't you focus on harmless modifications and leave everything else intact?"

"I will. Um, thank you for, um, the talk, Cobalion, um, I think I have to, um, go over there and, um...um" Keldeo hurriedly stood up and ran away. Cobalion laughed to himself and walked to Virizion.

"Keldy is so strange at times, Virizion. Way to raise him so well adjusted"

"It's your influence, you prick" Virizion pushed Cobalion away playfully "Aaaand...it's his personality too. Keldy already knows everything there is to know and doesn't need me coddling him anymore, but it's just too nice to see him bashful. At some point he...he won't be like this anymore. I'll miss these times"

"I will too and I'm sure Keldeo will too. He's in a hurry to try to act dignified, and I get it, at his age he wants to make clear he's independent and can deal with his life. Until then...let's enjoy this"

---

"I'm so glad it's over" Keldeo said, guiding you through his water pouch.

"But Cobalion must be right, though. You know, yesterday I visited Raikou's testicles"

Keldeo looked at you with bemusement. "Do I want to know why?"

"It's a long story and for your information it was not for whatever reason you're thinking. The point is that in there it wasn't like anything you imagine it'd be. Modifying your body is...something that can lead to unbelievable results"

"I would have never tried to know about it if it weren't for you, so don't expect me to turn my body into some sort of amusement park for you. Now let's focus on what's here"

"Where does all this water come from?" you ask. That was pretty much the only question you had. In answer to that an opening appeared on the wall and Keldeo and you looked through it. Outside, between Keldeo's organs and extending further than you could see, lots of thin capillaries emerged from the pouch and sneaked into every corner of the body.

"These ducts pick up the water, including from the outside. It's not hard to understand"

"Right. Hey, look over there" you pointed to an area between the stomach and what you were sure were the lungs "There's a lot of space over there. In the future you may need to create something there...when you finally get Virizion to supervise you"

"I'll ask her when I stop feeling so embarrassed about the talk. What else do you see?"

"Let's see..." you looked around and pointed to just a couple organs more. Keldeo took the time to see carefully how everything was placed, memorizing it "Those are the intestines, that's unmistakable. And that over there is...I'm not sure, I think it's the liver?"

"...I don't know what that is"

"Either way I know how all that works and I'm sure you do too, so I don't think we need to see by ourselves"

"Okay, down here again" Keldeo and you stood on the floor of the water pouch while the opening closed. "Let's get to the end of this. This runs to my hind legs too, so we could cross entire body here in no time"

"What other option do you have?"

"We could get out of here now and see where to go now. You tell me"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: An Unexpected Talk

choices: The Origin of the Swords of Justice
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Despite how confident and assured the colt looked, you were feeling very jittery about his plan. The view from that wall opening was the first look you had of his complex body. By your own estimate, the number of locations to explore could rivaled those of Raikou. You saw various organs beside the familiar ones. But Keldeo has no answer about their functions. With a novice like him, there is a real risk that he will sent you somewhere you wouldn't want to end up at. The large intestine comes to mind. Who knows what else this colt has in store for you?"

It doesn't feel like a good idea to be traveling down Keldeo's Water Pouch. You even started having second thoughts about being in his body. Why can't Mew just choose someone more experienced yet little known? I'm seriously thinking about 'moving in' with Virizion.

"Don't you think we should temporarily put our trip on hold, at least until we get some instructions from Virizion?" you cautioned.

"Don't worry. It is safe for you to travel through the Water Pouch," he said, "And I don't think I'm ready to go back to her yet. My cheeks are still burning from the sheer embarrassment that Cobalion has caused."

The earlier scenes played out in your head again, causing you to mentally smile at the Pokemon who's seems to be recovering. It's understandable. No one like having to hear that, especially if you're well past the age that normally make those type of discoveries.

"I don't know about what kind of plan you've got. Care to explain," you asked, "It could save us a lot of trouble.

"First, we'll travel down the Water Pouch. Then, we'll just wait near the rear end until I calmed down enough to return to my mom. After that, we're free to do all the exploring we want."

"If that's the case, how long would it take for you to get yourself back in order then?"

"I probably need at least an hour. Not much," Keldeo said straightly.

"That works for me," you shrugged, "But promise me, in the mean time, that you won't do anything dangerous."

"Arghh...." Keldeo rolled his eyes and pouted, "You're starting to sound like my mom when she's worried. I hate it when she goes into protective mode."

"And rightly so. Virizion really cares about you, Keldeo. Better to be safe than sorry. Come on, let do something less risky."

"Ohhhh......alright," the colt groaned, Follow me, my rear is this way."
____

Back outside, Keldeo walked north to a more secluded part of the clearing. Virizion and Cobalion are out ofsight; no one would disturb him in this peaceful corner of home. Away from all the nuisance, he made himself comfortable on a soft patch of tall grass and thought about his life so far.

*sigh* Peace and quiet at last. As much as I like them, mom and uncle can be really annoying. Can't they just take me seriously for once?

Keldeo looked at the sky and counted the clouds zooming across the area above him. He looked at their shape and imagined what they might be.

The colt noticed his pale yellow horn in the upper part of his vision. By measurement, it is only about a third of the length of his hoof. Keldeo frowned at the sight. Compared with those of the Swords of Justice, his appendage is rather on the short side. This has been a source of awkward jokes from Terrakion and Cobalion, much to his mom's chagrin. You'll learn about its true length once you're older, Keldeo heard them said long ago.

Well, it's been several more years since then and there's no lengthening at all. Would this affect how I could use Sacred Sword or the possibility of finding a suitable mate, if any still exists?"

Keldeo rolled onto his back and grunted.

My exam is in a week and I haven't practice frequently enough. This is getting stressful....I seriously need an outlet for this frustration.
____

The Water Pouch is vast and complex. You saw countless passages branching off from the main chamber, carrying water from other parts of the body. Those water gathered into the main canal and flowed toward the end of the Pouch. Along the way, you glanced at Keldeo every chance you got. He had this uncertain expression on his face as he shifted his eyes cautiously the path ahead.

It took you and Keldeo some times to reach the end where the groove split and drained down two holes that leads to the hind hooves. The water crested down with a thundering roar that drowned out Keldeo's voice.

"Here we are! We've reached the end," Keldeo announced on the top of his lungs.

It was a breathtaking sight to take in. A thick mist blew across your face as you looked down the chasms. Kelsey found a drier spot that's slightly elevated and beckoned you over.

"Let's just wait here until I get myself together," Keldeo said.

"Hmm...any ideas what to do in our downtime?"

"I could show you the story behind the Swords of Justice if you're interested. Wanna do that?"

"I could hear a little Legendary history directly from a Pokemon. So, yeah. Why not?"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Cross Keldeo's Body

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The chance of knowing what's basically a legendary story you knew absolutely nothing about was one you couldn't let pass. If I'm supposed to help him to get into that organization then I should know as much as possible.

After making sure that the noise of the water wouldn't drown Keldeo's voice you told him you were ready to listen. Keldeo took a deep breath, as if it were going to be a long story, and went ahead. "The Swords of Justice is...not really an organization. It's a small group whose objective is to keep peace between humans and Pokemon specially in times of war, but they tend to lean more towards Pokemon protection than protecting humans"

"No surprise there. I have the feeling most Legendary Pokemon look down on humans in some way or another". Dialga taking you only as an interesting study subject was a hint of that. At least Mew, Raikou and Suicune treated you more or less like an equal, although it was hard to consider yourself an equal when you're tiny. Keldeo seemed to be in a middle ground. He had a lot of reticence and originally didn't want to serve as your host, but now that you two had spent some time together he at least seemed to accept you. There was almost no trace of his nervousness by now.

"Cobalion, Virizion and Terrakion are the actual and...only members right now. Since the group was created our numbers are pretty limited because very few species have the ability to learn Sacred Sword, a essential move to be part of the Swords of Justice. It's said it's a move created by Arceus to harness enough strength to overcome any obstacle and achieve greatness for the benefit of others!"

"And do you know it?"

Keldeo looked away. "I know the basics but I haven't really done it yet. I have been working with them to learn it but I need to be strong and determined to do it! Not just anybody can.

The Swords of Justice are fighters and are rarely defeated. Mom told me once that the first Legendaries that knew Sacred Sword demonstrated its power in one of the many wars this land has gone through, saving hundreds of Pokemon from collateral damage done by humans. Hostile Pokemon, fueled by fear and loyalty to their masters, attacked anybody who wasn't on their side, including wild Pokemon. The first Swords of Justice fought against all of them, taking the wild Pokemon to safe places and avoiding a bigger tragedy altogether. It wasn't confirmed but it's said their actions are one of the reasons the war they took part in ended in the first place, as both human sides felt afraid of attracting their wrath if they continued"

That was an impressive first appearance of the Swords of Justice, you had to admit it. "When was all that?"

"Several thousand years ago, even before Mom was even born. Mom and Cobalion are part of the fourth group. Once a group has trained and taught new members the secrets of their work they can retire into obscurity, away from everybody, but it's hard to find worthwhile candidates. Even if they spend years training...it's very hard to meet their expectations"

"And what happens if you don't reach their expectations?"

Keldeo looked introspective for the moment. "Not much, but once one is rejected the chances is that...one won't ever reach them...I'm lucky on this regard because I have been with Mom and Uncle for so long and even if I'm rejected I'm sure they wouldn't abandon me, but...I have wanted to be part of the organization for such a long time I don't know what I'd do if I didn't achieve it...I don't think I'd be able to forgive myself"

Just what I needed, some pressure. Keldeo, not knowing what you were thinking, continued "The actual group is more accepting of humans than former groups, but even then they are...hostile against them. If you approached them I don't think it could end well for you, even with Mew arguing in your favor. I think that she approached me despite my inexperience not only because Dialga isn't going to suspect you're with me but also because...because I'd accept you after a while. Mom Virizion or Uncle Cobalion would outright reject you"

It can't be that bad, right? If the situation is explained to them I'm sure they'd support me...they fight for justice and I haven't done anything wrong.

"That's some of the things I know of the Swords of Justice. Our stories are many and heroic and it's likely there are many I haven't been told yet" And so he started to tell several stories about the kind of battles and fights the Swords of Justice had taken part in. They were riveting tales and you listened with attention, it was no wonder Keldeo wanted to be part of them: it sounded like a hard job but worth doing. "Nowadays Arceus contacts us directly in very problematic situations, but if I'm part of the organization I could receive orders directly from Arceus!"

"And not talk to...him? Her?"

"I don't know what they are. Cobalion, as the leader, would be the one to talk. Very few Legendaries are in direct friendly contact with them" Keldeo groggily stood up, the hour had passed.

"Are you ready to go talk with Virizion now?"

"...I think I am. I would rather to avoid talking to Mom for a good while but I'll have to swallow my pride and go. This situation will need all my attention...for your sake"

"With an attitude like that I'm sure you'll be part of the group next week!" You didn't know if you were saying the right thing, but you did think it was at least a good step onto the right path. Feeling encouraged Keldeo nodded.

----

Having relaxed and not feeling as embarrassed as before Keldeo carefully stood up and walked to a point where he could peek where Virizion was. Fortunately there were no signs of Cobalion, which was good. Despite his will to go ahead and ask he didn't think he felt like talking to him for now. "...Mom?"

"Yes, Keldy?"

"I need to ask you to talk about body modification, please...I still think it'd help in my training and would be good as a test of my power" Keldeo lied. He didn't think it was convincing but it was better than saying the truth. Virizion didn't believe it fully, but despite feeling Keldeo was hiding something she felt there may not be any harm on telling.

"Fine. I don't know what you can hope to achieve but I'll answer you some questions. Ask, Keldy"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Origin of the Swords of Justice

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Virizion sat down and readied herself for the questions Keldeo will ask. The colt acted a bit fluttery whenever she looked at him. Having raised him since he was a foal, it usually a bad sign when Keldeo started avoiding eye contact with her. She has this constant feeling that something is definitely going on. Though it might not be anything important, it's still troubling that her son would conceal information from her. More so, he wants to know how to do body modification which isn't part of his upcoming exam. His explanation that it's for training purposes just doesn't add up. What is my Keldy up to? she wondered.
_______

Keldeo noticed his mom looking at him attentively. He could tell that she wasn't entirely satisfied with his explanation. Virizion has a keen sense and could tell when someone isn't being honest. Based on childhood experience, it's only a matter of time before she figured out what happened with stunning accuracy.

Virizion never broke eye contact with Keldeo since inviting him to ask her questions. It always makes him uncomfortable when his mom did this. He could see himself in those rose-colored irises. His tiny images looked back at him innocently as if pleading for him to tell Virizion the truth in order for them to be released from their crystalline prisons. He looked away, no longer able to bear the prying look of his mom.

Sorry, mom...but I don't think you're ready to hear about the human yet.
______

Not wanting Virizion to scrutinize him any further, Keldeo launched off his first question.

"First, what do I need for body modification to work?" the colt asked.

Virizion blinked her eyes and refocused on her son's question.

"That is a good question, Keldeo. First of all, you need to have a strong concentration. Your mind has to be strong and impervious because any distractions could result in serious harm to your body if you're modifying vital parts," she said calmly, "Secondly, you will need a detailed picture of what your body looks like. That includes the location of vital organs, your bone structures, nerves, and so on. Do you have a good understanding of your organs?"

"Ummm...I only know a few of the basic ones, mom."

"That should be enough for a starter like you. Don't try to push yourself too hard. We will start with the easier moves."

Keldeo deflated slightly at the remark but put on his best poker face.

"So what kind of force is behind body modification?"

"The easiest way to put it is that each organ in our bodies produces a unique energy form that allows them to function properly. Those energies have vastly different properties; as different as oil is to water. A skilled Pokemon will be able to shift those energies based on their needs without disrupting the natural flow of their organs. In other words, body modification is done by shaping those energies and using them to create or reshape an organ."

"I've never heard about that before," Keldeo marveled, "It must be difficult."

"It's not much harder than you creating copies of yourself. Once you get a hold of it, it'll be second nature. You can do it!" Virizion smiled.

"How long has body modification existed? I want to know a little of its history."

"The knowledge of it has been around since the 1st generation of the Swords of Justice," the Pokemon explained, "Although the names of the members were lost to time, their lore still remains..."

Keldeo sat down and listened to his mom's story,

"I'm a bit fuzzy on the details though. Several thousands years ago, the 1st group leader was practicing his moves for an upcoming battle. When he tried to use the Sacred Sword, he was momentarily startled by the loud crack of a thunder. It was intense enough that he misdirected his power and accidentally swapped his lungs and created a second stomach. Fortunately, his health was not adversely affected but it caused a great deal of panic. The leader became curious about the phenomenon with his body and started to study it. And his research later set the foundation for body modification."

"What was it used for back then?" The colt asked curiously.

"It was said that the leader initially have no use for it since it won't aid him in war. But his second-in-command proposed that power be put to good use. His subordinate suggested that the extra stomach be used to store weaponry and food supplies, a practical and efficient alternative to bringing in auxiliary forces. Initially skeptical, the leader decided to give it a try anyways.....We'll fast forward and skip the gory and detailed parts....Long story short, the strategy worked perfectly and the Swords of Justice soon because the most feared and effective of all Pokemons. Body modification has since been mastered by several other Legendaries and used many others.

"It's nice to know about that, mom. The previous Swords of Justice did a lot for us. I'm so honored that I'll get the chance to join such a group."

"Without their effort, our world would be far less diverse and some legendary Pokemons won't even be here today. Countless lives would've been lost..." Virizion said sadly.

"Were the modifications used for any other purposes, then?" Keldeo asked with feigned ignorance.

"I don't know....but I heard instances of Pokemons, even humans, taking refuge in the stomach and other organs of a host Pokemon. And that's all I'm aware of."

"What a weird concept," Keldeo commented awkwardly.

"Well, I think that's enough explanation for now. Want to give your first modification a shot, Keldy?"

"Yeah, I'm ready."

"It would be quicker to show than tell. I need you to remain quiet while I used my mind to probe your energies. It's not harder than creating copies of yourself. I'm sure that my Keldy could do it," Virizion said, "Sit still now and follow my directions."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Basics of Body Modification

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
While Virizion talked to Keldeo about the most basic details about what Keldeo wanted to learn, you listened carefully. The backstory of this ability made some sense, although that meant it was relatively recent, but what got your attention was Virizion mentioning some Pokemon had taken humans as guests inside their bodies. That was unbelievable to you. You had thought you were an exceptional case, but apparently there had been other instances, enough for Virizion to know about them. Pokemon residing inside Pokemon was expected, humans inside Pokemon was stranger.

And since Legendary Pokemon were the ones who mastered this ability did that mean that for one reason or another other humans had been inside other Pokemon? You wondered in what circumstances that could have happened, and also if more common and known species could do this as well. For a moment you wondered if any of the members of your team back home would learn to do this, but it wasn't like you would have the chance to find out. Once this whole mess was cleared up and you returned to your usual size it wasn't like you had reasons or ways to shrink again.

When Virizion told Keldeo she wanted to link with her mind into Keldeo's energy you got worried. Would she sense you inside Keldeo? She was only going to probe his energies, it wasn't like she was going to find you, right? Keldeo seemed to share your worry. He looked as if he had been caught redhanded doing something he shouldn't have, and you sincerely hoped his real face didn't have that same expression. "I'll return later. Mom could sense my copy if she's probing my energies" he said and without even waiting for your reply the representation dissolved into thin air, leaving you alone in a corner of the Water Pouch. Oh, fantastic. I'm stranded in unknown places inside Keldeo and without any guide. I better not move.

---

Keldeo was much more careful with his expression outside of his body than in his representations. He somehow managed to keep a straight face and nodded, feeling immensely nervous. He hoped that at least he wasn't sweating bullets like he felt he was. Virizion stared for a moment before approaching. "Again, be very still. The probing will take only a moment but it's delicate" Keldeo obeyed and she slowly made contact between her forehead and Keldeo's horn, for lack of a better place, and closed her eyes.

She could sense Keldeo's energy. She felt it coursing through his adoptive son's body, but there were some anomalies that got her attention. "Keldeo" she said with a serious tone. Keldeo tensed up, fearing the worst. "Your energies are disturbed. I feel several modifications to your body. Have you been attempting this arleady? Without asking me?"

"Um...yes..." there was no use denying it. Virizion, alarmed, examined the changes.

"There's an empty space in your skull, very close to your brain. That's extremely dangerous for a beginner! Until you have enough experience I order you to leave it alone. Don't try to make it be gone" There were also a few tunnels, very small and almost unnoticeable. She could sense they connected the skull and the surrounding areas with the stomach, as well as an organ she wasn't sure what it was. She wasn't very knowledgeable about the internal anatomy of his son, after all. But what worried her the most was a foreign speck of energy. She could sense there was something inside Keldeo, and she was bewildered to find out it was in Keldeo's rear, barely above the articulations of the hind legs. The energy felt strange. She had felt something similar before. 'Dialga?' she wondered. That was the temporal dragon's signature energy, time powers. But no, there was something else joined to that energy, and that was what puzzled her. It wasn't Dialga. What was going on?

"Mom?" Keldeo had noticed Virizion had turned tense. Now he feared even more the worse, but Virizion made no comment. Instead she went to what they were going to do now.

"We're going to modify a lesser organ. Give me a moment to decide what..."

"Couldn't we create a new one entirely?" Keldeo asked, hopeful. The human would need a place to eat and he still thought his stomach wasn't the best place for that. Virizion didn't take long to destroy those hopes, though.

"You're way too inexperienced for that right now. Let's go with the basics first and if in a couple weeks you're still interested we can go into the next level, organ creation.

I don't have a couple weeks. Keldeo thought, forgetting he shouldn't have done that. Virizion was linked to his energies, she could feel it. Virizion opened her eyes, having heard that, but didn't inquire what was wrong.

"Here's one. Focus on your belly. In there you'll find a small round organ, it's a container for any debris the water you use for your attacks may have. When it's full it's emptied into your excretory system, but as right now it's not full we can use it. Have you located it?"

"I have" Keldeo pictured it in his mind, a very small organ compared to most inside him. It wasn't even a worthwhile place for the human to see, unless he felt like waddling thighs-deep through useless minerals.

"Picture how it's connected to everything else, it should have countless ducts connected. See how your blood vessels surround it. Carefully imagine that all ducts get separated from it, leaving it isolated" Keldeo obeyed. Just like he had gone when he got the human out of his stomach earlier, he imagined the change in his body. "That's right, well done. Let's try to make it larger.

Expand the size of the organ just a bit until it doubles in size"

That was a tad harder to do. Expanding it would mean pressing against the blood vessels surrounding it, he'd have to modify everything. Still, he obeyed, slowly and carefully moving the round shape of the organ until it reached the size he wanted. Somehow the blood vessels moved as well, compressing the organ a bit but nothing burst or got damaged. "You need to remember there are things around each organ. Don't modify anything mindlessly, always make a plan"

After that he was told to reverse the size change, which he did. There was a series of exercises that focused on very basic changes. The hardest thing he did was to make a thick passageway between that filter and his stomach, just to erase it. But he couldn't deny the time with Virizion had been useful. He was more conscious now of what modifying his body entailed and what the risks were. He hadn't gotten as far as he had thought he would, but it was useful.

"Thank you Mom. I'll rest a bit now, this was more tiring than I thought it'd be" he said after the connection was broken. He was in liberty to lie both in words and thoughts.

"Practice and be careful, Keldy. I don't know what use you can give to this, but maybe in the future you'll find it useful". Virizion watched him go before running far away from the grove of trees that formed their common areas. After fifteen minutes Cobalion appeared in the distance and she quickly went to meet him, making sure Keldeo wasn't near.

"Virizion! What's the hurry? Did something happen?" Cobalion asked, looking around for any danger.

"Not yet. Maybe. I'm not sure. Cobalion, we need to talk. It's about Keldeo" she said.

---

You had no idea what was going on outside. With Keldeo's representation gone you felt a bit abandoned, so when the air near you started to form the colt's silhouette you felt greatly relieved. "Keldeo! How did it go?"

"I think it went okay" Keldeo replied, making sure he had created the new copy correctly.

"Did she find out about me?"

"I don't think she did"

"What did you learn?"

Keldeo told you in few words the most important points of Virizion's lesson, which you approved. That all seemed great and at least would mean a smoother stay inside Keldeo in terms that he wouldn't risk the integrity of his organs. "Good. Now what?"

The colt looked around. The waterfalls that led to his hind legs were still there, but it wasn't like there was much to see in those places. "Well, I suppose we could continue going around. Virizion's lesson was of help but I still don't have a full grasp of the location of everything"

"Right. You lead the way" As soon as you said that a sphincter appeared in the wall of the pouch. "So, let's see...we're around here" you pointed to Keldeo's thigh. It was more of a supposition than anything else, but it didn't really matter. "What is on the surrounding areas you want to see?"

"I don't know" Keldeo went to the newly opened passageway. "I don't know if we'll find any surprises. Let's take a general look around first, check if there's any point of interest and if there's nothing worthwhile I could make a path to return to the front"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Virizion's Guidance

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You and Keldeo head into the newly formed sphincter for further investigation. As you descend the roughly formed tunnel, skepticism and uncertainty reigned your mind. The Pokemon may have mastered a few tricks from his surrogate mom, but you still have no idea about how he actually apply this freshly learned knowledge. Does he know where he connected this to? For all you know, the tunnel could lead to the bowels or some other unwanted locations.

"This wouldn't lead us to your large intestine, would it Keldeo?" you asked jokingly.

"No, it surely won't. I did it as my mom instructed. I'm...sure about that," Keldeo said uncertainly. The Pokemon tried to project his stance confidently and give you a reassuring smile. But his trembling forelegs betrayed the real state of his mind. It's both funny and to see Keldeo act like that.

"You can just drop the act, Keldeo. You have no idea what you're doing."

".....I know what I'm doing," the Pokemon insisted.

"Then why are your legs trembling like that?" you said while pointing to his legs.

"It's....," Keldeo searched for words, "Okay, maybe you're right. I'm a little nervous, alright? It's just.... this in my rear and you know how things go down here. I'm a little bit afraid for your safety. I don't want to put you into any sorts of danger. That's the last thing we need."

"You should've thought about that before taking us here. If this actually end up at your colon, you'll have to find some way to compensate me," you lightly chided Keldeo, "Since we've gotten so far, I must admit that I'm getting a little curious. Just make sure it's not something repulsive. I've been through enough bodies to anticipate all the outcomes. I do not intend to relive some of the worst ones like the cold, metallic walls of Dialga."

"Could you tell me more....if that's okay with you?" Keldeo looked at you curiously.

You gave Keldeo a firm look. "It's better that you not know about it."

"....Alright, no need for me to learn the details..."

The Pokemon fell silent as he continued walking down the tunnel.

"I'm curious. How did Dialga got you here? Why is he so eager to get hands on you?"

You thought all the ordeals you went through and collected yourself before replying.

"Dialga was nothing but an insane demigod Temporal Pokemon bent on making me miserable. He believed me to be part of a mythology that I still do not have a full understanding of; sometimes he referred to me as the human from the Legend."

"The Legend? Yeah, I heard that one a lot from my mom. It's about one human who would usher a new era for Pokemons. The human would unite all the Legendaries in a final big battle against all the evils of the world before meeting with Lord Arceus to create a new world of goodness. I never really paid much attention to that because it is so unlikely and so formulaic, like the other bedtime stories my mom used to tell me. If Dialga believe all of that, I'm seriously doubting if he's in his mind."

"I'm beginning to doubt the veracity of this whole thing myself ever since he showed me his bad side. He believed fanatically that I am the key to that story. He did various intrusive tests on me just to prove his point. But eventually, Suicune and Raikou showed up and helped me made it through that jerk of a Pokemon. Things went downhill from there and I've been on the run up to this point. It's better if I spare you the details."

"Not that I want to know about that," the colt said, "I get shudders just to think about the sheer power that Dialga has. Being about to alter time space at will. Terrifying...I imagined that he would be very pissed about bring trounced by a human and two 'lesser' Legendaries."

"That's exactly why I need to hide in you, it's the place he's least expecting to find me," you said.

"Don't worry though. I'll try to conceal you to the best of my ability. I cannot guarantee that I could cover your presence forever. Did anyone else know that you are here?"

"Besides you, Suicune, and Raikou, no one else," you answered, "Still...I'm on the edge about all this."

"But being all tensed up isn't going to help you recover from a horrible experience. I know some methods that Virizion has taught me to cope with stress. You want to try them?" he asked with a concerned look.

"....Maybe later..."
______

Both of you didn't talked much until you reached the end of the tunnel. Immediately, you could tell that it's one of those places you wouldn't want to be at.

You noticed that you are in an extremely soft chamber. Two large, bluish orbs dangled from the ceiling, connected by a network of veins and tendons. You can feel Keldeo's trotting in here, which caused the balls to sway back and forth. The pinkish arteries that crawled over the soft floor pulsed to muted heartbeats far away.

"So that's what my testicles look like from the inside," Keldeo said with wide eyes.

You looked at the colt, whose eyes are wide with wonder like someone who had just learned about reproduction.

"Impressive, are they not?" Keldeo said boastfully.

Goodness....why do Pokemon testicles and I seem to have so much in common...

________

Elsewhere in the meadow, Virizion and Cobalion sat down face to face besides one of the trees in the grove.

"Cobalion, something's wrong about Keldeo!"

"What is it this time? Was he misusing his sword powers on weaker Pokemon again," Cobalion said with a irritated expression.

"No. I feared that it is something far worse. How much do you know about body modification?"

"Body modification is used to store food and shelter Pokemons in time of conflicts," Colbalion said, "It is generally practiced by a larger Pokemon by changing the characteristics of their body to transform it into a makeshift living space if the necessity arises. What does this have to do with Keldeo?"

"I caught him attempting to modify his own vital organs without training or proper supervision. He made several crude passageway to his stomach, brain and heart," Virizion explained.

"What?" the male stag sounded bewildered, "A young Pokemon such as Keldeo has no business attempting moves beyond his expertise. He could hurt himself or worse. Did you find anything else off about him?"

"When I did an Aura Scan of Keldeo, I detected Dialga's energy along with another unknown life energy within his body," Virizion said, her voice filled with concern, "Do you know what this means?"

Cobalion heaved a heavy sigh and looked at Virizion. He focused on those worried red eyes of his companion.

"Dialga's energy....unknown life energy..." he repeated, "That doesn't sound good. We haven't had any contacts with Dialga for years. It shouldn't be possible for his energy to show up in Keldeo. Are you absolutely sure the energy came from him?"

"Yes, I did a double take the first time I discovered that. You cannot mistake his energy signature. It's very weak and bounded to another life energy that I cannot precisely put my hooves on."

Cobalion's golden eyes grew even more concerned at Virizion explained how the unknown life energy seems to be moving around Keldeo's body.

"Keldeo is hiding something in his body," Cobalion stated directly.

"I noticed that he's been acting a bit more skittish than usual around me. When I looked at him, I felt that he was hiding something from me. I knew that expression in his eyes. It's the kind of look that he gave when he's in trouble. What should we do?"

The male Pokemon closed his eyes as his mouth formed a serious frown.

"Only one way to find out. Let us go together. We'll confront him subtly. Keldeo will explain himself whether or not he wants to," Cobalion said with determination as he looked at the distant form of Keldeo on the horizon.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Exploring the Rear

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You stare at the testicles with bemusement while Keldeo walks around, mumbling stuff. "Hey. Keldeo, buddy. You did this on purpose, didn't you?"

That gets him to stop for now. "What do you mean?"

"You led us here on purpose. You seem a bit too elated for this to be a mere coincidence. Quite daring for somebody who was protesting a lot when Cobalion was informing you about the facts of life" you said, rolling your eyes. Keldeo spluttered, looking for something to say.

"T-Tha-That has nothing to do with this! B-Besides, even if I did want to come here, it'd not be my fault. This is what happens when someone talks about that stuff onto me out of the blue"

"Oh, stop denying it already"

"You are one to talk! You said just yesterday you went into Raikou's testicles"

You didn't let that get to you. Instead you looked straight to Keldeo's eyes, undaunted. "I didn't ask to be taken there. I didn't wake up one morning and decide I'd like to spend the day inside my host's balls. This is all on you, buddy"

Keldeo, somewhat embarrassed, stepped back and looked away. "S-Sorry" At least he apologized. Deciding to give Keldeo a break you sigh.

"I could be in worse places, and besides I'm not judging. I'd appreciate a warning next time you decide to lead me to some place like this"

"I didn't it on purpose" Keldeo kept denying it, and instead started walking around, looking at everything there was to see "B-But you can't deny this is interesting!"

"...I suppose. At least it doesn't look like you mangled anything here. It would have been quite a tragedy"

"I was careful! Besides-" Keldeo started saying, but suddenly he froze "Drat, it's Mom and Uncle Cobalion again. They don't look happy. Uh, I think I should get away" Everything around you shook, you fell onto the soft floor. Keldeo seemed to be about to have a panic attack "I can't get away! This is it. We screwed up!"

"What are we going to do?" You had to admit you were pretty worried about this development too.

"I don't know! M-Maybe if you left my body for now...no, you are too far away from my mouth and there's no time to create a path there. I-If they know about you I won't be able to lie...I don't know what to do!"

You really hoped Virizion and Cobalion had no idea about you, but judging by Keldeo's reactions he had a bad feeling about all this. Suddenly everything stood still, you supposed Keldeo had given up on trying to get away. All you and him could do was hope this wasn't going to last for long.

------

Keldeo could see Virizion and Cobalion were trying not to seem tense, but since Keldeo had something to hide he had a feeling of paranoia. He tried to not to look nervous, and if he did he hoped it wouldn't be visible enough for them to notice. Virizion took a deep breath and decided to go ahead. "Keldeo, I'll go straight to the point: are you fostering someone inside of you?"

"...I thought the plan was to confront him subtly" Cobalion whispered to her, but she just glared at him. Maybe it was better this way.

"W-Why do you think that?" Keldeo grimaced. They had been found out, he was in trouble...the last resort option was to protect the human the best he could. Virizion didn't go into detail about the exact mechanics behind her finding out.

"It feels like a foreign presence, somehow with Dialga's energy contained within it. It is too weak to be Dialga, and Cobalion is going to confirm his location later"

"No!" Keldeo shouted immediately, and when Virizion looked at him inquisitively he realized he had just yelled that "P-please don't tell him about this. It won't be good"

"Sounds to me you know you're doing something about Dialga. You won't go anywhere unless you explain yourself right now"

Keldeo looked at the ground. He could feel the disapproving stares, and silently he cursed Mew for choosing him as the host for the human. Virizion glanced at Cobalion, who said with the most authoritative tone he could do: "If you don't explain yourself - and even if you do it isn't a satisfying answer - I'm afraid we'll have to reconsider your candidacy for-"

"Okay, okay, I'm talking!" Keldeo yelled immediately. Although Virizion felt guilty for having used the Swords of Justice as a way to get Keldeo to talk, at least it seemed to have worked. Virizion and Cobalion waited patiently for a minute while Keldeo looked for the best way to talk about this.

Outright saying it was a human may not be good. Repeating everything the human had said didn't seem good, either. He had to be careful now. "D-Dialga may have been...doing some e-e-e-experiments with a Pokemon, shrinking it and...I don't know what else happened to it. That's how his energy has bonded with m-my guest's life energy"

"What kind of experiments?" Cobalion inquired.

"I don't know. Mew knows more than I do. She's the one who found the Pokemon and s-she said it would be safe with me. S-Since the Swords of Justice are about protecting and being guardians I thought it was good..." Virizion and Cobalion weren't the only ones willing to use the Swords of Justice as an attempt to get the other side to yield.

"She should have consulted us about this. No offense, Keldy, but we are much more prepared for this than you" Virizion said, seething with anger, most of it towards Mew. It seemed she was going to tell Mew what she thought about all this. Keldeo hoped Mew would be discreet and not contradict what he had just explained.

"S-She said Dialga would never guess I'd be the host..."

"She should have told us!"

"I have to agree. You should have told us too, Keldeo" Cobalion said sternly. Keldeo bowed his head, ashamed.

"I'm very sorry..."

"What are you supposed to do now? How long is it going to be in you?"

"I'm not sure. Maybe a week, maybe two...Mew was vague about that. What matters is that Dialga shouldn't hear about it"

"I suppose we shouldn't contact Dialga, after all" Virizion muttered "I'll go talk with Mew. Cobalion, please stay with him" she said. If Keldeo had lied then he would try to run away, better to keep someone here to reign him in if he tried to flee. Cobalion nodded, and soon Virizion left. There was silence for a moment before Cobalion spoke again.

"So that's why you were asking all those questions. It makes sense. We're getting involved in this now. First I think I should talk to this Pokemon inside you"

"What?"

"I'm no Psychic type but I should be able to establish a connection to talk with it. It won't be effective but it's worth a try. I'll warn you, Keldeo:

If I decide this presence inside you can be dangerous in any way I promise you I'll find a way to shrink and boot it out of your body. You won't have a choice in the matter. Understood?"

Keldeo nodded. This really wasn't in his plans either. Cobalion was going to talk directly to the human, so now he had to worry about two people not contradicting his tale. Keldeo hoped the human had heard everything he had said.

Cobalion moved around Keldeo until he was pretty close to his side. Without letting Keldeo move, he positioned his horns close to Keldeo's flank, focusing.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Confronting Keldeo

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The tips of Cobalion's antlers began to glow blue as the stag concentrated his energy. This should do it. Cobalion thought as a thin beam shot out and concentrated on Keldeo's flank. Cobalion navigated his energy through Keldeo's fur, skin, muscle, and bones, finally locating the "Pokemon"... in the testicles?! What the....? I'm not liking where this is going.

The blue stag wrap his energy around the life form and felt the familiar tinge of Dialga's temporal energy that encased the Pokemon. The being itself is very different from what he is used to. A typical Pokemon's force would show up as a faint haze each with a different color depending on their type. But this... "Pokemon" has a more defined shape. The stag could see the "Pokemon" stand upright on two legs while possessing a purple force energy with a white center. What exactly is this thing?

"Keldeo, I have never seen an aura like this. This Pokemon...feels very different. What exactly is this friend of yours? I need you to be honest with me," Cobalion asked with a growing sense of unease.

"Mew didn't exactly elaborate on that. She said that he had been through very traumatic experiences and must be treated with carefully."

"Then it's important that I speak with him right away," the stag said as he intensified his beam.

"I doubt that he will say much, uncle. He's still very reluctant to talk to someone other than me. The poor Pokemon has been through too much of Dialga's temporal experiments to trust anyone," Keldeo lied as convincingly as he could, "It took me a few days before he opened up to me."

"Is that so?" Cobalion's expression hardened, "Then it is even more imperative that I contact this Pokemon. I cannot allow a being to stay in you without explaining himself."

Keldeo grew anxoius as his uncle's energy approached the human.

"Are you even sure this being in you is a Pokemon and not something malicious pretending to be one?" Cobalion pressed on while eyeing the colt.

"Umm...He is a Pokemon. But he might be a little different from what you expect," Keldeo answered while his mind worked furiously to back up the claim, "Dialga sort of played and altered with his physical appearance."

Keldeo smiled awkwardly and shifted his gaze upward toward Cobalion. The way those golden eyes are dead fixed on his own made Keldeo shiver in his hooves. It's the look his uncle would give when he sensed something suspicious. Come on, Keldeo. Think! Say something, anything! The colt tried his best to stand straight and look confidently back at his steadfast uncle.

"I'm being honest here," Keldeo said firmly, "It may be hard to believe but what I'm saying is all true. How can I make this up especially when it comes to protecting a Pokemon? Isn't that what the Swords of Justice is about?"

Cobalion didn't immediately reply but kept his piercing eyes focused on the colt. After what felt like an eternity for Keldeo, Cobalion finally opened his mouth.

"...Very well then. I will trust that you are being honest," Cobalion answered in a less scrutinizing voice, "But, if I discover that you are not being honest, you will face serious consequences up to and including revocation of your candidacy. Are we clear?"

"Yes, read you loud and clear, uncle," Keldeo answered affirmatively. Mentally, however, he is sweating bullets and panicking.

Cobalion's eyes glowed golden as he trained his energy on the unknown 'Pokemon'.
___

Back in the testicles, Keldeo's representation besides you is hyperventilating and his face filled with dread.

"What have I gotten myself into?" he barely articulated.

Seeing him all worked up only makes you more nervous. Telling a bald-faced lie is one of the most nerve-wracking things you could do. You know from experience how awful Keldeo must be feeling right now especially when his dream of joining the Swords of Justice is at stake. You aren't in a better situation either. Cobalion is about to interrogate you and you have little time to figure out a convincing story. Just how are you supposed to explain why you are a human? And what would would happen if he finds your story unconvincing?

Before you have a chance to give those questions further thoughts, a strange sensation rolled through your body. A blue beam casted itself on you like a spotlight. You heard a deep buzz echoing in you ears and your vision became blurry as a male voice spoke up.

"Hello there, can you hear me?" Cobalion's voice rang.

"Huh....what? Who is it? Is that you Dialga?! No! Please get out of my head!" you said in a frightened tone.

Cobalion recoiled mentally from the loud and abrupt response.

"Are you here to get me to perform more experiments. No no no! Stop! I don't want to go back again," you made your voice more frantic.

It seems that the Pokemon is very agitated. I need to calm him down first before I can make any inquiries. I hope this will work," Cobalion thought.

"No, I'm not Dialga. Don't be afraid, little one. You are in safe hooves," Cobalion said in a soothing voice, "It's alright, you are no longer in danger. No one is going to hurt you anymore..."

You pretend to calm down by slowing down your breath and relaxing your shoulder. Even though you're faking it, he has a very reassuring and soft and hypnotic voice. With each slow reassurance from Cobalion, you felt yourself relaxing at the stag's suggestion. When you feel that you have "cooled down" enough after a few minutes, you spoke up again.

"You're....not Dialga? Who....are you then?"

"Allow me to properly introduce myself. I am Cobalion, the leader of the Swords of Justice and mentor to Keldeo. It is a pleasure to meet you. Keldeo has explained your situation to me. I would like to ask you some questions if your comfortable with them. Is it alright?"

".......I'll try my best to answer you as much as possible," you said.

"Thank you, little one. Your answers will help a lot. First, can you tell me what exactly are you?"

"I used to be a Pokemon...specifically, a Va...Vaporeon," you answered nervously, "Just a regular Vaporeon until I have the misfortune of encountering Dialga.

"Used to?"

"After seeing me, Dialga ate and imprisoned me in his body. He lured me into a chamber where he stored his temporal powers and changed me without my consent. I don't even know how to describe myself now," you explained while trying to sound 'composed.'

"Did Dialga shrunk you down to this size?"

"I don't know. He claimed that Palkia did it accidentally to me. But I doubt it. Dialga said that I need protection and that he would take good care of me. But that turns out to be a lie," you grunted.

"Let me take a closer look at you."

Cobalion concentrated his energy on your body. You felt the beam touching your legs, hands, and face like an invisible pair of gloves. After doing a full scan of your features, you heard a soft gasp.

"Oh my goodness... He changed you into a... human?! What was he thinking?" exclaimed the stag.

"Please believe me, Cobalion. I don't know what Dialga wants. He keeps telling me that I am an incarnation of the human destined to fulfill the Legendary prophecy. He placed me through endless exercises and mental test in this body to prepare me for the role. He even gave me a portion of his power to prove his point. I don't want any of this at all, but still he insisted and forced me to follow his instruction. I thought I was doomed to a life of endless torment in a reality-altering Pokemon."

"The Legend? But that is merely a ancient myth."

"Unfortunately, Dialga believed otherwise," you dreaded.
_____

Over the next hour, you recounted everything Dialga did to you, how you met Suicune and Raikou, and how you made it here with the help of Mew. The more Cobalion listened to your the "adventure" you went through, the more troubled he became. Even you are getting upset by just thinking about it.

"This is unbelievable. I've always heard that Dialga is a mischievous prankster but this is unacceptable. Did you know why he might've chosen you for this....experiment?"

"No. I have no idea. It feels like he just sensed something about me and just decided to whisk me away for training...If it weren't for Suicune and Raikou, I could have......" you tried to fight back the urge to cry.

"Alright, that is enough, Vaporeon. You have been through a lot. We will work this out as soon as possible. Virizion and I will discuss what further actions we should take later. I would like you and Keldeo to be present at our meeting too."

"I guess that's a good idea."

"By the way, I would like to apologize if my colt took you on some bodily misadventure. I will need to get you out of the testicles and fix up the mess in his body and give him a stern talking to. In the mean time, you're welcomed to stay in my newly formed living quarter while Keldeo received further instructions on body modification. I promise that you will find it much more accommodating."
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Interrogated by Cobalion

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Three conflicting emotions invaded you when Cobalion offered you temporal accomodations while Keldeo was instructed on the proper handling of the body modification powers. The first was elation, you'd be under the care of someone who wasn't a complete newbie at those matters. You were sure you could trust Cobalion not to make mistakes or endanger you or themselves. The second emotion was panic. It could be tough to keep up the lie, especially if Cobalion or Virizion interrogated you any further or if they contacted any other Pokemon involved in this mess. Finally, you felt pretty guilty for causing Keldeo all this trouble. You hoped the stern talking wasn't too emasculating for him.

"I accept, sir...I wouldn't mind that" you said to Cobalion, who hummed approvingly.

"Thank you for understanding the need to have you with me for the moment. You'll return to Keldeo's body once he has received the proper training, but I'll also say it doesn't make me comfortable at all to involve him any further. You'd be better with someone like me or Virizion protecting you, although it is true Dialga wouldn't guess Keldeo is your host" Cobalion was clearly pushing you to leave Keldeo behind once and for all, but after such a short while and all the problems you caused him you felt responsible for the colt. He didn't deserve all this mess.

"Let me think about it, but please, don't be rough with Keldeo. He wanted to help me" you plead, Keldeo looking at you with gratitude.

"That will be kept in mind. Now please make your way to Keldeo's mouth and exit to perform the transfer. I'll be waiting here" Cobalion said, and the strange sensation subsided. It seemed Cobalion had broken the connection. You could hardly believe how things had gone. You really doubted this was what anyone had in mind when you were given to Keldeo to be sheltered, but maybe it wasn't all going to be as bad as it seemed at first? What was clear was that you'd need to be very careful. Cobalion and most likely Virizion would watch over you, at the first sign of suspicious behavior chances were you'd be in serious trouble.

"...f-follow me" Keldeo mumbled. It was going to be a very long walk back to his mouth, and frankly he didn't feel like opening new tunnels. The walk would go through his water pouch and back to his head. The trek was done in tense silence until you finally broke it, feeling you needed to apologize.

"Keldeo, I'm sorry for what happened. This must have been very stressing for you" that sounded like a lame apology, but Keldeo seemed to accept it. He nodded, still glum.

"It's okay. I still don't know what I'm getting into, but it's too late to turn back. Just take care, and try not to mess up while you are inside my uncle" he looked at you "Uncle Cobalion is a pretty nice guy and I like him, but he won't hesitate to take action if he feels justified. Don't get on his bad side"

You cringed, that sounded fearsome. "I won't. Uh, if Mew asks about me, what will you tell her?"

"The truth. I don't think I can lie again like I did just a moment ago"

"That sounds good to me. Anything I should know about Cobalion?" May as well get some tips. Keldeo looked at the ceiling for a moment, thinking. When he spoke he did it slowly, as if he wasn't sure of what he was saying but judged it was better than staying silent.

"I thiiiink you should try your best to befriend him. Try not to talk about being a Pokemon, because I think you'll make a mistake if you push your luck on that. Be friendly, listen to him, and if you can tell him all you want is to be safe. He can be protective of those he cares about. If he cares about you then you should be okay"

It made sense. The Swords of Justice needed members like Cobalion, after all. After a while you were halfway on Keldeo's neck. The colt stopped for a moment, focusing. You remembered there had been no direct path to his mouth, since the tunnel you used to get to his head had been connected to his stomach, so there was one last modification for the moment to do. When the road to his mouth was formed you thanked him for that. "I'm a bit curious how it'll be to live in Colbaion even if it is for a short while. What could he be planning to have for my living quarters?"

"He'll have everything you need, I suppose. I'm sure it'll be in a nice location, comfy, and if he really believed you then I bet he'll have included information about himself and what you can find in his body" Keldeo fidgeted "Don't get your hopes too high..." There was silence for a moment "So this is goodbye for now...uh, see you, human"

"Thank you for helping me" you thanked again, extending your hand to touch him. He flinched for a moment, but then stood still and let you touch him. It seemed he was a tad uncomfortable about it, but let you nonetheless.

"S-See you" he said before vanishing. Now alone, you knew all that was left to do was to exit Keldeo's body. The path indeed did lead to Keldeo's mouth, soon you were standing on his tongue. Keldeo was trying very hard not to move it to not to cause you any discomfort while you walked to the tip of his tongue. Once your host felt you in the correct position he laid his head against the ground, letting you leave.

You looked behind you. Keldeo was still pretty bothered by how things had gone. You waved at him, but he didn't seem to see you. There was another Pokemon to his side, and you knew immediately who it was. Cobalion's form was very intimidating, especially at your size. He was considerably larger than Keldeo, while not as large as Dialga, he was imposing nonetheless. The way he was pointedly looking at you made you cower with caution for a moment before you forced yourself to relax a bit.

Cobalion seemed to be satisfied with his first sight of you. Without saying a word he put his hoof right in front of you. It was clear he expected you to get on it. That was better than being plucked off the ground as if you were grass, like Keldeo had tried to do when you were going to enter him. This reassured you Cobalion knew what he was doing. You got on the hoof, grabbing onto it as well as you could. Cobalion lifted it, and talked softly.

"Are you ready?"

"As ready as I can be, I guess" you replied. You had to admit the perspective of being in Cobalion's body was exciting in a way, too. Was this interest in Pokemon insides a consequences of having been inside three already? You thought it would have ended with being inside Raikou, but now you were going to see the insides of a fourth legendary Pokemon.

"Alright. I welcome you to my body" Cobalion said before moving his hoof. You braced yourself, ready to enter his body.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Transferring to Cobalion

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Keldeo looked up at you worriedly, the concerns in his eyes conveyed the fear and troubles that would befall if you let slip your true origin to his uncle. It was understandable the colt is afraid of what his more powerful mentors would do. The Swords of Justice's own history and their infrequent contact with humans means that their attitude toward your kind is rather ambivalent, even hostile. If you consider the group's mission is saving Pokemons from collateral damage done by humans, the implications can be rather unpleasant. Thankfully, Cobalion seems to be taking your 'human appearance' in stride. But there is no guarantee your cover will last.

Even with persisting fear for your own safety, you smiled at Keldeo if only to reassure him that everything will be alright in the face of uncertainty. He lingered on his gloomy expression and looked worriedly at you. You saw Keldeo's mouth about to form something but stopped before a sound a uttered. Perhaps sensing that he is holding things up, the colt finally managed to crack his muzzle into a smile if only a forced one and nodded gingerly as Cobalion's hoof lifted out of his reach, taking the human away.
_____

You came to a stop before Cobalion’s wide-opened maw. His impressive set of teeth towered over you like pillars and his pink tongue stick out like a carpet waiting for you to enter its owner's palatial body. It has become a well-established ritual by this point as you readied to enter yet another host. If all goes well, you could really get used to living inside Pokemons which you must admit offers a lot more than your small apartment ever could.

"Here we are! Just let me know when you're ready," Cobalion's voice boomed so loudly that it almost knocked you down. A bit too enthusiastic for your taste.

"Well....here we go, I guess," you replied, still reeling from the ear-ringing and his hurricane-strength breath.

Without hesitation, you walked onto the Pokemon's tongue and head for his gullet where you took a leap, allowing Cobalion to take you in. The esophagus enveloped your body, expanding and contracting as they worked to move you down to the stomach.

Moments later, you plopped down and landed in a large pool of what you assumed to be acid. But it felt frigid, almost freezing. A gasp escaped your mouth at the sudden change in temperature which caused you to take in a mouthful of the liquid. It didn't have the characteristic acidic or burning taste that you've come to expect. It tastes like plain, cold water with some slimy mucus added in for good measure. Although a bit unnerved at being covered in Cobalion's drool, you thankfully didn't end up landing in some digested Oran Berry and catching a lungful of stale, humid stench like a certain novice did.

After righting yourself, you saw that Cobalion’s stomach is far larger than Keldeo’s and much more tidy. By your own estimate, the size of the pool extends as at least 50 meters in all directions. The water is clear enough for you to see the bottom of the stomach which is quite deep and the stomach walls give off an ethereal cobalt blue glow that bathed your environs in a dim, shadowy light. It’s vaguely similar to the glow seen in Dialga’s artificial and steely interior. Sensing the negative turn in your thoughts, your mind swiftly suppressed any memories of that Pokemon to focus at the more pressing matter at hand. You are worried about Suicune and Raikou’s safety and reminded yourself to ask Cobalion to get in touch with them once you get the chance.

The stomach was then filled with the familiar cacophony of creaking and groaning as the stag restructured his bones and muscles to accommodate you. Before your eyes, a dock took shape and emerged from the stomach wall. It took the form of a long pier made from vein-like structures that extended out to the middle of the stomach near where you are floating.

You helped yourself out of the water and slowly walked on the soft and squeaky pier toward a tunnel. Taking extra precautions, you entered the tunnel and ascended a long flight of stairs. At the end, the stairs gave way to a round chamber that looks like something ripped directly from the lobby of a luxury hotel.

The lobby itself is an eclectic mix of modern and ancient architecture. Ultra modern sofas and coffee table sat upon a blue rug adorned with ancient runic patterns while the amber walls are adorned with countless bas-reliefs depicting the each member of the Swords of Justice. One that caught your attention has Cobalion battling a large imposing dragon-like creature, the Ice Dragon, Kyurem. Once engaged in a battle, you were told, it will relentlessly find its challenger until he either wins or lose. Additional murals depict the Terrakion and VIrizion.

The centerpiece of this lobby, however, is the impressive-looking chandelier made from hundred of glowing sacs. You walked down and sat on one of the sofas, appreciating how comfortable they feel.

"Enjoying the amenities already?" Cobalion’s voice echoed.

You turned to what you assumed to be a reception desk and found Cobalion standing there. Even when he shrunk his form down to your size, he still looks imposingly tall.

“Welcome to your new home, Vaporeon."

"This is incredible!," you acted surprised, quickly reminded yourself that you are now technically a "Vaporeon".
