"Body modification can be very useful if one knows how to master it," the stag smiled.

"....It looks so....distinctly human."

"I have some contact with human civilization previously," Cobalion said.

"Far better than anything I've seen in Keldeo."

"Unfortunately, Keldeo's hosting may have left a bad aftertaste upon you due to his ineptitude. It'll take time for you to appreciate the full potential. I can teach you this knowledge if you like to learn more about it," he chuckled as he walked closer to you.

"You know, I would love to take up on that offer but first I have to get my original form back," you remarked jocularly as the stag came within several feet of you.

“Ah, yes. Your current form....that's what really intrigues me. Might I take a closer look if you don't mind that is?” Cobalion circled you with glints of curiosity and excitement in his golden eyes.

There was a long silence that was punctuated only by the clip-clop of Cobalion's hooves on the hard surface of floor. His pupils focused on your form, taking in details of your “altered” feature. The Pokemon walked close enough for you to feel his breath and warmth from his body. You are almost tempted to touch his soft blue, velvety fur but decided better. It looks even softer than Suicune's.

The uncomfortable silence lasted for more than five minutes when it's finally broken by Cobalion clearing his throat.

“Hmm...it's been a long while since I last saw a human. As much as I hate to give credit to him, Dialga did a pretty decent job of replicating their physical characteristics when he transformed you. Not that I'm complimenting him or condoning his actions. Regardless, as a sworn member of the Swords of Justice, I hereby pledge to keep you safe from peril and danger regardless of what they may be. I will affirm this duty with good judgement and prudence.”

"Hopefully, that will be the last I hear about him."

"Don't worry. we'll sort things out. In the meantime, you are free to use my body as your own home."

"Thank you so much for taking me in, Cobalion," you said in a a grateful tone.

“No problem. You must be exhausted from your previous ordeal. Let me show you the way to your room.”
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Under Cobalion's Protection

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
The way to the room was surprisingly short. You didn't know where exactly in Cobalion's body you were, but everything the room was rather spacious, much more than you would ever need. There was a remarkably large bed, extending towards the middle of the room, you'd need to crawl for several seconds to get to the edge. The temperature was perfect, too, the always present warmness that came with being inside a living creature's body didn't exist, the air was pleasantly cold. There were several screens, most of them of unknown functions. A couple were turned on and showed what was going on outside, perfect to give you a view of nature without having to go there yourself. Several pieces of furniture were strewn around the room for your enjoyment.

"This will be your room during your stay inside me. It's not much, but you should be comfortable" Cobalion said.

"Are you kidding? This is amazing!" you replied. Cobalion smiled warmly, walking along the walls of the room.

"It's nothing less than the essential. You won't need to leave your room to receive my attention. If you look here..." Cobalion opened a passageway to an adjacent room, where a comfortable cushion was placed on the floor "...this is where you'll receive your food, anytime. You only need to tell me what you want and I'll get it ready for you in no time"

"There's no need for that, I can take whatever you want to give me"

"Nonsense. You're the guest, and after all the problems you have gone through it's the least you deserve" your host said. You stayed silent, while it was true you had gone through a lot of trouble ever since you met Dialga, it wasn't of the type Cobalion imagined. Cobalion stared at you for a moment before guiding you to another short hallway.

"I know your actual form isn't the one you're used to, Vaporeon, but I have also providad a deep pool for you. I expect you to stay for some time after we find a way to return you to normal, for the moment I don't advise you get in there"

"Return me to normal? What will you do?" That didn't sound good, for obvious reasons.

"I don't know much about scie nce, or about how Dialga may have caused you to change form like he did, but if you're willing I could perform a few procedures to find a lead on how to do it. That is, if you don't mind" Cobalion waited to hear your response. Was it more suspicious to stay silent, or to agree and see how there'd be no good results despite anything Cobalion could try?

"I'll tell you later" you mumbled.

"That's fine. Take your time to agree, but I'd imagine you'll want to return to your original form as soon as possible"

You berated yourself mentally for hesitating. Cobalion continued the guided tour. This place had everything you could ever need and wish, and Cobalion remarked that, if you ever needed anything, you just needed to ask and you'd receive it.

There was one last hole, closed by a sphincter. It was smaller than the rest, just large enough for you to enter if you wished. Cobalion stopped to its side, waiting for you to arrive. "That concludes the tour of your room. Any questions?" he asked as if he weren't standing to the side of an unknown passageway. You took the bait.

"Where does this lead?"

"Oh, this?" Cobalion tapped the side of the sphincter, making it open. The tunnel behind the sphincter sloped downwards, and in comparison to every other place you had seen inside Cobalion, it was dark and rather ominous "You shouldn't worry about it"

"...but where does it go?" you were starting to have a bad feeling about it. Cobalion turned his head towards you, any friendly demeanor gone.

"Vaporeon, there's one thing I hate, and it's to be lied to. This tunnel is meant to be a reminder. I don't mean to insinuate anything, but if I ever find out you lied regarding you, or about what has happened to you..." Cobalion glanced into the passageway "...let's say you'd be forced to endure a rather humilliating walk, followed by immediate ejection from my body" you didn't need to get clarification about what Cobalion meant. Great, as if you needed more pressure on you. For a moment you considered telling the truth now and hope for the best, but you hesitated. For now, all you did was stare dumbly at Cobalion.

The stag closed the sphincter. "Being honest won't be as bad, supposing you lied" he recovered his usual cordiality "I suggest you stay away from this tunnel, unless for some reason or another you feel like spelunking through my bowels, in which case I won't judge. Different Pokemon have different wavelengths" Cobalion walked to a small table on a side. "I hope you enjoy your stay"

"I will, sir!" you replied with exaggerated eagerness.

"Now that you're here in your bedroom, how about we talk and get to know each other better? I admit I'm curious about you, Vaporeon. Tell me about your life"

You sat beside Cobalion. "My life?"

"Yes! Where do you live? There may be other Pokemon worried about you. How did you encounter Dialga? Tell me about yourself"

You felt increasing nervousness. Did Cobalion suspect you weren't being completely sincere? Was he trying to get you to pile more lies into your story? You realized you needed to tread carefully if you didn't want to create more suspicion on you.

This was going to be stressful.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: The Best Room You've Seen

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
This is it....

“Umm...so small talks then. Good way to get to know each other better,” you managed to force out while trying not to make yourself look too fidgety.

You knew it was only a matter of time before Cobalion would ask you questions about your past. But you didn’t even have a convincing rough draft of your “past” thought out. Perhaps, he already found holes in your story and has serious doubts about Keldeo’s explanation.Otherwise,what reason does he have to show you the opening to his intestines and that ominous warning about the consequences of lying.

You also felt indebted to Keldeo who has done everything in his ability to keep you safe while placing his entire future within the Swords of Justice at risk for your protection. You have to return this big favor somehow. But any miscalculation will be the end of a young colt’s lifelong dream.

A few feet away across the table, Cobalion sat quietly with his face as stoic as ever while his impenetrable golden eyes remained fixated on you. Even when seated, the Pokemon is an imposing presence. Those large antlers and robust hooves could make easy work of you should Cobalion want to.

The Pokemon only quietly adjusted his position without taking his eyes off you. Unable to break away from his inquisitive gaze, you began fearing whether Cobalion could mind-read you like Dialga...or is he just studying your behavior and quietly waiting for a slip up. You felt like an actor caught in an uncontrollable stage fright and forgotten all his lines. Absolutely nothing would form on your lips. Your mind tried to churn out something that makes sense but you are overwhelmed. There is only the thin veneer of calm that is quickly wearing away as your heart started pounding faster.

Finally, it was Cobalion who broke the awkward silence.

“Vaporeon, you seemed... quiet,” he commented, “Is something wrong?”

“Umm...no. I just got a little caught up in some memories, both happy and sad," you smiled weakly, "I was just wondering what made you interested in knowing about my past?”

“As someone who has been a surrogate father figure to Keldeo, I’m rather curious to hear about your life story and aspirations.”

“Well you know, Cobalion, there are so many things I could tell you. I don’t know where I can start,” you answered carefully, hoping not to appear too unnatural to your host.

“It’s up to you to share what you want, Vaporeon. I cannot force you to disclose something that you don't want. But once again, I want to be clear that you will only tell me the truth,” the stag reiterated sternly.

“Yes, sir. Understood.”

“Then I’m all ears here,” Cobalion leaned across the table and crossed his front hooves to make himself comfortable.

There really is no backing off from this one. The stag is as determined as ever to dig up your past. You mentally composed yourself and began to piece together a long story.

“It all happened so long ago, my memories are a bit hazy,” you pretended to think, “I’ll try to recount as many details as possible.”

“Just tell me what you can,” Cobalion motioned for you to continue.

“The earliest memory I could recall is without doubt is the green shades of towering trees and the deep, winding cavern in which my family lived,” you began, “I was then an Eevee within a forest a good distance away from a human settlement which I later learned is called Violet City within a region called Johto.”

“Johto? Hmm...I remember being told about that faraway place.”

“Yes...but how I got here is another long story. Let's just keep it on topic for the moment. My parents, a Jolteon and Flareon, raised me carefully and did everything they could to minimize my contact with the humans. I could still recite the cautious tales my parents told me nonstop not to venture beyond the woods. They said that there are humans who would capture us in devices called a Pokeball and make us fight with other Pokemons."

"Pokeballs, one of the worst fears of a Pokemon after the trainers that weld them," Cobalion commented, "Especially true if you are rare or unique in ways that caught their fancies."

"As much as I hate listening to my parents lecturing me everyday, the tales did their job of keeping me safe, at least when I'm following the rules,” you said half-jokingly.

Upon hearing this, Cobalion chuckled a little which lightened the mood substantially.

“That’s a story is far too common among us protective of our children. I remember telling Keldeo something similar. In our case, it was that humans would conduct dangerous experiments on him if steps out of the grove,” the stag laughed as he reminisced about his own past anecdotes, “In keeping with our ancient traditions, the Swords of Justice prefers to keep a very low profile from humans.”

You mentally felt better and calmer now. The good news is the stag didn’t sense anything off about you and is more relaxed that you have something in common with him. But you are mystified by Cobalion’s mention of their ancient traditions. It is certainly something you would want to ask later. For now, you should continue with your past.

“For the most part, life in the wood was relatively peaceful... Until one day, the humans cleared a long strip of forest near our cave and constructed a new route. My parents were obviously alarmed by this and intensified their warnings,” you ‘recalled’, “But I was a curious little Eevee who loved exploring back then. Despite my best judgements, I ventured out onto the newly made dirt path. At first, I was happy that I got to see an unexplored area and being free from my parent. I saw the dirt paths, the road signs, and fences. It was the first human-made things I have seen. But soon my little adventure got me into trouble."

The stag fell quiet and listened on.

"I spotted some trainers in the distance. It seems that they were busy training or something, but I don't know. I approached them…they suddenly took great interest in me...I could still remember the curious and astonished tone of their voice upon seeing a young Eevee out here...a wild one...All at once, they took out their Pokeballs...ready to have me as their prize...It was..."

You feigned fear and trembled to make it seem more convincing. Cobalion took notice of the tears on your face and placed his hoof over your back and patted you gently. You looked up at Cobalion whose expression softened and nuzzled your cheek.

“It alright, Vaporeon. You don’t have to go into the details,” he spoke softly, “You are safe and sound with me.”

“It was... a traumatizing experience,” you sniffed a little, “I don't want to say much. I was chased for so long I thought I would be doomed... My father rescued me from those pursuing trainers and got me back safely. Within days, my parents decided that it was no longer safe for us to remain in the woods and traveled to the remote mountains. A lot has happened since then, but I don't want to bore you out with hours of stories."

Cobalion studied you for a moment.

“Alright, Vaporeon. I think we can save you life stories for another day. More importantly, I need you to tell me more about Dialga and anything that he mentioned to you.”

---------
Cobalion along with Virizion and Keldeo are returning to their tree together. The sun was slowly lowering toward the horizon and they planned on returning to their grove to have their dinner.

The stag curiously eyed Keldeo who seemed to be quieter than usual as he lightly trotted by his side. He seemed to be in deep thoughts, likely contemplating about his upcoming test.

“Keldeo."

"Uhh... Yes, Uncle."

"I am rather curious about your new friend that you brought in,” the stag said, “How was he?”

“It was good...,” Keldeo replied brightly, “We talked a little about my aspiration to become a full member of the Swords while he told me about some of his own anecdotes while he trained. I think we would make good friends, we have much more in common than expected despite his current state.”

“Did he say anything about his past or where he is from?” Cobalion inquired.

“He only told me that he used to be a Vaporeon that was captured Dialga,” the colt answered, “He also said that his interest is exploring the internal workings of a Pokemon. I recalled him saying that he lives in the forest.”

So far thing matched up.

"A Pokemon with an intense interest in Body Modification, so my Keldy isn't the only one," Virizion added while nuzzling Keldeo, which prompted to the colt to blush.

"Mom! Stop that, I'm not a young colt anymore. I am about to become a Sword bearer," Keldeo said annoyed.

"Awww...but you are still my little colt, Keldy," she teased which only made Keldeo more embarrassed.

Cobalion laughed at the sight.

"Alright, Keldeo. If you want to be successful within the Sword of Justices you have to start acting like one," he said while stroking Keldeo's mane.

"I do act like one, Uncle," he shot back while giving Cobalion a grumpy look only to hear the laughter grew louder.

"Okay okay...I got it," the stag blurted out while fighting the tears of laughter, "Let's get home."

I have to ask Vaporeon more questions to be sure about his reasons.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Telling More Lies

choices: Your POV: Points of Interest Inside Cobalion
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
"Thank you for talking about your life. However there's something I'm going to ask you about, no matter how much it hurts" Cobalion said, trying not to look confrontational. Vaporeon would talk more if he didn't feel threatened. "Again, please tell me about Dialga and everything he said"

You frown. This was the most delicate topic of all. Everything else was something you were free to completely make up, but everything related to Dialga was a dangerous topic that could either save or destroy you. You had to think this very carefully. "I don't like to think about this..."

"If you wish to return to normal you'll have to talk about it. You can trust me"

"Okay..." There was no time to think any further. You just had to think of something fast and hope you don't contradict yourself. "Dialga and I met almost a month ago. I was exploring a place not too far from home, trying to find a place I could live in by myself, when I fainted. When I woke up Dialga was there, and I was this size. I tried to run away, but then Dialga said..." you stopped, feigning to be bothered by your memories.

"Yes? Please continue"

"He muttered 'You'll be perfect'...I think he thought I couldn't hear him. Then he talked to me, he said he'd protect me, but I'd have to stay inside his body. At first I refused! I thought I'd die! But he insisted, and I had no idea how I'd survive back home at this size, so I accepted" you said, trying to look as pained as possible. To be completely honest that moment had been weird at first, but later you had come to appreciate it. If only things had stayed that way..."

"How was the inside of his body like?"

"I don't know, I couldn't see most of it. As soon as I reached his stomach I was pushed further into his body, where I was imprisoned. I was kept there for a few days, being fed sludge, until he finally told me what he was planning. He said I was the reincarnation of the star of a prophecy, and he...he turned me into a human"

"That's horrible" Cobalion said rather flatly, too focused on comparing your story to everything you had said before. So far it matched the little you had said while being inside Keldeo, there was no reason to think you were lying.

"It was so painful...I thought I was going insane! I want nothing more than going back to normal. That's all I want"

"I promise you we'll search for a way to do that. For now please stay calm"

"I had to pass through so many tests...

Cobalion leaned a bit closer to you, eyeing you with worry. "You'll have to be more specific than that" You grudgingly went into more detail, not really wanting to remember everything. At the time you had felt rather proud of having overcome all of Dialga's challenges, but now...okay, no, you still felt proud. Not anyone would be able to do everything you did. "That's outrageous!"

"It was...that's why I was so thankful when Suicune and Raikou rescued me"

Cobalion nodded, making a mental note to talk with them. "How did they do that? How did they find out there was a Vaporeon inside Dialga?"

You cringed, that was a detail you hadn't thought of yet. "I...I managed to contact them, so they shrunk and went inside Dialga to save me. I have been on the run with them since then"

"I was told Mew brought you here. Should I suppose she's one of your allies?"

"She is! If it hadn't been for her I wouldn't be with you right now. Dialga had found Raikou and Suicune, so I was brought here so I could be safe"

"You'll be safe" Cobalion said, standing up "I promise you I'll keep you safe until the matter can be settled favourably for you. All I ask in return is that you behave while inside me. You're welcome to bother me anytime you want."

You nodded, tearing up without it being entirely fake. "I will...thank you.."

"You're welcome to explore any place you want in my body. I was informed you got an interest in exploring bodies."

You sputter. Keldeo spilled the beans on that? That colt...! "I-It's not like that! It's just that this is the fourth I'm inside of and I--"

"Calm down. You can explore my body all you want. There are no restrictions at all. I'll provide you with some information regarding points of interest you could visit" A few pamphelts formed in the ceiling and fell on the table, forming a neat pile "Enjoy your stay, Vaporeon."

"Thank you..."

---

"That Vaporeon has suffered a lot, Virizion. He deserves some time to rest" Cobalion was telling Virizion once he got the chance while Keldeo ran ahead. There were only a couple hours of daylight left, if he wanted to train he had to start now. Virizion smiled at Keldeo, and glanced at Cobalion.

"Do you think he's telling the truth?"

"I think he is. But we shouldn't do anything without having all the facts of this matter. And for that reason we'll have to contact all parties involved"

"I can talk to Mew. Suicune and Raikou should be able to talk to you about the human"

"They're not the ones that interest me the most. Dialga is the key here. I should listen to what he has to say. That's the just thing to do"

Virizion tilted her head. "Do you think that's fine?"

"Yes. I'm as powerful as Dialga is, if not more. Despite his powers I should be able to have the advantage over him" I don't expect Dialga to admit his wrongdoings, but talking to him should allow me to have insight on everything that happened.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Cobalion Investigates

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You opened the first page which contains a fold-out page featuring a diagram of Cobalion’s entire body. A red circle indicated that your bedroom is located in a space between the lungs.

“Your room is located here," Cobalion pointed at the highlighted area, "Did you notice the difference?"

Browsing over the entire map, you see that there are many more paths and spaces leading away from your room to various other organs and locations which you didn’t recalled seeing when Cobalion took you here.

“I’ve added a lot of places that might be of your interest and convenience,” your host commented, “I hope you'll now find my interior much more exciting.”

“Exciting?” you repeated, "In what sort of ways?"

“That's for you to find out, Vaporeon," Cobalion’s eyes glinted slightly and a smile formed on his usually stoic face.

That look made you wonder if it was a good idea for Keldeo to disclose your interests to Cobalion. It sounded more like he really wanted you to explore him. Does Cobalion also secretly share this sort of fantasy like me?, you thought, a bit concerned.

At least, you’re relieved that Cobalion chose to believe you for now. But his voice still betrayed a hint of doubt that left you uneasy. You knew that you and Keldeo won’t be able to hold this up forever. Sooner or later, you will be confronted on more personal information and there is no guarantee that you won't slip. On the top of that, Dialga is still hot on your trail and will stop at nothing to get you back in his possession for a good reprisal.

This is my best bet on getting to the bottom of things and returning to normal size...

“Well, you aren't planning to spend all day sitting there, are you, Vaporeon?” your host said curiously as he waited at the exit from your room.

“Oh...sorry to keep you waiting. I kinda spaced out,” you blushed.

“Come along now…,” Cobalion gave you a perplexed look before turning away into the tunnel.

You got up from your seat, grabbed the stack of pamphlets, and hurriedly followed Cobalion’s representation out of the room. Back within the labyrinthine tunnels of Cobalion’s innards, you moved deeper and deeper through more split paths and up a few flight of stairs.

Midway through the seemingly aimless journey, Cobalion decided to break the silence.

“I'm a bit curious, Vaporeon. As a human, do you still get access to the Pokenet system?”

“Why did you ask?”

“I was thinking that although you are physically a human for all purpose right now, your soul possibly still retains some connection to your Pokemon form. Do you retain anything abilities from your original Pokemon form.”

“Unfortunately no," you shook your head sadly, "Aside from the worthless temporal power I was granted, it looks like Dialga’s transformation has virtually stripped me of all my Pokemon power. I have no connection to the Pokenet and I haven't had the opportunity to speak with my friends for weeks. I am as helpless as a human can get.”

You made an intensive effort to appear convincingly distraught.

“I have never heard about a Pokemon losing their power in such a terrifying manner,” Cobalion said calmly, "I will get to the bottom of this. We just need to start getting all the pieces of information we could possibly acquire.”

“How are we supposed to do that?” you asked curiously.

“We need to go to the Communications Center where you can get much needed access to the Pokenet and begin our investigation,” he said, “I’m interested in hearing more perspectives than simply from you and Keldeo. I believe Suicune and Raikou wouldn't mind sharing some of the details about your stay with Dialga.”

“I haven't spoken with Suicune and Raikou since Mew got me here. I should really let them know I'm fine. But wait… doesn't that mean I'll have to communicate under your identity and risk compromising everyone’s safety. What if Dialga intercepts our conversation?”

“Vaporeon, I doubt that he will be clever enough to look our way if your description of him is anything to go by,” Cobalion said.

“Let’s hope you're right,” you sighed.

------
Once you climbed the last set of stairs, you find yourself within one of the most technically sophisticated rooms you’ve seen inside Cobalion so far. Thick colorful organic wires covered every inch of the wall in this circular space. The floors here are made from steel which made every step you take echo. Your eyes followed the wires which ended at two large screens on opposite end of the chamber. Both screens are blank with a faint bluish glowing indicating that their on. What's more impressive is the computer console itself which looks like a multi-million device you would find in a research lab.

The center of the room is occupied mostly by a large opening that reveals several more floors below. You peered down the opening and got a good view of Cobalion’s brain which is blue and emits electrical sparks among the countless synapses and veins coursing through its mass.

“This is the Communications Center, which I have built into the hollow cranium space between my forehead and brain,” Cobalion explained proudly, “These wires connect the devices to my antlers which contain ferromagnetic cores that allows me to emit and tune into a variety of signals.”

The stag took you across the chamber to the other end where toward on of the large computer stations which is made purely from veins and membranes. You noticed that a standard keyboard and touchpad are provided.

“Here we are. Feel free to use it any way you like,” Cobalion smiled.

“This is incredible! I never knew that you could do this with body modification. What do you usually used these for?”

Most of the time to organize conference with other Pokemon about the state of the land. At other times, I simply enjoy some psychic movies and play games with others.”

You nodded in admiration. “Pretty much the same for me when I still had the power.”

“Oh and by the way, Vaporeon,” the stag added, “I've been getting a lot of interference from human-created signals. A lot of random stuffs that I must say are quite beyond the comprehension of a Pokemon’s mind. If you're the kind to fancy human-created contents, you're welcome to view them and let me know about your thoughts.”

“Thanks for the information,” you said awkwardly, “But I think I better let my friend know I'm okay before exploring any of those stuffs.”

“Very well. If you need anything, I'll be at the other work station.”

With that, Cobalion representation walked to the other side and left you to yourself.

You turned on the device. You are greeted by a menu that looks surprisingly similar to a regular computer but with very different applications. There are familiar things like a Pokenet browser and a chat app that you saw within Dialga. But there are also various fun-looking games, Pokemon forums, and “sight-sharing” networks that you will take a look at later. For now, you opened the chat app and start searching for Suicune and Raikou’s name.

Strange curiosity for a Vaporeon...It seems as though he never used the Pokenet before…perhaps being isolated for so long can make one a little data hungry, Cobalion wondered as he observed the human busy at his computer station.

-----
At his own station, Cobalion started searching for ways to reach and talk with Dialga. He had withhold this fact from Vaporeon, fearing that it might put the now-human Pokemon into distress again. It is a necessary step to understanding the story which includes hearing the perpetrator’s version of events to corroborate existing facts even if it's distorted.

Scouring through the Pokenet proved to be a formidable task. Numerous times, several promising leads came into a dead end. Many other Pokemons were reluctant to assist him in gaining an audience with the reality-bending demigod out of likely fear of incurring his wrath. Are you nuts? they said. Haven't you heard about what Suicune did to him and he's totally pissed right now?

However, Cobalion remained undeterred as he scoured deeper into the less savory part of the Pokenet. While looking through a nasty comment thread on Legendaries, the stag came across something peculiar. Every then and now, there would be random anonymous posts from an unknown Pokemon promising unusual rewards including new powers and other ludicrous things like gaining an audience with Arceus in return for helping him. It may see like the typical spam post if the poster didn't mention that he is looking for a shrunken human.

The mysterious posts have been voted down by several hundreds points and were flagged as spam by multiple Pokemons. Most of the reply are sarcastic and ridicules about how it is obviously a desperate attempt at attention.

Could it be? Is he really that obvious?....Or rather so laughably forthright.

Cobalion tapped on the connect icon on the post and waited.

It took some time for the connection to go through. It was poor and spotty but enough to transmit messages.

“Who is this that contacted me?!” the voice demanded, “How dare you seek audience of a demigod directly!"

"My name is Cobalion, Leader of the Swords of Justice. You've got some interesting posts here," the stag held calmly.

"Don't you test my patience. I'm in rather bad mood now," the voice growled.

“Does this have something to do with a shrunken human, perhaps? I'm very curious about what story you might have.”

Dialga fell silent. Could this self-important so-called leader possibly have some news about the human?

“State your concerns!” Dialga demanded impatiently.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Your POV: Points of Interest Inside Cobalion

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Cobalion left Dialga stew in his own anger for a moment. He wasn't sounding like somebody who hadn't done anything wrong, so it seemed the transformed Pokemon he was hosting right now was right to be wary about Dialga. Letting them see each other again wasn't a good idea, definitely not. "My concern is that your intentions towards the human may not be...benign"

"If all you want is to scold me then go away"

"I know where the human is" Outright saying he was hosting the human would have been a bad decision, but Cobalion saw no harm in saying he knew where the human was. That should be enough to make Dialga talk "And I have heard a lot of rumors about what happened between you and the human"

"Rumors? You have to be kidding me..." Dialga groaned "I did nothing wrong!"

"What I have heard is--"

"I don't care what you have heard, it's not true! Look, all I was doing was share some of my power with the human. It's not my fault the human flipped out and turned paranoid. I did nothing wrong!" he repeated.

"And how exactly were you doing that?"

There was an uncomfortable silence in the other side. "You know, the usual. Don't worry too much about that. Where's the human?"

His refusal to say anything specific was a red flag. If he wasn't even bothering to lie then his actions may have been worse than Cobalion had imagined. "A common Pokemon under my protection found the human and is taking care of him. For the moment that's better than letting you have him back"

"Come on! Why do I need to be persecuted like this? This wasn't even my fault in the first place, Palkia made him appear shrunken already, but somehow I am the bad guy here"

"What was that?" Cobalion's attention was piqued. In an attempt to make Cobalion tell about the human's location, Dialga told how Palkia had accidentally caused the human to appear in front of him at such small size, that he had given the human shelter, and that his intentions hadn't been bad. Cobalion didn't fully pay attention, because something else had gotten his attention:

Not even once Dialga referred to his unfortunate victim as Vaporeon. It was always 'the human'. It was also a bit strange he was throwing under the bus someone else...was he trying to say it was Palkia's fault Vaporeon had been transformed? That can be easily confirmed. Just contacting Palkia and asking him about that would be enough. Unlike Dialga, Palkia was much more agreeable. Cobalion didn't doubt he'd talk.

"I told you everything. Now it's your turn" Dialga demanded "Where's the human?"

Cobalion calmly spoke. "For his sake it's for the better I don't tell you. Thank you for the information"

"Wait a second, I'm not done with you yet! You dare to treat me like this?!"

"Yes"

"You said you're the leader of the Swords of Justice. I'm on my way"

Cobalion hurried to cut off the connection. Really? There was no way Dialga could ever find them. Even if he asked other Pokemon about where the Swords of Justice were at, nobody would tell him, he had made a ruckus in the Pokenet.

------

Dialga looked through the list of Legendary Pokemon he knew. Those words, the Swords of Justice, it sounded familiar. It didn't take long to find where he had heard them before. He had showed Keldeo to the human. It couldn't be a coincidence the leader of the group Keldeo wanted to join had mentioned the human.

Finally he knew where to look for the human.

------

Thankfully, Raikou and Suicune were okay. They were both relieved to hear from you. "How's Keldeo treating you?" Suicune asked.

"Um...I'm not under his care anymore. Cobalion found out and now I'm inside him"

"Cobalion? I'm not sure that's a good idea. I have heard upsetting him is dangerous" Raikou said "He's not violent, but he's not afraid of punishing those he believes are troublesome"

"Should we go get you?" Suicune sounded ready to somehow get to wherever Cobalion was right now.

"No, I think I'll be okay. He's treating me well" you said.

"This should give you a chance to unwind. It's not confirmed, but I once heard from Pokemon he has saved in the past. They say Cobalion sheltered them in his body and gave them all preferential treatment. He was willing to let them explore anywhere they wanted! I think he's into this, he likes having someone explore his insides. You'll get along"

Despite your situation, you had to admit that sounded somewhat appealing, and since Cobalion was willing then sure, why not to enjoy your time inside him? "I'll stay with him for a while. If anything happens I'll tell you" you said, feeling a bit more cheerful now. You had a stack of brochures and info, enough to spend a long time visiting everywhere inside Cobalion. Maybe he'd even be willing to accompany you!

You asked him that, and he agreed, if a bit absent-mindedly. "There are a lot of places I think you'd be interested on, and as your host, it's my duty to make sure you're content. Follow me" he walked towards a short passageway to the side, ending on a small flat disc inside a narrow tube. "This will take us anywhere. It's convenient to travel through the arteries.

Since you were a Vaporeon I'm sure you'd like a place where you can relax with water, don't you? I have prepared a place like that already" the disc started moving.

You feigned excitement. "Thanks! I'm sure it'll be great"

"I'll have prepared more places for you once I know what you're interested in. It'll take a few minutes to arrive where we're going now, so in the meantime why don't you tell me about that?"

"About what?"

"Tell me what kind of places and organs you'd like to visit. You can also tell me what you'd want to avoid, and I'll help you steer clear from anything you don't want. Understood?"

It sounded like reasonable questions.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Dialga’s Delusion

choices: Onward to Cobalion City/ Speaking with Palkia
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
“Hmmm...about that,” you paused in thought, “I was wondering if you have more places where I can enjoy things like stores, malls, and entertainment stuffs.”

“Interesting choice…. but it’s not something difficult to create,” the Pokemon said, “You seemed quite curious about humans, aren't you?”

Cobalion looked at you with with a raised eyebrow, eager for an answer. You closed your eyes and did your best to come up with a believable story.

“Since I was a wild Pokemon who was relatively isolated, I never had any real contact with humans outside of the little information I’ve gleaned from other Pokemons who ventured into their cities and saw their lifestyle. I was told how their cities glowed at night with bustling activities. There were places called ‘malls’ where you can get almost anything you want if you look around. Besides malls, there are also places where you play games with others, and locations that offer to satisfy your personal needs…. I'm fascinated by the description of these things and wanted to experience them myself. Sort of ironic considering what Dialga turned me into.”

“Now that I know about some of your likes, what kind of situation you would rather not deal with?” Cobalion asked.

“Anything to do with mind probing or experiment would be a big nono. After my experience with Dialga’s obsession about preparing me for the legend, I hopefully do not want to be subject to mind reading or altering influence without consent,” you said with emphasis.

Cobalion nodded.

“Your interests and concerns have been noted. You have my words that no harmful or intrusive things will come to you during your stay,” he reassured you, “For now, we are going to the Aquatic Resting Area. Step on board.”

------
Cobalion tactfully guided your ride through his capillaries and narrow veins at a lightning speed. Along the way, you caught sight of other stops that you potentially visit. But you are moving too fast for you to read the signposts. For now, you are clinging onto Cobalion’s front hooves for dear life as the ride gets bumpy

You thought the you’ve must have transverse the entire circulatory system before the disc stopped at your destination. The platform stopped at the entrance of what resembles a water park beyond your imaginations. There are multiple type of slides and terrain for you to enjoy yourself in. Majestic white arches stretch from one end of the chamber to the other. There are two dozen or so pools of various colors spread across the area. At the center of the park is a thundering waterfall about 100 ft high casts down from an opening in the ceiling, tumbling into a large, deep pool at the center.

“Here we are, Vaporeon. The aquatic resting area.”

“Whoa, this is impressive! Might I ask where do you get all these water from? They aren't from you-know-where, are they?” you asked half-jokongly.

“No need to worry about the water source, Vaporeon. These waters were redirected from a separate water storage unit,” Cobalion explained, “However, converting to the form see here is a very labor intensive process as you should know as a Water Pokemon.”

You listened to Cobalion go on with great pride into very technical aspects of the process of how he made this place, using terms and pronunciations that don't exist in the human language. Something about conversions, mixing, and distilling. You felt grateful that you won't have to know any of those technical stuffs.

While the stag carries himself on in his explanation, you turned your attention on the honeycomb layout of colored pools around the main pool. Within each of them, water jets churned and bubbled giving them the appearance of hot tubs.

“I don't mean to interrupt you, Cobalion, but what's with all the colored pools over there,” you pointed.

Cobalion stopped his lecturing mid sentence and looked at what caught your attention.

“Right, I got carried off by my little technical lecture,” Cobalion said apologetically, “Those are pools that I have made especially for this occasion. Each of them contains the distilled essence of natural elements found throughout our world. Each is designed to make you relax a specific part of your being. For example, the yellow one allows you to feel the flow of electricity through your body while the purple one allows you to cleanse your mind by experiencing the natural aroma of herbs. Especially in your case, I believe that you will find the large pool with water jets particularly to your liking.”

“This sure looks enjoyable,” you said.

“I’m quite happy that you are liking it. Won't you give it a try now?”

Following Cobalion’s suggestion, you went on to try several of the pools which you enjoyed greatly. You got to try pools that smelled of various herbal aroma, one that Cobalion said was deep sea water he got from Kyogre. You especially enjoyed the pool that has a mild electricity current running through it. The tingling sensation dulled the muscle ache you have accumulated. All in all, a very relaxing experience.

Cobalion sat beside the pool, watching you enjoy yourself, which brought a smile on his otherwise stoic face. Seeing that everything looks fine, the stag shifted his consciousness from his representation to the real world.
___
Outside, Cobalion looked at Virizion tending a blushing Keldeo beside him.

“Mooom… stop you don't have to do this,” he said with an annoyed grunt. But Virizion simply ignored him and continued licking and grooming him.

“Aww, Keldy you don't have to be embarrassed about this,” Virizion said sweetly, “Isn't this how you've always liked it?”

“But that was years ago, mom. And uncle Cobalion is watching. How am I supposed to become a Swords of Justice if he sees me like this,” Keldeo argued as his muzzle blushed.

“Being grumpy again? You never change, Keldy. You may be on your way to join our league but you are still required to let me clean you tonight. Like I always do,” Virizion sang.

“MOOOOOOM!”

Keldeo sighed grumpily and resigned himself to Virizion’s gentle grooming.

Cobalion smiled gently at the sight before him while the colt looked at him pleadingly to get him out of the situation.

The sun has long since set and the twilight is slowly fading as well. The scene is peaceful and serene as it can be, however a slew of questions brewed in the stag’s mind.

Dialga never seem to talk of this “human” as a Pokemon. What’s also stranfe is how Vaporeon seemed so insistent on no mind probing and his unusual interest in human things?...Something doesn't feel right. I’m getting the feeling that someone is not honest with me. Palkia could be the key to the other half of this story, Cobalion thought as he opened a chat app.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Cobalion's Aquatic Resting Area

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You sank into the waters of the pool you were in, relaxing. You could get used to this kind of thing, you thought. There was something about Cobalion's body that was miles above anything you had experienced so far, and much to your surprise you found yourself hoping to see more. The fact he was compliant and truthfully wanted you to relax and enjoy his insides was also good. Dialga had turned himself into a lot of tests, Raikou was welcoming but didn't go out of his way to do anything for you, and Keldeo was too inexperienced. Compared to them, Cobalion was a welcome change.

You glanced at him, he was staring forward, a bit blankly. You thought he must be doing something outside, you felt some unease. You knew this hospitality could turn against you if you said something you shouldn't, and while Cobalion had a lot of patience, by now you were painfully aware he hated lies.

"I hope I'm overthinking this" you say to yourself.

-----------------

Getting in contact with Palkia took no time. He didn't seem to be busy, the replies arrived immediately.

"Do you know anything about Dialga's recent actions?" a direct question seemed like the best way to deal with this. The celerity in Palkia's replies showed he wasn't trying to deceive him.

"I have heard about them, but I don't know that much. What about it?"

"Are you aware he has tormented a Pokemon by reducing them and transforming them into a human?"

"That's a new one. I knew about a human, but I didn't hear about that part"

So he's not aware of what Dialga has done. It was disappointing, as Cobalion hoped he could get more information, but since Palkia and Dialga were in rather similar status in the big and complicated legendary community, Cobalion thought informing him now would be good. He said everything he knew, Palkia didn't reply until he was finished.

"No, I'm pretty sure he was always a human" What? That wasn't what he expected. Palkia's words continued appearing on the chat app. "His size was an accident, I swear, I was getting some fruit for Dialga and looks like the human was caught in that all, but I'm sure I didn't transform them"

"Is that so?"

"Look, I'm working on fixing that, okay? I know I caused him a lot of trouble, what with everything Dialga did to him, but I'm working on how to return him to his normal size. I promise I'll do it"

"Thank you. I think that's all I needed to hear"

So that was it. No wonder it didn't feel right.

-------------------

While Cobalion explained to Palkia the lies you and Keldeo had weaved, you got out of the pool, soaking wet. It was kind of uncomfortable, but given how pleasantly warm it was inside Cobalion, you hoped you'd be dry after a while. "I'm ready to go to the next place" you said to Cobalion. The representation nodded, a bit absent, but stood up and moved rather stiffly towards a passageway. You followed him. Cobalion wasn't looking at you, just staring straight ahead with an odd expression. "Is everything okay?" You didn't get a reply.

After some time walking, you reached an expanse. Although the sign proudly said it was Cobalion City, to you it looked more like a town, a very interesting and detailed town. It seemed like you and the representation beside you were the only residents, but you knew there would be surprised somewhere in here. "This looks amazing" you praised, still receiving no reply. You looked at Cobalion for a second, he was looking at a building that resembled a Pokemon Center. "Should I go in there?"

"Please do" he said. The air around you warmed up a bit, you thought it was him trying to help you dry up. Not suspecting anything, you enter the building, immediately finding the inside was much smaller and emptier than you thought it'd be, there was nothing but four empty walls. "What?"

Behind you, the door disappeared, turning into bars of some resistant material. You grabbed them. "Cobalion, what's going on?" Whatever it was, you were sure it couldn't be good. Cobalion glared at you from the other side.

A hole formed, encompassing all of the floor in the room. The only place you had to stand was right under your feet, you couldn't move from where you were. You didn't know where the hole led, but you didn't want to find out, anyway. Despite the danger, you couldn't avoid wondering something: Cobalion had remarked that if you had lied to him, he wouldn't hesitate to punish you and get you out of his body immediately. What was he waiting for?

----------

"He was lying! He was never a Pokemon, I have a human inside me right now!" Cobalion was shouting outside, upset by finding out just how much Keldeo and the human had lied to him. Keldeo, underneath Virizion's care, could only look away.

"But it does sound like part of what he said is true, Dialga did misbehave in such a grave manner" Virizion pointed out. She sounded just as angry as Cobalion, but at least she was refraining from rushing to conclusions. "What's the human doing right now?"

"I have him cornered. In a moment I'll get rid of him"

"Wait, you can't do that!" Keldeo protested "Don't hurt him!"

"I'm not going to hurt him, I just want him out of me!" Cobalion approached Keldeo "He lied to you too!"

"No, I...most of the lies were my idea" Keldeo admitted. When he was told to explain, he added: "I knew this'd happen if you knew he was a human. Uncle, he needs help, and we are the Swords of Justice, we exist to protect those who need our help! It doesn't matter he's human, he needs our help and protection!"

"He lied, I can't just accept that!"

"I don't like any of this more than you, but we have to accept it" Virizion admitted begrudgingly "It is true we may not have seem like we'd have listened to him if we had known the truth all along"

"And it'd be a waste to undo everything you prepared, right? Please give him a chance, I'm sure he'll be a good guest!" Keldeo pleaded. Cobalion looked at the ground. He'd have immediately gotten rid of the human, but he had decided to tell Virizion first, so she wouldn't be mislead just like he had been. It hadn't gone as planned, they wanted him to keep the human safe inside him, treat him like a guest.

It was going to be hard to accept, but he had to do it.

"Besides I know you're very into having someone inside you. You're going to find it fun, Cobalion" Virizion said, daring to smile a bit "Don't pretend you won't"

"What I find fun is none of your concern" Cobalion said bluntly, and turned around to leave. He'd leave up to Virizion scolding Keldeo for lying to them so much, right now he had to deal with the human.

Since throwing him out wasn't an option anymore, he had to make sure he understood who was the boss here, lay some basic rules, and tell him to behave. He was already intimidated by the place he was standing at right now, surely the human would be willing to listen, even if it was out of fear. Afterwards maybe he could give him a break. Virizion was right, it'd be wasteful not to use the city he had just created.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Onward to Cobalion City/ Speaking with Palkia

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You stood precariously on what little space the newly formed prison offered you, completely at the mercy of your host. The gaping abyss looked certain to claim you at any moment Cobalion wills it. At the other side of the sturdy bars, his representation loomed tall over you. Cobalion’s face darkened as he continuously glared down at you.

“This little charade has gone on for long enough,” Cobalion remarked coldly, “‘Vaporeon’... or should I say… human.”

Cobalion’s eyes glowed disapprovingly as he continued.

“I've spoken with Palkia earlier and he told me you were shrunk as the result of an accident on his part; a human who was merely in the woods at the wrong time and moment. Am I right?”

You nodded silently.

“And through a series of events involving numerous actors, made your way here,” Cobalion said with a frown, “Tell me... Why didn't you tell me that you are a human?”

You were about to open your mouth but was stopped when the stag raised his hoof.

“Before you answer me, I don't want any excuses.”

“I was afraid…,” you slowly speak up, “I didn't think you would be as willing to help me if you know that I'm a human. Keldeo told me how you have serious misgivings about my species. I thought that being a ‘Pokemon’ can make things less troublesome for myself. I don't want to be placed under similar situations I endured with Dialga.”

“I can empathize with your situation but that doesn't make the fact that you lied to me any less reprehensible,” the stag stated firmly, “Do you remember the consequences I told you?”

“I do. I am to be expelled from your body.”

“I had intended to keep that promise. But.... Virizion didn’t like the idea of you being thrown out to fend for yourself. As did Keldeo,” the stag said begrudgingly.

Cobalion closed his eyes and weighed the choices he had. Within his mind, Keldeo’s plea to keep the human safe and his own inner voice’s argument to carry out his own promise played over and over again in a mental tug of war. There is an obligation to protect the human. It'd be easier to keep the human out of the equation. But he lied to protect himself. Lying is not the right way. Neither is leaving the human out in the wood with imminent dangers. The stag opened his eyes and looked back at the human.

“You are permitted to stay, human.....” Cobalion said sternly, “But you will bear responsibility for your actions. I am imposing new rules for you. Read it carefully.”

A piece of translucent membrane with neon blue text materialized in front of you.


I, Cobalion, Leader of the Swords of Justice, hereby imposed this contract upon you, the human, as a consequence for your untruths.

You are now considered to be under ‘probationary’ status as determined by Cobalion.

You will be subject to the following restrictions:

--You are to stay within Cobalion City unless authorized to travel elsewhere in your Host’s body.

--A curfew will be in effect. You are required to return to you assigned room before the curfew start time.

--Your behavior will be monitored throughout each day for evaluation.

--More representations of your Host will be positioned throughout the city in various roles, which will act as a simulation of a functioning city. You are to interact with them as part of your probationary training.

--The amenities you can access will be increased or reduced based on the above behavioral evaluation.

--This probationary status can only be ended by your Host.

As a part of this agreement, you are also required to:

1. Attend remedial sessions organized by your Host.

2. Participate in work service around the city as assigned.

3. Maintain an honest atmosphere.

I, the human, hereby agree to abide by the rules as laid out above by the Host and understand that any violation of the above rules will subject me to punishments as deemed appropriate by the Host up to and including detention in a jail cell.

Signature

_______________


You read the contract again and again. Despite being placed under probationary status, it's far better than getting outright expelled and having to deal with Dialga on your own.

You quickly signed it then turn it over to Cobalion, who made the prison bars dissolve.

“A word of advice. Letting you stay is not an indication that I have forgiven you. Don't you forget that,” reminded Cobalion.
______
You and the stag made your way back out into the city and saw that the streets and stores are now filled with other Cobalion representations of various sizes and colors going about their day.

The Pokemon led you to a 5-story building a few blocks away from the prison. The exterior has been colored cobalt blue like your host’s fur. After leading you through the front door, Cobalion took you to the second floor, where he directed you to another door.
You are shown a modest room with a single bed, a bathroom, a computer-like device, and a window that allowed you to view the busy thoroughfare.

“This is where you will be staying during your probationary period. Get some rest. I will be making arrangements for tomorrow.”
_______
Cobalion caught sight of Keldeo sitting alone by a tree, still hanging his head in shame. Virizion had left him to think alone after giving what was likely a severe admonition.

“Keldeo.” Cobalion called, prompting the colt to look up. A remorseful expression formed upon his muzzle.

“Uncle…I'm sorry,” Keldeo said, his voice cracking, “I know you've taught me better than to lie to you. I really thought that it was in the human’s best interest. I didn't want him to be in any danger especially after what he told me Dialga did to him….Did you expel him?”

“I'm keeping him. But he is under probation with numerous restrictions,” Cobalion disclosed, “Keldeo, we have to talk about what you did and the punishment you will be facing.”

Upon hearing the word punishment, Keldeo grew pale and a little light-headed.

Are you...planning to revoke my Sword of Justice candidacy?”

Cobalion looked at Keldeo, who is on the verge of crying. Though he is still mad at him for making up this entire deception, Cobalion felt that his colt has a point about their obligations as Sword holders to protect anyone under their care.

“No, Keldeo, you’re not,” Cobalion said.

“I'm not?” said Keldeo, a little surprised at his Uncle’s decision.

“You are still a candidate to become a full member. However, because you had planned to lie together with the human, you will be suspended from participating in training activity relating to your candidacy until further notice.”

Keldeo’s ears dropped upon learning that he can't continue his training anytime soon.

“What am I supposed to do now? Being a Sword of Justice is all I ever wanted.”

“You can stay with the human during his probationary period if you like,” Cobalion said, “You two can learn some things from one another.”
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Probationary Stay Inside Cobalion

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Sleep comes rather easily to you, when you wake up the next morning you find yourself well rested. You look around, a bit disappointed. It wasn't a bad place to stay, but compared to the room Cobalion had showed you when you had first arrived it felt lacking. To think if you had told the truth or kept the charade a bit further you could have spent the night there...although it was also likely if you had told the truth from the start you wouldn't be inside Cobalion in the first place. It was for the better all those lies existed, if only because it meant you wouldn't be inside Keldeo, not knowing if the colt would be able to keep you safe without hurting himself.

When you step out of the building you were at, you found the streets were almost empty. A few representations of your host were already walking down the street, when you passed nearby they looked at you with what seemed to you like disdain. Right, if they were all connected to Cobalion it was to be expected none of them would be too happy with you. You ignored them the best you could, and walked until you reached a small park with an active fountain in the center. You gazed into the crystalline water, wondering what you'd do now.

Obviously obeying Cobalion's restrictions was the right thing to do. You didn't want to anger your host, and even if he wasn't going to throw you out of his body, you didn't want to spend your days in a prison cell. You didn't doubt this city he made for you would have a lot of amenities, but you wished you could see more of his body. After being in three different Pokemon before this one, you were curious how Cobalion was different.

"There you are!"

You heard a familiar voice behind you, when you turned around you saw Keldeo, running towards you. "Keldeo? What are you doing here? Is Cobalion punishing you too?" You extended a hand and lightly touched his head. It felt more real than his projection in his own body had felt.

"No, I came here because I wanted to. I..." his ears dropped "I was punished, but this is completely different. He suggested I could be here while you're inside him, and I thought that was fine because I wanted to apologize" he said "If I hadn't lied he wouldn't have been angry with you"

"You don't have to apologize, I lied to him too" You didn't mention how that would be good "Wait, this isn't a projection, this is really you?" When Keldeo nodded, you said: "Then you shrunk too! Why can't anyone return me to my size, you all keep changing sizes!"

"Palkia did it, he accidentally used his spatial powers on you. We don't know what'd happen if someone who isn't him tried to return you to normal" he explained, looking around. There was wonder in his eyes. "So this is how it's like inside Cobalion...I had never been here before! To think I'm inside the body of another Pokemon is amazing!"

"It can be fun sometimes" you said. Keldeo walked around the park.

"I'm not in probationary period like you, I think I can go anywhere I want in Uncle's body. There are so many places and organs to see!" he paused "Maybe if you're with me and I keep an eye on you he'll allow you to walk outside of the city"

You crossed your arms. "I doubt that. He was really angry with me, I don't think he'd ever let me out of this city"

"He's strict but he's not so bad. If you're respectful he'll be more forgiving" Keldeo was rather excited at the thought of exploring Cobalion's insides "I think I'd be the one to say where to go"

"You're already making plans as if he already gave you permission, you're getting ahead of yourself" you wished it was true, but Cobalion had the last word on that regard, no matter how much Keldeo planned and talked. "What kind of places you'd like to explore, anyway?"

Before Keldeo could answer, Cobalion's voice rang all around you. It seemed like it wasn't a projection talking. "Human, the arrangements have been finished. Come to your first remedial session"

"First?" Keldeo looked up towards the roof of the chamber, far above your heads. "You're really in trouble if it's more than one"

"Then I just hope it won't be as bad as you just made it sound" you said, walking out of the park. After a moment of hesitation, Keldeo followed you. You couldn't avoid wondering what exactly Cobalion meant with remedial session.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Morning in an Unfamiliar City

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
“Where do I need to go to get started then?” you asked in the direction of the vast ceiling.

“The Remediation Center is located a few blocks from the park you’re in. You will get further information from me once you get there,” Cobalion’s voice boomed, “I am expecting you to honor your commitments as stipulated, human. Unless, of course… you preferred the alternative I mentioned.”

The stern warning is enough for you and Keldeo to get moving.

A sign with “Remediation Center” conveniently located at the park exit guided you south toward a bustling street lined with numerous shops, game corners and restaurants. You spotted stores that are supplied with clothing, stationery, toys, and virtually anything you could think of. There is even what looks like a Pokemon Battle Stadium in the distance. You couldn't help but wonder how Cobalion know so much about human technologies. But with newly imposed restrictions by your host, you aren't going to explore any place any time soon.

The local populace of Cobalion were going about their day, scurrying along busy crosswalks past you and Keldeo. You noticed that many of the younger looking stags were preoccupied with their Pokedex-like devices, fidgeting at the screen awkwardly with their hooves. Many others are simply enjoying their day at one of the many roadside restaurants, sipping at their drinks and indulging in snacks of berries and fruits.

Your presence seemed to have elicited more than a few looks from these residents, especially the young fawns who surrounded and observed the both of you with wide, curious eyes. Despite their cordial demeanor, you get the unsettling feeling that they are primarily here to keep a close tab on you.

You tried putting that discomfort on the back-burner and decided to ask Keldeo something.

“Keldeo, about this remedial session, can you tell me what is it exactly?”

“Well…,” the colt trailed off, “I was a bit of a mischief maker back when I was a foal and frequently got myself into more troubles than other Swords of Justice could handle. I pulled dangerous pranks, got into trouble with other Legendaries, talked back when I didn’t get my way, and on more than one occasion attempted to challenge Kyurem alone, much to Uncle’s horror. After Virizion and Terrakion had a discussion with Cobalion about my lack of self-discipline, he devised the Remedial Session. For every act of recklessness or wrongdoing, I would get certain freedoms restricted and will be required to attend lessons or serve any appropriate punishments.”

Along the way, Keldeo continued to describe some his misadventures and what punishments Cobalion meted out each time. Each one seemed more elaborate and bold than the previous one. You listened with interest as the Pokemon told other stories like being made to carry rocks on his back for the entire day for interfering with Terrakion's Boulder Balance training and that another time when he used his newly learned move Water Jet on every unsuspecting Pokemon he met and later had to attend a long, boring lecture about responsible use of his power.”

Despite the heaviness of your current plight, you still managed to smile at least once or twice through some of Keldeo’s anecdotes.

“Sounds an awful lot like being under school detention and having to attend classes to address your problems,” you remarked, “I think I can relate to that to some degrees.”

“I’m not exactly sure what you mean by ‘school detention’ but it must have provided you with strong incentives to improve yourself,” the colt tilted his head.

“It sure did,” you said a bit longingly, “Perhaps a little too often... Anyways, do you know what kind of Remedial Session I’ll receive for lying to him? You said something about me really being in trouble when I have to go through more than one session.”

“To tell you the truth, I don’t have an answer for that. Lying has always been on the top of the worst offenses list for my Uncle. If he requires more than one session, my guess is that he has a lot to talk to you about.”

“That doesn’t sound too reassuring,” you uttered.

“I won’t be too worried. He can be stern and firm, but he won’t go to the point of getting you hurt. Come on, let’s not keep Uncle Cobalion waiting.”
------

After a nearly seven-block walk down the street, you stopped at a dark blue building that is located at the very edge of town. In contrast with its more vibrant locale, the 8-story tower has narrow windows and austere facade that only drives home the message that the place means business. The local Cobalions are conspicuously missing around this area, leaving the place barren and quiet. The sign “Remediation Center” that looms over the entrance in bold lettering is the only indication of the purpose of this building.

“Here we are…” you whispered quietly at Keldeo who looked nervously at the sight.

“I….I never seen this before...my sessions were usually outdoors or caves...“ the colt managed to say.

You and Keldeo quietly walked up to a set of stairs leading up to a set of tall, metalwork doors. emblazoned with a pair of Cobalion holding up an large sun disk. Beneath the figures is a banner that reads:

“WITHIN THESE DOORS ARE THE ANSWERS YOU NEED”

The doors led you two into a two-floor lobby that was mostly covered in a dark blue marble-like material from ceiling to the floor. It was a mostly featureless chamber except for the long staircase where Cobalion’s representation was waiting for you. The steely expression on his face only made you more anxious.

“I have been waiting for you, human,” Cobalion said stoically, “All preparation for your Remedial Session is complete. Now, come with me...both you and Keldeo. We will be discussing the details of your tasks.”

The stag escorted the two of you up the stairs, through a rather long hallway, and into a chamber that was set up as a meeting room. There was a long desk and three chairs that incorporate many features of Cobalion into their aesthetics. You also noticed two of the Pokedex-like devices that you saw earlier in town on the desk. There is a large screen at one end of the room that displayed the agenda to be discussed by Cobalion:

Remedial Session No.1: An Introduction
Attendees: 2
An outline of the deception by Keldeo and the human and the recommended solution.

"Please take your seats. The session is about to begin," Cobalion reminded.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Remedial Session

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Your earlier assessment of what Cobalion's sessions entailed turned out to be more accurate than you thought they'd be. When you sat down, the fleeting thought you had is that it really was like a school detention. You managed to hold back a smile, because Cobalion surely would have taken badly if you had looked like you weren't taking this seriously.

On the screen, the letters vanished, replaced with an empty bullet point list. You had a feeling all of your crimes against Cobalion and justice were about to be displayed. "I'm sure you two understand already you have committed some grave transgressions. I'm not going to insult your intelligence by saying the obvious, but I will make you unwilling to be dishonest towards me or anyone else again" The bullet point list divided into two separate lists, and two names appeared on top of each one: 'Human' and 'Keldeo'. You noted with some nervousness yours was at least triple as long as Keldeo's.

The list was succinct but largely accurate. Keldeo had notes along the lines of 'lying to his superiors' and 'placing himself in danger'. Grave stuff on its own right, but not as bad as some of the ones that appeared under your header. 'Bringing danger to the Swords of Justice' 'Getting several Legendaries involved' 'Lying in order to gain protection' 'Invasion of another Pokemon's body'. It almost made you sound like the bad guy instead of someone who was at the wrong place at the wrong time. The indignation bubbled inside you, you managed to repress it to avoid saying something you shouldn't.

Keldeo had less restraint, though. Although he politely requested attention, he said: "He was scared...that makes it less grave?"

"Keldeo, I may not like humans, but I'm firmly on the side of justice. I wouldn't be a member of this group if I wasn't" Cobalion said with pride. He said it with such vehemency you felt foolish for not telling him the truth from the start. You lowered your eyes as Cobalion started lecturing you and Keldeo about the importance of honesty and trust.

Even though it any other occassion you would have fallen asleep from such a lecture, it was as if Cobalion had a rather charismatic appeal that prompted you to listen no matter what. You listened to every word of his lecture, without spacing out. "Trusting others can be difficult, but when there's reason to trust them and you know it, there's no reason to lie to them and put yourself and others in jeopardy" Cobalion was saying. You felt those parts were directed more at Keldeo than to you. After twenty minutes of continuous lecturing, you saw the Pokedex device light up. It seemed to have some sort of word processor installed.

"The point here is that you can trust me. As such, I want you to show me your trust by telling me every detail of what happened. Don't omit anything, understood?" he remarked that with a lot of emphasis, and added in a much softer manner: "I won't judge anything you say. Simple write everything you know and remember, and trust I will be impartial"

"...Uncle Cobalion, I don't know how to write" Keldeo said, tapping the Pokedex device a few times. It did seem a tad difficult to type with hoofs on such a small screen. You had an easier time, so while Cobalion adjusted the device so Keldeo could type with ease, you started with your own tale.

Every detail you remembered was added. How at first it seemed like Dialga would keep you safe, how he slowly turned you into a test subject, every detail of what you experienced, how Suicune and Raikou got involved, how you escaped with them and entered Raikou's body, everything you explored and saw inside Raikou, how you were taken to Keldeo, and your brief stay inside the colt. Soon you were absorbed into the extensive story, focused on writing as much as possible. You wanted to ensure Cobalion wouldn't be able to ever say again you hid anything from him.

You were finished after half an hour. To your side, Keldeo was still working, with a look of concentration, and at a slower rate than you. "Good luck" you said, patting Keldeo's head through the mane. Keldeo nuzzled his head by instinct against your hand before he realized it and forced himself to continue writing. Hoping this was going to be enough, you passed the device to Cobalion. "I'm done"

"I already know everything you typed. I read it while you were writing" the projection in front of you admitted. He was looking at you with a curious mixture of pity and authority. Maybe your story did appeal to his sense of justice. Behind him, the screen gained several new sections. "Based on everything you and Keldeo have said, I have made an outline of the remaining sessions.

My recommended solution is to undergo all of them, to establish the necessary relationship of trust and authority we require between us three. It will take a couple days, but once you're finished I believe we will tolerate each other enough."

Remedial Session No 1: An Introduction. Attendees: 2. An outline of the deception by Keldeo and the human and the recommended solution.
Remedial Session No 2: Authority. Attendees: 1. Community work throughout the city. (Only for human)
Rest for the Night - including a casual meeting with your host
Remedial Session No 3: Teamwork. Attendees: 2. Work together to navigate a route in the circulatory system

"If I judge more is needed in the future, I shall leave this open" he looked at you. "Let's get started with your second session"

"Community work...?" you left the room with Cobalion, leaving Keldeo behind to continue typing. You wondered if while you were working he'd meet you again.

"I want you to walk through the city. You will pick up trash, do menial favors for those who need it, and report any parts of the city that look strange"

You raised your eyebrows. "Let me see if I got this straight: you created this city and its inhabitants. Will you also create trash for everyone here to start throwing around for me to pick up?"

When put like that it was silly, and Cobalion didn't want to admit it. He limited himself to nodding, trying his hardest not to break the rigid stare he had towards you. "It is a necessary part of your lesson"

"That's fine. What's that about reporting any parts that look strange? I thought you had a perfect control of everything you made"

"Why you...of course I do!" his rigid stare broke, like he had something to prove. "I can control everything inside me perfectly, I even could make the most unpleasant points in my body be so appealing to you you'll want to return as much as you can!"

"Really now?" you needled him, pleased he had dropped the hard jailer attitude.

"If you want me to prove it then I will! You, Keldeo and I are going to meet tonight, remember? I will prove to you I have perfect control of everything in my body" he claimed. Now that he thought about it... "It also could be a good lesson for Keldeo. He would see what kind of thing he could do once he mastered control over his insides..."

"Should I be concerned this is happening?"

"Human, as much as I don't like to admit it, you are a guest inside me. Not only that, Keldeo is also here. I would never make my guest and my student undergo something unpleasant for no reason. If something ever happens it will be because you or him brought it upon you, not because I felt like making you have a hard time"

It was somewhat encouraging. You weren't sure if Cobalion would do the part about making something unpleasant change so much it would be unrecognizable, but you at least knew he would give you and Keldeo a moment to relax with him despite how cross he was with you. Besides, you had to trust him. He wanted you to trust him, then you would.

One of the Cobalions around you shoved a bag and a stick at you, while the one you had been talking to signaled with his head. "You may start. Don't leave any trash untouched, human. Hard work is pivotal for learning"

Easy for you to say because you're not the one picking up the trash you yourself make. You thought, but started walking nonetheless, carrying the stick with you.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Cobalion's New Assignment

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
“My representation over here will be supervising you through your community service,” Cobalion said as he recovered his usual sternness, "Do not think about slacking off while I'm away. Should I receive any reports of noncompliance, it will be the jail cell for you. Have I made myself clear, human?"

You nodded quietly without hesitation. Something within those eyes compelled you to answer in the affirmative regardless of how you really felt.

"Very well then. I will be checking on Keldeo. I am expecting you not to disappoint me any further.”

With that, Cobalion began making his way back to the Remediation Center, leaving you to the device of his clone beside you.

“Well, it looks like I have to take care of you at this point. Let's get started with the first thing on our list here,” the representation said as he produced a checklist. In contrast to your host himself, this Cobalion spoke with a melodic Hoenn accent. Never have you imagined the stern and authoritative Cobalion could speak with such uncharacteristically posh voice.

"...Where do you want me to start cleaning?... umm..." you wondered how to address your new chaperone.

"You can call me Coby for distinction's sake," Coby gave you a slightly annoyed look, "Come along now."

You are soon led by Coby to a part of the city that looked as though a storm went through it. The sidewalks were strewn with newspapers, bits and pieces of plastics, soda cans, and food containers. To add insult to the injury, there are also overturned garbage bins as well. Thankfully though, there isn’t any rotting food or worse in the spilled contents.

There is a crowd of Cobalions standing by the sidewalk, frowning and whispering among themselves at the hideous sight.
