When those representations noticed you making your way through, their expressions only darkened and their hushed tone grew louder. You can hear the contempt and anger through their snorts.

"Hey, aren't you the human who lied to our leader?…," you heard one of them said.

"What is he doing here? Haven't this town been through enough?" another growled.

"You can't trust these so-called trainers, let alone a human! Why is our leader allowing him to stay?" a dark red Cobalion gritted forcefully, "If it were up to me, that human would have been long gone from here."

Hearing those remarks only made you even more uneasy about your community service, especially when you know that you will be working with these Pokemons at some point in the future. Coby did his best to ignore the crowd's animus and took you right into the worst part of the mess.

“Alright, this should be a good place to start cleaning,” Coby said while handing you a pair of protective gloves, "If you do a decent job here, it might be a start to repairing your standing in this town."

Even when Coby sounded polite in contrast with the unwelcoming jeers from the crowd, you could tell that he more than likely agreed with their sentiments based on the tone of his voice.

You quietly put on the gloves that Coby gave you and got to work. It wasn't particularly difficult but it was as monotonous as you imagined it would be. Using the spiked stick, you began piercing the paper wrappers and depositing them into the bag. Once a bag has been filled, you simply drop it off at the corner of the street. Every now and then, when you picked up a piece of those newspapers called the "Icirrus Justice Press", you would catch glimpses of the day's headline: "Human Guest on Probation. Ordered to Community Service. All Residents 'Encouraged' to Give Him Work."

From the snippets you managed to read as you toss the papers into your trash bag, the entire town has been ordered to assign work for you, whether it was in stores, restaurants, and other necessary miscellaneous tasks. But whoever wrote that article didn't agree with Cobalion's decision and presented you as dangerous being who is a threat to the well-being of the "Swords of Justice" and a bad influence on the upstart Keldeo. Even more upsetting and absurd, the article alleged that you are working for Dialga and other nefarious forces in a quest to usurp Arceus and get power for yourself. No wonder the welcoming party I got here. you thought as your picked through more trash.

Behind you, Coby silently watched you to ensure that you didn't slack off. The other representations watched on with hostility even when seeing how much you are working to improve their city and to make things right again.

After 40 minutes, you are drenched in sweat from collecting the countless cans and styrofoam boxes. There's already 3 large bags worth of trash and yet you barely cleaned up about ¼ of the city block. It's only now that you noticed the artificial sun that hang high above the artificial sky. The scorching heat snugly hugged your body like a thick coat, worse than any windless summer day you can remember. If Cobalion wanted to make your community service as hard as it was memorable, then he has done a superb job.

You heard Coby's throat clearing behind you, causing to realize that your thoughts about the heat has stopped your from working.

"If you wish to get this wrapped up sooner, I suggest that you get back to doing your designated assignment," the representation chimed.

I hope that Cobalion won't be too hard on Keldeo.

____


On his way back to the center, Cobalion’s expression turned into a frown as he mentally read through the colt’s story. Although Keldeo has provided a fairly detailed summary about his initial interaction with the human, Cobalion found several gaping holes in the story, especially when it comes to Dialga.

According to Keldeo, he was wandering through a nearby valley, anxious about an upcoming Swords of Justice training session. It was the same valley that Keldeo always stroll through when he felt overwhelmed by his practice. While he was trying to clear his mind, Dialga suddenly contacted him through Pokechat and introduced him to the human. While the exchange is mostly pleasantries and compliments, the familiarity indicates that it wasn't first time that Keldeo has spoken with him. The idea that his adoptive son has been in touch with the Temporal Pokemon without him knowing doesn't sit well with the stag.

This is the same manic Pokemon that has threatened to find this human and subject him to who knows what. What have you gotten yourself into this time, Keldeo? the stag sighed as he paced toward the Remediation Center.

______


Keldeo sat quietly at his desk as he waited for Cobalion to return. He heaved a sigh and looked at his screen and through the text he composed. Hopefully, his uncle will find his explanation to be sufficient.

As if on cue, the unmistakable sound of hoofsteps echoed down the hall, heading in the direction of the meeting room. Keldeo's heart began to pound faster as it came closer, dreading all the scenarios that could play out.

Cobalion emerged through the doorway and turned his attention to Keldeo.

“I have read through your story, Keldeo,” the stag said as he walked into the room and approached the colt and sat down beside him.

“I wrote down everything the best I could remember, uncle,” the colt answered as he felt Cobalion placed one of his large hooves on his shoulder.

"Everything?" Cobalion asked with a raised eyebrow.

Keldeo could feel the thinly-concealed doubt in his voice.

"Umm yes…...so… How's the human doing?" Keldeo asked in an attempt to momentarily distract from the topic.

The display screen on the wall to switch to a surveillance camera of the town. Keldeo saw the human busy cleaning all the trash that has been left on the street while being closely supervised by one of his uncle's representations nearby.

"He is doing a fine job… as I expected," Cobalion answered before switching the screen back to the bullet points he used earlier, "But let's not stray from our topic now. I've read what you've written. There is something you are not telling me."

Keldeo looked up and saw his uncle looking at him disapprovingly. He is not sure if it was his imagination playing with him, but Cobalion towered over him twice as much as he remembered. The Pokemon already felt the rivers of sweat forming beneath his coat and his legs trembling involuntarily. The discomfort he felt was skyrocketing to an unbearable level. Keldeo gulped and did the best he could and looked back with confidence (or what he thought it was) deeply into Cobalion's golden eyes.

The tiny reflections of his own face within them looked back with a mixture of hesitation and fear. Keldeo felt overwhelmed like an inexperienced foal rather than the Sword of Justice member he wanted to be.

"This isn't the first time you have been talking with Dialga, am I right?," the stag said calmly, noting how apprehensive Keldeo looked,

Keldeo only nodded, uncertain about how he should tell his uncle about his first encounter with Dialga and what they talked about.

"Keldeo...if there is anything that you wanted to tell me, now is the time,"
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Community Service

choices: Cobalion Tries to Impress the Human
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
Cobalion knew he was known for being stern. Right now, he raelly wanted to dial that down, so Keldeo would tell him everything. Keldeo trusted him, that much was for certain, but the colt was still just, well, an inexperienced legendary Pokemon among beings that were hundreds, thousands of times his seniors. Intentionally or not, they may use Keldeo for their own goals and machinations.

Dialga may have been one of them.

"I promise I'm not judging you. I simply want to know as much as possible about what's going on," Cobalion assured. It didn't seem like Keldeo felt reassured by that at all, but he could see in his nervous face that he was glad Cobalion was trying to be understanding.

"Are you going to do something about Dialga?"

"I don't know yet if I should," Cobalion admitted. "For the time being just tell me how you met him. How long ago was it?"

Keldeo sat down, recalling that moment. "It was just a few months ago. I had gone exploring, trying to find someone to train with"

Maybe they had been a tad too permissive with Keldeo wandering around. Still, this wasn't the time for hindsight. Since there hadn't been any interruptions, Keldeo continued. The more he talked, the calmer he felt, like he was finally getting a weight off him.

----------

Climbing a rock wall was good exercise, and Keldeo was lucky he had agility and strength. The colt leaped from a small platform to another, slowly getting up the wall, towards a hill from where he'd be able to see everything in a range of miles! Maybe he should ask everyone to come and spend the day here. It'd be great!

The top of the hill wasn't as barren as he expected, though. Instead of rocks and dust, like he thought he'd find, there was a flat stone surface, clearly built from many stone blocks. Status flanked the edges of the plateau, looking towards places far away, and there even was a strange square structure on the far end of the plateau. Obviously Keldeo hadn't been the first Pokemon to reach this place, someone had come before and built some sort of temple. Curious, Keldeo trotted on the plateau, inching closer to the structure.

It was just a large block, nothing worth writing home about. Disappointed by how mundane that turned out to be, Keldeo turned around to leave, already thinking of how to bring up the existence of this structure to Cobalion, when he noticed he wasn't alone anymore. Instead, standing right on the center, was a rather large dragon. Metallic protrusions and shapes covered the dragon's body, giving it a rather impossing appearance, bringing to mind armors. Keldeo stared up at the dragon's head, trying to recall what this Pokemon was called. He was sure he had once been told who this was, but the name simply eluded him right now!

Few times in his life Keldeo felt so small, and now this dragon bending its neck to take a closer look was going to get added to that list. Keldeo stepped back, nervous. "I'm sorry if I'm trespassing. I had never been here before--!" Keldeo hurried to apologize, hoping that'd be the end of this.

The dragon seemed to have felt his unease, because he chuckled. It seemed like it was trying to be friendly. "You're worrying too much. What's your name?"

"K-Keldeo?"

"My name is Dialga, the Pokemon who rules over time. You would do well in remembering my name," he said. Had he realized Keldeo hadn't known who he was. No, it had to be a coincidence, Keldeo hoped. Otherwise this was almost humiliating. "I can see it -- your power, the unique life you'll have. You're a legendary Pokemon, if I'm not mistaken"

"Th-That's right," Keldeo sounded prouder about that. "I'll join the Swords of Justice very soon!"

Dialga nodded. "That's an excellent goal! I wish you the best of luck. If you'd like, I could help you. Would you like my help?"

He wanted to accept, he really did, but Keldeo was certain his elders in the Swords of Justice would be better teachers than anyone, even if it was Dialga. Still, he couldn't just say that! It'd be such a bad first impression. Instead, Keldeo bowed his head, surreptitiously keeping an eye on Dialga. "No, thank you. I'd like to do this by myself"

For a moment it seemed Dialga wasn't happy, but he changed his expression quite quickly. Instead, he stepped aside, giving Keldeo space to move and leave the plateau. "Don't worry, that's fine. Chase your dream by yourself, you'll do well. I just have one request, though"

Keldeo stopped, ready to listen to said request. Once Dialga was sure the colt was listening, he said, persuasive: "Let's stay in contact. You show a lot of promise, and I'd like to see how you chase your dream. We can be friends, I can give you advice, and if you ever change your mind and you'd like me to help, then I'll be available anytime. What do you say?"

That wasn't too strange, lots of Pokemon had asked Keldeo and the other Swords of Justice to stay in contact. Once it was certain they'd be in contact, Keldeo finally was able to leave the plateau, returning to his day. Dialga stayed behind, impassive. Had Keldeo handled that well? He didn't know, and he sure didn't want to find out if he had offended Dialga at any moment.

------------

On the surface it seemed like a rather normal interaction. It was common for legendary Pokemon to help each other and be in contact, and had it been any other situation, Cobalion wouldn't have minded much.

What bothered him was that, if Keldeo and the human were telling the truth, nobody should accept Dialga's help at all. Keldeo may have dodged a bullet back then. Putting a hoof on Keldeo's shoulder, he said: "You did well in not accepting"

"Do you think the human may have accepted and all that happened to them is because..."

"That's a possibility," Cobalion said. More like that was likely what happened! And in that case, then the human wasn't nearly as malicious as he thought they'd be. Perhaps they had misjudged everything...because he thought the human had to been hiding something? Cobalion knew he had to reevaluate his stance about the human.

Keldeo looked at Cobalion with assertiveness. It wasn't common for him to look so ready to confront anyone. "You'll help the human, right? Uncle Cobalion, please, you have to help the human"

"...I'm sheltering them already. I can promise you I'll do my best to keep them safe," and he could do plenty, that much was for sure. Cobalion nudged Keldeo. "Go, take a break. For the time being let's continue our scheduled plans. Then I'll evaluate if I should change my stance about the human and their problems"

"What will we do now?"

"I'm going to spend some 'quality time' with them. The real me, not copies I made to make them work. I'm sure they'll be grateful for that." they better be grateful. "Go rest, tomorrow you and the human are going to have quite the adventure. You're going to need as much energy as possible"

Now, what should he do with the human...? Cobalion had bragged about having the utmost control of his insides. That could be the way for him to impress the human and make them admit Cobalion was the best choice of host they could hope for -- and they wouldn't want to be inside anyone else until it was all over. And for that...

"What I need is to subvert their expectations," he decided. Cobalion had said he could make even unpleasant places inside him be so appealing the human would want to stick around, and now he was going to prove it. Evaluating his options, soon Cobalion focused on one of his stomachs. Being a stag, he had four stomachs to process his food, and usually a couple of them were organs he wouldn't want someone to visit. Not many would like to walk around in half-digested plants! That was it, he was going to use one of his stomachs to impress the human.

But what should he do in there? He already had received the human with a lake when they entered his body. Perhaps an island, then? Tropical-looking, completely out of place inside a body? Cobalion felt a tad giddy at that thought. For some reason, he was looking forward to the human's reaction. He even felt tempted to make them witness how he finished the island, so they could be impressed properly.

He really needed to stop being so proud of his internal skills, but he just couldn't!
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: How Keldeo Met Dialga

1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.content:
You are lifted up to cobalions head. the sword of justice opened his mouth and set you down gently on his tounge. He lowers his paw and waits for you to walk inside. You turn back to look at Keldeo one last time, He looks at you with a slight smile, You smile back and walk inside. Cobalion closes his mouth, and the sunlight disappears. You head for his throat and look down. This will be the 4th one you've jumped down.. and you hope it won't happen much more. "Welcome to my body" Cobalion said telepathically. You nod and are about to jump down when your new host interrupts you "Theres an easier way" he said. his throat vibrated a bit and fleshy steps formed a large spiral staircase. "Thanks" you say "But jumping will be faster." Cobalion retracts them "Ok, if you want." You took a deep breath and leapt into cobalions throat.



Cobalion looked down at Keldeo, who was looking up at his uncle worried. "You needn't be afraid" he said "your friend will return when you are able to control your internal modification powers better." Cobalion turned "Now come with me." Keldeo nodded as the colt walked along side his uncle, back towards their home. As they did you slid down cobalions throat and into his stomach. You use your time powers to slow yourself to a gentle stop, and see you landed on a pier, it would have overlooked a lake, but there was nothing there. This was good, it meant less of a smell. "Welcome" You nearly jumped as you turned to see cobalion had formed his own copy of himself like keldeo had. To your surpise, he wasn't that much bigger than you or keldeo. "I see you have been able to use your temporal powers." cobalion said looking at him. "That is impressive." "So.. can we get out of the stomach?" you ask "yes" cobalio
n said turning "follow me vaporeon." You follow him. "So, can I still talk with keldeo?" you ask. "Yes" cobalion nodded leading you down a tunnel "I will open telepathic links that will let you talk with him. of course nothing will be private since it has to go through my head first to get to you."



Keldeo and Cobalion returned to their cave "So... is mom gonna be back soon?" Keldeo asked a bit nervous "I don't know." cobalion said as he lay down. Keldeo followed. "Vaporeon has just asked me if you can still talk with him" "And?" Keldeo looked hopeful "You can. However I shall be monitoring everything." Keldeo smiled, but inside he groaned annoyed "Alright I will open a connection" You hear a noise, and soon the 3 of you share a telepathic link "So.. why do you call him Vaporeon even though he looks so much like a human?" Keldeo asked hoping it wasn't too sensitive. You honestly wondered that too. "Keldeo..." Cobalion sighed "It is because the poor guy was a vaporeon to start. I mean if you suddenly became human, I wouldn't call you human, i'd still call you keldeo." "Point taken" Keldeo said. You nod, sigheing a little as youll have to get used to being called that.



After a nice chat with the two of them, Which had to remain casual, Cobalion finally lead you to the end of the tunnel "Here, this is where you will stay during your time inside me." He said as he stepped inside. You looked around in wonder, Its fleshy, but has some metallic bits, considering cobalion is also a steel type. You see a large comfy bed, and a desk with a lamp. "Since I don't expect you to stay for an extremely long amount of time before going back to Keldeo I'm only doing the basics." You nod. "Thanks" You said "It is alright. I'm sure you've been through a lot Vaporeon. I can't believe Dialga would do something this extreme... it must have been difficult inside Keldeo when hes so inexperienced."



"Um.. Cobalion?" you ask nervous "are you mad at Keldeo?" Cobalion frowned "I am disappointed that he was not immediately honest with us. He should have told us about you the moment you were sent into him. And mew should have told us ahead of time." "Well.. the reason they didn't is because they were afraid youd immediately refuse to help.. because I'm human.. kinda." Cobalion shook his head. "I am a sword of justice. I am willing to protect all pokemon, no matter what they look like. even ones that look human. And I will protect you to the best I can" "I see.." you say nodding slowly. Then you think to yourself "what if he found out I really was human... what would he do then?" "Anyway" cobalion said interrupting your thoughts "You must be hungry. Come, I'll show you to my food storage chamber" A new tunnel opened up, and you walked through followed by cobalion.

You are suddenly terrified.
1451111111111111111111111111111111211111.title: Giratina does not agree with Raikou

choices: After a while, you get up to see if your headache could be cured...
1451111111111111111111111111111111212.content:
As you went along the tongue the black cavern of Dialga's mouth let you think about the talk with Palkia, the words not fully setting in yet. Palkia couldn't restore you. He couldn't because he misused his powers and because of this, he doesn't know how to fix the problem.

The gaping hole leading into Dialga's throat loomed menacingly as you slipped into it. As you sped down towards the rooms, that nagging thought re-entered into your head. What if Dialga is keeping me here? For an ulterior motive? He hasn't told the direct truth whenever you asked. 'It's like he's keep-'

The lights slowing your decent re-appeared as your mind blanked, yet again. '...what's up with my head?' you thought as you went to the Central Chamber. 'This headache just won't go away.'

Dialga noticed with a tinge of worry the thought line you started going through, before blanking your mind. It's happened again. That thought doesn't seem to want to leave. I can't keep altering his mind, especially if his subconscious is starting to notice the effect. How can I keep him from that trail of thinking? I can't freeze time on him for an extended period of time, that'll just prolong the inevitable. Not to mention being unable to keep an eye on him.

You clasp your head as the dull throb intensifies to a full on assault. 'Seriously, where did the headache come from? I was fine a moment ago until...'

That's odd. Your thoughts just...stopped. Palkia said he wasn't able to return you to your normal size, you started feeling depressed, then...nothing. After that the headache started.

'Maybe I'm actually ill.' you think as you settle into your seat and resume watching the monitors. 'It would make sense, sort of. Me getting shrunk could have done something to me.' You rubbed your eyes as the throbbing intensified again. 'Seriously, I should go and see if there's something wrong. Aside from not being able to go back and meet them again...'

Your eyes wavered from the monitor for a moment as Palkia's words re-entered your mind.

All of this happened because of Palkia's misuse of it's power. None of this would've happened if...

You sighed, looking again at the monitors. 'Just don't think about it. The more you think about it, the worse it'll get.'

Dialga went out of your head, unbeknownst to you, causing another brief flash of pain.

His mind is somehow starting to barricade itself against my monitoring. Time, ironically, is running out...
1451111111111111111111111111111111212.title: A throbbing problem

14511111111111111111111111111111112121.content:
You've been lying down on the floor for several minutes. The migraine faded as quickly as it came which only served to puzzle you further. You've never had such awful headache before, at least not before you entered Dialga. Did this had something to do with that scanning that the Pokemon had perform when you first entered him? If so, why would he do this? There's nothing to gain from this... Or perhaps it's just an effect of you being stressed out by this dramatic change in your size.

I'm probably just over thinking and making connections where there are none, you thought.

After sitting upright for the first time in half an hour, you are glad that the migraine did not return. You wanted to do exploring but the aftereffects of the headache took a big chunk of your energy out of you. There's pretty much nothing you could do except perhaps going back to the bedroom for some rest. But before that, you decided to ask Dialga about your headache.

"Hey Dialga, I've been having this awful headache several times. I never had this before. I was wondering if you can do a checkup for me?" you asked.

"...yeah sure, why don't you head for the examination room. I can perform a health check for you," Dialga said telepathically.

"The strange thing is, whenever these headaches occurred my mind was filled with weird thoughts that interfered with my thinking. And there's this feeling as if my mind is being drained. Do you know what could possibly cause such symptoms?"

Dialga is getting a bit worried. The human is starting to question things. At this rate the human would figure out that he had been monitoring him the whole time. How would he react if he knows the truth?, Dialga thought. He's gonna leave me and it'll all be ruined. My plan, the experiment, all down the drain. Dialga mentally collected himself before speaking.

"I'm....not sure about that that," Dialga answered as naturally as possible, "I'm not that knowledgeable about human physiology. But I can check if any 'time dilation' is interfering with the neurons of your brain. Lots of my organs generate temporal distort ions and they might have affected your brainwave."

"I don't understand a lot about all that but please do a checkup for me, will ya?" you sighed, "Where's this Examination Room you're talking about?"

"Follow the blue glowing line I made, it'll take you there without you getting lost in my body."

A blue line lit up on the metallic floor, directing you toward a doorway then a large hallway. You followed the line, hoping whatever is causing this throbbing pain can be found.

Whew. That'll keep him distracted for some time. But the surveillance thing will still be exposed if no preventive measures are taken. I guess it's time to take mind surveillance to a new level. New program will include the ability to delete and implement memories, alter emotions, induce suggestions, and the ability to assume full body control of the human. Sorry trainer, but the interest of the Pokemon and my experiment still trumps your privacy.
14511111111111111111111111111111112121.title: After a while, you get up to see if your headac...

145132.content: How about Arceus or Giratina?
145132.title: Reader's choice.

1452.content: Which of these legendary Pokemon would you want to choose? Which one?
1452.title: Latios/Latias

14522.content:
The large figure that towers before you overwhelmed you. You cannot even see it in its entirety due to its sheer size, possibly 300 feet high, completely obstructing your field of vision. The shady creature comes closer to you, seemingly hovering above the forest floor. That voice you heard a while ago has you startled. Without thinking, you cowered in fear, shutting your eyes tight, preparing for what about to come.To your surprise, your surrounding seem to brighten a little...maybe the behemoth creature before has left you alone.

You slowly opened your eyes to see what has happened. Instead of seeing the forest, you saw flashes of 'red and white' markings in front of you. Bizarrely enough, in between all these colorful markings is a GIANT golden 'mirror'. It is highly polished and reflective, you can see yourself and the surrounding forest behind you in it. It is a beautiful sight. The mirror has a strange glowing and radiant pattern to it, alternating from brown to bright gold around a dark hole. The more you looked at it, the more you're mesmerized by it...How in the world can such majestic thing be in existence?, you thought.

"You like my pretty eyes, don't you?", a young female voice suddenly said,

The voice made you fell off your feet. You take a good look again at that 'mirror' only to realize that it's actually an eye and it belongs to.....you can't believe it.......it's Latias, a rare legendary Pokemon that you've only heard of.

"Hi there", said Latias with a beaming face, "You seem to enjoy my presence here, little creature. You look so lovely."

"Uhmm.... actually, I'm a human.", you managed to blurt out.

"But you look kinda.....small... for a human.", said Latias.

"I was shrunk in this forest, no idea what happened to me, I just randomly walked around here. Do you know anything going around here, Latias?", you asked, "Wait, I'm talking to a Pokemon. You can actually speak to me?"

The Latias gave a another playful giggle and a big nudge on your small body: "Actually, I have the ability to communicate with anything here, be it living things or inanimate objects. I just learned to read off your mind and use your knowledge to facilitate communication. And unfortunately, I don't know what happened to you, but I can offer my help since you have no idea of why you shrunk."

Hearing Latias' offer of help brightened you up almost immediately. Your ask Latias what kind of help can she offer you right now. The Latias gave you an even wider smile.

"Well, you can learn to live within me...", she said.

"What did you mean 'within you?", you asked.

"Apparently you don't know, legendary Pokemons have a long-kept secret: they all have an obsession with having something living within them, including me. If you ever wanted to enter me, you won't be affected by anything in my body. It'll be extremely comfortable and safe in there. And a plus, legendary Pokemons like to make their interior other-worldly, filled with stuffs that you won't find in an ordinary body system."

"So, do you want to enter me and try it out?", said Latias with a slight seductive tone.
14522.title: Latias

145221.content:
Latias' offer sounds appealing enough for you to accept it.

"Alright, it doesn't hurt to try out, I'll go in you. I have no other choice as of now.", you said.

Latias gave you a shrill of delight and a wide grin. "I'm glad that you made this choice. You wouldn't regret it. I promise.", said Latias, "From this point on, you'll have to live in me until we can figure out how to make you normal again. During this time, you're free to do whatever you want in my body."

While it seems that you finally found some kind of "shelter" to stay in, you are still confused as to why are you caught in this situation? Something tells you that there must be something behind your shrinking, be it some supernatural forces or unexplained phenomenon. But, there is nothing you can do about it for now. You went on and on, thinking about what this whole shrinking event means for you. Suddenly, you heard Latias speaking to again and you snapped back to reality.

"Well......What are you waiting for? Don't you want to get started and to fulfill my little fantasy?", Latias asked

"Uhm..yeah, I want to. It just that I'm still...unable to process this whole....turn of event. My mind is kinda 'exploding' from all the new information", you said.

"I understand. But pondering isn't not going to solve your problem anytime soon. Plus, you're vulnerable at this size. So, why don't you just enter me and we'll figure out the rest later on."

Hearing Latias' assurance, you managed to give her a faint smile. Seeing that as a sign that you're ready, the Pokemon landed onto the ground and placed her head several feet in front of you. Then Latias opened her huge cavernous mouth and you are immediately greeted by humid air emanating from the her body. The Pokemon slowly stuck out her tongue for you to step on. You promptly stepped onto Latias' tongue, which is soft and moist when you touched it.

The Eon Pokemon seems to sense you on her tongue so she gradually withdrew it back into her mouth. Latias closed her mouth and began to tilt her head. The interior of her mouth has become dark save for a few rays of light that shine through a narrow gap near her teeth. You felt Latias moving her tongues around you as if she is tasting you. You began to feel yourself slipping toward her gullet. Eventually, you went down toward her esophagus. You felt Latias' esophagus pushing you down toward your new home, the stomach. The expanding and contracting muscles around you provide you with a steady and comfortable movement downward.

A minute or so later, you landed in what could only be Latias' stomach. The stomach walls and floors around you are light pink. As you survey your new surrounding, you couldn't help but look at the massive size of her stomach. The huge size is most likely due to your shrunken state or did Latias has some kind of special power to make herself larger on the inside?

"Welcome to my stomach.", you heard Latias said as she patted her belly in delight, "You'll be safe in there and feel free to look around my body. I'll be flying up in a moment."

You sat down on the soft floor of the stomach, thinking about what to do next.

"So, What are you thinking about doing?"
145221.title: Eaten by Latias

1452211.content: You stood up and walked around the stomach, looking around, you are surprised to be able to see anything inside of Latias. To you additional surprise, you notice that the air is as fresh as the air outside, only a little warmer then the outside. As you walked towards the back on the stomach, you saw two openings, along with a small sign. According the the sign, the hole on the bottom led to Latias bowls, while the hole on the top led to her "Inner World." You were always the adventurous type, so out of your desire for adventure, you entered the "Inner World" Hole to explore. After walking down the tunnel for a few moments, you saw the end and ran towards it. When you stuck your head out the tunnel, you saw a strange setup that you would see inside and airplane. Passeger seat, tray tables and even windows! The windows, you could see a forest enviroment. "That is my "Window vision" Latias said. "It allows you to see outside my body from any area of my body, just in case you want a view from high above." She added. You sat on one of the seats and noticed it was made of the same matter then was in the stomach walls. You looked out the window as Latias took flight. After a few moments, you could see clouds, and the forest whitch was only a spec on the horizon. You stood up in amazment and thought of what to do next.
1452211.title: Explore Latias better

14522111.content:
You look around your new environment curiously. You never know that such places could exist in Latias. Despite it being a little bizarre, you immediately took a strong liking to Latias' interior. You sit on your seat for several more minutes, blankly staring out the windows at the clouds and the sun. Then, you decided that you wanted to know even more about Latias, so you leave your comfy flesh seat and head toward the "front." As you walked, you counted that there are a total of 5 rows of seats in this "Viewing Room" and each row can seat up to four people. It reminds you of a trans-ocean airship you took to get to Sinnoh about a year ago. 'I wonder why Latias would have such a place in her body.', you thought as you continue to explore your surrounding.

After walking for a minute or two, the room comes to an end and a sphincter opening is blocking your way forward. You noticed that there is a directional sign up front on the ceiling. The sign reads: Flight Control.

'That's interesting', you thought, 'Might as well check out what that is.'

You stepped forward to touch the constricted opening to see if there is a way of making it give way. The muscle feels soft to your touch. Then; as if Latias senses your presence, the opening gradually loosens and become large enough for you to pass through. You passed through the opening and find yourself about to go up an inclined passageway.

You make you way up the steep tunnel which is kind of exhausting. Eventually, you arrived at another closed opening. Just as you did with the first one, you touched it to let Latias know that you've arrived at your destination. As expected, the opening loosens up and you pass through.

You find yourself in a small room. You notice that the room has an oval shape to it. Up front in the room, you found a seat made of soft tissues situated in between two large elliptical windows. From the windows, you can see that Latias is flying over the ocean, islands randomly dotting the seemingly calm waters. 'It looks like I'm in some kind of advanced cockpits.', you thought. You walked toward the seat and sit down on it. On the armrests of your seat, you spot two joystick-like controllers, presumably for controlling Latias. They are made of some flexible organic material. In the front of you, there is a small display showing the current speed and height. 'This is amazing', you thought, "I wonder where am I in her body. But anyway, I can't wait to "play" with Latias.

"Hi. This is the "Flight Control" room.", you heard Latias said, "This room is located in my head and My eyes will act as your windows here. In this room, you can try to fly me around as you wish. Before I can allow you to try out, let me give you a quick flight lesson. The two controllers on your seat controls the altitude and speed of my flight. Pushing down will bring you lower while pulling up will sent you higher. To make a turn, you just have to pull or push the controllers in opposite directions to the desired way. You will also have to keep an eye on the screen to maintain a safe flying height. If you need to leave the control for a while, please lock the controls and press the "Self-operate" icon on the display to give control of flying back to me. Then, you can just sit back and enjoy the sceneries I'm seeing. Well, that's about all. Hope you'll enjoy the fun."

You hear Latias gave you a playful giggle. You blushed a little, never really met a "girl" so enthusiastic and curious for you. 'Who wouldn't like such a lovely 'girl', and a legendary Pokemon at that.', you thought.

You look for a while at the control layout to familiarize yourself with the basics.

What would you do?
14522111.title: Do some more exploring

145221111.content:
You look around the "cockpit" and see it has all the features of a real-world cockpit. The only difference is that everything is made from flesh and the two round windows (her eyes) because you're in Latias. The small display before you has the height indicator, which reads 1,000 feet. The speed indicator reads 85 Mph. You also see that attitude of Latias is level. You grab a hold of the controller that controls Latias height. You push down and like Latias said, she started to descend. You then pulled it back up and Latias leveled out. You then pull up on the controller and again, like Latias said, she started to climb.

"This is amazing!" You said to Latias. Latias only giggled and said. "I though you would like it." You then try your hand at the directional controller. You turn left, but Latias goes right. You then remembered, turn the controller in the opposite direction you want to go. So you pulled left and sure enough, Latias turned right. Then you saw something that caught your eye, and option that read "Latias co-pilot." You pondered for a moment and asked Latias what it was. "That allows me to project a hologram to fly with you. It is one of many ways we can "Personally" interact with each other.

After thinking for a moment, you finally decide to...
145221111.title: Flying Latias

choices: Stay in the Flight Control Room
1452211111.content:
"Latias co-pilot? That sounds like an interesting option. Looks like it's worth trying out.", you thought.

You activated the "Latias co-pilot" by tapping on the option on the display. Immediately, an aura began to form on your right side and gradually, the shape of a virtual Latias appears. The virtual Pokemon gave a lovely smile and began to speak. She looks exactly like her real self but with a semi-transparent body.

"Hi again, trainer. It seems that you like me to accompany you on my "flight", the holographic Latias said, This is a virtual representation of me created by my psychic power as an interface to interact with you when you are physically within me."

"Yeah!", you said, "I just want to talk to you more often and that flying with you is an life-changing experience for me. I never knew that you could have control mechanism in your body. I've read all about Pokemons and yet I never seen a book mention this kind of secrets. Is this some kind of hidden powers?"

"It's something similar. That's because each Pokemon has a well-kept secret: our bodies can be easily altered to accommodate our needs. In my case, I changed some parts of my body to allow you to live in me. This means that you can eat and sleep in here until we find out the reason to your shrinking.", Latias explained.

As you hear the virtual Latias explaining things, you continue to pilot her, occasionally lowering her altitude and making turns left and right to have a closer look at mountains or the cities along the routes. You have absolutely no experience in flying, but yet, it seems so easy to control Latias. You feel Latias smoothly gliding through the clouds, listening to the turbulent 'whooshing' sounds of wind forces that envelops her body. From high above, everything below you looks significantly smaller; the land looks more like model maps you saw at the Sinnoh Museum. You remained quiet for a least 10 minutes already. The quietness in the Flight Control room is further intensified by a silent Latias floating besides you. Then sensing the stiffness in the air, the Pokemon began to speak again.

"Isn't it beautiful?", Latias asked softly, "To be able to fly so freely up in the skies is probably something that you can only dream of. You don't get to see this kind of 'point-of-view' very often."

"That's right...until I met you and started to pilot you around", you said playfully, "Just one question, do you get to see this everyday when you fly around?"

"That depends on the location or region I'm flying through. If I'm flying through Kanto or the Hoenn region, the views are quite spectacular there. The islands, the beaches, the forests....they all seem so welcoming. On the other hand, if you're going through areas with poor weather, that wouldn't be a pleasant experience in my opinion. Plus, my older brother Latios is currently living, or should I say 'patrolling', the Hoenn region, so I get to travel a lot with him sometimes."

You nodded in agreement with her. Then, you feel the need to tell her something that you've been feeling since you met her.

"Latias, I don't know how should I say this to you.", you said as you look toward the curious Pokemon, "Since meeting you at the forest, I got a strange feeling for you. I.... can't quite..... put it. I'm always fascinated by Pokemons; I always admire their majestic appearances and qualities. Out of all the Pokemons I've encountered so far, I find you the most beautiful, admirable, and, frankly..... cutest of all. I think.... I'm about to have...... a 'crush' on you. Maybe being shrunk by some unknown power isn't such a bad thing after all."

You notice that Latias blushed a little and made some adorable expressions while covering her mouth: "Ohh...You're so nice. It's been some time since I saw a human like you. Because I never really come to a human up close, this will probably be my first chance at it."

Then, you saw the virtual Latias coming closer toward the seat you're in, holding your hands and gently nudging on your face. Despite the fact that its body is translucent, you can actually feel her touch. The feeling you got when she brushes against you is similar to rubbing against that velvet Shinx Pokedoll you have in your bedroom since you were a kid. Your blushed as Latias continue to brush you with her face. After a minute or so, Latias finally stopped and remove herself from you.

"That's such a wonderful feeling I got in me.", Latias exclaimed, "If I ever had the chance to introduce you to my older brother (Latios), it'll definitely change his mind about humans.", Latias said.

You continue to chat with the virtual Latias as you randomly control her flight from your seat. After an hour of aimless flying, you decided that you probably have enough flying for the day. The virtual Latias instructs you to press a red triangular icon on the display to return control to her. You pressed the icon and a "Control returned to Latias" confirmed its activation.

"So, what can we do now, Latias?", you asked the Pokemon.

"Well, you can either stay in here to watch the places I'm flying by or you can explore other places in my together with my virtual representation.", Latias replied

"So, what option do you choose?"
1452211111.title: Try out the "Latias co-pilot"

14522111111.content:
You decided it was time to get back to exploring. You left the cockpit with Latias at the controls and started to go back down the tunnel you came from. As you were walking, Latias talked with you about her innards. "Believe me, you have a ton of options you can choose from." Latias said. When you two made it back to the "Viewing window" You asked Latias to give you a few options.

Brain
As you probably already know, this the control center of my body. You can do many things here. You could view my memories and dreams, and even look at any Pokemon in the world with the Latias Pokedex. And if you want to share anything about yourself, you can let me view your dreams and memories as well.

Computer room
As you probably have known, I can incorporate Human technology within me for your enjoyment. In the computer room, You can chat with other Pokemon, browse the "Poke-net" and view the online Pokedex. But My Latias Pokedex is much more extensive then the online Pokedex. You can also Browse at and interactive map of me with a personal program I made. The best part, And I think you'll like, Is that I have got an comprehensive collection of games for you to play.

"Those are not all the destinations I assure you." Latias said. "I just thought you could start with one of those two." She added.

You thought for a few moments. You really can't decide what to do. There is just so many things to do in Latias. Not only her brain and Computer room, but only Latias knows what else awaits you. "So, what will you do next?" Latias asked. You decided to go along with the suggestions Latias gave you. "I think I'll will explore your...."
14522111111.title: Explore other places

145221111111.content:
"I think I'll explore your brain, Latias", you replied.

"That's a good start for you since you can "learn" much more about me if you get to my brain.", said Latias, "Let's safe the "Computer Room" for later."

"So how do I get to your brain?", you asked, not yet really clear about the 'layout' of Latias' body.

"You just need to take the spiral passage located to the left of the entrance to the "Flight Control" room. Take it up and your should be there in no time.", Latias replied happily.

You did as Latias instructed, moving your way to the front of the "Viewing Window" chamber. You made it back to the "Flight Control" entrance. To the left of it, you find another hole that takes you up toward the brain. The fact is further confirmed by a sign saying "Brain" and an arrow pointing in the direction of the passage. Without any hesitation, you made your way up the tunnel which is so soft that you have to occasionally crawl to move. The tunnel seems rather short as you reached the end of it within 2 minutes.

You've arrived in the chamber that houses the Pokemon's brain. The circular room has a diameter of of more than 200 ft and Latias' brain occupied the center of the room, taking up at least 80 percent of the space in the chamber. The brain is connected by a thick stem that leads to the floor of the chamber; it resembles a thick bundle of colorful wirings which you find rather other-worldly considering the fact that you're in an organic life form. You guess that it must be the medulla, which allows brain signals to be sent out to the entire body. You slowly approached the pink, crinkled brain before you, and you walked around the entire brain to see if you'll find anything special. To your surprise, there is an elevated walkway that leads directly to the center of the brain. The walkway is made of a mix of veins and soft tissues.

"Go in and have a look at what I've got. You'll be amazed.", Latias tells you.

Wanting to delay you exploration no further, you walked onto the walkway and entered Latias' brain.

Within it, you discover that you're in a room with countless colorful rows of building block-like structures. You are overlooking the chamber on some type of balcony. The interior of Latias' brain resembles a huge computer-server room but much more massive and the blocks are also larger. You assume that the block contains 'information' about Latias' memories. From your perspective, you see that there are blue, red, green, yellow, violet, and orange blocks neatly arranged in rows. You went down a flight of stairs that you find at the left-hand side of the balcony and made you way down to the chamber.

Once you reached the ground floor, you discovered that there is a raised platform at front end of the room containing some sort of command center that overlooks all of the "blocks." You wasted no time in getting onto the platform. You find a seat like the one in the "Flight Control" so you sit on it. The controls laid out before you are entirely different. There is a single large screen before you displaying a rough map of the blocks in the brain chamber that are colored accordingly. A legend provided at the bottom of the screen explains the significance of the colors:

Blue= Contacts with Latios
Red= Latias' Memories
Green= Secrets
Yellow= Emotions
Violet= Personal Fantasies
Orange= Latias' Pokedex

As Latias promised you, you are indeed very fascinated by this surprise within her brain.

Just then, the screen before you instructs you to press one of the colored block areas on the screen to access the desired information.

"Which one would you choose?"
145221111111.title: Journey to Latias' Brain

1452211111111.content:
After going over the options available, you decided to see the first option,Contacts with Latios, for a start. You press the region on the display that is marked with blue. You immediately saw the blue blocks in the chamber began to glow and generate electrostatic sounds. The screen refreshes and present you with a list of the most recent interactions that Latias has with her brother Latios. Although this is amazing, one question puzzles you: Why does Latias need to create a separate area in her brain just exclusively for encounters with Latios. Does this means something for her?

"It seems that you like to know more about my relationship with my brother.", Latias said playfully, "The reason I have a separate region in my brain for my memories with my brother Latios is mainly because we don't meet each other very often. Being in different faraway regions make contacts rare so I often firmly remember everything about my meetings."

"That's sounds like a good thing and a sign of a good mind.", you tell the Pokemon, "It's probably because you really like to be with Latios. He's probably just as nice and majestic as you. But I'm curious, what do you two talk about during those rare meetings?"

"That you'll have to take a look at it yourself to know.", Latias replies, "Plus, my brother is still a little wary of humans in general because he nearly got caught by one. If we ever meet him, it's best to keep your status as a trainer a secret."

"You don't have to worry, I'll take note of that.", you assure Latias, "In the mean time, do you mind if look at your memories of Latios? Just asking before I "browse" over you thoughts."

"I have no problem with that since you'll be the only one to know it for now.", the Pokemon replied approvingly.

After getting the green light from Latias, you started "browsing" through the lists of meeting the Pokemon had with her brother. Each of the individual item is marked with a short title. Some are casual conversations about current things in the Pokemon world while others are more about personal relationship. You saw one labeled Looking After Hoenn that looks particularly interesting.

You tapped on the choice on the display. The screen instructs you to proceed to two specific blocks in the blue area; to simplify matters, it provides you with a flashing dots diagram about the location of the blocks with the information. It also instructs you to enter the block once you find the one you want.

You left the command center for the millions of "blocks" before you. You walked over to the blue area and began to search for the right one to access. After a 5 minute search, you located the blocks with the corresponding coordinates. The block is huge, resembling an extremely over-sized refrigerator. You decided to enter the one about Looking After Hoenn. Despite resembling solid materials, the blocks are extremely soft and slimy. You walked into one with relative ease, like passing through a fine net.

When you're fully inside, the surrounding is initially dark. You wonder about how Latias is going to show you about her brother Latios. Then, the room started to brighten up and you began to hear voices. Things started to materialize around you. Initially a messy blur, a grassy ground began to take shape, sounds of Bug Pokemons began to waft through your ears. Studying your surrounding, you see that you're in a forest, much like the one you're shrunken in, but based on the bright red and yellow of the leaves, it most likely took place during fall. When you are just amazed about how realistic the memory is, you heard a melodious male voice coming from you're right side. When you turned you're head, you realized that you're looking at none other than Latios. He is slowly hovering through the woods accompanying 'you.'


"Latias, looking after Hoenn is a really important job for me.", Latios said, "Look at this vast natural wonder before us. This is all possible because a balance exists here. That balance needs to be maintained here, a balance between Pokemons and the........humans."
