1542222222212111.title: Meloetta's special show

15422222222121111.content:
Giving a loud sigh, the green haired pokemon starts venturing into the forest, hoping that the pink pokemon she's looking for will eventually come out herself.

"How longer do we need to walk?" you ask tiredly.
"Again? It's like the third time you ask me. Still a little bit anyway." Meloetta replies, floating in front of you, leading the way.
"It's easy for you to say! You fly!" you state with a groan, making the green headed pokemon giggle.
"We're here you silly human. Look.".

Looking forward, you manage to see the end of the tunnel you've been walking in for what seemed an eternity. Following Meloetta, you enter what seems a rather large, round bedroom.

A big, comfy - looking bed, with black and green sheets, and white pillows, occupies a good part of the room. You notice two identical windows near the bed.
"Are those...?" you look at Meloetta, who simply nods.
"My eyes, yes." she replies.

Nodding at her answer, you walk over the bed, literally crashing on it. It's incredibly soft. As it looks anyway.
"So? How do you like it?" Meloetta asks in a singsong voice.
"It's wonderful." you reply.
"How can you do all of this? Change things inside your body I mean." you ask.
Meloetta smiles.
"I'll have you know, human, in other circumstances I would never have revealed this to you. But since you saw it now... legendaries have some powers. Powers that no human knows about... well, almost no human now..." she says, sitting next to you on the bed.

"You see, one of these powers is changing our insides as we wish. Like the city you saw earlier, or the room we're staying in now." she quietly says. You remain silent, taking in every information.
"Why are you revealing this to me?" you then ask, before another question forms in your mind.
"In fact, why did you even help me in the first place?".

Meloetta smiles.
"I helped you because I thought you aren't a threat to me, like other humans could surely be." she states.
"Well..." you try to say, but she interrupts you.

"And then again, you didn't flee when you saw a huge pokemon, you remained to admire me; You didn't get angry at me when I almost crushed you, you asked for my help; And you didn't yell at me when I swallowed you, you accepted to stay in my body. You seem pretty trustworthy to me." she states.
"And, I'm revealing these things to you because, as I said, you already saw what I can do, so why deny it?" she says, getting no response.

"Well, if you don't need anything else, I'll be go-".
"Wait." you stop her.
"You talked about other powers aside changing your insides. What else can you do aside this?" you ask curiously.

Meloetta smiles, as if you just said something funny.
"That's something you'll have to find out yourself." with that, her projection vanishes, leaving you completely alone.

"Where... is... she?" Meloetta asks, exasperated. She's been looking for Mew for about half and an hour now, where the heck could she be!?

Groaning, Meloetta turns around. Just to discover two sapphire eyes staring right into her own eyes, a pink muzzle inches from her face. The green haired pokemon blinks a few times before screaming, floating backwards, a laughing Mew now occupying her view.
"Not... funny..." she whispers, recomposing herself.

"Hi there Meloetta!" Mew beams with her usual cheerful attitude.
"Hi..." Meloetta mutters, before clearing her throat.
"Mew there's something important I need to tell you...".
Mew stops laughing and smiles.
"I'm all ears." she says.
15422222222121111.title: Looking for Mew.

154222222221211111.content:
"So? What do you have to tell me? I'm listening." Mew repeats with a giggle. Meloetta breathes deeply, before finally talking.
"You see...".

Back in the room within Meloetta's head, you had been resting for a while. You tried to figure out how the heck you suddenly shrunk and, most of all, why. But, obviously, you weren't able to answer to any of your questions, so you just shook them off and decided to catch a nap. You woke up a few minutes ago and you're bored out of your skull.
"Meloetta." you call out.

As expected, the green headed pokemon appears in front of you.
"Enjoying your stay?" she asks in a singsong voice.
You nod.
"Hey, you said that you made your whole body livable for me, right?" it's now her turn to nod.
"Well, I was wondering, is there any place I haven't seen yet?" you ask.

Meloetta smiles.
"Yes. A lot of places actually. Why, do you want to go exploring?" she asks you.
"Sure... why not?" you reply.
"Then let's go. Follow me." she says, grabbing your hand and literally dragging you out of the entrance of the bedroom.

She leads you into a big chamber. Everything is quite dark around you, you barely manage to see.
"Meloetta, where are we?" you ask.
"In my Memory Chamber. Look there." she points to a large mirror. You curiously get near. Weirdly, you can't see your reflection in it; instead, you're staring at Meloetta, who is sitting on tree, singing.

Seeming to read your mind, Meloetta giggles.
"That isn't a normal mirror." she says you.
"If you look in it, you'll be able to see my memories.".


"I see. That's quite an interesting story." Mew says. Meloetta nods.
"But I'd like to share a few words with this little guy you're talking about. May I?" she asks, with a hint of hope in her voice.
"Sure, go ahead." Meloetta replies. Nodding, Mew places a hand on her friend's forehead and focuses, trying to find the little guy within her.

Scanning Meloetta's aura, she detects your little body inside hers.
'So she wasn't lying.' Mew thinks with a giggle.
'Okay, here I come.'.

'Hi there.' a voice suddenly rings inside the chamber. You turn your back to the mirror, trying to spot the source of the voice. Meloetta disappeared from the chamber, you notice, and, aside you, there's no one here.
"Who is it?" you ask.
'I'm Mew, Meloetta's friend. I'm talking to you through your aura. Meloetta wants me to help you. Can I talk with you for a little while?' Mew asks.
"Uhm..." you try, but another, familiar, voice is heard.
'Go on little guy. She's our friend.' your recognize it as Meloetta.

Nodding to yourself, you speak up.
"Sure, we can talk for a bit." you reply.
'Good.' Mew's voice says.
'But, do you mind coming out? I'd like to see you.' she adds.

As if reading your mind, Meloetta's psychic projection appears once again.
"Follow me, I'll lead you outside." she says with a warm smile. Shrugging, you follow her out of the Memory Chamber.

She leads you into a tunnel. You notice the passage getting more slippery each step you take. And then... light.

You find yourself standing on a large, black paw. You look up to see Meloetta's smiling face and another pokemon, pink in color, which you assume is Mew. Looking around, you notice the three of you are in an enlightened clearing.
"Hi there." Mew says cheerfully.
154222222221211111.title: Talking with Mew.

1542222222212111111.content:
"Uh, hi." you reply to the pink pokemon.
"So, Meloetta told me you found yourself shrunk a few hours ago. Is that true?" Mew asks you.
"Yes, that's right. I was walking around in a forest, when I suddenly felt dizzy. I fainted and, when I woke up..."
"...He followed my song and found me. He asked for my help and I decided to let him stay inside my body." Meloetta finishes your story.

Mew just looks at you two silently, seeming to be pondering something, before speaking up.
"Well, as I said, that's really a really amusing story. Little one, I seem to understand that you don't have any clue of how you got so tiny, and nor do you Meloetta." she says, both of you nodding.

"Well, I'm sorry to say, I don't have any idea of how to change you back." Mew says with a sorrowful look.
"But I may have an idea." she adds.
"We're listening." Meloetta says.

"Well, I think we should split up for a while. I'll try and find a way to grow the little human back, while you, Meloetta, keep him safe in the meantime... Although I really wouldn't mind staying with this little guy for some time. It can get very lonely in this forest. Anyway I'll let you know if I discover anything." Mew explains. You look up to Meloetta, who returns your gaze.
"Just a minute, Mew..." she says, turning around.

"What to do?" you whisper.
"Well, it seems a good idea to me. And, then again, what other choice do we have? Might as well stick to this idea." she whispers back. You nod.

Meloetta turns around again.
"Well, Mew, we think it's a good idea... if it's not a problem that is..." she says.
"Are you kidding? It'll be the perfect excuse to leave this forest for a while. It gets incredibly boring around here, and this adventure seems like lots of fun!" the pink pokemon cheers.

"It's decided then. I'll contact you if I find anything interesting. See you later!" Mew beams, before disappearing in a flash of light.
"She teleported." Meloetta explains upon seeing your confused look.
"And I think we don't have anything else to do here." she adds, starting to float toward the exit of the forest.

Shortly, she is out of the forest, the midday sun shining in the sky. Meloetta looks at you, who are still sitting on her black paw.
"Hey little guy." she calls out.
"What?" you reply.
"Ready to go back in?" she asks, opening her mouth to empathize the sentence. You nod as the green haired pokemon lifts her paw to her face and drops you inside her mouth, before swallowing.

Once again, you get to experience the descent into her stomach. But, this time, you know what awaits you, so you land on your feet on the bone floor, Meloetta's psychic projection waiting for you.
"Welcome back trainer." she says cheerfully.
"Say Meloetta, where could I explore now?" you ask.
"Well, there are lot of places you haven't seen yet." she says, telling you some places such as 'Singing Room' or 'Dance Simulator'.
"So, where would you like to start?" she then asks.

Before you can reply, though, your stomach growls, asking for food. You rub your head.
"Um... Maybe some place where I can eat something?" you ask, making Meloetta giggle.
"Of course. Follow me." she says, floating off, you following her.

Soon, she stops right before a fleshy sphincter.
"Go through this hole." she says. You do as instructed and walk toward the hole. You touch it, and it opens at your contact. You walk through it and find yourself in a large, spherical room. You see large folds of flesh resembling a table with some chairs around it, while some tubes hang from the ceiling.

You sit down on a chair as Meloetta comes in.
"Welcome to my Food Store. You'll be getting your meals here." she explains. Just then, trays of food come out of the many tubes. Nuts, berries and much more food land on the table along with water, berry juice and what seems to be wine, judging by the strong aroma. Your stomach growls impatiently, waiting to be satisfied. Meloetta sits down on your lap.
"What are you waiting for? Eat up!" she giggles.
She doesn't have to tell twice, as you immediately start digging in, enjoying the great sensation of having your belly filling up.

Meloetta patiently waits for you to stop eating, before lifting herself as you get up.
"How was it?" she asks with a smile. A satisfied sigh seems to please her.
"Good. Now, how about we resume our tour?" you nod in response.

You spend the next hours exploring the various places within Meloetta's body as she guides through new rooms. But in the end, she guides you back in your room before disappearing. And her booming voice is heard, making you assume it's the real Meloetta speaking.
"I'm going to sleep human. If you want to keep exploring, you're free to do it. Or you can go to sleep, it's pretty late." she says.

You look at your watch. And true to her word, it's 11:30 PM.
"Whoa, time really flies. I think I'm going to bed as well." you reply.
"Goodnight then." comes her voice, before everything goes quiet. You are about to lay down on the bed, before you you look at the twin 'windows' that are her eyes. You get an idea and go look through it.

As expected, you manage to see where Meloetta currently is, even though it's really dark outside; she's in some kind of cave. Yawning, you decide it's time to hit the hay and lay on the bed.
'This day sure has been pretty eventful.' you think, before slowly drifting off.
1542222222212111111.title: Confronting Mew.

choices: Go through the hole, you're too curious.
Go to bed, you'll find out later on
15422222222121111111.content:
You open your eyes. Nearly a week has passed since you've met Meloetta and you have been living inside her body since then. You know almost every part of her body now. Though you are still wondering about a small, mysterious hole that frequently appeared during your exploration. You though about going through it a few times, but if you just looked at it, it would simply shut close and disappear. So you decided to forget it.

"Good morning, trainer." Meloetta's usual cheerful voice greets you as you get up.
"Slept well?"
"Yes... as always though." you reply, making her giggle.

You head into the personal bathroom right next your bedroom and decide to take a quick shower.

Once you're done, you step out, dry yourself and get dressed, before heading out of the bathroom, where Meloetta is waiting for you.
"Say human." she says looking at you.
"What are you going to do today?"
"Um, the usual things I guess. Why?" you ask.
"Oh, nothing important. But I think I'm going to show some new places today." she replies.

"Really? What are they?" you ask curiously. Meloetta giggles.
"You'll find out in due time. Now go get breakfast. I think you know the way." she replies, fading away. You nod to yourself and exit your room, passing through the tunnel that leads into the Food Store.

You catch a quick breakfast and get up. Shortly after, Meloetta appears again.
"Okay human, I think I can show one of the new places now. Meet me at Memory Chamber." she tells you, fading once again.

You do as instructed and, within five minutes, you get to the familiar dark room where Meloetta's Memory Mirror is placed. She's waiting for you next to it.
"Glad to see you came." she says, smiling.
"Now, here." she gets behind the mirror. You follow her and notice a hole, similar to the mysterious one, but much bigger.

You look at Meloetta, who nods. You touch the sphincter, which opens itself, revealing what seems a cliff, a deep blue sea roaring downwards.
"Welcome to my Imagination Lounge." the green headed pokemon says, entering after you.
"Imagination? You mean...?" you ask.
"That's right. Everything I imagine can be seen here. And about the cliff... I thought it would be a great playground." she explains.

"Playground?" you parrot back. Meloetta giggles.
"Yes human. Playground. I want to play with you for a bit." she says.
"Do I have a choice?" you ask. The green haired pokemon shakes her head. And then... she suddenly starts growing before your eyes.
"Meloetta... what... why?" you ask.
"Well trainer, I think we can have some real fun if I'm bigger than you." she replies, empathizing the word 'real' .

And then, without adding any other word, she flies toward you, her paw wrapping around your torso and scooping you up like you were a doll. Meloetta quickly lifts her paw to the white landscape of her head and drops you on it.
"Okay then, let the fun begin!" she beams, starting to fly around.

Surely, Meloetta's idea of fun is very different from yours, as she just spent the successive hours flying around while singing or, eventually, shifting into Pirouette Form and starting to dance while you were still on her head. But you're actually having fun. In fact, you completely lose the track of time.

Just when the now redheaded pokemon stops her dance and lets you down on the ground, you have a chance to look at your watch. It's 8 PM.
"Oh, it's already that late?" Meloetta asks, while slowly returning to her normal size.
"Very well, trainer, I think you should have dinner now." she says. Maybe you're just seeing things, but you're sure a small smirk just appeared on her face, right before she fades, leaving you alone.

You shrug it off and walk out of Imagination Lounge, heading to the Food Store. You have dinner - daring to try berries you didn't even know that existed, assuming they are very rare, and some of the strong berry juice Meloetta provided you, which tasted surprisingly sweet - before deciding to head back to your bedroom inside her head. As you walk through the fleshy tunnel, though, you once again notice the sphincter that leads to unknown places within Meloetta's body.

You look around. There's no sign of Meloetta, and the passage is still here. So you reluctantly extend a hand to touch it. Surprisingly, it doesn't disappear like the other time you tried to get it to open, this time it actually opens.

You stare inside it. The passage is really dark, and it's impossible for you to see where it leads. You can just go through it and find out what Meloetta is hiding from you from a whole week.

Weird. You had been trying to discover what is on the other side of his hole for a week, yet now you feel you shouldn't explore this part, unless Meloetta tells you so. But you're extremely curious, and you have the chance to satiate your curiosity.

You hesitate for a few minutes, trying to decide if you should go across this dark tunnel or just forget it and wait for Meloetta to tell you to explore it. You linger about what to do for still a few seconds, before finally deciding yourself...
15422222222121111111.title: Continue.

154222222221211111111.content:
Shrugging, you decide yourself. It's now or never. You want - no, you have! - to find out what's on the other side of this tunnel.

Carefully, you slip inside. It's very dark, you barely manage to see. You walk further in, your curiosity raising each step you take. You keep walking, thinking about what you're going to find when you reach the end of this passage. And you get completely lost in your own mind, since you completely lose the track of time.

You walk for a hour or so, before you finally manage to see the sphincter that is probably the end of the passage. Your heart begins to race. Whatever is outside this hole, you're going to find out now.

Mentally preparing yourself, you step out of the sphincter, which seals shut behind you. You take a look around. It seems that you just entered a cave situated near a cliff. The walls around you are rocky, and you can distinctly hear the sea roaring, but it is covered by another sound. A familiar, enchanting sound.

You follow it, even more curious than before. And then, you come come to an end. A bed - black and green like the one in your room, just much bigger - is placed against one of the rocky walls. Floating in midair just above it, there's Meloetta, singing, her eyes closed. But, as you get closer, they open up a bit, a smile growing on her face.
"So you came after all." she says, almost in a whisper, but with a happy smile.

She was expecting you!?

In your shock, you don't notice Meloetta gracefully descending on the bed.
"Welcome to my Emotional Room my dear human. Or, as I like to call it, my Private Room." she explains. You take in the information, figuring out that this was the other place that Meloetta wanted to show you.

"Listen up trainer, I'd like to share a few words with you. So, I suggest you sit down." she says. You obey and sit on the bed, while Meloetta sits right next to you.
"Listen, as you maybe noticed, this chamber was inaccessible to you over the last week." she says.
"But tonight, I led you here for a reason." she looks at you very softly.

"Go on..." you say.
"Well, having you explore my insides over the last week felt amazing. Not many pokemon like to be near me, because of my power, and thanks to you, I felt... really good, like I had someone to keep me company. But then, I realized something." she explains.
"What is it?" you encourage her to continue her story.
"Well, I realized I've grown affection for you. And not an affection like between best friends, brothers and sisters or pokemon and trainer. No, it's more than that." she says, now blushing.

You get where this is going, a blush starts spreading on your face.
"So, you're trying to say..." you try, but Meloetta cuts you off.
"... I really like you." she ends the sentence, while flying up to your head. And then, she does something you never thought that would have happened in your whole life.

She places a kiss on your forehead. Your eyes widen in shock, your heart starts galloping inside your chest, your blush grows. Meloetta returns to her original position next to you, smiling.
"I'm sorry, but I had to do that. It's just... you're really the nicest creature I've ever met and..." she stops herself, not able to finish the phrase.
"I understand. I really like you too..." you admit. Meloetta's smile brightens as she hugs you. You hug back, enjoying the moment. The hug lasts a few minutes, before she finally breaks it.

"As you may have guessed," she says.
"This chamber is situated within my heart. And it's where, my dear human, we are going to sleep together. If you don't mind, of course." she says very softly.
154222222221211111111.title: An unexpected revelation.

choices: "Could you come outside? We need to talk."
"Mew contacted me last night. Looks like she found something."
1542222222212111111111.content:
You still can't believe what is currently happening. You enter the sphincter, you find that Meloetta was waiting for you and then she kisses you...

"Human? Anyone in there?" Meloetta's voice snaps you from your mind, bringing you back into the room.
"Are you alright?" Meloetta asks again with a worried voice.
"Yes... I was just thinking." you reply.

The green headed pokemon smiles and flies back, sitting down on the bed, patting a spot beside her, smiling and blushing at the same time.

With an awful sense of embarrassment, you decide to just do it. You silently slide next to her. Both her paws rush to hug you once more.
"I'm so glad you decided to stay!" she says in a gleeful voice voice.

"So... are we going... to sleep now...?" you ask. Meloetta giggles.
"Silly human, we still got some time to talk." she replies without stopping her laughs.
"About what?" you ask again, trying to hide the massive embarrassment you're feeling right now. Obviously with little success.

Meloetta doesn't seem to notice though.
"Well, do you have any questions for me?" she asks.
You quickly think of something.
"I've been inside you for a week. You know about my life..." you say, recalling the moments you spent talking with Meloetta about your life as a pokemon trainer. Meloetta nods, clearly telling you to go on.
"... well, as I was saying, you know about my life, but I don't quite know about yours. I mean, you lived for centuries, right? Can you tell me something about yourself?" you ask. Meloetta smiles warmly.
"With pleasure." she replies.

Many hours pass as Meloetta talks about her life, telling you about stories and ancient legends. She literally had your full attention after a minute of talking. You just lay there the whole time, the small pokemon... the small projection of the pokemon snuggled in your arms, telling you about how the Abyssal Ruins. You know about them, they are the remains of an ancient construction that somehow sank into the depths of the sea.

Meloetta reveals you that it was her to sink the Ruins because of foolish men trying to catch her and use her powers. She keeps talking until you let out a deep yawn.

Looking at your watch, you notice it's midnight. You look at Meloetta, who smiles.
"Looks like you need your sleep for tonight trainer." she says.
"Sleep. I'll continue my tale tomorrow." she says. Even though you are really curious and want to hear more, you decide you'll better sleep for now.

So you close your eyes. You feel Meloetta snuggling closer to you.
"Goodnight trainer. Sleep well." she says, before starting to sing. Her sweet song does a good job in soothing you. Your body feels more and more relaxed until you fall dead asleep.


The next morning, you are awake by the sound of Meloetta's voice.
"Human... Trainer... wake up." she says, getting no response from a still sleeping you.
"Human, wake up, come on." she says again, still without getting any progress in waking you up.

With a sigh, Meloetta flies over you.
"Wake up trainer!" she literally shouts. Your eyes shut open and your body rockets upwards. You land back on the bed with a thud.
"Meloetta... why...?" you ask, recovering from the scare.
"It's all my fault. I shouldn't have sang you to sleep." she says, rubbing the back of her head.
"Anyway, you're awake now, can I tell you something?"
"Go ahead..." you reply.

Meloetta breathes in, as if trying to say something big, before speaking.
"Well, you see...
1542222222212111111111.title: A night with Meloetta.

15422222222121111111111.content:
"... could you come outside? We need to talk." Meloetta's voice speaks.
"Sure..." you reply, rubbing your eyes.
"Mind if I shower first?" Meloetta's projection nods her head, disappearing.

Still drowsy, you walk to the end of the Emotional Chamber. You notice the sphincter you went through last night has appeared once again. You have a feeling you'll be able to use it more often now. Touching it, it opens to let you out, before closing again. Though this time, it doesn't disappear.
"Meloetta?" you call out, expecting her to appear behind you.
"Mh?' her booming voice asks instead.
"This hole didn't disappear this time, why?" you ask.
"Well, now you know what's inside, what's the use of keeping you out? You're free to enter it whenever you want." she explains.

You nod to yourself, walking in your bedroom. You step into the bathroom right next it. Ten minutes later, you step out, fully clean and dressed.
"Ready, human?" Meloetta asks again.
"Yes, I'm coming out now." you reply.

You head toward the passage that leads to her mouth. She opens it, letting you slide down on her paws. You are greeted to the outside world by warm sunlight, the spectacular sight of the crystalline sea and the nice, cool breeze... and the next second, Meloetta squeezes your body in a bone crushing hug.
"I'm so happy about last night." she cheers, softening her grip a bit, enough to let you breath.

"Whe-where are we?" you ask after catching your breath.
"On a island I know. Quiet, peaceful and relaxing. That's why I like coming here. Anyway, we have important things to talk about." she suddenly looks very serious. You just nod.
"Well, I think it's clear we really like each other. But I wanted to talk to you because I'm unsure about future. I mean, can we still be with each other when you're back to your normal size?" she asks.

"IF I return to my normal size. And, telling the truth, I'm not sure. I don't even know how it works." you state, blushing. Meloetta doesn't seem to have understood though.
"What do you mean?"
"I mean, will we have to... you know... mate?" you explain. She flushes red as well. But she gives a playful smile.
"I don't think so. You can't possibly give me eggs. And, even if it happens someday, I can assure you it'll be in a long time." she playfully wags her free paw, empathizing the word 'long'.

You stay silent for a while, not finding anything else to say. Neither she does, you guess, since she's being silent as well. The only noise is now the occasional wave crashing on the sand.
"Well... I'll have to go back in now... right?" you suddenly ask. Meloetta thinks about it.
"Actually, I'd like you to be outside." she admits.
"What?"
"Just for today. Look around, this place is beautiful. You don't mind staying out with the real me, instead of being inside my body with a mere fake, right?" she winks.
"You do have a point. I can't compare that projection to the real you." you say with a smile.

*Smooch*

As soon those words escaped your mouth, Meloetta leaned forward, pressing her lips on your forehead. You feel like you're going on fire right now. Each inch of your body burns while Meloetta's warm and soft lips smooch your forehead. She pulls off, laughing merrily. You feel dizzy.

"So... what are we going to do here?"you ask upon recomposing yourself. Meloetta smiles warmly.
"Well, the first I can suggest is that we explore around for a bit. What do you think?" she asks.
"Sure." you reply.
"Why not?".
15422222222121111111111.title: "Could you come outside? We need to talk."

154222222221211111111111.content:
Hearing your words, Meloetta's mouth widens into a happy smile.
"Great. Let's get going then." she says cheerfully. She lets you sit on her large paw as she starts to float around, more accurately, into a small forest nearby.

"Where are we exactly going?" you ask her.
"It's a surprise, silly. You'll see when we get there." Meloetta replies.

Ten minutes pass. Twenty. Half and an hour. But Meloetta keeps flying silently. You're bored out of your skull, and your curiosity for wherever the green haired pokemon is taking you surely doesn't help.

Sighing, you lay down on her paw. She stops.
"Hey, what's wrong?" she asks, looking at you.
"Nothing, I'm just bored." you reply.
Meloetta smiles brightly.
"Well, you might just think otherwise. Look." she points somewhere in front of her with her free paw.

Sitting upright, you notice what she's pointing to: a huge clearing. In the middle of it is a lake; behind it, a roaring waterfall streams down a rocky wall.
"Wow." you say.
"Yep." Meloetta says, flying over a large rock and sitting down on it, placing you down on her lap in the meantime.

She goes silent, closing her eyes. Probably meditating, you think, closing your eyes as well. You get to enjoy the soothing sound of the waterfall from the comfy 'seat' made out of Meloetta's black skirt.

Quite a while passes when she finally speaks up again.
"There we go. It's really nice around here, isn't it?" she whispers as if she doesn't want to break the silence.
"Mhhh." you reply distractedly. The green headed pokemon smiles.
"You comfy?" she asks.
"Yes." you whisper.
"You like it here?" she asks again.
"Yes." you repeat.
"Can I pet you?".
"Sure... wait wh-" before you can add anything else, Meloetta's paw gently comes down on your head, gently stroking your hair.

You give a sigh of pure happiness as the gentle paw keeps rubbing your head. Meloetta giggles her signature, melodious giggle. And then, she starts singing, not stopping, though, her paw from rubbing your head. You got used to the hypnotic sensation you feel everytime Meloetta starts singing, yet, as always, you can't fight back.

And now , completely under her spell, you barely move at all, 'trapped' between the sweet song and the soothing, gentle stroking on your head.


"Some cute little human you are." Meloetta comments softly, stopping her song after a few minutes.
"I knew you like staying in my body, but know I can tell you don't mind staying out either, right?" she asks in a singsong tone.

You murr in response, too relaxed to even talk. Meloetta smiles happily.
"I'll take that as a 'yes'." she states.
154222222221211111111111.title: Exploring time with Meloetta.

1542222222212111111111111.content:
Meloetta keeps gently rubbing your head for a few more minutes, getting pleased sighs from you, before stopping.
"Hey human, how about we resume our little tour?" she asks you.
"Fine by me. If the other places are like this, I can't wait to see them." you see energetically.

A delighted smile quickly appears on the green headed pokemon's face.
"Oh trust me, you'll love them." she says, floating up in midair and starting to fly over the forest once again

Meloetta was right. You really enjoyed each place she carried you to. You got to see many beautiful things, such as huge - and not just from your point of view- trees with their leaves dancing along the wind; the beautiful show of thousands of different colored berries that formed literal rainbows.

And, now, all snuggled up to Meloetta, who is sitting on a tree, you are seeing the best sunset ever: the sun, descending over the horizon, is in fact painting reddish yellow shades on the deep blue sea, with the effect of making it shine brightly.
"Well, this sure has been one good day, wouldn't you agree?" Meloetta asks you.
"Yep. I have to admit, I got used to exploring the insides of your body, but taking this... 'free day' and see this place with you was really a great idea. Thank you Meloetta." you say.

Meloetta brings you to her face and pushes you into her white cheek.
"Aren't you just a sweetie?" she says, happily nuzzling you. You gladly let her.

When she finally pulls off, the sun has settled down. The sky is now enlightened by a beautiful, full moon. Smiling brightly, Meloetta plucks two berries from a near branch and hands one to you.
"It should be enough to fill you up." she says. In fact, the berry is as big as you are.

You bite on it, savoring its sweet taste, enjoying each bite you take.

When you finally finish your meal, Meloetta had already eaten her berry long ago.
"So, I think we should rest now. It has been a long day." she says.
"Yep, long and exciting." you point out.
"Glad you enjoyed your time outside me. Though we're not done yet." she replies.

"What do you mean?" you ask.
"Well, I thought it would be nice if you slept outside, with me." Meloetta admits. You flush red.
"Uhm..."
"Just for tonight. I'll let you back inside me tomorrow morning, before we start traveling again. Alright?" she asks. You nod.

Meloetta smiles as she lies you down on her belly, before laying down herself, covering your body with her paws.
"Goodnight trainer. See you in the morning." she says. You close your eyes, snuggling up to Meloetta, enjoying the soft texture of her dress and the warmth provided by her paws. Soon, your mind drifts off.


"Wake up... Trainer?" Meloetta calls out. You keep on sleeping. The green haired giantess sighs.
"You asked for it." she says, pressing her lips on your cheek. You instantly wake up and bolt upwards. The first thing you notice is that is morning now. And then, you notice Meloetta laughing like crazy.
"And I thought princesses needed kisses to wake up!" she laughs, making you blush even more.

She sheds a tear before recomposing herself.
"Oh man, I didn't laugh like that in ages." she says happily.
"But, anyway, ready to go back in?" she asks.
Shaking off your blush, you nod.
1542222222212111111111111.title: Continue.

15422222222121111111111111.content:
Meloetta smiles.
"Well then. Here you go~" she sings, bringing you to her mouth. Her lips open to reveal the familiar insides of her mouth. Gently, Meloetta places you inside. Her lips seal behind you. The green headed pokemon playfully moves you around.
"Ready?" she then asks in a cheerful voice.
"Yes, swallow." you reply.

Immediately, the tongue beneath you gently pushes you to her throat. Her muscles get a grip on your legs and slowly pull you down as Meloetta swallows.

Once again, you travel down her esophagus, landing into her stomach. And, knowing what awaits you, you successfully land on your feet.

Outside, Meloetta rubs her belly, satisfied. She's done this a few times, yet she can't get tired of the little guy's taste.
"Say trainer," she says at some point.
"What are you going to do in there?" the question takes you aback. You didn't think about that yet.

"Well... I really don't know. I already explored almost your whole body-" you are interrupted as Meloetta bursts into laughter.
"Are you kidding? There's still a lot of places you still don't know!" she laughs.
"Then... can I see them...?" you ask.

Instantly, Meloetta goes silent, remaining so for a minute.
"Yes," she then responds.
"I think you can see a couple of them." Meloetta's psychic projection appears and nods her head, gesturing you to follow her.

After a while of following Meloetta through the usual fleshy passages, you notice her stopping in front of what seems a large building. You reach her and follow her into a door.

You stare with wide eyes at the scenario you are staring at. A literally huge store. In the middle of it is a large fountain, with a statue of Meloetta in the act of singing on top of it, water flowing from the statue's open mouth.
"Dear trainer," the green haired pokemon says you.
"Welcome to the Meloetta Store. Anything you might want, you can find it here!" she proclaims with a smile.
"Wow... that's... amazing..." you admit.
"What are we waiting for? I'll show you around." Meloetta says.


While the little human is busy with exploring her insides, Meloetta had meanwhile left the island. It's a great sensation to feel the marine breeze through her hair. She always loved sea, even though she doesn't really like swimming.

With a happy smile on her white face, the green headed pokemon starts singing happily as she keeps floating a few meters away from the seawater.
‘Yes, this is going to be another wonderful day.’ she thinks to herself.


Several hours later, you step into your bedroom, exhausted. For half the day, Meloetta had been dragging you around her Store, showing you lots of stuff, such as note-shaped necklaces, plushies of her and other pokemon, even photos of her and other legendaries and gifts, according to what she said, that she received from them.

You place everything you took from the Store on a nightstand, before laying on the bed. You had lunch shortly ago. And, with a full stomach, your drowsiness just rose.

Meloetta comes in, sitting down on the bed.
"Hey, are you tired already?" she asks. You nod.
"I need to rest for a bit. Mind if I...?" you ask. Meloetta shakes her head.
"Go ahead, take your nap. Just call me when you wake up, I've got something else to show you." she sings, before disappearing, leaving you alone.

Giving a yawn, you close your eyes, quickly taken away in the realm of dreams by the mix of your tiredness and the softness of your bed.



You wake up hours later. Getting up, you rub your eyes, quickly remembering where you are.
"Meloetta." you call out. The psychic type appears in front of you.
"About time you woke up." she says cheerfully. You look at your watch, taking notice that's it's 6 PM. You turn your attention back to Meloetta.
"You said you have something else to show me?" you ask. She smiles.
"Of course, just follow me." she replies, starting to float away, you walking behind her.

"Are we there yet?" you ask. Again. Meloetta had been floating in front of you for two hours and more. Your legs hurt, and you're bored out of your skull. Meloetta giggles.
"Silly human, it's like the fifth time you ask that. Still a bit." she replies you.
"But I walked for hours! Where is this place?"
"Right there." Meloetta stops in front of a sphincter.
"Finally." you mutter as she lets you touch the hole, which opens up immediately.

You enter in a large, circular room. And what you see is enough to take the breath from your lungs.

Gemstones. A lot of gemstones. Of all colors and shapes. Laying around in the room.
"What..." you mutter in disbelief.
"Like them, uh? This is the most secret place in my body. My Treasure Room." Meloetta states. Then, noticing the shocked look on your face, she starts to explain.

"I've always liked collecting gemstones. I used to keep them in a secluded cave, but, when other pokemon tried to steal them, I decided to find a safer place. So, I picked the safest place: my body. Nobody can possibly steal them here." she says, picking a few gems, staring at them with affection.

Then, she looks at you, who still can't find nothing to say. The green haired pokemon smiles, floating over a small pile of gems, digging through them. She then returns to you, holding something.
"Take this." she just says, extending her paw to show you what she is holding. A black ruby. The size of a walnut.
"What?" you ask, not sure of having heard good.
"I said, take it. I want you to have it." Meloetta repeats, placing the ruby in your hands.

You stare at the gem, not sure of how to reply to this display of kindness.
"Thanks Meloetta..." you say after a bit.
"Don't even say that. Take it as a gift. So, when you look at it, you'll be thinking of me." she replies, flying over the sphincter again.
"Let's go... I'm sure you're hungry." she says. Just then, your stomach growls in confirmation of her words. Laughing along her, you place the black ruby in your pocket and exit the room, the entrance sealing tight behind you.


It's almost midnight when you decide to go to bed. You bring your tired body into your personal bedroom. You lay down on your bed.
"Hey trainer," you hear Meloetta's booming voice.
"Listen up." she says, starting to sing, the sweet melody quickly getting to your ears, keeping you under her spell.

And, in a matter of minutes, you fall asleep without even noticing.

Outside her body, Meloetta stops singing, feeling no more activity from the human inside her.
"Good night, small one. Sweet dreams." she whispers as she lies on a tree, shelter she found for the night. Slowly, she falls asleep as well, ending the day for both her and you.
15422222222121111111111111.title: Going back inside Meloetta.

choices: "I think there's another legendary around here." she says.
"Mew has contacted me. I think she found something." she says.
154222222221211111111111111.content:
Another few weeks pass. You kept living inside Meloetta's body for the whole time, sticking to the amusing habit of exploring her body, while your relationship with her blossomed.

The green headed pokemon always took great care of you, often following you as you enjoyed your time exploring her insides, which you now consider as your own home.

And, since that day on the island, you and Meloetta accorded that you would've come out of her at least once a week. On a casual day, Meloetta would stop in a different place, letting you out of her body to enjoy some 'quality time', as she calls it.

Sometimes, at night, you would take a detour and head into her Emotional Chamber, snuggling up to Meloetta as she tells you incredible stories about her past life, or simply sings you to sleep, her sweet songs always having a great effect on your dreams.

You can surely tell, life has never been so great... if it wasn't for the fact that you're still shrunk.


As for Mew, she has contacted Meloetta a few times, to make sure you were alright. Each time she contacted, your heart would fill with hope. Hope that she found something. Hope you would return to normal.

But, you were constantly deluded. Mew still didn't find anything that could tell how you shrunk or how you could return to your original size. But Mew assured you she isn't going to give up.

That, at least, is a consolation...




"Wake up, trainer!" you sit up, and slowly open your eyes, finding yourself in the huge bed of the Emotional Chamber, Meloetta floating beside the bed. You recall going to sleep quite late, busy with listening Meloetta's stories.

The green haired pokemon giggles.
"Good morning, human. I assume you slept well." she says. You give out a small smile.
"As always, though." you reply, getting up. You walk out of the room, toward your bedroom. More specifically, toward your bathroom.

After washing yourself, you slip into the clothes Meloetta provided you and exit the bathroom, finding the pokemon sitting on your bed. She gives you brief smile, which you return, before walking toward the door.

Leaving your room, you head to the Food Store, Meloetta floating behind you.
"Say," she talks while you walk.
"Have you planned your day yet?" you shrug.
"Not really. Why?" she giggles.
"Well, silly, today you're coming out, remember?" she says between giggles.
"Already?" you ask, stepping into the Food Store.
"Yup. Ready for another awesome day?" she asks.
"Of course." you reply, sitting down at the table in the center of the room.


"Ready to come out?" she asks you as you gulp down the last bite. You nod your head as you get up, starting to follow her.

Soon, you reach her mouth. She opens up, letting you slide out, right into her open paws.
"Hi there!" she chimes playfully. You take a look around, noticing that Meloetta is on a rocky mountain.
"Meloetta, why are we on a mountain?" you ask her.
"You'll see. I wanted to try something..." she replies, floating off.

She carries you in a circular area surrounded by giant, rocky walls.
"Here we are..." she mutters.

Before you can ask why she carried you here, she starts singing what you recognize as Relic Song. You watch as she shifts into her Pirouette Form.

Once she stops singing, she gazed down at you with her now crimson eyes and a smile on her face.
"You see, I thought this would be the best place for a dance." she says.
"Wait, ‘A dance’? What do you mean?" she giggles.
"Well, I do that sometimes. You should know it far too well." she winks. You nod slowly, remembering the first time you met Meloetta and how she almost she crushed you in your first day as as shrunken human.
"Well, ready?" she asks. You nod as she starts singing.

But, before she can begin, she suddenly closes her eyes and brings her free paw to her forehead.
"Something's wrong?" you ask.

She stays silent for a few minutes, before reopening her eyes. She looks down at you, opening her mouth to reply...
154222222221211111111111111.title: Continue.

choices: You wake up in the middle of the night. The dark stone is glowing!
The night goes on smoothly. You and Meloetta leave the next morning
1542222222212111111111111112.content:
"... Mew contacted me." Meloetta responds to your question.
"She says that she found something really interesting. She said no more. I don't know if it's related to your shrinking or not." she states.

You rub the back of your head.
"Well, one way to find out then..." you reply, giving a sigh.
"What a shame, though. One spoiled day that I was meant to spend outside..." you admit with a slight hint of annoyance.

Meloetta smiles.
"Excuse me, but whoever said you're going back inside me? This is your day outside, and you're going to stay outside with me. I'm not going to let Mew spoil our precious quality time!" she says firmly, but with a smile painted on her face.

Then, the red headed starts singing, glowing as she does so, shifting back to her Aria Form.
"Let's go then. Something tells me that we have a long trip ahead," she says with a small sigh. You understand the reason of it.

You don't know much about Mew, but you quickly learned that she gets excited about... everything to say the least. You imagine your own face if it is nothing more than a shining rock or something like that.
"Hey, at least we'll be together," you say, trying to cheer her up.

Meloetta looks down at you with a smile.
"Sweet little one." she says, lightly caressing your head with her free, before her mind travels back to her task: finding Mew.

Holding you in both her black paws for safekeeping, Meloetta hovers upwards and in direction of the sea, soon leaving the mountain behind.

--

While Meloetta soars the skies, you try to make casual conversation.

"Ehm, so... is Mew always that... uh..."
"Childish? Yes. Yes, she is," your green headed host replies with a sigh.
"Don't misunderstand me, she's a good friend and all, but she can be a little... noisy at times." she says.
"Oh. But she seems pretty nice to both people and pokemon," you remark.
"She is. One of the sweetest legendaries you'll ever find, trust me," Meloetta replies with a smile.
"I already met one." you reply.

Your remark is greeted by a pair of white lips briefly smooching your cheek.

--

A few hours pass before finally Meloetta arrives to what appears to be a normal cave; a certain pink pokemon with a long tail waits outside of it. And her excited expression tells you that this cave is nothing near normal...

"Hi there!" Mew cries excitedly as Meloetta approaches her.
"Hi Mew!" she replies, showing her brightest smile.
"Uh, hi." you timidly greet the pink pokemon, who seems to just notice you as her gaze fixes on you.

"I see you've been protecting our tiny friend well, Meloetta," Mew says cheerfully, gently patting your head with a paw.
"Obviously." Meloetta proudly replies.
"Did you expect otherwise?" Mew giggles.
"Hehehe, somehow this reminds me of your rivalry with Celebi," she laughs. Meloetta flushes red.
"It isn't rivalry! It's... friendly competition!" she cries, momentarily forgetting about you.
"That's what you both say!" Mew chimes.

To avoid them starting a fight, you quickly speak up:
"Mew, you talked about something special?" you ask, hopeful.

The pink pokemon suddenly remembers the reason of why she bothered Meloetta, although she couldn't know that.
"Oh, yes, it's something really cool!" she chimes excitedly, her sapphire eyes sparkling.

"And... is it something related to my shrinking?" you ask. Mew's cheerfulness fades to a somewhat sad smile.
"Er... I don't think so." then, seeing your dejected look, she quickly adds:
"I'm sorry. But look at the bright side! You're not alone!" she chimes, her smile returning on her face in no time.

To empathize her friend's words, Meloetta starts petting you. You give a grateful smile to both of them.
"Anyway, what's this cool thing you were talking about earlier?" you ask, trying to change topic.

--

Mew flutters out of the cavern. As soon as she heard your question, she just flew inside; and now, you notice her holding a spherical, black object.

You don't recall having seen anything like that before - although it just seems like a black rock. But Meloetta suddenly looks surprised.
"The... the dark stone, Mew?" she says, before muttering under her breath:
"Zekrom..." Mew nods her head in a cheerful manner, confirming Meloetta's concerns.

"The what?" you ask. Meloetta shakes her head, as if wanting to shake off bad memories.
"The dark stone. Zekrom." Meloetta repeats. You don't quite understand the meaning of her words, and shot her an inquisitive gaze.

The green headed pokemon sighs.
"This stone is in reality Zekrom, the dragon type who protects ideals." she explains.
"Exactly! Just imagine, we could revive him into his true form!" Mew chimes. But Meloetta suddenly looks worried.
"Mew, please don't. Zekrom wasn't exactly find of humans, and..." she holds you out for better explanation.
"What?" you ask, suddenly dreading that black stone.

"Aw, come on, this little one is harmless. Zekrom would never attack him, would he?" Mew asks. A look at Meloetta's face answers to her question.
"It was just an idea..." she says dejectedly.

--

Putting the dark stone and Zekrom aside, Mew and Meloetta accorded that you and them could spend the rest of the day together, then part the next morning on your own paths, Meloetta still keeping you safe while Mew would keep searching for a remedy for your shrinking problem.

By the time the sun completely sets down, you're completely tired out because of the many games Mew insisted to play with both you and Meloetta.

Now, after a quick dinner made out of berries, the two legendaries declare their intentions to rest. The two find shelter inside of the same cavern where Mew found the dark stone. The pink pokemon sets it apart on a rock, before laying down.

As usual, Meloetta closes you in an embrace as she lays down next to her friend.
"Hey, seems like you two are more than just friends!" Mew jokes.
"Stop saying silly things, Mew," Meloetta says, blushing along you, while Mew giggles, ignoring the fact that she just spoke the truth.

Soon, her giggling dies down as she wraps her elongated tail around her body and gets ready to sleep, joined by Meloetta.

--

Soon enough, the two giantesses are fast asleep, while you have some troubles.

You really hoped that you would have returned to your original size today. You really did. But you didn't return to your size. Mew found a rock which is a pokemon that, according to Meloetta, is hostile to humans. Nothing related to your mysterious shrinking, and something possibly lethal for you.

So you have to give up and stay tiny for more time. But if there's a bright side, is that you get to spend more time with Meloetta. The thought makes you smile. You really don't mind that part of your shrinking.

Living inside Meloetta's body, constantly discovering new places and hearing new stories from your host is something awesome.

Instinctively, you dig your hand in your pocket: you feel the hard surface of the black ruby she gave you many weeks ago because 'Every time you'll look at it, you'll be thinking about me'.

Drowsiness starting to claim you, you mutter one last sentence:
"I wish to return to my size again." with that, darkness claims you, and you're soon led to dreamland.
1542222222212111111111111112.title: Mew and the dark stone

choices: Zekrom catches you and imprisons you in his body!
Out of options, Meloetta throws you in her mouth and swallows!
15422222222121111111111111121.content:
You are rudely awoken from your slumber as a bright light suddenly shines in the darkness of the cavern. You desperately cling to the last remains of your sleep, trying to get asleep again.

But you have little success as you are forced back to reality.

Huffing and yawning, you open your eyes to check whatever made you wake up. You only take notice of Meloetta still cuddling you, Mew laying on one side, the dark stone glowing and both pokemon still slee-

...Wait, the dark stone glowing?

You fix a tired gaze on the black, spherical object, noticing that it is indeed glowing of a blinding light, forcing you to narrow your eyes to see. You also notice a few sparks of electricity coming from it.

The next thing you notice is one of Meloetta's black paws leaving you as it travels up to her left eye.

You feel the giantess moving as she sits up.
"Mhh... what is happening...?" she asks, yawning. The time you had spent with her told you that if there is one thing Meloetta hates, that is being awoken from her sleep.

Assuming that she's talking to you, you hurry to reply:
"Uh... the dark stone is kinda glowing..." you reply.
"Mh... the dark stone glowing..." she drowsily parrots back.

Only to fully regain consciousness as your words sink in her mind.
"What?" she asks again, opening her eyes to see the stone, that is Zekrom, gleaming with electricity.

"Oh no! How can this be happening?" Meloetta exclaims, startling you.
"Ehm... what's happening...?" you ask.

The green headed giantess pays you no attention as she moves to Mew.
"Mew! Wake up!" she cries while shaking the pink legendary with one paw.

The only response she gets is a light shift of position.
"Mew! You need to wake up! Zekrom is-" she is interrupted as the dark stone glows even more brightly, the light becoming too much for your eyes to bear, forcing you to close them.

And then, what appears to be an explosion echoes inside of the cavern, succeeding in waking Mew up.

Then, the light finally dies down.
"Meloetta?" you ask, reluctant to open your eyes. Slowly, your eyelids part and the first things you see are Meloetta and Mew, both agitatedly staring at something.

Following their gazes, you fix your own gaze on a particular spot, which seems even darker than the rest of the cave. Suddenly, something briefly glows of an azure color, much like the dark stone was doing earlier. In the instant before the glow dies down, you manage to spot a dark, gigantic figure that towers above Meloetta and Mew.

You slowly look upwards, discovering a pair of bloody red eyes staring at the three of you.

You distinctly hear the voice of Meloetta in the back of your mind:
‘The stone is in reality Zekrom, the dragon type who protects ideals,’ you stare at the creature again, noticing that it has in fact a draconic figure.

Is this Zekrom? The dragon of ideals?... The dragon that didn't like humans too much...?

You swallow hard.

Then, suddenly, the creature breaks the silence that formed in the cave.
"Meloetta... Mew..." much like his looks suggest, he has a deep, powerful voice.

Then, you feel his red eyes fixing on your small form.
"... H-Hi?" you squeak. Only to feel a surface of some sort being pressed on your mouth.

Silenced, you look up at Meloetta, noticing her looking back at you, shaking her head lightly while keeping you from talking by pressing her own paw on your mouth, silently telling you to be as quiet as possible.

"Hi Zekrom!" Mew cries, having regained her usual cheerful behavior. You see her waving her paws at the huge dragon, while Meloetta limits herself to muttering:
"Hi..." while gazing at the floor, the paw holding you against her chest pushing you deeper. The giantess only wishes that you would simply slip up inside her dress somehow.

Meloetta internally sighs. That's just impossible. She'd have to slip you inside her skirt to accomplish such task, and it is out of question. Not that she's embarrassed by the idea... well, maybe a bit, but you and her spent so much time together that she discovers she doesn't feel too bad thinking about it.

No, the real problem is that any wrong movement and Zekrom would notice Meloetta's tiny guest.

Too bad, Zekrom apparently already spotted you.
"A human..." you hear him growl. If you weren't firmly held by Meloetta, you would have cowered. Still, her paws don't manage to keep you from trembling.

Meloetta takes notice of you shaking with fear and smiles a little.
"It'll be fine." she whispers sweetly, her sweet voice betraying her agitation. In reality, she doesn't really know what is going to happen.

"Meloetta..." Zekrom speaks again.
"Why are you holding a human? And why is he so small?" he asks with a grumbly voice.

Meloetta frowns.
"That was exactly what me and Mew were trying to find out. I found this little guy one day, and he was like this, alone and helpless. So I... we decided to lend him a paw," Meloetta explains truthfully.
"True!" Mew confirms, not dropping her cheerful smile.

Zekrom growls, showing a pearly set of razor sharp teeth.
"You're helping a human?" he says, sounding disgusted.
"How can you trust that creature? You don't know what he could do to you! You mustn't trust humans, did you forgot that?" Meloetta pouts indignantly.
"Well, I trust this human. And I do have pretty good reasons to do so," Meloetta retorts.
"Also, Zekrom, this human would never do anything to me or Mew!"

You, who are watching the scene still unable to talk, notice the dragon's mouth shifting into a smirk, showing his fangs again. Is it you or are they shining sinisterly?

"Really? And how can you tell that?" he asks, comprehensibly clueless about the time you and Meloetta had spent together.

But the green headed pokemon has the intention to make it bright to the dragon of ideals.
"Me and this little human have been spending weeks together. Not days, Zekrom, weeks. I simply know that her would never do anything against me!" Meloetta cries, starting to get angry.

However, Zekrom seems to be focused on one particular. You, Meloetta and Mew watch the dragon ponder to himself. Even Mew understood the seriousness of the moment, you can tell by the fact that she dropped her smile, and is glancing at Meloetta and you worriedly.

"Weeks?" Zekrom breaks the silence.
"I have heard enough." he says, one of his paws descending towards Meloetta.

Towards you.

And you can only watch with terror as...
15422222222121111111111111121.title: The awakening of Zekrom

choices: Meloetta and Mew manage to give Zekrom the slip!
154222222221211111111111111212.content:
You watch with sheer terror as the giant hand of Zekrom descends towards Meloetta in an attempt to grab you from her.

And Arceus knows what he's going to do with you once you're in his grasp...

However, Meloetta flies back, dodging the giant paw that ends up grasping air. Zekrom looks at the green headed legendary, who is glaring daggers at him.

The black dragon growls at the small legendary.
"Hand him over, Meloetta," he says.
"I'm gonna deal with this human from now on." he adds, his growly voice scaring you even more, while giving you an accurate idea of what he wants to do to you.

Thousands scenarios of your dead body flash across your mind, and your face suddenly pales as blood is drained from it. However, your frightening thoughts are interrupted by a much more sweet voice.

"If you think I'll give this human to you," Meloetta says, grasping you even more tightly.
"Then I say that you've gone crazy!" she spits venomously.

Mew remains in between the dragon and the small legendary, looking at the two with an unusual worried expression.
"Uhm..." she says, but whatever she meant to say is soon interrupted.

"You're going to hand him over, Meloetta. Or you'll be forced to." Zekrom growls. Meloetta stares at him defiantly.
"Bring it on." she says.

These words said, Meloetta abruptly loses her grip on you and lets you sit on her black paw, which she then brings up to her face.

Desperately, you look at her, but she gives a reassuring look.
"Don't worry. He's not getting his hands anywhere near you," she says in a sweet whisper.

Then, in a matter of seconds, Meloetta opens her mouth, roughly pushing you inside.

Before you have time to react, the giant tongue beneath you shoves you in a familiar abyss: Meloetta's throat. You initially scream out in terror, before remembering whose throat is this.

You tranquilize a bit as you fall down, landing on your feet on the bone floor of the town within Meloetta's belly. Though, it's completely deserted.

Meloetta is probably too busy to craft her psychic projection.

And your hypothesis is confirmed.

Outside, the yelling just begun...

--

"What have you done?!" Zekrom growls as he takes a step forward.
"You're not getting your hands on him, Zekrom!" Meloetta snaps back, Mew floating beside the green headed legendary.

"Zekrom, calm down," Mew chimes in.
"Meloetta is right - the human is harmless!"

The dragon of ideals huffs, while his tail sparks menacingly.
"Mew," he begins.
"Humans are ALL but harmless! I'm only trying to protect you two!" he exclaims.

Meloetta frowns, indignant.
"We don't need your protection. If the human was a threat to me, I would have noticed, and I would have left him by himself!"

Inside her body, you hear the last remark. And you're glad that Meloetta didn't consider you a threat when you first met her.

"You can't simply fly around and house humans in your body!" Zekrom cries.
"And you can't simply fly around and menace shrunken humans for no reason!" Meloetta retorts.

The black dragon growls. And his tail suddenly lets out a violent spark of electricity, directed straight at Meloetta, who promptly dodges and glares at Zekrom.

"Last warning, Meloetta. Be reasonable and hand the human. Or I'll attack you." Zekrom slowly says.

At this point, Mew and Meloetta look at each other.

Both know that Zekrom is more powerful than they are. And not only because of his size.

The only chance they got is running. And, while it wouldn't exactly be the best display of courage, Meloetta doesn't even think about it.

The only thought occupying her mind is the task she must focus on: protect the human.

"That's it," Meloetta says.
"We're leaving." Mew says, preparing herself.

Both legendaries turn around, starting to float in direction of the only way out of the cave, which is luckily on the opposite side of where Zekrom currently is.

The dragon growls again as he glows of an azure color, before letting out a thunderbolt, in direction of Mew and Meloetta.

Too bad for him, they expected that.

In a split second, both petite legendaries separate, dodging the electricity, before Meloetta turns around, opening her mouth as she lets out a deep cry, using Hyper Voice.

Below her vocal chords, you are taken aback from the sudden, loud sound and are forced to cover your ears.
"What is going on!?" you shout, unable to imagine what's happening out of Meloetta's body.

Although you have a pretty close idea.

Taken by surprise by the sudden attack, Zekrom growls in pain as he feels like his head is about to burst. He's pretty sure that his ears are bleeding.

The wave of sound eventually dies down. Mew, who had been covering her ears, suddenly removes her paws and crafts a blue sphere in her paws, before throwing it at Zekrom, hitting him in the chest.

The sphere explodes, and the black dragon cries in pain as a cloud of smoke spreads inside the cavern.

Only when the smoke starts to dissolve, Zekrom notices that Meloetta and Mew are no longer in the cave.

--

"Let's go!" Mew exclaims as she and Meloetta fly up in midair, getting away from the cave.

However, they don't get too far as an explosion suddenly bothers the quietness of the night.

Terrified, both legendaries look back, noticing that Zekrom completely destroyed the cavern with an attack. The dragon looks up, spotting the two up in the air.

"You're not getting away!" he growls as he starts to float upwards, towards them.

"Let's go!" Mew repeats again. She doesn't need to say it a third time.

The two small legendaries start to fly away at full speed, while Zekrom gives chase.

Inside Meloetta's belly, you understand that the green headed giantess and Mew are running from Zekrom.

You only hope that they make it unharmed...
154222222221211111111111111212.title: Nighttime chase

choices: You decided to remain with Meloetta
You decided to go with Mew
1542222222212111111111111112121.content:
If you only could have caught a single glimpse of what was happening outside, you'd be glad you were in the safety of Meloetta's belly.

Said pokemon and Mew flew away from the destroyed remains of the cave that was their shelter for the night, while a certain black dragon chased them, enraged.

"Get back here!" he roared, flying behind the two.

Both petite pokemon ignored him.

A roar echoed, and it didn't belong to Zekrom.

Meloetta and Mew turned around, and avoided getting hit by a blue spark of electricity.

Mew reacted immediately: her paws glowed blue as an azure beam was shot from them, hitting Zekrom's chest.

The huge dragon growled in pain, his chest getting covered by a thick layer of ice. And dragon-types were notoriously weak against ice...

The Dragon of Ideals slowed down, but kept chasing Mew and Meloetta, wanting nothing more than to grab a hold of the second, squeeze her until the human came out.

"Be reasonable you two! I don't want to hurt you!" Zekrom growled, frustrated,
"Hand over the human and I'll let you go!"

"Dream on!" Meloetta hissed from above as the dragon struggled to keep up with her and Mew, the ice on his chest slowing him down.

Another Ice Beam came down, this time hitting the dragon's neck, causing him to grunt in pain while slowing him down even more.

Then, a wave of sound came down too, shattering the ice while forcing Zekrom to cover his ears, eyes close shut.

The black dragon's feet touched the ground, which shook violently while the sonic barrage continued.

The Hyper Voice eventually came to an end.

Zekrom opened his eyes again, looking up. The dragon snarled furiously upon noticing that the two petite pokemon weren't there anymore.

Angrily, he flew up in the air again, his tail sparking with electricity as it enlightened the dark sky with an azure light.

Zekrom looked around to find his two opponents, but no avail.

Meloetta and Mew had disappeared into the night.

The huge dragon roared, angry.

He was going to find them. The shrunken human Meloetta was housing couldn't escape.

--

When the two pokemon finally stopped, dawn was rising over the horizon.

Exhausted and drowsy, Meloetta and Mew flew down in a forest.

It was improbable Zekrom was going to find them soon, he had lost their tracks, but they couldn't risk exposing themselves.

"I told you." Meloetta stated as she and Mew took a seat at the foot of a tree. The pink legendary sighed.
"Hey, I wasn't the one who restoring Zekrom... speaking of, how did it happen?" she asked.

"I'm clueless..." Meloetta admitted, before placing a paw on her belly. Her worry momentarily waning, the green-headed pokemon smiled.

"... He's gone, human, you can come out," she said, feeling a tingle in her eye. She assumed that you were in what had been your bedroom for weeks.

You heard her voice, but didn't reply.

Soon enough, Meloetta felt your tiny body entering her mouth. Gently, she placed a paw over her oral cavity as her lips parted, letting you leap out of the mouth and onto the black paw waiting for you.

Meloetta smiled sweetly.

"Hello there..." she said, her paw moving towards her chest as she hugged you.

"... Where's Zekrom?" you asked, dreading the fact that the dragon might just appear out of nowhere.

"Don't worry, we're safe," Mew chimed in, smiling.

You shot a skeptical look.

"He lost us," Meloetta reassured, gently petting you with a paw. A warm feeling spread throughout your whole being as you relaxed.

"... But... he wanted me, no? I don't think he gave up so easily..." you continued after a moment of silence, fear once again overwhelming you.

Meloetta nodded with a serious expression.

"You're right... he'll probably hunt us down..." she said. One paw left you as the green-headed giantess placed it on her forehead.

She gently shook her head.

"Stupid me... I told him that you've been living with me for weeks... now he'll search for me when we part..." she mused.

Surprisingly - or very expectedly - Mew smiled.

"Yeah... that might be. But... he can believe it, no?" she suggested.

You looked at her,
"What do you mean?" you questioned.

The pink giantess giggled.
"Well... he knows you're with Meloetta, no? He can chase her, find her, but you won't be with her..." she continued, Meloetta adopting a confused expression.

Which suddenly became one of realization.

Meloetta's blue eyes widened.

"You mean..." she considered the idea, discovering that she didn't agree.

Mew nodded.
"He can come with me for a while!" she chimed, looking at you with a smile.

"Think about it, he'd be safe for a while... and when Zekrom discovers that he isn't with you and comes searching for me, we'll meet again and I'll give him back, so he'll chase me when I don't actually have the human! It's perfect!" she exclaimed.

The air left your lungs... going with Mew would mean leaving Meloetta...

"B-But..." you looked at the green-headed pokemon holding you; she answered to your questioning look with a sad one.

"... What if Zekrom comes searching for you first Mew? He'd find the human..." she mused.

Mew smirked.

"Even if he finds me - and he won't - I'll be able to escape... y'know, knowing all the moves is quite useful..." she remarked. Meloetta sighed.

"Yeah yeah, we're all jealous of that Mew..." she intoned.

"Celebi isn't..." Mew snickered, ready to enjoy Meloetta's reaction,

"Stop bringing up Celebi!" Meloetta cried, cheeks burning bright red.

Mew giggled, before looking at you,

"What do you say? Do you want to come with me? For some time at least..." she repeated.

A terrible idea found its way in your thoughts before you could reply.

"B-But... what if Zekrom finds Meloetta... and makes her tell him where we are?" you wondered, shivering at the perspective.

It was Meloetta's turn to smile.

"You're underestimating me, human," she said with a half-giggle.

You blushed, recalling how powerful her Hyper Voice was.

"So? What are you going to do?" Mew inquired again.

You looked at Meloetta questioningly; she smiled,

"It's up to you human... I'll accept whatever choice you make, whether you want to stay with me or go with Mew..." she said with a hint of hope in her voice.
1542222222212111111111111112121.title: Temporary safety

choices: "I'm sorry Mew... maybe later." you replied
15422222222121111111111111121212.content:
You thought about your options long and hard.

You really, really wanted to stick with Meloetta, but you also really, really didn't want Zekrom to get his claws anywhere near you.

And, in the end, fear made you make your decision... after all, it wasn't going to be so hard, no?

You looked at Meloetta, who smiled at you.

"Yes, human?" she asked with a growing smile, sure of what you were going to say.

"I-I'll..." you tried to say, before looking back at Mew, who also smiled as she got up, eyeing you with interest.

You sighed.

"I think... I'm going with Mew..."

You lowered your head, so that you couldn't see Meloetta's fading away; it looked like it was added to Mew's face, because her smile grew impossibly big.

"Oh..." Meloetta muttered.

The paws holding you moved forward, gently pressing you into a black surface: her stomach.

You hugged back, an aura of sadness forming around the two of you.

"I'm sorry..." you whispered, looking up. You could swear you saw something sparkling under Meloetta's eye, but she quickly shook it off.

"It's okay..." she said sadly.

Mew giggled.

"You two are so cute," she chimed, her tail coiling around you.
"Can we go, now?"

You looked at Meloetta.

"Mew," she said, gently untangling her friend's tail from you.
"Can you give us an hour or two?" she said.

The pink legendary looked first at you, then at her friend, before smiling and waving a paw.

Smiling back, Meloetta flew back, to the other side of the tree and sat down at its foot.

Then, without saying a word, she hugged you again.

You sadly looked up; now, her tears were free.

--

"I think... I think it's time..." Meloetta sniffled after crying in silence for an hour.

You didn't reply.

The giantess wiped her eyes, took a few deep breaths and got up, before flying back to Mew. But she wasn't there.

Before you could say anything though, her familiar voice rang from above,

"Oh, are you two done?"

You looked up, Mew was staring at you and Meloetta from a branch.

"Yes..." the green-headed giantess said as the pink one came down, wearing a solemn expression mixed with an unwell hidden cheerfulness.

A short, pink paw came forward, expectant.

Meloetta looked at you, her lips shaking.

Then, without any embarrassment, she pressed them on your face.

You felt it growing red, but you didn't fight back.

"Aw!" Mew chimed while Meloetta finally pulled off, shooting one last, sad look, before finally placing you on Mew's paw.

"Good-bye..." she whispered, apparently heartbroken.

For a moment, you had second thoughts, but you couldn't go back now: if Zekrom ever found you, there would be no more you for Meloetta.

And there would be no more Meloetta for you.

Going with Mew meant safety... for the time being.

"Good-bye..." you parroted back, sad.

"Take care of yourself," Meloetta continued, before looking at Mew,
"And you take care of him."

"Of course," Mew smiled, extending her free paw, which was grabbed by Meloetta's.

Then, the two broke and, with one last salute, they flew in opposite directions, much like they had done when you first met Mew.

Only, this time Mew was the one holding you, and Meloetta was the one leaving.

You shot the green-headed pokemon one last look full of sadness, before she was engulfed by the vegetation, disappearing.

"Ehm... so..." Mew began as she stared at you. You didn't even register her words.
"You've been living inside Meloetta for... y'know... right?"

You looked back, offering a nod.

Mew nodded too. She understood your situation, so she was being careful with words.

"Well... I can let you do that too... if you'd like?" she asked.

You stared at her.

Mew could change her insides like Meloetta did? You enjoyed spending time inside Meloetta, so... why not, you thought.

"Yeah... fine..." you mumbled.

The pink giantess smiled.

"Great!" she said.

Then, unexpectedly, Mew hugged you.
"I promise Zekrom isn't going to find you! Me and Meloetta will do our best!" she chimed, before pulling back.

You were blushing. Mew was smiling.

"I'll provide you with a bedroom for now. Then... I'll see what I can do for your entertainment." she said, opening her mouth and holding you close to it.

Soon, your world became pink and fleshy and soft as the lips fell back in place, sealing you in darkness.

Mew licked you a few times and giggled.

"You do taste good!" she chimed, causing you to hold your ears in pain due you being just above her vocal chords.

Then, the tongue gently moved you towards the abyss that was her throat.

You slid down her throat. In every other circumstance, you would have screamed in terror, but this time you knew what awaited you.

Curiosity outweighed sadness a bit as you finally slid into a tight, soft chamber, which was roughly twice your height.

Mew's stomach, deprived of gastric acid.

You blinked - was this only a stomach?

Behind you, someone giggled.

You turned around, noticing a small Mew looking at you cheerfully.

You were used to psychic projections, so you didn't mind the sudden presence aside from you in the stomach.

"So... uh..."

"Yeah, sorry for this, but I didn't have much time to remodel... but don't worry!" Mew chimed, a tunnel opening beside her.
"I have your bedroom ready! Wanna see it?"

You nodded as the pink pokemon flew to the hole that led, according to Mew, to your new bedroom.

You followed the legendary through the passage for a few minutes, before Mew flew into a spherical room, letting you enter as well.

The room was simple: a completely pink bed, two windows made of sapphire glass and a desk.

"You can decorate it with anything you want, you just tell me!" Mew offered, smiling. Clearly, she wasn't an expert when it came to human culture.

"Yeah, uh, thanks..." you distractedly replied, automatically walking to the bed and sitting down.

You looked at Mew.

"... But I'd like to be alone for now... d'you mind?"

Mew just smiled, then disappeared, leaving you alone.

Only then, you fell on the bed, back-down.

Just then, you felt a sting in your leg, and realized that something was in your pocket.

You reached for it, pulling out a black ruby you recognized.

Meloetta gave it to you.

You sighed, sad, as you stared at it.

‘Meloetta...’

--

"You've been staring at that thing for a while..."

You perked up, Mew suddenly appeared in your room, breaking the silence.

She was wearing a smile, but it was evident that she was worried about you.

"I'm... sorry," you sighed,
"But I don't feel like I want to do anything right now..."

Mew smiled, comprehensive.

She flew closer to your bed, sitting next to you.

"I know you miss her." she simply said, causing you to look at her.

"But you need to cheer up! I mean, it's not like you won't see her again! I can even let you talk to her!" Mew reassured.

You perked up.

"Really? Can I?" you asked.

Mew blushed, and looked down.

"Ehm... maybe not right now... I've tried to contact her, but she didn't respond..." she admitted.

"Oh..."

Again, the legendary smiled.

"Now, Meloetta told me that you liked to explore her body - we talked back then," she said, noticing your confused expression.

"Would you like to... explore a bit?" Mew offered.

You sighed.

You figured that exploring Mew's body could be a good way to keep the your mind off things.

Still, you weren't feeling like doing anything right now.
15422222222121111111111111121212.title: Two parted ways and two broken hearts
